title: 40th birthday stay
text: 3/5 review, we arrived 27/03/14 for my 40th birthday. My wife put this on the booking fotm but nothing was mentioned, she paid extra for a bigger room (which you could swing a cat in) room 1616 was pretty tiny. won't be booking here again, sorry.

title: Severely overpriced. I feel scammed.
text: I'm extremely disappointed to say the least. My full review is on booking.com this place is not worth the price. The only reason I chose it was for the pool table which was broken and closed. I wasted a bunch of food because of the lack of microwave or fridge. I also didn't care for how lack luster the cleaning was in my room; from chipped bathtub, to dirty toilet, to random clothes from previous guest under the furniture...I'm not satisfied. No cancellation policy gives me the impression that they know they are disappointing customers and are only happy to milk as much money as they can the first time you book because they know your likely to not return if you have self respect. Scam Likely there are other options near time square.

title: Central hotel
text: The hotel is really centrally located. It is therefore very well suited for visiting all of New York's notable sights. Otherwise, the hotel is average. The entrance area is well designed and interesting.

title: Very centric
text: I'll stay again in this hotel. It was clean, friendly staff and super close to Times Square. There are lots of places to eat around the hotel. Also close to Central Park. We had a situation with the people of the next room making a lot of noice after midnight, we call and tell the hotel staff and they solved in minutes. We were very grateful for that.

title: Excellent Location!
text:
The hotel is old, the air conditioning is terrible, but the room and bed are good and clean. 
The location is its strong point. 
I would definitely come back in the future.
The reception and the staff are very attentive and deserve congratulations.

title: PARAMOUNT HOTEL NY
text: The hotel is very well located but too much noise at night, receptionist didnt take a payment neither cash or with my credit  or debit card because didnt show my name, I had travel a lot in the US and in Europe and my cards have been taken like that all the time, this is the first time it was rejected, we solved it with my friends card, however if I had traveled alone, what would have happened? shower also not working correctly

title: Exceptional value for money
text:
Having read a few of the reviews for the Paramount hotel, my partner and I were doubting our previous decision to book for 5 nights over the past week. However I’m glad to say we really enjoyed our stay and experience at this hotel so despite not being one to usually leave reviews, I thought it worthwhile to detail our experience. 

Location- the location of the hotel was absolutely ideal, close to all the theatres in Times Square that you could possibly want to visit and close to many subway lines meaning the whole city was easily accessible to us. Times Square is naturally quite noisy, however we had no issues sleeping and found generally the walls/windows were thick enough to keep the majority of the noise out (bar a few sirens which is to be expected!)

Reception/arrival- upon our arrival to the Paramount hotel, we were greeted by several members of staff, all who were polite and willing to help. You have to pay a city tax for your stay at reception, however we’re pretty sure you have to do this at all hotels in NYC. Our tax was $86 (£69) for our 5 night stay. Considering the hotel was cheap anyway, we were happy to pay this no questions asked. The reception of the hotel is a work in progress: half has been renovated and is modern (see pics) whilst the other is still being worked on. We saw no builders or heard no noise related to this work and think the hotel will look incredible when it is done! 

Room- we stayed in a superior queen room on the 11th floor. The corridors and elevators leading us to this room were modern and efficient. We loved our room and frankly didn’t want to leave it!! The bed was incredibly comfy and we enjoyed a lot of time watching the food network on our flat screen tv. The room was big and modern enough for us with a few scuffs but nothing that bothered us really! Could do with a few more hangers for the wardrobes maybe. The bathroom was a peculiar design but did exactly as it needed to- the water pressure was incredible and we had plenty hot water at all times. The bathroom could be modernised and cleaner (chipped paint and wear and tear) but I wouldn’t lower my rating of the hotel because of this. On our first night, we struggled turning the radiator on in our room- it was plenty warm but we needed to dry some rain soaked clothes. We called reception and maintenance were up within 30 mins to change the batteries in our thermostat and show us how to use it- much appreciated.

Staff and check out- the check out process was incredibly smooth. With our flight back to London not being until late evening, we checked out at 11am and chose to store our bags with reception for a small fee. This was well worth it, the concierge labelled our bags up for identification and looked after them whilst we went about our day. We also used the airport shuttle service arranged by reception- this cost $70 (£55) for the two of us. The driver was there bang on time and dropped us right off at our terminal. A special staff shout out to the cleaners at the Paramount hotel- our room was cleaned every day during our stay with fresh towels and bedsheets. When we wanted a lie in, we simply used our do not disturb door marker and our room was skipped only for them to do it later in the day when we removed the sign. 

All in all, we loved our stay at the Paramount hotel and are glad we gave it a chance. For the price we paid, we really couldn’t have expected any more. In our opinion, the value for money was exceptional given the hotel location and facilities. We hope to return some day ❤️🇺🇸

title: Spot on
text: Had a fab time, Shakira made a last minute announcement she was coming to times square was so glad to be so close. The staff were great. Thank you for making our stay pleasant. I was nervous being on my own with my daughter but everyone was so helpful

title: Ok hotel in a great location.
text: It's old and quirky, so it doesn't have the polish of chain hotels in the same price range, but the location is great.  The beds are super comfy.  Our A/C stopped working for a day, then came back on.  The elevators are very small, so expect some wait time.  There are no coffee makers or cups in the room for water.  Overall, and average hotel with a cool vibe.  Staff were nice.  Rooms were clean and housekeeping was good.  For similar money, I'd stay in a Hilton or Marriott next time though.

title: Don’t stay
text: Place was terrible. No microwave or fridge. My room was 63° and the heat did not work. I told the maid I did not need service and she still came in while I was sleeping and started to clean. Bathroom extremely outdated.

title: Awful dangerous rooms.
text: The windows on the 11th floor have no safety and can be opened fully. Rooms and bathrooms old and outdated. No mini fridge or tea coffee facility in room. Wall outlets loose, lifts broken and only go up to certain floor. And on top of that you have to pay $100+ for a property fee. And for what? The only thing that makes it look like a 4* hotel is the lobby and the rest is horrendous.

title: Not a good place to stay.
text: Good location, bad service, security and facility. This hotel is falling apart and the employees are not well trained to help with anything. Did not feel safe in this hotel either because the lock from my room door was tampered with and the hotel did not seem concerned about it. The need to reevaluate the way they do things.

title: Small, run down & dirty. AVOID
text: Don’t let the lobby fool you, about the only nice thing in this hotel. Rooms look nothing like the glamorous photos. Holes in the walls, draws held together with tape, dirty windows & bathroom. £1900 for a room you can barely open your hand luggage in, nevermind a suitcase. Apparently there is an iPod docking station.. still yet to see it?

title: Excellent location
text: Highly recommend for families. Location is so central for times sq, theatres, central park and a short walking distance to the subway. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable.

title: One of our bucket list trips
text:
I had read some of the reviews and was slightly worried at some of them but  I went with an open mind . When we arrived they had had a problem with the gas which had affected some of the rooms and ours was one of them , so they had put us in a different one but as a gesture of goodwill waived the facilities fee as the room they had put us in had a broken toilet light, which didn’t matter for one night and they also
Waived the luggage storage fee. 

The rooms are small but cosy and very warm . We had a rattling radiator which added to the quirkiness used to joke it was our alarm clock . 

Wardrobe is small too not many coat hangers partner used the coat rack to hang his clothes but we didn’t spend that much time in the room only to sleep or on the rare occasion we had a early night and watched a film but that was rare .

Location is perfect for Times Square and all the hustle and bustle that goes on there . The hotel is having work done on it but we don’t hear any noise form our room only when we were in the lobby area . Only popped in once to the bar found the one member of staff quite abrupt the rest of the staff in the hotel very helpful and friendly .

Loved our stay here and New York and do plan to visit again

title: New York trip
text: Just had a week's stay here and have no complaints about the place, rooms are a bit small but your only really there to sleep, comfy bed and pillows . Housekeeping in every day and give you clean towels overall had a great stay here we were a bit unsure what to expect after reading some of the reviews but found no faults and would deffo book here again and recommend it to anyone 👍 👌 😀

title: Basic Room
text: The room was clean and the location was awesome! The cons…there was no fridge or microwave, the heat did not work, and the lighting is too dim throughout the hotel. This hotel was a bit too pricey for such a basic room, they should at least offer breakfast for the amount of money you pay.

title: Great customer service experience!
text: I’m glad that last minute the Paramount Hotel was able to accommodate my spontaneous work trip. But even more so, and the reason why I will come back to this hotel is for their customer service. From being greeted by Nathalie who was the first person of interaction at the hotel. I knew I would be coming back. Every interaction there on out was great! Thank you!

title: Brill
text:
I read reviews and was so worried that I’d booked this hotel . Long story short we have just come back from 6 nights and it was fab . The room is clean and got cleaned daily . We got fresh shower gels and shampoos every day . 
The tv you can watch live or put your device on it . 

Free water in the lobby : lots of lifts so no waiting about . 

Location literally ten steps from Times Square . 

Room is basic but why would you spend time in it . Had a bath and shower. Comfy clean bed . Safe in room 
Steamer in room , 

Perfect for the price ! Would go back don’t let others put you off

title: Construction work
text:
All i will say is your staff are wonderful, it is a pitty that the referbishment of the hotel is not up to international standards, the only saving grace is being so close to Bond 45 which more than made up for the hotel shaby condition.
 The welcome room upgrade by your staff due to dangerous metal sticking out of the matress in the first room and the tiny size improved our experience of the hotel, you have a long way to go to restore it to its forma glory.
We did have a wondeful time in the beautiful city of New York and enjoyed the friendly and clean city and the amazing hard working people we incountered while we stayed , just the hotel left us feeling sorry that it is as mentioned been restored to its previous elegance .
Regards

title: Great for sleeping, not for chilling
text: If you're looking for a great location then look no further. We had a great night's sleep every night, however the hotel is quite dated and if you're looking for somewhere that's a great place to spend a lot of time in the room then it's not the place for you. Great TV facility with casting so we could entertain our daughter whilst getting ready. The housekeeping team didn't really seem to do much other than give fresh towels, our bed wasn't changed in a week

title: Right in the heart of Time Square
text: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are on the small side, but we also didn’t go to New York to hang out in our room, so it worked out. If you want to be close to lots of shops and food and all the Broadway shows, this location was great. Was about 4 blocks to the subway, so not bad there either.

title: In the Middle of it All
text: This location is truly in the heart of Times Square and is surrounded by fabulous theaters featuring plays like Hamilton and The Wiz. Sony Hall is next door as well as a Parisian bakery that’s adjoined to the hotel and other eateries nearby (Junior’s is on the next block). Anyway, the rooms are small, yet comfortable. I did not like the loose electrical outlets for charging.  You have to be careful to make sure it’s actually charging. The bed was comfy, the shower was fine and I liked the soap that was included in the dispensers. The elevators jetted me to the 5th floor in seconds. Beware of the daily “resort fees” associated with the hotel because of the prime location.  Otherwise, very trendy and convenient hotel.

title: Good location
text: Great hotel, very well located. Quiet, clean, nothing to complain about, I will return there without any problem. Ideally located 100m from Time Square and very close to major metro stations. 10 min walk to Central Park

title: Excellent!!
text: The hotel was absolutely amazing and such a great location.  We loved that we were steps away from all of the Broadway Theaters and walking distance from Central Park.  The closeness to Times Square was also amazing!

title: Location!
text: We stayed at the paramount because I was volunteering at the United Half marathon and my adult kids wanted to spend some time in Times Square. The hotel was an easy 20 minute walk from Grand Central, and all the sights and festivities of Times Square (on St Patrick’s Day weekend) were mere minutes away. Our room was a very basic hotel room with 2 double beds, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable.

title: Average Stay at an Average hotel
text: Good and clean, so no complaints, under remodeling at present so should be better when done and no doubt the rate will reflect that. Got charged $40 per day resort fee even though there was no facilities available during the remodel

title: Nice basic hotel in an excellent location.
text:
We stayed here for our first ever week in New York. The hotel is a period building which appealed to our son who preferred the look of it to the more modern glass box hotels close by. The room was a little small for 3 people and had basic amenities - TV, safe, hairdryer. We brought along our own travel kettle but a fridge would have been nice. The location is in an excellent position about 3 minutes walk from Times Square and 5-10 mins walk from probably a dozen or more of the big shows.

There was no availability for breakfast in the hotel but there are dozens of places within a 10 minute walk.

title: Don't Let The Reviews Scare You
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 4 days at the end of February 2024.

In our initial booking process, the rates were awesome, very reasonable, many reviews spoke of ideal location however reviews of the rooms were frightening However we went out onto a limb and booked anyway! And I'm glad I did!

what I loved:
 - Location was Amazing. 1 Min walk to Father Duffy Sqaure and everything else just a stone throw away. 42nd Street Metro and 49th Street Metro Stations very close by. 
- Room - Yes it is small at 120 Sq Ft, however for a couple looking for an intimate getaway it was perfect. Enough space for 2 suitcases on the floor and comfortable walking room. Bed was extremely comfortable.
- Heat/ Air-conditioning worked perfectly well. Temperature thermometer worked well as needed.
- Bathroom and Toilet area was clean and welcoming 
- Hot Water was perfect 
-Coat Closet with Safe available. Couple hangers in the closet to keep Coats/ Jackets stored.
-Hair Dryer available
-House Keeping came once during our 4 day stay to change towels etc 
-Baggage hold available at $2/ suitcase before chk in and $3/suit case after chk out.

Things I Disliked:
- A water dispenser is available in the gym on the 2nd floor only.( It would be nice to have access or Hot & cold water closer ( maybe a dispenser close to the elevator if not in the room itself)
- Air-vents to Air-conditioning was very dusty 
- Carpet seemed to be very dusty 
-Hair Dryer was dusty as well.
- My partners allergies flared up by the 3rd day due to this and he had extreme sneezing and allergy symptoms. We concluded it was definitely the room/hotel as - as soon as we left the hotel - his sneezing fits would stop.

Despite the Dislikes - I had a pertty memorable stay ! If you're thinking about booking - Do it now. 
Of Course - Consider if you're paying $100-$130 USD per night - you cannot expect facilities of a $250+ USD per Night Hotel!

title: Clean, comfortable, and close to the Times Square
text: We were able to check in early. The service was friendly and prompt. The staff was helpful.  Our room was clean and comfortable. The location was excellent. No complaints! We would definitely stay here again.

title: Paramount Hotel Times square
text: We stayed at the Paramount hotel whilsg in NY. The location is great if you want to access Times Square as its about a 2 minute walk. The hotel lobby looks nice and is clearly being developed. The rooms are basic, no condiments in the room. The rooms and bathroom could do with updating as they didn't look as they do on the hotel website. Staff were polite and courteous, quite noisy at night time so could be problematic if you're a light sleeper.

title: Average stay
text: Very little room space, AC making this weird noise. Towels not available right away. However, very clean and had at least the basics to stay in. It is well located in Times Square, so you can really walk to many places around.

title: BEWARE brown water coming from shower and they don’t use wash cloths.
text: Rooms are small so beware. Even though it is march somehow my partner and I were waking up each night sweating bullets. Check google or yelp for the picture if the brown shower water they didn’t even care lol they said it’s not dirty it’s just discolored! WOW so New Yorkers bathe in brown water now? Rats in front of the hotel. They don’t even have an ice maker for you. You’ll have to shower with a hand towel in the brown water once you arrive because they don’t have any small towels/wash cloths . Kinda hotel is this? The only reason i stayed is because im 20 and 6 months which is frustrating because ill be the same person i am now in 6 months at 21 for a better hotel. You’ve been warned

title: Location Location Location
text: This location is walking distance to most Broadway shows! All the staff were amazing, friendly and helpful.  Hotel was clean and well maintained with visable security. Walking distance to times Square and all it's stores.

title: Good Location
text: Rooms are small and no storage. Small wardrobe but no other storage space. Bed was comfy and housekeeping daily. Room was hot and aircon was so noisy, window did not open more than 3inches which was probably for safety reasons. No window in the bathroom and no extractor fan. Quite small bathroom too. Overall our stay was good, the location was perfect as in Times Square. So everything was in walking distance

title: Would not stay again
text: The stay was disappointing. Website is very misleading with the lobby shot. Does not exist!! Dining area on website does not exist!! Nowhere does it say it's under construction. People hanging around in lobby at all hours. It was creepy. Felt like a step up from a hostel. Watched my back whenever I got in the elevator. Strange that the windows could open in the room as well. Window was open when I first entered my room. (I thought that was illegal in hotel rooms?) Couldn't find towels on first night. Slightly strange to be tucked behind mirror. And nowhere at all to get a cup of coffee onsite in the morning. I am not sure how they get away with charging the rates you do. Chipped paint galore and you can see where you painted over it's past life. A half done renovation. Gym was incredibly hot. None of the TVs worked and wifi didn't work there. I wouldn't recommend a stay.

title: A lovely getaway.
text:
I was a but wary at first due to some of the reviews I’ve read. However, don’t take everything you read to be true. 
Reception staff lovely upon arrival, very kind and energetic. Room spacious and there was 4 of us sharing. Cleaned everyday spotlessly-credits to the staff.
Very close to all amenities and beds were so comfortable! 
Not noisy at all in my opinion.
Would definitely return in the future!
Thank you for our lovely 10 day break☺️.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text: Bien sûr le temps de la splendeur du Paramount est passé. Il y a 25 ans (la dernière fois que j'y étais allée) tout le petit monde de la mode et de la branchitude s'y pressait, c'était classe sans être ostentatoire. Aujourd'hui même si ce n'est plus le cas, je garde une tendresse pour cet hôtel unique en son genre, même s'il est un peu défraîchi. La chambre était parfaite pour deux personnes, le personnel sympa et surtout il est à deux pas de Times Square, ce qui est super niveau pratique et sécurité. Loin des chaînes d'hôtel impersonnelles, le Paramount c'est une institution. Un défroisseur très pratique et un sèche-cheveux dans la chambre. Très bien chauffé. Chambre faite tous les jours. Personnellement, je n'irai pas ailleurs.

title: No thrills or effort made in this hotel
text: Rooms really dated and shabby. Stayed on 16th floor and windows still let all noise in from the street. No amenities in the room not even a cup to drink some water. No soap or towels first night, had to ask. Restaurant and bar is only open certain hrs so there is no where to get any food or drink within the hotel. No information was given or offered at the reception on check in and nothing said on departure. No customer service at all. Location was very good but alot of other hotels around same area which seem to want guests there more. Lobby is very dark and un inviting .

title: Da lo que ofrece
text: El hotel es sencillo y tiene una buena limpieza, la recepción 0 de español, por lo demás el personal amable y tiene una localización buenísima para hacer turismo, si lo que buscas es un hotel cómodo donde dormir mientras conoces la ciudad, es una buena opción.

title: Good stay
text:
Good basic hotel. Nothing special but good for its price and location. Great location, close to Times Square.

Booked as part of a package holiday, and was anxious after reading some of the reviews but did not have any issues at all. Read was cleaned every day, and didnt bother us that it was slightly dated - we didn’t visit the city to spend ages in the hotel. Would stay again when returning to New York.

Only complaint was that there is a cash only $3 per bag storage fee. We didn’t realise this until the last day and had to withdraw the cash.

title: Perfect location at a great price
text: I was nervous before arriving as some of the reviews were bad but we had a very pleasant stay. Location was amazing yet rooms were quiet, very clean, beds were super comfy and the staff were lovely. Only issue is no tea/coffee in rooms but we knew about this beforehand due to previous reviews. I would stay here again.

title: You get what you pay for
text: The hotels location is brilliant and first impression was also spot on the reception staff were very friendly and helped us check in no problems. The room we we’re in was a bit dated but the room staff kept it immaculately clean couldn’t fault it plus once you’ve walked 12 miles a day it was the most comfortable bed in the world. There’s no tea or coffee or kettle in the room which might help in the future as when you get back a quick brew always helps If there’s 1 thing I can moan about is having to check out at 11 then having to pay 3 dollars per item to leave in the secure holding area and I know it sounds petty but unless you pay your hauling your cases around with you till you get a taxis to the airport. We had a brilliant time and thanks for a good stay

title: Great Location
text: Great location just off Times Square. Close to everything. Rooms are adequate as you do not spend much time in them. Booked a twin room and the beds were a good size. Wardrobe space is small.  Friendly staff. Would return

title: Ignore the pictures.
text: If you're expecting it to be like the pictures you'll be extremely disappointed. Not sure where these were taken but we never saw anything like the pictures. Our first room the window wouldn't close. The panel for the aircon was hanging off then fell off. Our 2nd room was a bit better. No tea and coffee in the room.  Ice machine and hot water located on the 4th floor.  Ice machine only worked got our first 2 days. Location is excellent just a minute walk to times square.  New York is an amazing place with so much to see.

title: Would not return to this hotel
text:
Stayed here for February half term week with my son.

I paid for a luxury king bed room and it was spacious and on 14th floor. However the room was quite dated and there weren’t enough sockets (only one socket one side of the bed and one more under the desk opposite side of the bed). The bathroom was quite awful too - the bath was so old that it had stains in the enamel. The sink was small and there was little storage. 

The main problem with the room was lack of a refrigerator and the incredibly noisy - I would dare say not fit for purpose - heating system. It was so old that it made so much noise while it was heating that we ended up turning the heating off and requesting an extra blanket. The engineer did come up but said there was nothing he could do, the system was just old, not faulty. Considering it was freezing outside, it was it wasn’t great to have to sleep without the heating.

Also there was no kettle or tea/coffee making facilities although I understand this is the norm in Manhattan hotels - still not great to be honest. Yes there’s an ice machine and cold water dispenser on the 4th floor but that’s hardly convenient.

On the plus side the bed was large and comfortable and the room
Was clean. However I didn’t like the bedding. I would much rather have duvets than scratchy synthetic blankets.

What really ruined the stay was check-out. I was told we could leave our bags and pick them up later so I tried to do that and was met with the rudest, most unreasonable hotel worker I have ever come across. The bell man said there was a fee to pay to leave the bags which I would have paid without complaining (even though I wasn’t told before that there was a fee and most other hotels don’t charge) but he only wanted CASH!! I had no cash on me. I begged him to take payment by card and he said no. I begged him to pay on return because I was in a hurry and didn’t have time to go around looking for an ATM. Again no. I burst into tears and he didn’t give a damn. He wouldn’t even get the bags in a corner while I thought about what to do. He refused to touch the bags until I came up with the cash. I was really upset by the lack of empathy and complete disregard for customer service. I would not return for this alone.

title: Good location, but rooms are small and tired
text: Good location, but rooms are small and tired. Easy transport links across manhattan just a short walk away. A cheap hotel in the centre of manhattan, but don’t expect anything too fancy - it didn’t really appear like the pictures, but was a perfectly serviceable hotel

title: Need Improvement
text: It needs serious cleaning, remodeling and new carpet. The lobby does not reflect the rooms. The rooms smell like cigarette. The bathroom needs a deep cleaning and the mold needs to be removed. The lobby is very cute the rooms are terrible.

title: Hidden ‘facility fee’
text: We were charged a facility fee per room that we were not aware of when booking, paying for a hotel then having to pay for a facility fee as well it’s outrageous. You shouldn’t have to pay an Additional fee for facilities you didn’t use, because let’s face it, you’re in New York you’re not going to be staying in the hotel! The rooms were dirty, we had long black hairs embedded into the covers in the bed, carpets were dirty, the overall vibe on the hotel is not great. Very dark and depressing. Definitely would not recommend this place. Find somewhere better.

title: Unbeatable location for the theater and Times square
text: The location is great. The rooms are basic and could use an update, but they were clean and the double double room I was in was spacious.Chosen because they did not charge a resort fee and therefore, was considerably less than other area hotels. I would definitely stay there again. Don't expect many amenities at the price.

title: Decent Hotel
text:
Rooms were small,no refrigerator & shower & bath water pressure low.Plus marks are very clean hotel,nice staff & probably best location for Broadway theatre district & Times Square area.

Returning to hotel facilities there was no entertainment within the hotel,certainly none advertised or witnessed & no restaurant plus bar was closed sometimes in afternoon late evening.Although plenty bars nearby of course.Overall it was an ok experience would choose elsewhere on returning to New York City.

title: Nice Lobby & Rooms for homebodies.  Thrill of Time Square/Food/Shopping for those who like to explore.
text:
Very walkable location.  Easy to get to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State, Restaurants, train and more.  Will be back for more trips here.  

Good lobby, next to time square & amazing food choices in Hells Kitchen.

title: Not up to Scratch
text: Rooms were small. No tea/ coffee making facilities. Boiling water could be obtained 13 floors down, when it was working. Hand basin drain stopper did not work and was not fixed despite reporting it. Reception staff were very disinterested,

title: Excellent Stay !!!
text: Just returned from a WONDERFUL 4 night stay at the Paramount Hotel, I was a bit nervous regards staying here due to seeing so many mixed reviews! The location is fab and just around the corner from Times Square. The staff were very friendly and really helpful. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels and the beds were very comfy especially after being out all day in the city, the bathrooms are a little bit on the dated side but ideal for what you need. Overall, great hotel and will return in the future.

title: Amazing 😍 great spot 😍 great value for money 100% defo best location
text: Great trip.. great location turn left when come out off the hotel bang smack in middle off time square 👍hotel view was gr8 I was on the 19th floor amazing views great value for the price off hotel couldn't ask for better spot 💯 rebooked this hotel

title: Not the cleanest! Rude staff
text:
On arrival I was dissatisfied with the size of the room, the carpet was stained and dirty, food in the corner on the room and it was still there when we checked out. 
The only positive is this hotel is in. Great location

title: Tired but True
text: The building is worn down, but the staff do an amazing job of the upkeep and cleanliness. The location is perfect for Times Square and the theatres. Its just a short walk to 5th Avenue and Hells Kitchen. All in all a great hotel. We will be back.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: Great hotel in the heart of the Theatre District that is remarkably quiet at night! Rooms are clean and comfortable, the halls are well maintained with no smells. Lobby is very chic. Staff is friendly. I’ve stayed twice at The Paramount to go to a show next door at Sony Hall and would stay again.

title: Business trip
text:
Hotel in a perfect location. I turn the corner and you find Time Square. A stone's throw from the major metro stops. Small but clean and quiet room. Overall great hotel
I hope the Lobby will be as beautiful as I remember it again

title: Would not return, even for FREE
text:
Our group chose this hotel for our exit point after a cruise:  NYC->Caribbean->NYC.  
The only reason we give a 2 is the front desk staff and bellman were great.
As for the room?  Take a look at the pictures.  As a business traveler I expect to find the" omnipresent black hair on the white shower or bath".  In this case there were three 6-7 inch black hairs draping down the shower wall. Obviously it had not been cleaned.  Worse, the shower had mold in the tiles.  The shower failed to drain.  I imagine it is stuffed with hairs.  That water then pooled ankle deep while brining off of the moldy tiles!  The tissues were used - ripped and hanging limply from the dispenser on the wall.  I didn't get a photo, as we were hurrying, but I found my Towel had a perfect LIPSTICK smile where someone had used it to blot their recently applied lip-butter.  All I wanted was to feel clean after a sweaty day.  I left the bathroom feeling disgusted.  Lastly we got a good chuckle as the bathroom looks like it was designed after Ryker's Island!

title: Paramount hotel double room
text: The bed was just about big enough for one person never mind two. There was no room to even walk around the bed. The window was so heavy it was nearly impossible to open. The radiator fan is so noisy it wakes you up during the night.

title: Good time!
text:
I was worried… but didn’t need to be. Came Valentine’s week For 4 nights from the UK. 

Positives:
Quick and friendly checkin
Elevators were fast and we didn’t have to wait for them
Amazing location
Clean room
Comfy bed
Hot and powerful shower
Rooms cleaned daily with fresh towels
Hairdryer provided 

Not so Positive…
Small room - but this is to be expected - so we unpacked into the wardrobe and made the most of the space that we had
Noisy aircon - so we didn’t use it - I found the rooms to be very warm! 
The window did open - but wouldn’t stay open - so I propped it open. We slept with it open every night and the noise from the street not an issue at all

Somethings we did to make our stay easier - took a kettle - made a hot drink when we woke up at stupid o’clock due to jet lag - also some porridge pots and some general
Snacks. 

For the amount of time you are at the hotel
- and based on location - we were thrilled! 

Enjoy x

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: After booking & then reading some of the not so good reviews, I was worried about staying here…BUT we were really pleased with this hotel. The location is excellent, 30 seconds walk from Times Square, yes the rooms need a bit of TLC but they’re clean (and I’m fussy), the beds were SO comfy & the shower was hot. So all in all I’d stay here again.

title: Wouldn’t return to this hotel
text:
Hotel has a terrible appearance from the outside, and unbelievably dark and unwelcoming reception area. 
Rooms definitely need updating and very basic. 
Location of the hotel is very close to Times Square, so that is a positive but also very noisy and busy area.
Unfortunately met one of the rudest hotel receptionists ever (she refused to give her name, but if any hotel management are reading this she was working evening of 9th February around 10pm) we asked for a paper cup so we could drink some water in the room as there were none in our room, she directed us to the 4th floor as said there were some there, we went up to the 4th floor and no cups were left so we went back downstairs to reception, we explained there were none left, she went under the counter and produced a couple of paper cups but proceeded to moan at us saying it was not what the hotel do to give out “paper cups” when it wasn’t our fault they hadn’t restocked them on the “4th floor” she was so rude, and was it too much work to put her hand under the desk to get a paper cup?! And at the price we all pay to stay at this rundown hotel. Shocking. Wouldn’t return to this hotel when there are plenty of others to stay in.

title: Excelente Ubicacion
text:
Hotel muy bien, pero ruidoso en las noches.
Clientes muy nerviosos.
La recepción oscura pero con estilo
El bar del Lobby súper bien 
La comida no la probamos 
En las noches, muchos gritos en los pasillos
La ubicación es genial, cerca de todo.
Para Familias con niños no lo recomiendo.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square, NYC
text:
Absolutely loved our stay at Paramount Hotel. Super close to everything in Times Square and all the Broadway shows. Coffee shops on every corner. Really helpful staff from checking in to booking a transfer to JFK on the same day going back to the UK. 

We miss being in NY but it won’t be long until we’re back again! Thank you for the most amazing trip and memories! It’s been one to remember!

title: Shabby, and disappointing hotel. 1 star at best.
text:
Just arrived in town and couldn’t check in until 4 if we didn’t want a room over looking a construction site, so we waited until 4 and now have a 2 double bed superior room overlooking a drab wall with razor wire and noisy airCon units. Not worth the wait!
The room is tiny despite being classed as a superior double, not superior in any sense nor are the 2 beds doubles, 3/4 beds at best.
Very little storage, tiny closet and only 2 drawers, and nowhere to put the suitcases.
No kettle, tea or coffee equipment, with the reason being that kettles are more trouble than they are worth and there are so many coffee shops in the area, so they said they would however send mugs and glasses up so the kids can have a soft drink during our 5 night stay. But what was sent up was 6 paper cups….
A great start to this visit and frankly can’t wait to return home.
This was classed as a luxury hotel by the travel agent but when this was quoted to the reception staff, their response was that we wouldn’t call it luxurious, as it’s a boutique hotel. I had to laugh at that!

title: Total crap
text:
Rooms were not cleaned once while we were there staff were unhelpful and unfriendly. I am still waiting for the manager to return my call. 

Honestly it caters for tourists who don’t know better, the rooms aren’t large enough to swing a cat in and there are no amenities of any kind

title: 5 days in New York
text: Great city to visit,Taking all the sites Especially on top of the rock the view was amazing,Also the Edge ,A mazing experience .Great restaurants to choose from.The 911 site was a very moving experience.

title: Great location, but rooms were lacking!
text: The location could not be better, Times Square was just a block away. However, the hotel is pretty old. It needs some major upgrades in the rooms. The bathrooms are old and the rooms are small. But overall, cool for a weekend!

title: Bene
text: Poteva andare meglio ma comunque buona soluzione a prezzi molto contenuti… ne vale la pena tutto sommato! Da acquistare con pacchetto volo più hotel dall’Italia…………………… vicina Times square e la sera hai sempre qualcosa da fare

title: Pleasantly suprised
text: Through a private holiday firm for the price we paid I was not expecting much but the location was amazing, right next to time square. The price and tax were much lower than other hotels we stopped at and although the rooms were quite plain they were spotless and the beds were comfy enough that I found no problem. The atmosphere is not for people who like glitz and glamour, I found it calming and a nice break from all the bright lights of New York.

title: Paramount Hotel February 2024
text: We have just returned from NYC. The location of this hotel is perfect for sightseeing and is 30 seconds from Times Square. The rooms are small but ours was clean and we had it cleaned and fresh towels daily. If you are planning on staying in your room all day it’s not for you, a base to stay, sleep and get out and enjoy NYC it’s perfect. Little bits could have done with a little touch up and the bar is small but we always got a seat and beers are all bottles. If you  want 5* this is not for you!!!

title: Holiday
text: Not a bad hotel in a good location shame about the smell of weed all the time has soon has you walk out the main entrance. Cleaner’s very good and work hard cleaning every day if you wanted it. Average hotel first time in New York very pricey.

title: Nice hotel in a great location but needs updating
text: Nice hotel in a great location.  We moved rooms as our heating wasn't working and was moved to the front of the hotel but it was very noisey due to the old windows. The room was a good size with very comfy beds but the windows were old metal with drafts blowing through all the time. We rolled up our bath towels to keep the draft out!! We had no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which would have been nice. We did have a garment steamer instead of an iron which was fabulous. Nice bar area with very nice and strong cocktails and 10% discount as we were hotel guests so that was good.

title: Avoid!!!! - rooms are better in a hostel!!!
text:
Avoid!!!! Room in very poor condition, Damages, bedding used with makeup and blood on sheets, body hair in bath!!
Made front of house aware and did nothing to rectify our issues and was told well we are not a stared / rated hotel

title: Average: location excellent but room terrible
text: We stayed here in December hotel is a great location! 2 mins walk frm Times Square lots of restaurants and fast food. Shops etc. close to subway! The hotel itself looks lovely on arrival and reception but the rooms are very basic. Our room must have been next to the hot water tank so all night every night we heard banging clanking and running water which was very very annoying!! Toilet in room isn’t nice it’s a big metal toilet and the shower is very hard to get into and very small. Value for money for location it’s good for the actual room it’s self it’s shocking Would I stay again. Prob not.

title: Creeepy - Don't stay there; Not worth it.
text:
I had a heater problem in my room. I called it in twice, and nobody was sent and hotel cancelled my service call.
I returned to the hotel around midnight, went to the front desk and she still insisted to send me the engineer before switching me to room with functioning heater - at midnight!
Heater still did not work, and then front desk sent me three times to a room that was occupied - even though they should have known as I reported to them that the keycard was flashing orange which means the room is locked from the inside. 
They showed a lot more concern about the illegal occupants than me, making me go back and forth before finally swicthing me at 2am in the morning to an available room with a working heater of the exact same configuration I had booked.
The whole experience was horrible and creepy. Worse hotel ever!
They also add on a very high $40 resort fee per night at the hotel.

title: Good Location
text: Overall hotel is in a good location, very clean, bedrooms on the smaller side but ok although a better design was needed for our bathroom to be able sit on toilet, bar needs a few improvements as very hot and seating not comfortable, staff were very good and always available to help if necessary, good base for Times Square.

title: Alright.
text:
On Times Square so expect noise. Not a problem for our stay though, we don’t mind. 
Concierge was no help. Just handed us a flyer and said to use google 
Overall, good location and was a place to rest after a day of sight seeing and shopping

title: Read the reviews before booking and don’t trust hotels description of rooms and facilities!
text: We booked what we were told was a “deluxe king room” but that is false advertising as nothing deluxe about our room! We even double checked we had been given right room. Photos on website are misleading!  Very poorly decorated! Very basic all round and dated. Bathroom decor was awful and looks like those you see in prisons on TV.  We also had the delight of the very strong  smell of weed coming through the vents every day.  Very few plug sockets! One heater in the room blasting out hot air and the other air conditioning! Asked every day for the heater to be turned off and it wasn't! Had to sleep with the windows open and listen to the loud fans in the enclosed area outside window! No tea or coffee making facilities. The bar is tiny and poorly stocked! We also there when someone walked in off street through side door  into bar and staff had to ask him to leave. Only redeeming factors that stopped us from checking out and going to another hotel were that bed was Ok, location good and if not for the fans outside room it would have been quiet location!

title: Great value
text: Hotel ticked all the boxes for what we needed. Clean, comfortable, rooms were small but worth it for the location. Sheets were changed every day. Check-in was easy. Air-con/heating was a little difficult to work. Gym in the hotel was very convenient.

title: Not the best but fit for purpose
text:
Our first experience upon arriving at Paramount was to be told that our room had been cancelled! After an 8 hour flight it was not the stress we needed. After speaking with management we were assured that the room was still booked… not a good first impression. City / state tax cost around $87 for 5 nights.

The room (queen superior) was very small. I can’t imagine what the smaller rooms are like! The photos on the website are not reflective of the rooms at all. If you aren’t planning on spending much time in the room and you don’t have a lot of luggage, it’s probably fine. We didn’t find the lack of space to cause an issue but on first sight, it was shockingly small but ended up being manageable.

We had housekeeping every day which was great and we were provided with fresh towels each day. The room was clean and everything worked as it should. We had air con on most of the time (in January) as the room was very warm. The beds were comfy and clean. 

The location is great!!! There was no noise overnight considering how central the hotel is to Times Square. 

Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Paramount, it was good enough for the purpose of a busy city trip. We wouldn’t rush to come back and I think there are much better hotels out there for similar prices.

title: It was a disaster!
text: The rooms are a complete disaster and, from a hygienic point of view, very bad! I will also write a negative review and post it on every website there is. In addition, as an influencer, I will rate this hotel negatively on all social media!

title: Great overall hotel 😊
text: Amazing perfect location, basic rooms but just what you need and very clean, very helpful friendly cleaners, the two ladies who worked behind the bar were very friendly loved them, would definitely stay here again

title: Budget friendly for the non picky traveler
text: This is what I call my version of getting "Catfished". Let me start with the positives, great location, clean and the staff had great customer service! Restaurant isn't accessible through hotel so by the time you walk outside you "better" options to explore. Bar is very small and hidden in the back. Size of rooms and restrooms were very small as well. (Stayed in 2 double bed room) Sony Hall closed and under construction - know before you go.

title: Hotel Increible
text:
El hotel esta a 30 segundos de Time Square, muy limpio y moderno.
Las habitaciones limpias y cómodas, no son grandes pero suficientes para dejar las maletas y estar cómodos.
La cama grande y cómoda al igual que las almohadas.
El recepcionista muy amable y simpático, era el único que hablaba español.
Tienen hielo y agua gratis.
Esta muy cerca del metro.
Sin duda volveré.

title: Good stay in the end!
text:
Wasn’t sure what to expect from other reviews.  On arrival the lobby looked lovely and check in easy.  However we arrived at our room which is sold as a double but was the size of a stamp.  The bed was right up against the window - which had a cold breeze blowing in all night - so much so I had to sleep with my hood up!  The heat/aircon unit was so loud and smelly.     I went down to ask if I could switch rooms - we had to stay one night in our original room then moved to a queen room which was an extra 20 dollars a night.   This room was so much better and so worth the extra money if you like a little more space.    Room was clean and comfy. Good tv channel choice.   We were pretty much out all day so a bit of comfort was nice in the eve - the first room didn’t really have that vibe.    I had emailed ahead to say it was for my daughters 21st if we could have a nice room - feel we got the worse!   However after moving all was good.  The staff are super helpful and friendly 
Yes you can smell weed but the whole of Times Square stinks of it! So maybe stay further out! 
All in all once we had moved rooms our stay was fine.  Location is very good for exploring but is loud as you’re right by the square

title: Good location no thrills
text:
I was unsure what to expect when booking hotel as weeks leading up to arrival I noticed mixed reviews however I was satisfied with the stay.  The hotel is in a great location right next to times sq and only a short walk to both subways.  It has a good size lobby with comfortable seating but with a dark decor throughout, we was able to check in early and went to our room.  Room was okay with enough electric sockets and TV. Beds were comfy enough bathroom on the small side but towels replaced each day and room cleaned so overall happy with the accommodation.  
I think a few improvements would really make the stay much more enjoyable, the air con unit is loud when turned on, sounds like needs replacing. Tea n coffee facility in room would be a nice addition or even in the lobby.  I did notice renovation works being carried out at the hotel.
If you just want a no thrills stay for a few nights then i think this hotel will be fine

title: Very noisy and bedroom and bathroom are far away to be clean and good.
text: Very noisy and bedroom and bathroom are far away to be clean and good. Carpet in the bedroom needs to changed, the bath is disgusting and I had to step in to have a shower as the shower is in the bath. The sink looks like they got it from a prison. The wardrobe is dirty, no breakfast available and over charged for facilities fee.

title: Cut my losses and checked out early - worst hotel ever!
text: RUN - as fast as you can, away from this place. I travel for work frequently and this has to be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Noisiest, dirtiest, unhelpful staff, unsafe... the list goes on. I should have read the room when I arrived in the lobby and two separate guests were crying - one from the noise and unable to sleep, the other because her room had been given away and she was stranded. DO NOT STAY HERE!

title: Great place for a short break in NYC
text: Great stay. Despite all the negative comments, we enjoyed our stay. Fantastic location. Close to everything, Time Square, hells kitchen etc. But yet had a nice relaxing sleep, quiet enough. Comfy bed. Yes, the building is quite old, and rooms might need renovation, but it didn't bother us at all. Very good staff, polite and helpful. Definitely would come back again.

title: Good location- small beds
text: We as a family of 4 had booked a 2 needed room however Beds are very small. We had to book an extra room for my mum and daughter. Heating in rooms was just a fan and blew out warm and then cold air(-13C Outside) I did work with it on different settings but still no luck. No tea/coffee facilities in rooms. You have to go to the 2nd or 4th floor for water. Remember to bring your own tea bags etc as nothing is provided.Great location tho just off Times Square.

title: Basic
text: Hotel room so small no coffee facility,  Leak on the 10th floor asked to move as there was river running down walls and corridor and was told " not possible " Customer Service could be better.Also couldn't adjust heating even though it was -8 outside☹️

title: Great stay excellent location
text: Great stay with the Paramount for 4 nights, you couldn’t ask for a better location in NY 2 minute walk to Times Square. All the facilities you need for a city break, easy check in/out with very friendly staff, room always made up well everyday and very clean.

title: Don’t get caught
text:
As we checked out we were asked if we had taxi booking, we said no we plan to do it closer to the time, the receptionist offered to do it so we agreed to the “shuttle” this turned out to be a bus with other passengers all who were unaware the trip would be a shared ride for the same amount as private transportation, the driver almost left us late as he had other pick ups took long way I assume to avoid tolls And worst of all he gave over the wrong luggage at terminal 1 which wasn’t realised untill we were at terminal 4, shame on the receptionist who misrepresented this to our party of 2 and to the 7 other passengers he collected at Paramount, book your own taxi 
Other than this hotel is basic clean and great location and quiet enough that we could sleep well

title: Wouldn't recommend.
text: Our room did NOT look like the pictures at all. The room was really small and not the nicest. The bathroom was not nice. We were n the 9th floor and had a bad view out our window. The hallways also don't look like the pictures and they had a really strong smell of week every time we walked in or out of the hotel. The location is good as time square is only a 2 minute walk away. The price was also extortionate which is understandable for New York but it would be fine if it looked like the pictures.

title: Smells of pot, rooms dated
text:
Hotel is in an amazing location, it is one of the best locations for the money. However... The hotel reeks of pot, the rooms are dated, the mattress needs replacing.

Otherwise it matches the photos, no fridge in room, limited storage if you are doing a weekender sure give it a shot.. If you are staying for a week maybe spend a few bucks more and stay at a different place.

title: Do not book here
text: Would not come back here. First of all the rooms are tiny, there was only two of us and we didn’t even have room to open out suitcases on the floor to get our stuff out, we had to put it on the bed with dirty wheels etc from wheeling them about the streets. Constant draft from the window, noisy location. Our water stopped working for half a day, no shower, no running water, no toilet. Then when we were sleeping one night the ceiling started the leak water!!! Our bed was completely soaked within 10 minutes, we had to move rooms twice and beg for a late check out the following day as we had a late flight. It was a nightmare of a stay and we won’t be back

title: Worst room in 40years
text: The room was terrible frozen with draught constantly blowing in window the toilet was like from the 1970s chipped tiles heating stopped working which made the room sub zero through the night on one night decided to go to bar a large Rose wine and a can yes a can of Guiness was 35 dollars that was 10 percent of for hotel guests we always go to Las vegas maybe I'm just spoilt avoid honestly

title: Mostly very good
text: Found rooms were a little dated and could use a refresh to clean them up m. Rooms were very clean though, Beds very comfy , and location was absolutely wonderful . Staff were good,  especially the bartenders in the hotel bar.

title: Good if you’re just sleeping.
text: Rooms are so tiny that there was not enough space for two of us with two suitcases. Shower would go hot and cold constantly, air con/heating system was hard to understand, constant draft from the window and noisy as close to Times Square.

title: Thank you for a pleasant stay.
text:
I was very unsure about what to expect after reading these reviews. I was very pleasantly surprised.
We arrived on the 15th January in the evening hotel reception is very dark with low lighting but I think it makes it quirky. Reception staff checked us in all very friendly yes there are taxes to pay but that’s always the case in New York. We were given our room card room 404 on the 4th floor. We booked a twin double  bed room. We got two lovely beds with very deep mattresses on and soft pillows which where very comfortable to sleep in. There wasn’t much of a view but this was not a problem as we would only be resting in the room you have to be outside in New York to appreciate it. Black out blinds on the windows too. Big flat screen tv with plenty of channels. There was a small wardrobe with hangers and two draws which was enough. There was a safety deposit  Which was free to use just had to set your own password. There is a small hairdryer in the room. Bathroom was fine with hot water and fresh towels daily.  Our room was done each day and beds all made rubbish taken out for us. We were able to pay a little extra on our last day to keep the room which was great to have a late checkout at 2pm you can store your luggage for $3 dollers. 
All in all we had a very pleasant stay here and if I return to NY I will not hesitate to rebook.

title: Great location, but below average hotel
text: The hotel is in a great location, but the hotel was below average. The pillows were very flat, there was a strong odor throughout the hotel (even in our room), and there were pricey resort fees and more fees to hold our luggage after checkout.

title: Worst hotel room I've stayed in
text:
Avoid hotel unless you like staying in dirty cramped rooms that feels like a prison cell! They are nothing like the pictures!!!

Gods knows how this is classed as a 4 star hotel it's terrible. The bathroom is also very cramped, both taps have hot water no cold.  We checked out after one night couldn't take it anymore moved across Times square.  We are still chasing for a refund but still don't have any response.  Don't waste your money!!

title: Paramount hotel Times Square
text: Excellent location and rooms . Lovely reception and seating areas and lovely staff everything you need in a room in such a central location . Easily accessible for all subway journeys and close enough to most attractions to walk

title: Perfect location, Great hotel!
text:
I am so confused as to why there are so many negative reviews, 
We arrived at the hotel at 1pm due to an earlier arrival on our flight, 
I was stressing because I knew check in was 4pm but I thought I would ask if we could leave our luggage somewhere for a few hours,
The receptionist actually checked us in to our room 3 hours early, and not just me, but every guest that was on our flight, 
I was very grateful for this! 
We were also able to keep our room until 2pm for an additional fee,
Yes, we had to pay Tax, but going into New York this is obvious,
You pay tax on the majority of stores in New York, so why would a hotel be any different?

The rooms are small, they are basic, however they come with a lot of additional facilities, 
A large tv with cable, and a variety of channels, 
A steam iron, a hairdryer, mirrors, a safe, a small wardrobe, aircon, a hot shower, a bath tub, (the hot water and water pressure is amazing) multiple clean towels and toiletries, 
Our toiletries and towels have been changed everyday, 
The beds are small and basic but quite comfortable, 
Our room had blackout blinds and more than one lock on the door, 
This is probably the first hotel I have actually felt safe and comfortable in! 

The location is perfect, Times Square and plenty of shops and restaurants within extremely small walking distance, Local beautiful surroundings.

For a city that doesn’t sleep, Me and my partner have slept amazingly here, 
I can’t fault it.

Please go into the hotel with an open mind, don’t always believe every review you read.

I would have marked it 5 stars, but the only downside is the our bathroom is very outdated, and our bathroom sink is quite grotty, (you can see in the photo), the decor is outdated and our hairdryer didn’t work, but everything else is brilliant,
I would return!
Thankyou!

title: Very good Hotel
text: this Hotel for the prices is very good great location to Times Square and the theaters in the area.  close to subway stations and bus routes.  room was clean and for just me was a good size nice bathroom

title: Will be going back in the near future
text: Was in a good location, 1 min from times square. Friendly and helpful staff. The hotel was dark inside, but was lovely. Rooms where also a good size. And the beds where comfortable. The hotel was on the same street if you where wanting to see a broadway show.

title: Location is best thing about this hotel
text:
This hotel is in a great location, right near times square but beware that it is a very very busy road that gets stuck with both works, cars and people! The foyer is very nice, clean and plenty of seating but the rooms need updating and refreshing. The beds are comfy but the bathrooms need things fixing. This hotel is ideal for exploring NY and just needing a bed for the night. The staff are not overly helpful, we had an issue with our air con unit (in their extreme humid heatwave) and we asked someone to look at it twice, and no one ever came! 
There is also a long wait for lifts if you leave in the morning or come back at certain busy times.

title: Brilliant place
text: Great place to stay no hassle rooms are nice all refurbished beds are comfy bath and shower on hand staff are nice plenty seats to make your self comfy while you wait on your taxi or friends plenty off lifts to take you to your room rooms are nice and warm would definitely stay again

title: First Time Visit to NY?
text: If it's your first time, this hotel is a good choice since it is 30 seconds from Times Square. You can easily access all the important places and broadway is right across the street. If you've been to NY before I don't believe this hotel does enough to justify you spending money there. There are many other options for the same price but with much better value. Unless you value the time to get to Times Square, I believe there are better options.

title: an excellent stay once again!
text: I have stayed at the Paramount several times before and I like it because it is very centrally located, convenient to all the theaters and the restaurants on 8th and 9th Avenues and is a very comfortable hotel. The staff is very helpful. I was travelling alone and stayed in a single which was fine and suited my needs for the time I was in NYC. The single room is small and during the rest of the year would be no problem but in the winter, there is really limited space to hang up coats, etc. The closet space is limited even for one person. In terms of bathtub safety, either a grab bar should be installed along the back wall /side wall.  Decals should be placed on the floor of the tub or a rubber bath mat provided to avoid an unfortunate accident. Another thing which would be ideal would be to provide some plastic or paper cups. There are also no wash/face cloths provided.  I was surprised to see some evidence of things needing to be repaired [picture enclosed] Otherwise, In summary, I cannot say enough about the Paramount. Its location is paramount, and overall comfort is optimal.

title: Lage perfekt
text: Zimmer und Bad müssen modernisiert werden, abgewohnt. Empfangshalle mega, Personal super nett und hilfsbereit. Laut, ist aber der Gegend geschuldet. Unser Ausblick war auf eine Wand, welche 1 metter von ins entfernt war.

title: Morbid charm - clean - good mattresses - friendly staff
text: Morbid charm but still clean, good mattresses and very friendly staff. Recommendable if you want to stay in midtown manhattan. The construction site across the street will take some time but does not really bother.

title: Don’t believe the bad comments
text:
I wasn’t looking forward to staying here as some of the reviews were awful. I stayed with my two granddaughters and it was a two double bedded room. I found it perfectly adequate for the three of us. It was clean, the towels were changed daily. The shower was adequate, plenty of hot water. When we arrived the room safe wasn’t working the maintenance man came straight away but he couldn’t fix it, so they bought us a new safe. The reception staff are very pleasant and helpful.
The reason for only four stars, we were on the front and there was quite a draft from the window which made the building work sound even louder, also there was quite a smell of weed throughout the hotel.
Other than that I would certainly recommend this hotel and if I’m ever in New York again would certainly use it.

title: Please don’t be panicked by bad reviews.
text:
After reading recent reviews I was pretty anxious on arrival with my husband and 2 daughters. But reception checking was very quick and easy, our 2 double bedroom was grand, not huge but never expected it to be big in NYC. All clean & comfortable. We were at the front of the hotel in 12th floor. Building site opposite started each weekday morning at 7am and as the air con unit is part of window it sounds like window is open. Thankfully I’d brought ear plugs so we were fine (and awake early too with time difference from home!) 
We used the gym each day and was great. Location was unreal, 30 sec walk to time square. Perfect for what we wanted. Staff all very friendly and nice coffee shop on corner as you walk out to right for breaky each day. I would certainly stay here again.

title: Excellent Location, Very Kind Staff
text: First, the location is excellent, very close to Times Square.  I stayed in a single room.  Of course, it was small, but it was clean and convenient.  I recommend this room if you travel alone.  The staff were very kind.  I left my luggage bags in the hotel after checkout, and they charged only $3.

title: On the doorstep from times square
text:
OK so I was very very nervous about this hotel after reading all the negative reviews. But in all fairness we arrived at 2.30 & was checked in quickly reception lady was very welcoming & friendly, we were given a room upgrade. Our room was a decent size a large double I'd say, was clean & tidy & did us fine for our stay we took a travel kettle & hot drinks which was a life saver if you are desperate for a coffe before heading out in the mornings, otherwise theres no cups in the
the room, there is facilities for cold/hot water also ice machine on the 4th floor, we had fresh towels & room was cleaned  daily, We didnt use any of the hotels facilities so cant comment on those but its very dark (dim) in the lobby & throughout the corridoors, The location is the key factor, its literally out the doors to the left & your in times square & around the block for all the boardway shows.

title: Stay away
text: This hotel is a nightmare, we visited here from the 31st-7th of January 2024 travelling all the way from Scotland we were very excited about the experience, we paid roughly £2000 for this hotel for the week, once we arrived we were told we had to pay an extra £300 which was a “maintenance fee” after being given our room key and reaching our room we were shocked to see the state of the room and the size of it, we could each every corner of the room from the one place, not only that but the place was filthy, and the tv was broken, after complaining we were told that they couldn’t move us that night due to being fully booked, and we were left to spend new years the most important night in a tiny, filthy room with no tv.

title: Not for large group of people
text: This trip was for four friends. Room experience not that great. It is for small families does not work for large group of people. I wouldn’t recommend for friends. No amnesties included. No free breakfast or parking.

title: 5 nights stay
text: Had a brilliant 5 night stay at the paramount. Fantastic location. Very good value for money. Very clean and friendly staff. Would defiantly recommend to friends and family and when we hopefully return again to NYC will stay here again.

title: Worst hotel Ever
text: Checked in and started to look for another hotel straight away , hotel smelt of drugs throughout , room disgusting , dirty, mould, bed all ripped, no heating , safe broken . Found another hotel for the following 9 nights . Still waiting call from hotel manager 7 days after I left him voicemail, do not stay here

title: Overall good
text: Website photos made the rooms appear larger and nicer than they are in actuality.  Our carpets were a little bit stained.  People were smoking quite a bit of weed in the hallways but it's New York City and that appears normal.  Overall our stay was good and the staff was friendly.  Thanks!

title: Skip it, not worth it in any way
text: Too much to comment on, location is the only positive for this hotel. Broken, dirty, run down, not secure, outdated, poor room layout, lacking amenities. Sketchy people ride the elevators with you. Lack of attention to detail in literally every way.

title: Very Good experience. Stayed Jan 2024
text: Spent 5 nights here with my family. Staff were very nice. The hotel was always clean with fresh towels etc. The loction was perfect and you got value for money. All other bad reviews do NOT reflect my experience.  If you want 5 Star luxury then pay for it. Just one point. Rooms are small for a family of 4. Beds could have been slighly bigger.  Thanks Paramount.

title: Mostly happy
text: The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. My only complaint was the thermostat in the room didn't work. It wasn't set on "heat" when we checked in. I changed the setting and increased the temperature a few degrees. The temperature in the room never went up all night long. In fact, it went down a degree instead. Otherwise, loved the location as our theatre was right across the street and the beds were comfy for us to spend a night in.

title: Great value, perfect location!
text: Location is great, staff is helpful and friendly. My friends and I felt safe with the door guard during the night. The room is your average hotel room in terms of space and comfort - it’s clean and not noisy.

title: Nice location but a little too "impersonal and noisy" even for NYC
text: The place is in great location (46th st.) and the checkin and check out fast and accurate BUT due to the construction site right in front of it sleeping after 7 o'clock was almost impossible. Not having even a pare of glass for water in the room was also very "unexpected" and when I tried to get it @ front desk they told me to "try the bar" (??) - Not whats I was expecting to get from the Hotel staff :-(

title: bad security and smell of weed on the bedroom floor for 05 days and the management did nothing
text: The location is good, but the customer service is terrible, we complained to the night manager and he only told us what we wanted him to do!!! that he couldn't control it, but for 05 days and they can't do anything, that's incredible,

title: Great location  value for money
text: We really enjoyed our stay, the rooms were small however we expected this prior to arrival. The resort fees for 5 night were 89 dollars and 1 dollar charge for damages. The staff on reception were extremely friendly as were the maids bar staff etc the only downfall really was the noise at night but suppose this is to be expected in the city that never sleeps. We will deffo return thank you.

title: Soddisfatti!!!
text: Hotel un po' cupo e tetro  negli ambienti comuni e lungo i corridoi,le stanza sono piccole ma luminose,confortevoli e dotate di ciò che serve.Non ci sono però ne' frigo ne' bollitore.Noi abbiamo optato per un piano alto, il 15esimo,perché essendo in ottima posizione accanto a Time Square non volevamo patire il casino di notte e così è stato.Paghi subito con carta di credito la tassa di soggiorno(non accettano contanti) ma non ci hanno chiesto alcuna cauzione.Se devi lasciare i bagagli,paghi in contanti il deposito di 3€ a valigia fino alla mezzanotte del giorno della partenza.E' tutto molto pulito:le camere vengono risistemate ogni giorno e gli asciugamani cambiati.Lo consigliamo!!

title: Perfect location, could be cleaner
text: Great location! In the middle of Time Square, accordingly very loud in the evening. The beds were very comfortable and you got new shampoo every day, etc. Wenn man sein Gepäck dort abgeben möchte, dann kostet es pro Gepäckstück 3$.

title: Worst hotel ever
text: This place is terrible! The rooms are cramped and dated, there isn’t even any water on the rooms. The bathroom was dated and old and smelly as the fan didn’t work. The windows didn’t fit properly and the road noise was awful. We were booked for 10 nights, we had to leave after 3 as we were so miserable.

title: Amazing NYE experience at the Paramount
text: My family had a great experience while staying at the Paramount for NYE. No complaints and the staff were extremely helpful in making sure our stay was memorable. The staff were very accommodating in making sure we had an excellent night. Highly recommend.

title: Holiday Stay at The Paramount Hotel...move on with your online search to another hotel
text: Let's just say I believe that this hotel benefits from it's proximity to Times Square (less than a block) and regardless of what I say, people will continue to book rooms here b/c of it's location alone. Sadly the hotel amenities, which looked amazing from the hotel's website were not as advertised. First off, the lobby lighting was like "club" lighting 24/7....why so dark ALL THE TIME....and the website touts a bar + game room, which due to traveling with another family, and wanting to have a common meeting area and area to possibly kill time (without spending money at a restaurant/bar) is NO LONGER a hotel amenity...the hotel bar is but doesn't open until 5 pm but the "game room" area has been walled off and is hotel storage.....The hotel doesn't seem to think the year is 2024 as even if your room is not ready, they won't text or email you when it is...they ask you to return at 4 pm to check in....and when we arrrived back after shopping the line was about 40-50 peoplle deep with ONE employee assisting with checking in...finally after about 20 minutes in line a 2nd employee began assisting with check-in. I understand potentially being understaffed in these current times...but if that is the case, allow people to check in prior to 4 pm (meaning get rooms ready earlier)....As I said at the beginning this hotel will continue to book rooms bc tourists from all over the world flock to Times Square daily.....but in the future I won't be one of them

title: Amazing experience
text:
The hotel is located in a strategic position, the staff is helpful and the romm is small but confortable.
It is ideal for a stay in NY; the hotel is near times square, broadway, central park, Moma etc.. You can visit the city on foot.

title: nicht noch mal
text: Sehr kleines Zimmer, leider nur einen Nachtisch, trotz Doppelzimmer, keine Möglichkeit einen Koffer abzustellen, selbst am Fussboden zu wenig Platz. Waschbecken hatte scharfe Kanten, welche die Hosen beschädigt hat. Eine Beschwerde an der Rezeption führte zu keiner Änderung. Sehr schwach.

title: Terrible hotel
text: Ugly, bad bedrooms. Booked 4 nights for a good an amount of $ but had to move rooms twice due to various problems with amenities; then eventually had no choice but settle down to get through the time: outdated ugly bedrooms lacking basic amenities, Smelly bathroom (fans not working), sink and bathtubs damaged; rooms are super small with no actual view; no water and coffee in the room, limited towels. Unfriendly staff. Felt like a cheap hostel in bedrooms, although lobby looks fancy. Weird!

title: Amazing place for the price we paid.
text: What an amazing place for the amazing price. As soon as you walk into the lobby it takes your breath away. Very nice. The lift was a little dated. Now the room again couldn't ask for anything more for the price it was a great room and bathroom, the view.. there wasn't one but oh well.

title: Try it
text: it was excellent I loved my stay there and I will be back soon by the way there was a lady at the reception she is impeccable a very young lady i dont remember her name the welcome was very warm I congratulate the team and the service is impeccable

title: Fantastic location, hotel slightly dated
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location, if you want to be in the centre of it all then this is the hotel for you. 

The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated and the check in was smooth and the staff were friendly. 

However, the rooms are tiny and are in desperate need of updating. We upgraded to a Queen Superior Room and still felt like this was tiny. Nowhere proper to store away your clothes and leaving your suitcase out takes up most of the room. The thermostat was useless, difficult to control and turn on/off. 

The plug sockets are awful, make sure you take a type B socket as otherwise the plug will fall out of the wall. My hair dryer didn’t work so I had to use the one provided by the hotel and my partner had to hold the plug in the wall!

Even though you’re not allowed to smoke in the hotel, be prepared for the constant smell of marijuana in the hallways. 

Finally, it’s not that bad of a hotel. Would I come back? Maybe. But not in a rush.

title: Paramount After Christmas Stay
text: We were overall pleasantly surprised by the Paramount Hotel Times Square.  Great location and the staff were all so friendly and helpful.  Room was very small and there weren't many amenities (no water bottles - was directed to purchase a water bottle from the bar).  It would've been nice if the bar served food.  The rooms and elevators could be upgraded a bit but they were fine, especially for the price.  We asked for extra towels and pillows and they were delivered to the room, which was wonderful.  Again, overall, it was a great experience and we will most likely return.

title: Don't let the modern exterior fool you.
text:
I stayed at this hotel back in January 2023. I was glad to pick this location because it was super convenient to all the limelight Times Square has to offer, including fancy restaurants, broadway shows, etc.

The customer service was very professional, and the staff are bilingual, so any native Spanish speakers would be comfortable staying here. I am not sure if they speak other languages, but English & Spanish are definitely the primary ones in this hotel.

Upon entering my room, I felt a bit of regret for choosing this place- It was so SMALL! I had to laugh to hide my pain.

Although I was a solo traveler, I never had a room as tiny as this. A small, twin-sized bed with an even skinner closet (some of the space being blocked off by a safe). The bathroom wasn't inviting at all, with the shower being the biggest reason. It's placed in a dark corner, with no toiletries; I felt uncomfortable going in with no shoes in there.
