For the high price this hotel offers, you'd think there'd be more modern architecture. The lobby appears very classic and sleek, but it's a drastic change when you go upstairs.

I believe I am very easygoing when it comes to hotels. Staying in them is a pleasure of mine that I relish every chance I get. However, I cannot deny that I was not my happiest staying here. While the staff were certainly polite, most of my time was spent lying in a cramped space that reminded me of my room back home. I wasn't trying to pay money to sleep in "my room" but in a fancier one.

Rooms like this carry the basic essentials for travelers like myself, I understand this, but there's still a part of me that craved to feel luxurious- just for a couple of nights.

title: Stay away from Paramount that is the opposite of its name.
text: Awful smell and DIRTY room, no drinking water, NOISY Air Conditioning, NO HOT WATER IN THE BATHROOM. The kindness of the front desk staff does not make up for the low quality of this establishment which is not worth the price charged.

title: greed and junk
text:
greedy, cheep, junk 
staff n0 personality
where is  my money as resort fees , even thought reservation said everything included
ac n0izy  continues headache
thieves
bad experiance
i as0 saw an0ther sh0cked cust0mer at recipti0n

title: Shabby and noisy
text:
Would not recommend this hotel 
Rooms are shabby, dirty, noisy and expensive. It needs a refurb or a deep clean. The photos on the website must have been taken years ago and are very misleading. Stay away

title: Cool Stay
text: Great placement. Close to everything which was great for what we wanted. There is no parking at the hotel but very close and accessible, It was a very pleasant stay. We did not use the bar  but it seemed fine. Missing food but you can get anything within walking distance anyways.We had a great time.

title: Very bad for this money!
text: Very bad Hotel for this money! Stuff not helpful and noisy, dirthy, very poor rooms. Would give 2 stars not four! Everywhere in hotel smell marihuana. After check out they chared 3$ for lag. room. Not EU charger adapter aviable for guest. Only to buy in hotel.

title: Hotel com arquitetura linda, mas precisando de reforma.
text: O Hotel é bem antigo e está precisando de uma reforma.  Coisas simples como pintura e limpeza podem melhorar muito o aspecto geral já que a localização é excelente. Nos quartos podem ter travesseiros mais confortáveis e sistema de aquecimento mais moderno. De qualquer forma é bom hotel a um passo da Times Square.

title: Gashi
text: To noisy,  in the room at night time, extra changes for something I never used and didn’t get e receipt for this charges. The radiator make crazy noise, the windows never been cleaned, blind to dirty, window is with plastic instead with glass and can hear everything from outside and pillows to bad

title: Worst stay ever
text:
The only thing good about this place is the location. Everything else is extremely bad. Rooms are not clean, smell bad with old carpets and stains everywhere. Air conditioning won’t work either. They can’t change temperature but make rattling and hissing sounds throughout the night and we were told that’s how they work there. 

Avoid this place at all cost. Not worth the hassle

title: No customer care
text:
I recently visited this hotel for a short trip before Christmas with my partner. On the last day of our trip my partner was taking to the emergency room from the hotel on a stretcher because of an unexpected illness. He was then hospitalised for the next 5 days which meant I needed to extend my stay at the hotel. I spoke to several people on reception and explained my situation I advised I no longer needed a large room as it was just myself staying at night after getting back from being at the hospital all day supporting my partner, I asked if they could move me to a single room for a cheaper rate to help. I was advised several times that they could but it would only be 20 dollars a night cheaper. I then looked on booking.com and found the single room for almost a 100 dollars cheaper a night, once again asked the receptionist but they couldn’t help me. 

So I booked on booking.com for a small room, checked out of my previous room, to then be told I could stay where I was in a large room. 

As much as I am aware how sites like booking.com work with hotels I am confused as to why my hotel made it so difficult me when they knew the situation I was in, surely there would of been more they could of done to help. As you can image I was incredibly worried about my partner, frightened being alone in another country, and concerned over the increase in charges we had to pay. Very average hotel but unfortunately Serious lack of humanity.

title: Terrible stay...do not use
text: Old, outdated room decor. Poor windows. Horrific noise from building site at 5am. Poor quality of sleep due to the noise. Insufficient pillows and towel. Excellent location but that's the only positive thing we could say about it. Avoid, choose elsewhere.

title: Mother/daughter trip
text: Treated my mom to a day in the city. The hotel was great and we were able to check in early. It was centrally located to Times Square. The room was the perfect size for an overnight stay. Would like to have an ice machine on the same floor.

title: Room door did not work but got treated like aim an idiot who can’t open a door.
text: I took my daughters to NYC as part of their Christmas gift and when we arrived the hotel was cute and cozy. Our room was small but it was fine for two days the bathroom wasn’t super clean and there was one towel. I called for 4 more towels for each of us and so we had one to lay on the ground to not get the floor wet. They brought me back two towels. Then after walking around for a long day in NYC we went to go to go to our room to snack and get in bed and the door wouldn’t open. I had to go up and down the elevator 3 times with my kids because the receptionist kept treating me like I’m an idiot and “teaching” me how to properly use a card to open a hotel room as if I’ve never stayed at a hotel before. I kept explaining the card worked in the elevator but for some reason not at the door. She then continued to show me how to NOT scan a card. Once she could see I was visibly irritated it is now late after 11 and so she sent a woman in security to check out the door and she found that even her master wasn’t working and it was an issue with the lock. She said she was calling for someone to fix it but it may take a while. My kids and I sat in the lobby to eat our now cold food    and we sat there and my kids were falling asleep on the chairs downstairs. It is after midnight and I’m annoyed and got it he desk and ask how the door is coming along. The receptionist has no clue what I’m talking about and I’m like ???? She said the woman who went upstairs with me never told her anything about the door. Then a random guy asks what room it is and I tell him and he tells me that issue had been resolved about an hour ago???? So not one single employee thought to notify me while I’m sitting in the lobby with my kids falling asleep that our room door was fixed after being treated like I’m an idiot that doesn’t know how to open a door. All they had to say was “no one told you? Sorry for the inconvenience.” Not acceptable. The hotels aren’t 100 dollars a night that service for what is charged is unacceptable.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square(ニューヨーク・タイムズスクエア)
text:
独自の目線(5点満点)で評価しています。ビジネスホテルが中心です。

【立地】4
タイムズスクエアに近くとても便利です。地下鉄の駅からは少し歩くのでその点は少しマイナスです。夜もにぎやかで安心でした。

【部屋】3
古い施設なので仕方ないです。部屋も狭いですが、NYの現状を考えると十分だと思います。

【コンセント・ＬＡＮ】コンセント3・LAN3
どちらも満足です。

【エアコン】3
特に問題ありません。

【シャワー】3
水圧はやや弱いですが、必要十分です。

【スタッフ】3
特に問題ありません。

【総合】3
こちらは場所に比べて非常に安いのでそれだけでも十分な価値があると思います。掃除などもきちんとしてくれます。ロビーが非常に雰囲気があってよいのですが、それと比べて部屋ががくんと落ちるのが面白いです。

次回も同じくらいの値段で予約ができればまた泊まりたいと思います。

title: Meh! Used to be a great hotel.
text: This hotel is in a GREAT location. The issues are that security is sparse, construction is underway, there’s no restaurant, and the “limited” bar has “limited” hours. The lobby is dark and gives a feeling of entering hell. The rooms are clean, the rates are reasonable and the staff are helpful. The ownership must be in transition because there’s a lot to be desired!

title: Basic - not the best experience
text:
So we're currently staying till Friday 22nd December, when I can honestly say I can't wait to go home for a good night's sleep!
The heating is unbelievably noisy!!! We are opposite a building site with windows that don't shut off any noise at all, so if it's not construction noise from 7am, the traffic and sirens will keep you awake all night.
The rooms are very basic, chipped wall boards and stained carpets and 2 towels for a room of 3 people! - we have asked for more, only to be given 2 new towels (between 3) 
The foyer looks very grand and location in excellent. Its beyond the elevator where it all goes wrong.
We're British and don't like to complain, but might have to build up the courage this time - we have another 2 days here!

title: Underwhelming
text:
We arrived at the hotel relatively late, after a full day of travelling from the UK to the USA we just wanted to get into bed. On arrival, the receptionist advised us we had an extra £180 to pay for city taxes which we knew nothing about. 
Once we got up to our room, we were… let’s just say disappointed. The room was TINY. There wasn’t enough room for one person with a large suitcase, let alone two. The bed is definitely smaller than a standard double. There were only two pillows set out as though only one person was going to be sleeping in the bed (which is really all that should be sleeping in it). The AC unit was right next to the bed and I’ve never known anything like it, it sounded like it was trying to set off when the cooling fans were on. There was also a sock wedged under our bathroom door. There was no facilities to make a drink the only positive was that there was a big TV on the wall. Now let me talk about the bathroom, it looked like a prison cell, with a steel sink and a tiny square shower space with a rather old looking shower curtain hanging, our toilet also hand a crack in it which looked like a hair. There was no toilet brush and very low pile toilet roll. Overall we were VERY disappointed, but because we’d spent so long travelling, we were exhausted and just wanted to sleep we gritted our teeth and made do. The next morning I quickly nipped to the front desk before heading out, to ask them to double check that our room was definitely logged in the system as a double room because it really didn’t feel like it. She confirmed it was but was happy to move us rooms the following day when some bigger rooms became available. That was a huge relief, the second room we were given was much bigger, it had a really big bed, four pillows and space at both sides, we each had a bedside table and space to put our luggage. The bathroom was still underwhelming but we’d ungraded to a bath aswell as a shower. 

The hotel seems dated but I can’t fault the staff. The location is ideal, a stone throw from Times Square and central that you’re not far from any attractions. It was very expensive for what we actually got, we were very lucky that they gave us a free upgrade but even still, the price that you pay could easily be matched in a much nicer and more modern hotel slightly further out. Also I must warn you, we moved to the 17th floor and it was NOISY! So if you’re a light sleeper, like me, make sure you have ear plugs with you.

title: Centrally located and no-frills
text: Well, this was once the trendiest hotel around--back in the 90s--hipster rock stars and models and actors. Now, it's a fairly decent place for a night's sleep.The once-lively bar/restaurant is now a tiny barroom tucked in the corner. The rooms are adequate in that there's a bed, a bathroom, and a deak, but the double rooms are TINY (the ones with two beds are more spacious). No lamps (just overhead lights); no cups in the room (I was told I had to travel to the 4th floor, where the water cooler is), and a surprise $35.00 fee on top of your room (read the small print!) for use of the wi-fi, gym, and 'amenities' (perhaps the free paper cup?). AND my room's AC/heater sounded like a jet landing at JFK. That all said, great location if you are seeing a show or think Times Square is the heart of the city, and I slept like a rock. My bed was quite comfy!  Lobby was nice, and the bartender was super duper.

title: Don’t stay here
text:
Room not available on arrival ( 8 hour after we could have checked in).  

We were made to feel it was our fault there wasn’t a room available even though this stay had been booked several months previously,

title: Bad
text: Discourteous service and unacceptable solution to resolve disagreements, They did not provide my transportation from the hotel to the airport and they did not return my money. The bathrooms in the rooms are too old and the showers are blocked, apart from the damaged heaters.

title: Worst dirty hotel ever.
text: Dirty unsafe hotel drug use in corridors.  Doors in room don’t lock  unsafe hotel dirty. Hotel rude staff  outdated dirty dingey hotel no modern facilities no reso no nothing just a unsafe hotel  we’re I. Harmed from Starr to finish dirty damp. Rooms

title: no value for money
text: The room was small and dirt. bath tub porcelain all peeled of, looked like a slum. The mattress was a sack  full of corn leaves. Painting was sliding from the wall as if painted in a rush, dirt was hidden behind the TV set board

title: Good location
text: Location is great, just off times square. The lobby area is beautifully presented and staff are helpful. The rooms are small and basic but clean. I have since been told this is the case for New York. The hotel does have a gym but we never used it. Would stay again just for the location

title: Overpriced and Lack Luster
text: Location is good. Times Square and Theater district. This hotel is in need of a long overdue remodel. Lobby looks cool and contemporary just would hate to see what it looks like with lights fully ON. Rooms are sterile and small. Relatively clean room with comfortable bed. No extra blanket, pillow or towels. Bare minimum for over $500.00 nightly. NO VALUE.

title: Overpriced Motel-Type Stay
text: Hotel room is old, beds are cheap, sink did not drain, shower had terrible water pressure, rooms dont have fridge or even an ice bucket, AC in room did not work. Staff is rude and room service is non-existent. Housekeeping does the bate minimum and interupted us 3 times the morning of checkout to make us leave even though we paid for late checkout. Only good thing about this hotel is the location.

title: Great value for NYC
text: Incredible location, room and a really great value for NYC. Was honestly pleasantly surprised to get this much value during peak holiday time. Such a good space at such a convenient location. Room was quite and had a great view.

title: Good location, the rooms need renovation
text: The location of the hotel is perfect, you can get to Times Square very quickly. However, the hotel should be renovated, the windows in the rooms are very poorly insulated, the air conditioning does not work, the bathroom is old and partly worn out.

title: Honest review ! GREAT stay!
text: Me and my mum stayed at the Paramount Times Square 11 December till 15 December after reading so many bad reviews we was worried about our stay and I can honestly say we had nothing to worry about, upon check in staff was polite and helpful was given water and chocolates told where things was located in the hotel and given any information we needed the lobby is dark but is nice and chilled vibes, we booked a deluxe king room and the room we was given was perfect! Nice a big massive king bed closet sofa and desk with chair the view was great too! The bathroom is small but why would you need a big bathroom?! The sink is a little odd an takes up a lot of space but you don’t spend that much time in there to complain! The room was cleaned daily and fresh linen and towel daily also I have stayed in NYC before and stayed at a popular chain of hotels and I can 100% say that I would stay back at paramount as the location is great hotel room was fine staff was nice I genuinely have nothing to complain about! I’m so glad the reviews did not stop us booking the paramount! I forgot to take pictures until the last day so please ignore the messy bed!  Hope this helps! Enjoy NYC see you soon Paramount!

title: Website pictures deceiving. Small, dark, dirty
text: Website pictures deceiving. Front desk staff were rude. Lobby dark, no water, tea or coffee for guests. No vending machine either. Rooms were very small. I felt a broken spring poking through mattress. Carpet and windows filthy. Bathroom looked like a prison bathroom including the steel metal sink mounted to the walk with rust underneath. No ice bucket. Only 1 ice machine for all guests on a separate floor, with plastic bags to put ice in but no place to store in room. No fridge, not even a single cup coffee/ tea machine. You are only paying for location. I have pictures of it all. We stayed in a deluxe double room. Our friend stayed in a single. It was so small it looked like it was a storage closet at one point that they decided to put a bed in, put a TV on the wall and 3 people couldn't stand I'm there at 2 time.

title: Review
text: Overpriced.. great location though..no complimentary drinks/coffee/ or any appliances inside the room..receptionists arent welcoming..air conditioning produces loud sounds..typical room that is worth 50 dollars a day and no cleaners to clean the room or even pick up the trashes for 3 nights of stay!

title: Ignore the bad reviews!
text: We arrived at the paramount hotel, not knowing what to expect after seeing several bad reviews. I’m pleased to say we took no notice. Before even arriving I emailed the hotel to confirm it was only $86 tax to pay as it sounded so cheap for a Times Square hotel ( it was correct!) they kindly emailed me the concierge of all nice restaurants in the area.  It’s in an amazing location! Our room was fairly big, everything is walking distance or a subway away. The male cleaner who cleaned our room every day did a great job, we always had spare loo rolls/ towels etc. We had a king deluxe room, and genuinely never wanted to leave. The lobby is a lovely area to chill too. We will definitely be back! The water area on the 4th floor is also a gods send! Thanks again the paramount :)

title: Great spot but really needs updating if you want a good spot and don't care about mode cons and getting stuff changed
text:
This hotel is In a fantastic spot just a 2 minute walk literally from times square. Also very close to major tourist spots Rockafella centre macys so definitely can say it was in a great spot. The hotel itself had a very modern feel to it at reception which I thwas the nicest part of it but the problems are in the actual rooms first our view was literally a brick wall so I just thought ok we are unlucky with that

 I thought the size of the room was good for nyc and it was also very clean the problem was this is a very old hotel which you can really tell when you try to charge your phone and stuff which should normally take for a modern mobile maybe an hour took all night no matter what charger you had with you or what device you were trying to charge watch portable Bluetooth charger it didn't matter
 Also felt like you could get an electric shock at any time
One other thing was its a very dark hotel in hallway and room very hard to put makeup on and no coffee or tea making facilities which was really a pity and lacked a table or two  to put stuff on but wardrobe was OK
One other thing was the lift it had a card system where if 6 people got into the lift at one time we all had to scan our card which was a real hassle or it would not stop at your floor we dreaded coming back at night as it took forever
Staff very friendly

title: Great location, beautiful lobby, sparse room
text:
The lobby - absolutely beautiful and welcoming. The staff - friendly and efficient. The location - fantastic (across the street from the Rodgers Theater that hosts Hamilton, and a block from Times Square). The room - completely sparse and austere (but clean, thankfully). 

I live in the Midwest, but I also travel quite a bit (usually in the $150-$200/a night price range). This was my first self-directed trip to NYC Times Square, and admittedly, I expected more from a hotel that charged just over $300 for one night. Basic room amenities (commonly available at hotels for a much lower price than this) were not present -- there was no dresser, no fridge or microwave, no coffee maker or bottle of water (or cups so you could get water from the sink), not even a clock radio. The room did have towels, but no washcloths, and none of the room decorations shown in the pictures on the website were present. I was disappointed that the room was not as nicely appointed as the the pics featured on the website for the price we were being charged.

The location was perfect for what we were doing, but there are many other options in the same area that might offer a few more amenities for the same price.

title: Lovely stay
text: A really nice stay can't see what people moan about the room was on the small side but we have stayed in caravans so never bothered us. The bed was very comfortable, bedding and towels were changed everyday and room tidied it was very clean.

title: Paramount Hotel
text:
The Paramount Hotel isn't the most luxurious hotel I've stayed at and I can understand a little why some people have put bad reviews on, but, it was ideal for the amount of time we were in the room. Why would you go to New York and stay in The Hotel instead of sight seeing. The room and bathroom were small but cleaned every day. It was ideally situated 30 seconds walk from Times Square. We done the usual top site seeing attractions which were brilliant (Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, One World Observatory, Top of the Rock, Brooklyn Bridge at night, and of course the 9/11 Museum         
 (very very moving). I would recommend you booking a night time attraction called The Ride. This is a bus that drives around the streets while you watch street performers.

title: Bare minimal close to time square!
text: Location was great! Hotel was bare minimal. No face clothes,  no extra toilet paper, dingy and small! The lock for the safe was low on battery and did not work properly. We asked for water or a cup and apparently they don’t have that either! If you are in a pinch it’s close to time square!

title: Bad hotel
text: If you have a choice in a hotel don't chose this one. Hotel is run down, and the Security Staff are rude. The rooms are small in comparison to similarly price hotel in the immediate area around Time Square.

title: Amazing
text:
Amazing, if you book via BA please don't listen to the bad reviews, I was so nervous as we had never stayed here before but it was perfect, cleaners came every day, and nothing was ever to much.
The hotel was beautiful and while there is no restaurant in the hotel there is a pizza shop next door and a restaurant two doors up! People saying you have to pay cash only! We tried it's a cashless hotel our room tax was £202 and that includes taxes, the lady on reception was amazing with our little who was so tired. I'd definitely stay here again

title: Elegant Hotel
text: Overnight stay this trip. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Location is great! Close proximity to all theatres and Times Square. Within walking distance to Mid-Town. Comfortable bed and clean room.

title: Xmas in NYC
text: The property has it hand down as far as location to show, Times Square and other places of interest. will advise the property is dark in the lobby & in the hallways, the rooms/bathrooms are small( think inside room on cruise ship) and we had issue with just getting wash cloths.  If you can put up with that to get the great location, go for it.  I will not go back.

title: Would Not Recommend
text: This hotel is a great location which is what you are really paying for.  There are bars, restaurants, shops, Broadway shows and more touristy things all within walking distance.  However, the hotel itself was not great.  The lobby is pretty nice, but the rooms and amenities were not.  I grew up in NYC and we visit every year so we have stayed in plenty of hotels in this area. This hotel was our first not so great experience.  The rooms were small which is fine, it is NYC.  However, they were outdated and the bathrooms were more like a public toilet than a hotel bathroom.  Our room had a faint urine smell.  Im sure we could've gotten a new room, but we had an adjoining room with our kids and it was the only one they had available so we kept it and dealt with the smell.  We don't spend much time in the hotel so it was fine for 2 nights, but I would not recommend this hotel.  There are so many in the area for similar prices.

title: central location for Times Square and theatres
text:
Hotel has everything you need for a short trip and is conveniently located for shopping, theatres, and some of the sights. We often came back to drop off shopping, have a break and start again.
Due to the location bedrooms were a little noisy but did not inhibit sleep.
There is a bar with very helpful staff but no eating facilities.However there are cafes and coffee shops 5 min away some open very long hours.

title: Close and cheap
text: This hotel was close to Times Square and other attractions. The price was great for the area. The room is small, BUT you are in NYC.. it was comfortable for my girlfriend and I. We had an issue with the AC, maintenance was there and had it fixed in minutes! My gf forgot a hair dryer, the front desk had one in our within minutes! There weren't any wash cloths, and we asked for some at the front desk, no kidding they were on our bed before we got upstairs! Outstanding service!!

title: Hotel more like hostel
text: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We booked a standard room. Upon Stovall we discovered that the room was tiny, heating stuck on and window wouldn’t open. We went to reception to see if there was anything they could do for us, they replied with they can sort the heating out but we are stuck with the room unless we upgrade for £150. Considering we didn’t have enough room in our ‘room’ to unpack our cases we was left with no choice but to pay the extra. We got to the new room which was bigger, however the exact style bathroom was installed. We was on the 9th floor and heard the traffic like we was on the street outside. Also there is a building site operating opposite the hotel (Nov 2023) which is very loud- nothing to do with the hotel I know but keep in mind if you’re going soon. On our second morning the shower got blocked and no water would drain. This was fixed by the handy repair man. Next morning the bathroom light died on us which was also fixed by the repair man. The only positives are the location is right next to Times Square (not so good if you want quality sleep) and the size of the bed in our upgraded room. Hotel wasn’t the cleanest I’ve been in but it wasn’t too bad.

title: Business trip to NYC
text: Sadly not favourable, considering recently refurbished and access to times square etc very favourable. There is a little bit to do, for me to utilise again.  But am sure if all is attended to then will be fine.

title: Overpriced and antiquated with silly surcharges
text:
The hotel rooms are antiquated very small barely any wardrobe space.
It’s dark and smells musty. Upon arrival be prepared to pay extra for water,
Ice and service charge for Wi-Fi. I had to pay 85 dollars up front for a five night stay. I am shocked at the tiny rooms with no amenities.
There is also a 1 Dollar charge for Breakages?. Before room keys are issued.
Added to that . There is a 14.75 Tax on the room rate. 
At 320 dollars plus  before the extras mentioned a night it’s poor value for money I was Shocked at what was on offer for the price.

title: NOISY ROOM AND LACKS THE PERSONAL TOUCH
text:
Arrived a day late after a cancelled flight and then a delayed flight. Kept waiting for over an hour to check in. My wife had found out that morning her mother had died and that did not prompt any member of staff to expedite the process to allow her to grieve in private. We were kept waiting in a busy lobby for just over an hour.
Eventually we were allocated a small room which was very noisy (traffic). Decor was very dated. It was basic with nowhere to sit other than the bed. The bathroom was cramped and had no fan.
Location of the hotel is good, but the way we were treated lacked the personal touch. 
We would not stay here again.

title: I wouldn't recommend this hotel.
text: Sorry. I would not recommend this hotel. No Parking. No food or drink. No amenities. Bedroom was very small, as was bathroom. Bed was old. No room to do anything. Do not recommend this place to anyone.

title: Paramount Times Square - December 2023
text: Very noisy!!  Construction ongoing across the street made it very difficult to get some sleep.  The AC and Heat were both on the same time.  Pipes banging. Rooms and bathrooms are small and need updating.  No place to put luggage or belongings.

title: Needs maintenance and cleaning
text: Need more housekeeping and maintenance staff and increase staff pay to encourage retention of staff.  Staff is exceptionally hardworking and conscientious but they are clearly overwhelmed and need more help.

title: It’s okay
text: Just got back from a 4 day trip, location is great. Right on Times Square, bedrooms are definitely a catfish as look nothing like photos online. The rooms are VERY small. The bathroom you couldn’t swing a cat, beds are okay. No storage for any clothes or suitcases. Rooms are clean, and beds were made daily. It did us for what we wanted but I wouldn’t go back. The noise at this hotel is terrible, you can hear every police siren, ambulance and the many many car horns. Woke us up several times through the night.

title: Amazing
text: After reading the reviews we were hesitant to stay here but in all honesty this hotel was great! Great location a 2 min walk from Times Square, yes the rooms are small but your only staying there at night? The room was spotlessly clean and was cleaned with new towels daily. Comfy bed and was provided with shampoo and soap. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and ignore the reviews and see for yourself! Will definitely return

title: I just wanted a drink of water in the room
text:
Room clean, warm and in a great position just off Time Square. 
Bedroom in  need a refurbishment especially the bathroom.
Little storage room and no glass or cup to take my medication.
Room was noted as a superior room, not sure I agree.

title: Great location, good value for money.
text:
I was a little apprehensive about the hotel as there were a few negative reviews prior to our visit however i had a really good experience. Check in was really quick and easy. Our hotel room was spacious and clean, the bathroom was a little dated but perfectly useable and most importantly clean. The price of stay was quite alot less than other hotels in the area and so the stay is good value for money. The hotel is literally down the road from times square so great location. We stayed on floor 6 and did not feel that it was too loud or anything like that.

Tip: You have to pay to leave luggage at hotel on last day and they only accept cash.

title: Bad experience
text: The worst and most expensive hotel that I have ever stayed. I paid $330 per night just for a bad and dirty bathroom. Nothing more. The smallest hotel room that I have ever stayed and you call that cell as "superior queen room". I wonder what kind of queen is that.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: We chose Paramount Hotel Times Square for it's convenient walkable location to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. While the room itself was fine, it was definitely bare bones and nothing like any other hotel we've stayed in especially for the price ($250+/night). Most hotels have an in-room refrigerator, microwave, and alarm clock...this one didn't. These amenities would've been nice. The hvac system in the room wouldn't cool below 68°, even with it set to 64°. All in all, our stay at Paramount didn't take away from our amazing trip to NYC.

title: Average or below average
text:
Should have complimentary tea and coffee, fridge and microwave in each room. Water should be available at all floors. Room and bathroom needs major renovation and uplift.

Already mentioned what needs to be improved.

title: Appalling hotel
text: The single worst  hotel experience we have ever had. We travelled from it eland to new york for my mums 70th birthday. This hotel was the most do’s graceful hotel we have ever stayed in. We paid £2000 for 3 nights and the hotel room was disgusting, the service was appalling and overall the experience ruined my mums birthday. You should be ashamed with yourselves.

title: Would not Recommend.
text:
Was in NYC for a business trip. The location is great but that is about all that I can say positive about the hotel. 
They had no cups, water, iron board or even wash cloths. My bathroom sink leaked terribly and worst of all my AC didn't work and my room would be 85 degrees in the night. I had to literally open the door to the hallway to be able to get fresh air. 

Would not recommend.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed with my daughter for 5 nights. Was worried after reading g negative reviews before we went. Need not have, great location, the best pizza shop 2 doors away. Lobby is beautiful ,yes it’s dark but adds to the feel of the place. Staff are wonderful, cleaners are good at their job, room cleaned and spotless every day. No ques at the lift in our experience. Good that you have to use your key card to go up. We had a delicious town at the rear of the hotel on 11th floor, no noise at all. Room was warm, beds super comfortable, didn’t need the air con/heating on at all. Was warm even through the night. Shower was good with good pressure and heat. Water on 4th floor which is fine, we just brought bottles water in to use. Plenty clean towels changed daily. Left luggage after checking out $3 is ok to know your luggage is safe. Hardly make you skint ! Wouldn t hesitate to recommend or stay again. Dont know what people moan about. ! Stop looking for problems ! Thank you paramount for a great stay

title: Staying at Paramount
text: I had a wonderful time with you. Next year I will book with you. Service was excellent and very nuce people to help me. I like the cleaning . It was done every day. The location amazing , evething was near si you can walk around .

title: Good location but very old hotel
text:
The location is very good but all the hotel need to be renovate, do not reflect the 4 stars.
very unpleasant to charge 3$ for storage the suitcase to the hotel guest.
I do not raccomend  this hotel, you can find better at same price in the area

title: The least money can buy
text: This was a business trip and I was really surprised at how bare bones it is.  I’m used to the New York shoebox room, but it was the sparseness.  No iron board, not even a plastic cup in the room.  Big thumbs down.  When you pay this much for a room you expect at least to have a cup for water.

title: Paramount Hotel NYC
text: Location was amazing but our room was tired and the bathroom rather dirty. The floor and bath seals were brown as was the seal around the sink. The toilet bowl was also cracked. The bed was beautifully clean and comfy which was a highlight and the tv was fab. However, the aircon was fitful and did not seem to respond to the temperature that I put in so we either woke up very hot, or freezing cold. Our stay was OK but could have been so much better value for money if we had had an updated room but this was not the case. :(

title: Horrible
text: The worst and most horrible room I have stayed in during my stays in NY. The price paid for the room they gave me is not worth half of what I paid. A room that a walking closet is larger than room 518. A full bed that is not a double bed, nor space for a refrigerator, nor a small table, nor even space to open a suitcase. Conclusion the worst and most horrible hotel I have stayed in in NY. Zero recommendation. And the bathroom is nothing to talk about, if you move a lot you bathe outside. What a shame, such a good location and such a bad room.

title: Location over luxury
text:
Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and upon first impressions we felt quite deflated. 
The hotel as a whole is quite tired and worn looking. 
The receptionist greeted us in a friendly manner and promptly gave us our room card. 

We stayed in room 616 on the 6th floor. When we arrived at our room we did feel quite disappointed with it. The size of the room, albeit, not large didn't bother us too much.  Nor did the view (we are in NYC so the view of the aircon units outside and brick walls didn't bother us, we expected this) due to the air con units outside you definitely would NOT have a silent night sleep in this room. So if you're a light sleeper i would ask to move rooms, there is a constant noisy hum. 

What bothered us was that the room was tired looking and not the standard we would have expected. It could have done with a good lick of paint, the bottom of what I think is the large old aircon unit on the floor was badly chipped and rusted, the tiles in the bathroom by the door were no existent in the corner. It was an odly decorated bathroom with an absolutely massive stainless steel sink that imposed the room. The inside of the bath was chipped fairly badly and could really do with replacing. 
We had to turn the "aircon" unit off at night as it was unbelievably loud and hardly cooled the room anyway. So night time was pretty warm in the room. The toilet when flushed sounded like it was going to suck you down the pan. 

However,  the room was clean and the bed was soft and felt amazing after a long day of site seeing. The only saving grace to the room we stayed in was this bed. Well done to the housekeeper who made our bed every morning,  stocked up the toiletries and gave us fresh towels. 

There are NO coffee/tea making facilities in this room. So we bought a large bottle of water every evening to take back to our room. 

There is a safe, old fashioned hairdryer and steamer supplied in the room  

We ate breakfast in a restaurant called Juniors which was a 2 minute walk from the hotel and I'd highly recommend a visit. 

The location was fairly good, but that's what you pay for, certainly not the luxury or the facilities.

title: Perfect Location and Gorgeous Interior
text: We truly loved our stay and we couldn't have found a better match for our needs and budget. Excellent staff, charming old hotel. Great location for Broadway and Times Square trip. The design and interiors were gorgeous.

title: Great Location!
text:
Location is great! I went to watch a Broadway play at the Luntz and this Hotel is right next to it. Located just a few steps from Time Square and many other theaters and Broadway shows. 

The room was smaller than usual, but it served its purpose! 

Hotel staff was very nice and helped me to set up transport back to the Airport!

title: Tolle Lage, Zimmer renovierungsbedürftig
text:
Die Lage vom Hotel ist super. Dafür war das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis ok.
Ich war zuerst in einem Mini-Einzelzimmer mit einem Mini-Bad und mit Sicht auf eine Wand. Für eine Nacht wäre dies ok gewesen aber nicht für 7. Ich konnte das Zimmer aber am nächsten Tag ohne Probleme wechseln und bekam dann ein grösseres Zimmer in der 18. Etage mit Blick zur Stadt. 
Die Zimmer sind soweit sauber, mit minimaler Einrichtung. Ein Wasserkocher im Zimmer wäre schön gewesen. Die Zimmer bedürfen langsam einer Renovierung. 
Ich kann das Hotel aber empfehlen.

title: Great location
text: I was nervous at first due to the affordability of this hotel and location. But as soon as I walked into the lobby I was blown away! We picked a room with 2 queen beds, super clean, and had everything we needed. Customer service was excellent, along with being personable! We spoke with receptionist, a manager, security, and the bartender. Everyone made us laugh and we enjoyed our time. The hotel was less then a block from time square, and was the best price!

title: Very depressing place
text: Very dark reception and lobby uncomfortable chairs and rooms very small plastic furniture no where to put anything no cafe or restaurant attached and ba4vsmall and very expensive. Information given out could be better

title: construction noise may be a problem
text: Always ask for room at rear of hotel. Jackhammers and airhorns roaring starting at 7 am. Quiet time during day was a problem. We've been staying at Paramount since it was run by Ian Schrager. Staff was great. Dean and deluca coffee shop in front closed. Luckily theres a bakery on 8 th ave. Place needs coffee in lobby. They moved us to room in rear but it had strong cooking odors probably from restaurant behind.

title: Always our go to...
text: We love the Paramount for the location, price, and convenience to everywhere in Manhattan. This trip was incredible, just as all the rest. We appreciate the staff and comfort of The Paramount. The rooms are simple, but they are clean and have what you need. The beds are very comfortable and the heat/AC worked great. I love this historic hotel.

title: No Frills Hotel
text:
I live close to NYC and have stayed at many hotels for an overnight throughout the years. I normally avoid Times Square, but I had an early morning meeting and wanted to be nearby, so I chose the Paramount. I'll start with the good parts - the lobby was inviting and cozy and the elevators were fast (often a big problem in older hotels). Now the not so good, the room was very small, there was no decor, no view - we looked out over an alley (although no noise, so could be another plus I guess), we were provided with one bath towel each, no hand towels or wash cloth, the toilet paper on the roll was soaking wet (no idea why - but there was an extra) and no refrigerator or coffee. Basically zero frills for over $300. Also, the reception desk at check-in was neither inviting nor forthcoming about any amenities. Also, two of us only got one key, which seemed weird. 

And maybe the worst part, I had to get up very early and I set my alarm on my phone and plugged it into the outlet next to my bed. By some miracle, I woke up at 5:00 AM and noticed that my phone was black - completely dead. The "outlet" did not work at all. If I did not notice this in the middle of the night, and overslept, this would have ruined my whole reason for staying overnight. Basically, if you need a place to literally just sleep for a night, it is doable, but I can't imagine staying in a room like I had for a week's vacation.

title: Short Trip in New York
text:
Overall, the price didn't meet the value of the room.
The location was excellent.
The lobby was nice.
Security for access also good.
Just very dissapointed with the room and also the services of the housekeeping.

title: Great stay! Would recommend
text:
It was perfect for a one-night trip. The location was unbeatable; just a few minutes from Times Square. I was kinda worried because of all of the reviews I read, but I didn't find any issues. They let me leave my luggage in the place hours before check-in. Everyone from the staff was really kind. Finally, the AC was working perfectly well, and the beds and pillows were comfortable. 

Would definitely come back!

title: bad experience
text: bad experience in low quality. Poor, dirty and very noise bedroom. What is on their website is not what you will find. the hall is spectacular and the poor lighting hides the lack of attention to detail and finishing. But compared to the rooms it can be defined as beautiful.

title: Just ok .
text: The room and bathroom was extremely small . The room was so large lain seem outdated compared to the lobby of the hotel ! The hotel smelled amazing in the lobby. It is pretty close to things. You are paying simply for the location not the luxury .

title: I am not satisfied
text: They are nice but cancelation was worst. If I have another plans to visit NY. Then I try to find some other place to stay. I sent email to cancel my over booking several times, but their reply was terrible.

title: Very Poor
text:
Not a nice place to stay. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone. Needs to fix the heating problem.
and improve the bathroom faucets. only one worked and that was the hot faucet. The furniture in the room was old and the draws were not shutting. tried many times.

title: Ótima localização, limpeza deixa a desejar
text:
Localização excelente, no mesmo quarteirão da Times Square, literalmente! 
Tamanho do quarto muito bom, cama confortável e toalhas trocadas todos os dias. 
Smart TV no quarto, o que possibilita rotear o celular. 
No ato da reserva não conseguimos pedir 2 camas, mas essa solicitação foi atendida no momento do check in. 

Limpeza deixa a desejar, tanto do quarto tanto do banheiro. Ralo do banheiro muito lento para dar vazão na água e descarga vazando água por cima.

De maneira geral vale o custo/ benefício

title: Not as advertised
text: Good location to Times Square, hotel staff friendly and professional. Unfortunately, bedroom and bathroom were small, grubby and a lot of noise from outside. Not like the pictures show the rooms to be.

title: Bed to sleep in
text:
When I first arrived I had planned to give 5 stars but the condition of the room changed my mind.

I arrived the the paramount early with a bathroom emergency and the lovely clerk checked me in early and upgraded my bed size. 
The lobby is so beautiful I was surprised how dingy the room was. The room I was in desperately needs an update. The carpet especially. 
The window in the bathroom was open and couldn't close. I reported it to the front desk but no one came to fix it. I had to stuff a towel in to keep the cold out, thankfully it wasn't too cold yet.

Really this was just a bed to sleep in while in NYC. You can't beat the location of you're there for Broadway shows and times square. All of that is a 5 min or so walk down the block.

I would probably stay again if I got an excellent deal on a room. It's definitely over priced as is.

title: If you wanna be both safe and close to Time Squares THIS IS IT!!!!!!!
text: We have stayed here many times and been happy.  Service was very good - drop off your luggage.  The men are very patient and efficient.   Prices of the rooms seem to be going up and the size going down but this may just be the post covid world.

title: Generally a poor hotel. Recommend looking elsewhere.
text:
I rarely write reviews, but I feel compelled to warn others about this hotel. I have traveled extensively and stayed in many hotels and hostels across the world, and Paramount is below hostel standard, let alone a 4-star hotel.

Beginning with the hidden fees of the hotel:

In addition to the upfront cost of c.$285 per night (what I paid), there were a number of hidden fees. 

1. $17 per night for safe (tap) drinking water, WiFi, and the bar facility (this only covers the bar area, not drinks).
2. Storage fees for luggage kept past checkout time (11am) which does not accept card, only cash complimenting the next charge.
3. ATM fees of $4.50 per transaction

Rooms: 2/5

The rooms were extremely small and poorly maintained. The tiling, painting, electrics, and general maintenance were all very poor. For example, live switches and sockets coming off the wall, large gaps and mould in the tiles, an unsecured shower pole, dirty windows, and an old, crumby carpet.

When we first entered our room, there were no towels and the bed had two mattress protectors on, one of which was rolled up under the sheet creating a large bump.

Granted, there is AC and it is FREE. However, my flight home was arguably quieter than this unit.

Interior and exterior of the hotel: 2/5

The lobby, lift, and general interior of the hotel were also very run down. There were missing tiles from the walls, dirty elevators with mold, dirty carpets, room doors with no handles and holes due to being kicked in.

The exterior of the hotel was under renovation, with an extensive scaffold covering the front. We were notified of this after booking, but the email stated that it would not affect our stay. This was completely inaccurate. We could hear the drilling, banging, and vibration from our room on the other side of the hotel, starting around 7am.

Staff: 3/5

The staff were generally dismissive and more interested in talking to their colleagues than attending to guests. They were dressed in casual clothes, which is fine for a hostel but not a 4-star hotel.

The only positive thing I can say about the staff is that one man was courteous and polite. I didn't catch his name, but he was wearing a suit, shirt, and tie with dreadlocks.

Overall: 2/5

Overall, this hotel was poor. It was dirty, poorly maintained, and overpriced. The staff were dismissive and the hidden fees were ridiculous. On 2/3 times that I visited reception, other guests were filing complaints and requesting new rooms. I would not recommend this hotel.

Advice:

My recommendation is to avoid this hotel. There are many other hotels around Times Square at the same price point, or even cheaper once the hidden fees are factored in. You could also pay a little bit more for a renowned brand hotel and get much better value for money.

title: Noisy, Exploitative and Overpiced
text:
New York is city that never sleeps, you won't sleep if you stay in this hotel. There is near no sound insulation meaning that even on the top floor you will hear everything going on including the construction operating at all hours across the road and the general traffic of New York, both street performers and vehicles.

Rooms were very small with minimal storage. No fridge or coffee machine / kettle. Plumbing was very poor with taps not working on arrival (although these were fixed relatively quick). Water had a low pressure and was slow to warm. Shower was difficult to operate due to poor construction quality and being in a fixed position on the wall. Although soaps and shampoos smelled nice. 

I found the cleaners to be extremely good and helpful. The hotel has a hidden service fee (on arrival we were charged around $120 for a 7 night stay. It's not clear what these services include, we did not use the gym. Bag storage on checkout day was $2 a day,, per bag and had to be paid in cash. This is clearly a money grabbing gimmick to direct guests to the cash machine in the lobby where you will be fleeced around a further $5 to take $20 out. 

The only other redeeming factor is the location, you are less than a minute away from times square and the pizza place next door was very good.

title: Good stay in NYC right next to Times Square
text: Friendly staff, good location, nice vibe around hotel. Within minutes of Broadway shows and Times Square. Room we stayed in was slightly outdated in terms of decor in comparison to lobby but nothing to really complain about. Would stay again if visiting NYC.

title: no A/C
text: It’s was our first time in New York. Your hotel lobby was nice and comfortable. Our was 303 and it was too small beds where smaller then we were told and our A/C was not working so we didn’t get a good nights rest.

title: More of a hostel than a hotel.
text:
We were hugely disappointed when we turned up at the hotel. It’s dark and dingy and in no way luxurious as we were made to believe online. Yes it’s close to Times Square and in a convenient location but that’s all it has going for it.

The room was small and basic which is fine but not what you expect from a 4 star hotel. On top of that we had to pay extra fees on arrival which we were told, cover room cleaning, running of the bar and drinking water (essential things you expect from a hotel!). Storing our luggage after checkout also cost extra which I was annoyed about but expected this to be the case after the extra fees at check in. I’ve never had to pay for drinking water or luggage storage at any hotel or hostel so this was rather shocking and added to our negative experience of the hotel.

I’d be interested to know where people writing reviews are from, especially those that thought this hotel was ‘excellent’. I must say, this hotel would not be a 4 star in the UK and would certainly not be very popular. Extremely disappointing stay and wish we hadn’t wasted our money. We should have just stayed at a hostel and saved some money.

title: Great value in the theater district / Times Square area!
text: This hotel is not posh, the rooms could use a refresh, and of course many of them are very small.  But, the staff is friendly, professional, and attentive, and the rooms (I've stayed twice in two different room levels) have what you need.  They have hand steamers vs irons which I found convenient.  So, I recommend for the value, cleanliness, and professionalism, not for the luxury.

title: Stay at the Paramount Hotel
text: Staff were very good no issue with them. Room was very small, bed was uncomfortable,Carpet in bedroom was extremely dirty, air conditioning was very noisey. Location is very good. Would stay again if they invested in upgrading the rooms

title: A real disappointment!
text:
We were booked in.by our cruise travel agent as it was an add on! From tripadvisor we were concerned by the poor reviews!
On arrival we were pleasantly surprised by the outside and the lobby of the hotel..However it was very dark! Unable to check in until 3.30!
However things took a turn for the worse when we entered our room.So small and pokey! Hardly able to walk round the bed! 
Bathroom was tired and looked like a prison cell! Basin tap was broken.
AC didn't work well and very noisy. No coffee making nor any food to be had anywhere. A trick missed there! 
Sad but it spoilt our New York stay!

title: Lovely lobby and staff. Room was awful with no facilities whatsoever!
text:
We came here after a cruise so was chosen by our Travel Agent.
Looked great on the outside and lobby. We were early so couldn't check in till about 3 which seemed late to us.
Sadly our room was a nightmare. So small that you could hardly walk round it. The sink plug didn't work and the engineer couldn't fix it. Bed was tiny and needed replacing. Aircon not good and noisy. 
No facilities. No coffee machine or food available.
A 2 star no way a 4! The main reason we really didn't enjoy New York!

title: Too expensive for how small and dirty rooms are
text: The lobby looks like the inside of a Hollister store: super dark, music is too loud, and smells are overwhelming (air fresheners). The rooms are TINY, with barely a bed and a chair. Cleanliness is not great, the carpet looked like the Subway floors from how dirty it was. The TV didn’t even work. Called the reception one time for a question, never got an answer. If it wasn’t for location, this place would be rated one star.

title: Paramount Review
text: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Paramount. I liked the location and felt completely safe, even when out in the wee hours of the morning. I would choose the hotel again on a future visit to New York, whenever tht may be.

title: Beautiful Lobby, Lackluster Rooms. Close to Times Square.
text: Beautiful place in the lobby. Does not really translate to the rooms, but they are fine, you’ll still like them. I just hate that places have the audacity to charge a fee for “resort fees” when there’s no real amenities or reason, when the toilets dont even flush, theres no mini fridges or storage, and theres not even an ice bucket or anything special about the room. Each booking for a resort fee could buy a mini fridge for literally every new stay. I’m spending $1300+ for 3 days, I could get an ice bucket or a flushing toilet, or a not peeling shower with no standing water. Beautiful downstairs and lovely staff. Best location next to Sweeney Todd theater and Times Square.

title: Perfect for city break.
text:
Upon reading previous reviews I was very sceptical. Yes the hotel rooms are small but you’re only sleeping in them. 
Yes it is loud but you’re staying just off Times Square and on broadway so what would one expect? 

Amazing location, central to everything. Comfortable rooms and warm. 
Easy to access taxis directly outside. 
Spotlessly clean! 
Atm in reception which was very handy! 

Will definitely be back again!

title: Excellent Location
text:
This hotel was right next to Time Square. Overall stay was good and staff very polite, decent and helpful.
Ambience was good. They could have kept water or coffee in the room. But it was worth staying

title: Too dirty, too expensive
text: Too dirty, especially bathroom is terrible, i killed more than 10 flies at the bathroom, and construction noise is crazy, reception ppl are kind but not worthy to pay $650 per night, the building is old

title: Fantastic location, Great price & brilliant Staff
text: Decent comfortable hotel for the price in an amazing location which is walking distance from top sites to visit in New York City.  Beds were comfortable to sleep however room needs modernizing especially the bathroom.

title: Good location, stylish lobby, small rooms
text: The paramount used to be a very fashionable hotel and they try hard to become cool again. For the location and the overall atmosphere the prices are very fair! Particularly the lobby is well designed and has a very stylish touch!

title: Paramount 2023
text: Not recommended. Resort prices with no amenities. No coffee in the morning. No on property restaurant/bar or even a place to purchase snacks. Limited selection of food near hotel or walking distance. Not worth the price.

title: Paramount hotel time square marathon weekend stay
text:
The good and the bad 

The Good
Central location to time square near lots of shops and restaurants 
Comfortable bed
Good security to room room card to operate the elevator 
Room very clean 

The Bad
Dark lobby 
Unhelpful reception 
Gave us a very small room cat would definitely bash his head
Safe not fixed down so could be stolen 
Air conditioning good but made us very dry 
Asked for a twin when booked when arriving said only had a single left for the first night then 50 dollars extra a night after that for our  2 night stay 

The bad outweighed the good so that’s why the low score

title: Tired hotel. Overpriced. Not very clean.
text: For $300 per night I expected more. The hotel is dated and badly finished. Don’t stay at the front of the property. They’re building a new tower across the street. 24 hours per day. In fairness they did find me a room at the back which was quieter. Hotel doesn’t really have any facilities save for a fairly unappealing bar. No food etc.

title: P
text: The room is too small but location is in a prime location. In the room hotel should provide some bottle of water for guests since it is a normal of hotel to offer. However, service and staff are very friendly and they provide an excellent service.

title: Great location and value for money, historic building
text: I came to NYC to see a Broadway show and was very pleased with this hotel (Paramount). It was by far the cheapest hotel in the area, in a beautiful old historic building and had comfortable beds. The location cannot be bet. Rooms are small, but that is to be expected in NYC for this price point, and they had everything I needed for my stay. Great coffee shop next door (Patis) and Italian restaurant 2 doors down (Bond 45). We were able to walk everywhere.

title: Great location. Tired, minimal bedroom
text: Location is great. Staff is great. Bedrooms are tired and extremely basic with towels and bedding and cleanliness. We didn’t spend much time in the room luckily but I didn’t feel great about my bare feet being on the floor.

title: Good, perfect location.
text: Good, perfect location, a few minutes' walk to Times Square, but peaceful and quiet, great for sleeping. The rooms are a bit smaller, but everything was clean and everyone is very friendly. We will be happy to come again.

title: 3rd Stay at the Paramount
text:
This was our third time at the Paramount this year, and it was by far the best! The updated room was absolutely beautiful, and I can only hope to stay in one of these rooms on future occasions. 

We’ve always felt so welcome and respected by everyone we’ve encountered there, and the Paramount has truly become our home away from home in NYC. We look forward to staying again in May!

title: Amazing hotel
text: A classic and stylish hotel that gracefully ages. Remember when it first opened and what a splash it made with its high style, small rooms and hot models in the lobby. The artistic elements have been taken out over time and there is some aging happening as befalls all hotels. But it's the Brooke Shields of hotels - once a stunner, still a beauty after all this time!

title: Localização PERFEITA
text:
Ótimo hotel com uma localização excelente. Super limpo.
Tive dúvidas para desligar o ar condicionado e a recepção enviou alguém para me ajudar em menos de 3 minutos.
Único ponto para melhorar seria o chuveiro e o box do banheiro.

title: Caríssimo
text:
Prós: ótima localização, limpo, ótimo secador de cabelo.
Contra: muito caro pelo que oferece. Chuveiro gelado, não esquenta nunca. Quarto bem pequeno , bom para quem viaja sozinho, complicado para casal. Não oferece café da manhã.  Apesar da diária caríssima, cobra taxa para guardar suas malas (se você quiser  fazer o check out e deixar as malas para pegar mais tarde, por exemplo)

title: Comfortable stay
text: Location was very convenient though timesquare is very noisy, impossible to avoid noisy from the street. Room was clean. I like tv has screen mirrored so I could see netflix, youtube on tv.I will stay again

title: A very positive experience
text:
We had a good experience of this hotel. Friendly and helpful staff and a great location. The rooms were small but clean. Very close to Times Square so can be a bit noisy at night but that's to be expected.

Reading some of the other reviews we were a bit nervous about what to expect but we were very pleased with our experience of the Paramount Hotel. Thank you.

title: Wish I'd read the reviews!
text:
Lobby is great, and the staff good - but that's it.

The rooms are basic, tired, felt dirty with no amenities. The storage was straight out of IKEA, the safe didn't work, the windows let in light and noise.

title: Avoid at all costs!
text: I've stayed in other classic hotels and this was by far the worst!  We were booked for 6 nights and checked out after just one.  Thankfully another hotel was able to accommodate us on short notice.  DO NOT GO HERE!

title: Enjoyed our stay
text:
Our double room was tiny and could barely fit the suitcases. Lovely staff upgraded us to a king room and we were much happier with the extra space. Bathroom small but ok and water was hot and pressure was good.  Water fillling facilities on the 4th floor. Beds and pillows were comfortable and minimal outdoor noise. We were on the 6th floor. Air con was loud but didn’t bother me. 
Location was perfect in the heart of Times Square.. walking distance to subway and broadway. 
Checkout was quick. Shared shuttle to airport was expensive $100 for me and my daughter but we booked it for convenience. Had to pay $2 per bag for storage for 2 hours which I thought was unreasonable as other hotels it’s free.  Overall we loved staying here. Basic Coffee facilities would be welcomed.

title: 1st New York stay
text: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff located just off times square, no Restaurant on site which i thought was poor, no facilities in standard rooms for making drinks ,not even a cup in bathroom for drinking water, rooms very small but clean and comfy bed . Overall ok for a few nights stay for sightseeing,but not recommended for long stays as as food and drink facilities very poor

title: Hip lobby and dirty and old hotel rooms
text: The lobby makes you feel like this is going to be an amazing hotel. Then you enter the rooms that have stained carpet, chipped paint, rusty sink, and lumpy beds. Also, there is no coffee on site anywhere. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of equipment in the gym to find out there was no air circulation (heater was on) and no fans. Also the water machine did not work in the gym. The only redeeming quality about this hotel is the staff. They are helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable.

title: Terrible rooms not for family had to leave as not big enough.   Gabrielle was very helpful though as manager thank you
text: We couldn’t stay here the rooms simply are way to small and we had no space to unpack bathrooms are tiny and this isn’t a cheap hotel Gabrielle however the manager did help in refunding me a 4 night stay thank you Gabrielle as it wasn’t your fault just simply this isn’t a family hotel due to room space

title: Good Central Hotel
text: The Hotel is a few minutes walk to Time Square and close to Port Authority. I enjoyed my stay and I would recommend to my friends. My room was clean and comfortable. The reception area was clean and all the staff very helpful. Thank you

title: Do not stay at the Paramount Hotel, New York
text:
Poor quality bedrooms and bathrooms, worst hotel I have stayed in. This Hotel is in need of a major bedroom and bathroom refurbishment.

I booked the Paramount Hotel for it's location just off Times Square. If I had known what the quality of the rooms and bathrooms were like I would have booked somewhere else.

title: Fantastic location
text: Turn left out of hotel and you're in Times Square. Excellent sound proofing, had 4 nights of good sleep on 16th floor. Room basic but clean and fresh towels everyday, bigger than expected and would definitely stay here again. Friendly and helpful staff too

title: Not really cost effective experience
text: The room for two people is super small, and the bed are small too. My bed sheet wasn’t clean,,,, and we ended up staying one night with no hot water. Btw, just to warn the people who want to use the hotel provided private or share ride taxi to airport that we had horrible experience as we booked private ride to airport LGA at front of hotel, the guy charged us $10 cash for deposit and he said we only need to pay the rest of $55 the second day. However when we were on the way the driver was not able to communicate in English and she said there is a faster way which can save us 25mins but $10 more charge. Me and my friend agreed so we need to pay her $65. When we reached the airport she asked $85,,,and we were explaining her we have paid $10 ahead so we only need to pay $65 but she consistently said based on the calculations on her phone should be $75 + other fee’s which they never mentioned…. Anyways we ended up missed our flight as she stopped us too long at airport

title: Khách sạn trung bình
text: Máy điều hòa ồn ào, phòng không có bình nước nóng, không có nước uống, không trà, không cafe, phòng nhỏ, nhận phòng 4pm là quá trễ, cơ sở vật chất cũ kĩ. Chỉ được cái gần quảng trường. Không bãi đổ xe

title: Decent price - average stay
text: Small, pokey rooms but fairly clean. It's in a Central location which is good. Showers were hot. Best part of the experience was the hotel employee Clayton who was really helpful, friendly and interesting. 😊

title: Our trip to the Big Apple
text: The location of the hotel was excellent it was in the center and walking distance from Times Square. The room that we had for a family of 4 was a bit small. There was no fridge in the room, no complimentary coffee, no bottled waters. Tge rooms were cleaned daily with fresh new sheets. Overall, it was an amazing stay.

title: Review of Paramount Hotel
text: This is a jewel in the middle of Restaurant Row and Theater Row. Everything was convenient, easily walkable and and fairly safe. Security is present. However, they don't employ a bellman. The price was reasonable for the services rendered. The Concierge service was exceptional!

title: Great location, not a great hotel.
text: We chose the Paramount because of its ‘slightly cheaper’ price point. The location was great, 2 min walk from Times Square but the rooms are small and in desperate need of refurbishment. Comfortable bed and pillows, friendly and helpful staff. Ok for a base if you’re not fussy.

title: will not stay here again
text: the room is tiny, twin/full size bed though we have 2 people. the bathroom has prison looking sink. shower has no hot water! house keeping never brought us extra towels that we requested. TV did not work well.

title: Ubicación y Precio
text: Hospedarse en Times Square suele ser bastante inaccesible. Este hotel lo tiene todo, ubicación, limpieza, amabilidad sobretodo relación calidad- precio. Los cuartos son pequeños pero eso es normal en cualquier sitio de la gran manzana. Lo recomiendo ampliamente.

title: Do not come here
text: Bare bones ugly hotel in a busy location. Not worth the price at all. The bathroom is very outdated and our toilet   kept making a loud noise, keeping us up all night. Not a nice stay at all, room was barely clean with no amenties

title: Dirty and loud room
text: Room was very small and for your clothes there is no storage u have to keep it in your suitcase. Powersocket was only on the right side available! Bathroom was dirty and room very loud because of some waterpipes! Bed was ok

title: Overall good for $ excellent location
text: Overall good for $ excellent location room Size fair specially for NY size. Just not enough towels in the bathroom and no coffee maker or ice bucket in the room also there is only a bar and no food service in it.

title: Rude staff! Small and unclean rooms
text: The staff is unprofessional and rude! Rooms are not clean, construction right in front of the hotel which will go on for months so kindly refrain from booking it until and unless you wish to sleep with noise around you!

title: Don't waste your hard earned money!
text:
The hotel is very tired, the rooms are extremely basic and small the corridors have an awful smell. The lift have all broken tile coming off the floor. When we arrived after a long trip, there was no hot water for a shower/bath, many people were compiling of no hot water. The bedrooms are small and the water pretty much non-existent! It is generally dirty, in need of modernising and very over priced, poor value for money. Don't waste your money, Im sure you can find a cheaper, cleaner room in NYC!
Maria G

title: Almost…….
text: Overall a very convenient and easy stay. The staff was incredibly helpful and promote a sense of welcomeness. The room was very efficient and clean. Extremely basic but I didn’t mind that because the outlets were placed appropriately. The bathroom was designed to take a small space and make it work for your toiletries. Except for the issue with the Wi-Fi it was pretty good today. Thank you.

title: Cramped room for the price.
text: Described as a deluxe room, with deluxe prices.  The room was small even by Japanese standards.  There is no room to place your luggage on anything while unpacking, and the bathroom is dated with no modern amenities.

title: Not worth it
text:
Gym equipment not working.
Bar and coffee shop only open at 5pm.
Heating in room noisy all night.
Water pressure terrible.
Closet space minimal 
WIFI in room very weak.

The only positive thing about this hotel in the lobby which is newly renovated the rest of the experience is poor and not worth the money.

title: Real gem in the heart of times square
text: Fantastic location, rooms comfortable, quiet and just right. Good value for money based on location. Staff really helpful and bar staff really friendly. The linen was crisp and white…only lacking a kettle, but I think a cuppa in the morning is just a British thing

title: 4 Stars
text:
Hotel was old and needed some work to the rooms with paint and chipped molding features.
Mattress was hard. 
Small bathrooms.
No wash cloths were provided.
Construction is going on directly across the street. 
No fridge in the room. No water bottles in the room. 
Steamer was provided.

title: great location
text: This was the perfect place to access all the sites of NYC---was in walking distance from our event, broadway shows, great restaurants, public transportation, museums, coffee shops, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Hideous
text: There is a screw loose in New York business, but even so, I will not tolerate having some two-bit hotel hustle me.   I had a package sent to the hotel and was told that I needed to pony up a $5 cash handling fee.  I was ready to give the person a tip until they tried this little extortion move.   When I said to put it on my bill I was told it had to be cash.   This is when I came close to taking the little piece of trash by the neck and dragging out and beating him.   They gave it to me when I said, " you can give it to me now or I will call in the NYPD or simply come over the counter and take it for myself."   The rooms were small and the service is horrible.   No one needs this aggravation while traveling.   Go elsewhere for your own comfort and peace of mind.

title: Business stay
text: Was everything at the Paramount perfect?  No.  Was it good enough?  Yes.  Cons include bad water pressure, no top sheet, burnt out lights, a clock with the wrong time that I couldn't reset, and a door to my room that stuck and required a lot of strength every time. Pros include courteous staff, a steamer (!),  and obviously the location is impossible to beat if you need to be in Times Square.

title: Will not be staying again.
text: ONLY positive is the location of this hotel. Great being able to just walk out and basically be in time square. The lobby looks nice, but does not compare to the rooms in the slightest! Outdated and loud.

title: Hotel at Times Square
text: Excellent hotel with nice and clean lobby. Rooms are a little dated and could use a bit of freshening up but you can't beat the location. There are two playhouses and a music venue right on the street with times square right at the end of the block.

title: Bussines Trip
text: Great Location, just next to Times Square. and good price for the location and acomodation. The service, the hall and the room was very clean and nice. Only negative thing is that you have to pay for luggage storage.

title: Excellent location, safe, but loud and basic
text: Excellent location, opposite Hamilton museum and within 5 minutes walk to any musical. 2 minutes walk to Times Square but beware: that’s why it’s always noisy! Very friendly staff, generally very clean. But loud air con and thin windows mean, it’s never quiet in your room. It does feel like you’re in an airplane. I travelled solo and felt very safe, I can recommend the place if you want to be central and don’t mind the noise.

title: NEVER AGAIN!
text: My wife and I stayed stayed at the Paramount Oct. 8 until Oct. 11. Never again! We booked the room on the Paramount website two weeks out but when we arrived we saw the same room on the Paramount website for $70 less per night. When we asked the woman at the desk if we could get the better rate, she said NO.  Then we asked her if we at least could get a larger room with two beds. She replied it would cost us another $120.  She was not even apologetic. What a way to win back business! Our room was the size of a postage stamp and we constantly bumped into the TV as we went from one side of the bed to the other. Only one foot separated the bed from the TV. Then we asked for washcloths for the room and, at first, housekeeping told us the hotel did not provide them. Later, they dropped off 5 in our room. The bathroom could not accommodate a somersault by a dwarf. The bar (?) of soap was small enough to fit inside a thimble. The only positive thing was location inside the theatre district but, of course, there are hundreds of hotels in NY with the same location. Next time we'll choose one that is more customer-friendly.

title: Business Trip in NYC
text:
Overall a good hotel, but the rooms are a bit tired - small renovations would greatly improve the experience. Location is great for tourists, but a bit hectic for a business trip ie: lots of people in the neighborhood, heavy traffic, noisy outside etc...
Front desk and baggage staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Times Square Worthy
text: A budget-friendly hotel with wonderful amenities within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park, the rooms were nicely sized and the luggage check was well worth  the small amount they request to keep luggage.

title: Terrible stay at Parmount Hotel
text:
As an travel agent I will not book anyone for this hotel. The staff were not helpful and welcoming. the check in line was too long. the lobby was too dark and the rooms and bathrooms were small and old,
The bed sheets were not clean, I found hair from the previous guest on the sheets under the cover.
The place is disgusting. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The price was very high of course.

title: Terrible
text: Very dirty bathroom, someone else's underwear left there. Bedroom under bed was dirty. My sister had mold on her quilt. Other sister had someone else's shoes left. Obviously a cleaning problem. Front desk could of cared less. A.c.went out too.

title: Nice building, good stuff, but little things to change
text:
My stay was actually ok till i got really annoyed the day of my check out when they asked me 2$ only cash per bag to store my little bag for few hours, first, should be a free service, specially when a solo room cost you 280€ per night, second, since I had no cash, I had to get it from an ATM, so all this time wasted in my last day in NY just because they needed this 2$ only cash, guys I really don’t get it, it doesn’t bring you any business and it just annoys your guests and ruins your final review.
Staff very polite; and room essential, but fair for what looks in the pics.

title: Good position and atmosphere
text:
The bathroom was very little and the light in the lobby is really low... But position and overall quality is very good.
The worst was to be requested 5$ each bag/jacket to keep for one hour after check out... After 280 $ per room per night it seems very bad!

title: Avoid room 1142
text: Avoid room 1142...if so you'll rather be in a motel I promise you!! The room looked dirty, it had a smell, and it was super small. The staff didn't want to change the room at first. It was so embarrassing for my birthday. Paramount Hotel staff converted a small dirty storage room in to a bedroom. Bad service for that!! Avoid room 1142!!

title: Paramount
text: Great Location nice rooms On check in front desk very friendly and helpful. There is no resturant on site. Rooms were nice, Bathroom was small. Staff not helpful if the fire alarm goes off as was in the case of my stay.

title: Awful hotel. USD600 a night for hell
text: I was put in a room next to a construction site that was doing work all night. This wasn't mentioned when I checked in by someone who couldn't speak English. The whole experience was awful.  I was told tough luck about the room. I was told I would be moved first thing the next day, at 2pm I was moved. Expect a stainless steel sink (like a prison) with no cups or anything in the room

title: Not good
