text: Not happy with what I saw and I should be refunded fully for all the troubles I pass through traveling all the way from Massachusetts to New York. Hoping to have  a Wonderful rest after a long ride on the train only to get a disappointing room?

title: Not what I expected I was shocked
text:
Already wrote to trip advisor and said how bad it was the money I paid 2000.00 dollars for this room
Was disgusting .central heating wouldn’t turn off made  noises all night , bld works outside wasnt told about very noisy from 7 am all day terrible

title: Do Not Stay Their
text:
The hotel service is horrible. The pictures online are not accurate. They are photoshopped. The rooms are Tiny!!!! I felt like we were in jail. No storage or place to even move.

Do not stay there it is horrible

title: Fantastic location
text: The hotel staff was nice. I got early checked in. But the room was outdated and small. But the location is outstanding. In just few steps you can reach time square. I had good experience and will come back again.

title: Small Jewel Shines!
text: I booked this hotel predicated on proximity to Times Square, and for being in Midtown Manhattan. I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel's small demeanor  but, was wowed by the comfort, facility, and staff attention for the guests. I truly wished that I had made a choice to have stayed longer. I enjoyed myself so completely, I would definitely suggest it as a choice for a hotel to anyone I know who is traveling to New York City in the future!

title: Nice stay in NYC
text: Wonderful location next to Broadway.  Rooms are very, very small with limited storage and no extras such as glasses, ice buckets, coffee machine, mini fridge, iron, etc.  There is only one chair and a very small closet.  However, it was very clean and the staff were all very friendly and helpful.

title: A mediocre experience for an average price...
text:
The Paramount is located in a great area just a few minutes walk to Times Square and many of the Broadway theaters, as well as Hell's Kitchen. The check-in process was quick; of note was the fact that payment is collected up front (at least it was for our stay). The Front Desk staff was friendly and provided decent enough information about our stay and where to find things in the hotel. A nice feature (common in my experience in NYC) was the requirement to scan your room key to access your floor via elevator. The public areas were clean enough, too. Our room was average size for an NYC hotel and looked clean. The bed was fine (quite soft) and the bathroom had everything you needed. 

Where we had issues was with the staff. On our first morning after checking in, I left the room to get coffee and ran into a housekeeper in the hall. She asked if we needed any service to which we replied "no thanks." The housekeeper then asked if we had any trash and I said "actually, yeah we have some. I'll grab it for you." The housekeeper then tried to follow me into my room where my wife was still in bed. 

The following night, we had a minor issue with our TV remote (dead batteries) and requested a new remote. Within minutes a new remote was delivered. The team member asked for the old remote and when I said "I'll grab it, please wait here" the team member tried to enter our room. The issues with staff were reported to the front desk but as of today (one day after check out) we have not yet received a follow up call from management. 

Overall, the stay was fine. Not great but also not the worst hotel experience I've ever had. Maybe our experience was an outlier.

title: Get Hotel, just got a not so great room
text: Overall my stay was good. I was able to check in early and relax. Unfortunately my room had loose outlets, so my chargers had to be held up by a pillow. The bed was comfortable and I didn't hear much outside noise!

title: a nice stay in NYC
text: I spoke to friends regarding a place to stay in NYC since I had to make a brief stop there recently. They suggested the Paramount Hotel due to its location near Penn Station and Port Authority along with being central, near Times Square and the theaters. My check in was uneventful and the staff was very helpful. i got a single room since I was travelling alone and was only staying for the night before my cruise started. I was also going to be working during this time and found that the outlets for charging were in inconvenient places in the room. One was alongside the bed but there was nothing to rest anything on other than the bed. Outlets for the most part were located at the baseboards. The bathroom is small but suited my needs. For a really tall person, the tub is small. The flat screen TV is mount alongside the bed, not opposite to it. This may be a viewing problem for some. Storage space is minimal but there is room to hang some clothes and two drawers as well. The bed was comfortable. The shower can be precisely regulated as to how hot or cold you prefer. It is not really close to the Jacob Javits convention center. It was a pleasant stay and I was comfortable. I would recommend and return.

title: Hellish noise from the constructions across this hotel
text: Terrible. The construction noise that starts at 7 am every day and lasts till late afternoon is pure hell. It affects your whole being. Prospective guests should be warned. In fact, this side of the building should not even be open to guests during the construction.

title: VERGOGNA UN INSULTO ALL'ACCOGLIENZA
text:
I stayed at this 4-star rated Hotel from 21/09 to 27/09.
Granted that as an Owner and Director of a Hotel and Restaurant I have never written a review, but for this Hotel I am compelled to write one. 
The only good thing is the location, very central. Convenient to get around downtown on foot or by subway.
Negatives:
Non-existent breakfast service.
The room and bathroom are small, not very clean, absent mini bar, TV without a European channel, dilapidated and non-soundproof fixtures with water infiltration, dirty and smelly floor carpet, authentic guillotine access doors to rooms. Inoperable safe, non-existent luggage rest bench. Around the entrance lamp there was water seepage from the upstairs room and rubble was constantly falling. 
Twice during my stay I had to ask for towels to be given to me because they had not been put in.
Extremely rude, rude and incompetent staff, it is unthinkable that in a 4-star hotel the Reception staff speaks only one language. Concierge, like a statuette was unable to give information and solve the difficulties encountered for tickets and reservations for museums and shows.
The Manager, a woman ( can't be called Lady ), the rudest.
Unfortunately, a friend of mine had the misfortune to fall and break his leg and, given his age, 80 years old, he had difficulty using crutches. It was not possible to find a wheelchair so that he could get out of the room ( so small that you could not turn around in it ) and stay in the Hall ( there was not even a bar ) nor did they make any effort to find it and even inform us of a possible cost, but it could be transported with the luggage cart, offered to us by the porter the night when we returned from the hospital. The next morning we requested it from the porter on duty who also courteously helped us carry our friend to the lobby. Shortly thereafter the " Manager" showed up who railed, in English ( she spoke only that language, Manager!!!!!!! ) against my friend because according to her to walk he had to make do with crutches as using the trolley was against safety regulations. Safety????? from what we saw, the woman manager does not know education and the most basic safety rules. There are outside electrical wires in the rooms, there is no emergency exit, signs for any emergency exits , etcc.
The truth is that the "woman manager" probably wanted to be paid for such service but did not know how to ask for it. In that situation it would have been shameful.
In an Italian facility when what happened to my friend happened to a forestier we make ourselves available and try to solve any problem at no cost, they did not even call the ambulance for us to be able to go to the hospital. As for the stars in Italy a facility like this could be rated 1 or 2 stars always assuming that permits are issued to be able to open. Therefore, NOT RECOMMENDED.
Dear Manager, I invite you not to write any response, it would be the same as what I have already read in most of the negative reviews that have preceded mine. Do not waste your time, devote it perhaps to studying another language.
Regards
Marino

title: Left & paid for another hotel.
text:
I stayed here twice previously, 2016 and 2018, and whilst basic it was clean, rooms were equipped and location is great, things have changed a lot however. 

We booked a double, for 5 nights. The room we were given didn’t even fit our luggage. It was dingy, dirty, bathroom was mouldy, and we had one pillow, between two. The room had no decor and was nothing like I had stayed in before. 

We enquired about paying to upgrade being told nothing was available, and at that point noticed that others at the desk were homeless and organising longer term accommodation. To say this place has gone downhill is an understatement. 

We booked another hotel from the lobby and got our resort fee refunded! The desk clerk was nice and apologetic. We since followed up about an even part refund considering we are £1400 out of pocked which has been denied. 

A once decent budget hotel, don’t stay here.

title: Lost a Step or Two
text:
I loved The Paramount.  I stayed here exclusively when in New York on business, etc.  So it pains me to say that I will never stay here again.

Construction/excavation next door woke us at 7a Fri morning.  We asked to change rooms to the other side of the hotel and were told flatly that there was nothing available but not to worry!  No construction on the weekend.  But bright and early on Sat morning.  BAM-bam-bam-bam-bam.  We ran into other refugees at the excellent Irish pub across the street who were trying to get loaded just so they could go back to sleep.

The Paramount bar, which used to look out onto foot traffic along 46th, has been relegated to a shabby, blue-gray space in the back -- the dreariest bar in Manhattan.

No water bottles or even paper cups are provided in the rooms.  Humans require water to live, last time I checked, especially if you need to take prescription medicine.  So be prepared to lap water out of your hands over the sink like a dog ... for $450/night.

One of the rooms on our floor (11th) had clearly been forced open and then padlocked.  Crime scene, anyone?  Seriously, this is a safety/security concern, right?

The location of this hotel is excellent if you're doing the Times Square, Broadway theater thing.  We loved O'Caseys Irish pub across the street and breakfast and brunch at Bond 45 just a few steps down the street toward Times Square, but based on this most recent visit I'd look for something else if I were you.  Sad.

title: Not what I expected.
text: The room was very plain and small. Staff could have been a lot friendlier. Nobody every answered when I called guest services. The lobby was nice looking and I wish I could say the same for the rooms.

title: My Hotel Experience
text: Overall the experience was great and the atmosphere downstairs was great as well. The only issue I have is the construction going on next door causing a lot of commotion and noise, you will not be able to get no sleep due to the fact they start their work early in the morning.

title: Last stay was a better experience
text: Last stay would have been all excellent ratings this stay no ac and construction noise was relentless.  Stay on back side of hotel if you want to sleep on a week day!!!  Still love the Paramount, and we will return in a couple months, Just will bring ear cups to sleep in!

title: Agneta from Sweden
text: Got a good room for just a little more money than a cabin (like when you sleep in a storage).The room was wellkept and I was surprised how nicelooking the hotel was compared to other I looked at for a low price. When I arrived it was fully booked.

title: Traveler BEWARE
text: Pretty awful, and waaaaaaay overpriced. Dingy, dirty, barely equipped rooms, bathrooms that look like public toilets and have mold, and cleaning staff that will touch your personal things and “lose” your jewelry. And management that does absolutely nothing when you talk to them about it. Just save yourself and book anywhere else.

title: Week business trip
text:
Very old and dirty look rooms and bathroom, need complete refurbishing.  Stains in carpet, sheets, yellow pillow, mold/yellowy in sink drain 
General facilities are average, some strange smells in hallway nice employees though

title: Wonderful Staff
text:
My stay is off to a great start thanks to the excellent service of Vivian and Kwasi at the front desk. They couldn't have been more helpful! 
The hotel is conveniently located to major attractions in the city.

title: Don’t stay here
text: Hotel was booked by travel agent for business trip. This hotel is terrible. My room stank and was generally dirty. The halls smell like weed smoke and the carpet is dirty and stained. The best thing about the property is the location. I will never stay here again.

title: Not recommended
text: The position is perfect, 2 minutes from times square. The bedroom was very small, and the bed was not good. The bathroom was very old and uncomfortable. During the night it was very noisy. Really not recommended

title: Major construction noise
text: There is a major construction right next to the hotel and it’s IMPOSSIBLE to sleep in past 7am. Be aware. Also, reception seemed to be very short staffed and no one picks up calls from the rooms during the rush check in times. AC unit kept disconnecting and we had to ask for engineers few times. Seemed like it was a known issue for other rooms as we overheard other guests complaining about it in the hotel lobby.

title: Good location, adequate facility
text: Hotel was generally clean and adequate.  There are other hotels in the area that are only a little bit more expensive, but much nicer properties.  Property could be brought more up to date with technology.  Lobby was very dark. King size bed was very comfortable.

title: Think several times before going to The Paramount Hotel
text: A tour operator called Klerk suggested to move my original reservation from The Royalton Hotel to The Paramount Hotel as an upgrade. Real facts: smaller room, noisy, weed smoke all over in a “non-smoking” hotel, inconsistent towel supply at room, bad air conditioning, poor carpet cleaning, very bad Wi-Fi

title: Great weekend stay!
text:
Friendly and helpful front desk reception 
Clean comfortable room with a hot shower
Well stocked bar with skilled mixologist 
Great location mere moments away from all the action on Times Square, restaurants and theaters 
What more can you ask for??
👍🏾👍🏾

title: My review
text: An okay Hotel. Had expected a larver bed since we were two persons but there was just one king size bed. Modern reception, great location. Sometimes hard to ger an till elevator. We could hear the elevator from our room

title: gross hotel, rooms haven't been renovated and I left after one night
text: The Paramount has a renovated nice lobby, but it's lipstick on the pig.  It looked like my hotel room hadn't been renovated in decades.  It had a window air conditioner!  The sheets felt old and I wasn't sure they and the pillows were clean.  I was uncomfortable enough that it took a while to get to sleep.  The carpet was old.  The bathroom had a metal pedestal sink and a built-in old tub with flaking paint.  There was a sketchy-looking woman trying to get into the elevators when I was leaving the hotel for work early in the morning.  The room cost about $500 for the night, even though the same quality of room in rural America would be like $100 or less, and nice legit hotels like the Westin where I went the following night, after cutting my reservation short, cost about the same.  It's just wildly overpriced, a tourist trap right off of Times Square.  Avoid this place, don't give them your money.

title: Pleasant stay in Times Square
text:
Me and my girlfriend both enjoyed our stay at the Paramount hotel in Time Square, New York.

The hotel is literary a minutes walk from the center of times square which was ideal. 

The staff were very friendly upon arrival and even let us check in early, as the room was already empty.

The room itself was very clean and tidy upon arrival and of an average size.

Room good points: --

- Very comfy bed.
- Good size bathroom (with towels)
- Decent size flat screen TV.
- Good WiFi
- Clothes steamer
- Air conditioning

Room bad Points: -

- Room was very plain
- Safe did not work
- Very small cupboard for clothes
- Construction work on nearby building started at 7am each morning

Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend.
However, we did not like the 15% daily fee! Not sure what it was for.

title: Lousy hotel in the heart of times square
text:
We came for fashion week, and we were in room 527. premium rates!  lousy below basic room, a window air conditioner that had visible space around the makeshift enclosure, no microwave, no coffee maker, no fridge, no vent in the bathroom everything stayed damp. no face towels I was told I would have to go to front desk to get some.  cheap ugly carpet, the stainless-steel bathroom sink looked like a jail house sink, and it leaked around the faucets, not even a luggage stand. no amenities whatsoever, the only thing you all had going for you was location, and you all financially exploited us for that reason. never again, and for the 30 plus people in our party we all came away with the opinion the paramount is a rip off. I will be posting on social media my experience, many of us said the same thing.
I had to lay my luggage down on the floor, as I said not even a luggage rack, no dressers, no furniture other than a chair, night table and mini plexiglass table. bare bones ugly room
your facility looked clean, and the maids did a good job of cleaning our room, but everything looked old, dingy, and frayed, the pillows were old and flat, useless no support. Everything felt damp. truly a ghetto room in the heart of times square. Yes, I have been told NYC is expensive, but I went in other hotels that were beautiful and cheaper than the $1400.00 plus for 3 nights we paid.
never saw any security, your staff was very friendly, but the spirit of greed was evident in the lousy rooms, that was the crime. I am sure you had better rooms for VIPs but it's a shame that the general public is treated so poorly.
The only reason I booked was because of location our event was in Sony Hall next door, that is all you got going for you, location.
I don't know how this hotel got a 3.5 rating; the room are old, not newly remodeled.
plus today I am looking at the rates and they are 189.00 and thru 210.00 we paid almost triple that. that price gouging.

title: Just don't
text: Room was not clean (garbage, empty drink bottle on window sill),  The room safe not bolted down (I could have literally walked off withe it).  It was noisy even on the 19th floor, super loud air conditioner.

title: Just awful to arrive after long flight from Australia to be told our already paid for room was not available,
text:
Terrible experience, we advised them of our late arrival many days before, we got there to be told the twin room, paid for many weeks ago, was not available,  and I would have to share a bed with my young niece,  I am 75 years, so not good,  our room was to be ready next day at 12.30pm,  we got back at 4.30pm, and again told room not available,   I called for the manager,  who miraculously discovered a twin bed room.  Also need to point out the rudeness of the receptionist, 
So finally able to unpack as we were staying for next 3 nights 'unfortunately'
The wardrobe was about 12 inches wide, so no good for 2 people, or even one,  the bathroom was so small,  and we had to ask for a 2nd towel.

We didn't use any other facilities in that unpleasant hotel,  we always went to other cafes and restaurants for breakfast,  lunch and dinner, I had no intention of spending more money there.

title: NY Weekend
text: Great location and cool lobby. Bathroom was very small and dated. But overall a great experience and staff.  It was NY Fashion which and one of the shows was held under the hotel - that was very cool! Looking forward to our next trip to NY and will look at staying here again.

title: Tiny, nothing like the pics!!
text:
Small rooms, toilets are actually ridiculous you cant sit straight on! 
Great location if you want to be in Times Square, noisey AC, no other facilities like room service or a bar to get bottled water. 
Advertised DJ's and a bar - certainly didn't see that!

title: Skip if you can find elsewhere
text:
1st off I get that it was Fashion week, so prices were artificially inflated to begin with, but $450+/night for a closet of a room (it wasn't big enough to fit an ironing board, so they supplied a hand held steamer instead) with an air conditioner that ran all the time unless it was turned off, inches from your head. The bathroom was also incredibly small, with an all stainless steel sink you would see in a cell, lol. The hotel also has what are probably the SLOWEST elevators in NYC. 

This was a last minute business trip, and I was barely in the room, but it was enough after just 1 evening to put me off.

title: So Bad! Read the Negative Reviews!
text:
This might be the worst “4-star” hotel I have ever stayed at, and I’ve been traveling all around the globe. 
I don’t know how they remain in business because the rooms are SO old and outdated and the stuff is rude and useless. 

Their A/C system doesn’t hold the load and constantly breaks down, so be ready to sweat in your room during Summer! 

The carpet in my room was so dirty and gross, I had to make sure I didn’t step my bare feet on it.

There is No drinking water in the room, no mini bar, no snacks, no nothing. 

The room is incredibly tiny, even by European standards, it was comical. 

The lobby stinks of years of mold and cigarette smoke. 

There is a MASSIVE construction going right next to the hotel, so you will hear it.

The lobby is so dark, but not because it’s cool, but because if you turn the lights on, you’ll see the insects crawling on its walls and fungi growing in the corners.

Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY!

title: Hotel was lovely but staff were not very helpful
text: The room and hotel design was lovely and rooms were very spacious for New York City but unfortunately the staff were very unhelpful when a personal belonging of mine went missing from my room as staff put in no effort to try and find it

title: Don’t stay
text: You will be disappointed staying there, dark entrance was like a nightclub. Not value for money. No kettle l,ironing board, tea or coffees in the room. No breakfast facilities. Some staff reluctant to help.

title: 1-Night NY Visit
text: Hotel had a dimly lit lobby and was amazing cold in the heat of early September. However, that's where the positive statements stop. Water for water bottles is only found on the 4th floor, our AC went out 3 times, no one ever came to fix it the third time and management never responded, huge wet spot in the floor where the AC was leaking, and a random wire hanging outside the unit (moisture sensor, maybe?). Couple that with a hot day/night and a very weird bathroom, it wasn't a great stay.

title: Customer Honest Review
text: Downstairs reminds me of old Hollywood, however that bedroom carpet was unpleasant and terrible. Steamer doesnt work, no iron was provided as an alternative when you call the front desk. Noticed there was no microwave, when we as the front desk if there is any way to warm our food they said no. Even if you dont want to provide a microwave in the rooms ,you can atleast let the front desk staff access a microwave to warm the customers food up.

title: Nice Place to stay!
text: The location is perfect! a 1 minute walk to Times Square. The staff was awesome and very polite! The rooms are a bit tight, but we were just there to sleep. The lobby is dark, but very cool! This place worked perfectly for us!

title: Very disappointing for the price charged
text: Very disappointing for the price charged.  No fridge, no microwave, no cups, coffee, and broken AC. Supposedly fixed the first time, but we requested to change rooms. They also charged for baggage storage which world's new as much of an annoyance if the bare minimum in this hotel was cleatly communicated to customers. This hotel's only saving grace is the manager who with very few words just upgraded us to a slightly bigger room with functioning AC.

title: Great location, average rooms
text: Location was ideal for us, aircon was great as it was very hot that week. Extremely unbearably noisy from construction work. Woke up at 7am both Thursday and Friday. Luckily it didn’t go on at the weekend. Rooms were okay size but needed updating, just repainted and maybe a new bathroom as it was old. There also wasn’t many sockets available and none on one side of the bed. Only 1 bedside table also. Could only hang about 3 T-shirts in the closet. Safe broke on the 2nd day and we couldn’t get into it. Maintenance did open this quickly but said we couldn’t have a safe now for the remainder of the stay which was pretty poor.

title: Hotel muy bueno, atención al cliente malisima.
text: El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación, las prestaciones son muy buenas. Lo califico como regular por la mala atención al cliente de las personas en front desk y concierge. Muy poco amigables, sin ningún tipo de capacitación ni buenos modales. Aclaro que fui en otras oportunidades, evidentemente cambiaron el standard de atención al cliente. Una pena.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square
text: It is located almost at Times Square which has the disadvantage that you have the noise from the street all night long as the windows are not good enough to let the noise not in. We had water dripping down to the windowsill (most probably coming from the AC in the room above) which should have been noticed before booking someone into this room. But at least we got another room quite soon when we informed the team at the reception.

title: A fuir sauf si la localisation est votre critère majeur.
text:
Le seul point positif de cet hôtel est son emplacement. 
Le reste est d’une médiocrité inouïe. 
J’ai resserve une chambre exécutive, censée être dans le haut de gamme juste avant les suites. 
Résultat : 
-vitres de la fenêtre très sale au point qu’on avait du mal à voir l’extérieur 
-chambre décrite avec une sdb contenant une baignoire et une douche. Au final il n’y a qu’une baignoire avec un pommeau de douche …
- aucun service dans la chambre : pas de bouilloire, pas de machine à café, pas de bouteille d’eau offerte par personne et par nuit 
- moquette très sale avec des taches partout 
- serviette de bain pas changée tous les jours 
- décoration de la chambre inexistante 
- pas de prise électrique de chaque côté du lit 
- Clim très bruyante 
- trkl de bruit venant de la rue. Les fenêtres n’isolent rien. 
- à la fin du séjour si vous voulez laisser vos bagages avant de repartir, il faut payer 2 USD / bagage ! Du jamais vu. 
- les hôtes/ hôtesses d’accueil ne sont pas accueillants. Ce sont des jeunes qui font un job d’été ? 
-

title: Great Hotel
text: Paramount hotel is very well located in the heart of Times Square. Service is very good. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Our room had a great view to the 8th street. Bathroom was also clean

title: Un hotel con historia
text: Hotel antiguo, de la década del 1920. Muy bien ubicado, a metros del Times Square y de las principales atracciones de NYC. Mi habitación estuvo bien, aunque el baño -concretamente la bañera- es un poco inseguro. El lobby un tanto oscuro para mi gusto, así como los ascensores (que son cuatro y los cuatro tienen poca iluminación interior). Entre el personal de la recepción, rescato algunos muy educados y serviciales y otros bastante despectivos. Cuenta con un sitio seguro y custodiado para dejar el equipaje hasta que te entregan la habitación (que es a las 4 de la tarde) o cuando ya has hecho el check out y te faltan horas para el traslado al aeropuerto (en este caso te cobran 4 dólares por cuidar tu equipaje). El lobby tiene una atmósfera interesante, es un tanto oscuro, pero la gente fluye, conversa, come, lee, e interactúa.

title: Terrible room !!
text: The room smell so bad, humidity, dirty carpet, hair in bathroom in the bed, no glass to drink water no Coffee machine nothing to put our suitcase on have to put on the floor on disgusting carpet.Never going back again !!

title: Decepción, no volvería
text:
La decoración es genial y según calidad-precio te esperas un buen hotel y esa fue nuestra decepción.

Para una estancia de 7 noches nos encontramos una habitación “doble” tan pequeña que no podías estar deshaciendo la maleta en el suelo y abrir la puerta del “armario”.

La cama estaba pegada casi a una pared y solo con una mesita de noche (porque la otra no cabía)

Lo que parecían ser desconchados en la pared del wc eran mosquitas matadas de anteriores huéspedes. No sabemos por donde pero el wc se llenaba de mosquitas que tenías que ir esquivando.

La maleta la tienes que hacer y deshacer en el suelo porque no hay ni un siemple mueblecito para dejarla en alto.

El “armario” es una puerta con una tabla a modo de estantería donde está la caja fuerte y 3 perchas arriba.

La maquina de aire condensa y está sin limpiar como desde hace 1 año (veo en otras opiniones fotos y es totalmente verdad)

Nos tocó la planta 19… olvídate de ducharte en hora punta porque no hay presión.

Hotel muy ruidoso, la ventana de la habitación daba a la parte trasera donde hay más hoteles, maquinas,… es ruido constante.

El servicio es muy amable y eso si, la ubicación es excelente.

Ni lo recomiendo ni volvería

title: Nothing Superior about the Superior Queen
text: Our Queen room was very small and there were no amenities.  Shampoo, Conditioner, and Soap, yes.  No coffee maker or ice bucket.  The bed was comfy and I liked the pillows.  Being on the 18th floor and at the very end of a hallway provided for a quiet stay.  Had a few technical issues: TV remote didn't work and needed new batteries (we checked in late and were ready to settle in but had to wait for Engineering).  Was woken very early one morning by Engineering to fix a problem we had not reported.  The lobby was very dark, and the music was too loud.  The location is incredible!  There is an extra facilities fee of $35 per night for items that usually are free or are inconsequential (internet, filtered hot and cold water, Staycast, fitness center, 10% off at bar).

title: Stay at your own risk.
text:
The room is so small and the bathroom is even smaller hardly you can squeeze in a square area without touching the wall while taking a shower. The reception and lobby is so dark as if you are part of a spooky movie. The smell of old carpet and the cranky elevator will add spookiness to the property. There's no amenities given. Even for keeping your luggage they charge $2.00 per lb! No tea/coffee machine. There's a water/ice dispenser on the 4th floor which doesn't dispense hot water! 
All the tariffs are not revealed until you book the property. Booking,com colludes with the hotel for it's non-transparency in the tariff.

title: Lovely experience at Hotel Paramount Times Square.
text:
We stayed at Paramount Hotel Times Square from July 25th to August 4th, 10 Nights & it was one of the most beautiful experience at NYC. The day I checked in they upgraded our room to a Deluxe king size on the 16th floor, so that was a lovely gesture from the front desk staff. 

Some of our positive experiences:

First and foremost the location of the hotel is one block next to Times Square  & right in the heart of theatre district. Everything from here is so convenient and easily accessible. You can be late out at Times Square & it's safe and convenient to get back to the hotel late night. The subway or the bus terminal is easily accessible & are at walking distance from the hotel.

The front desk people are really nice and helpful & they are very much approachable. 

The hotel ambience is very unique especially the Lobby, it's so comfortable to  just chill on those sofa's, especially when you come tired from outside after long walks across the city and just want to sit & relax.  

The rooms are very very clean & the beds are extremely comfortable, the house keeping staff is really polite and do a great job in room cleaning every morning. 

Overall the place has a very positive feel & hence I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to come and experience the beautiful NYC. In fact we plan to comeback and stay here at Paramount once again in the future. 

The only negative that I would mention here is the construction site that is coming-up right in front of the hotel. They start the work early morning & that is little disturbing sometimes but not much as the entire day we are out.

title: Mehh
text: If you looking to stay close to Times Square this is a good hotel, walking distant, on the least expensive hotels. I would say this is a small upgrade from a motel. They didn't offer anything to accommodate my friends birthday. We were hardly in the room so it would go enough to sleep and go but we felt it could have been better presented.

title: Excelent
text: Perfect location steps to times square , broadway theathers and a lot of restaurants.  The check in was excelente and simple.  When you check out you can left in the lobby of the hotel your luggage for a low cost and continuing enjoy the city

title: Below average
text:
As stated
Treadmills and water dispenser in gym not functional
Only one soap and no cups, glasses or waters in room
Lack of restaurant hurts
Bar is spartan
Staff was good
Location very good
I have stayed at paramount since 2003- probably 10 times and always liked location, vibe and value
Quality has deteriorated because of poor amenities 
Would consider not staying again

title: Great Location. Overpriced Rooms.
text: Disappointing. We booked a superior room and it was nothing like the photo. Cleanliness poor - needs a deep clean as dust build up in areas like edges of doors, light and air con unit. Carpet dirty. . Light not working. Bathroom - dirty and needs updating. Staff friendly and bed comfy. Location great. Would not stay again unless prices reduced - not value for money.

title: not so much
text:
the room, they just leave alot to be desired.  lower the prices and we won’t expect much.
no amenities at all!  brighten the lobby!  put some glasses in the room.  change the bathroom sink!
a wasncloth wouldn’t hurt.

title: Placentero
text: Buena relacion precio calida. Excelente ubicacion por la cercania al Time Square, aunque esto depende de lo que cada uno prefiera (demasiado movimiento de gente todo el tiempo). Lobby bien ambientado aunque le falta algo de iluminacion.

title: Is what it is.
text: Hotel is clean and tidy, rooms a pretty basic but everything you need. AC packed up on our last night and the room turned into a sweat box. Day staff pretty good. Night staff not so helpful that night. He got a bit grouchy with us that we kept telling him it wasn’t working again after they come to fix it. He wouldn’t move us into a different room as apparently the hotel was fully booked. I’m not sure if this was true tbh it didn’t seem like it was I believe that he just didn’t want to come down at 2am to give us a key to a different room. But I guess we’ll never know.

title: Last Stay
text: I was very disappointed in this hotel. I have stayed here several times  and this time was the worst. I am considering never visiting this hotel again despite its great location near Times Square. Ssss

title: Perfect location, proper facilities. I recommend.
text: The location is spot on to be at Time Square. Be adviced that there are renovations works done outside but this does not affect the hotel experience. The room was exactly as expected, small but efficent: A bed, bathroom, storage and a TV. The staff is attentive to requests and professional. The overall cleanliness of the rooms and hotel is good. I will come back to this location without hesitation!

title: New York
text: Unforgettable travel with my family. Hotel in central position. Staff excellent. Rooms not so big but ok for few days. Bathroom little and to renew. In general good hotel. I hope to return. Thanks very much.

title: Great location but that’s about it
text: Great location right by Times Square and with great places to eat nearby. The main foyer is nice enough with comfy sofas and pool table. However the room was very basic with a small bathroom and shower that was constantly boiling. The noise was an issue and affected sleep on a few nights, though the bed was comfy. Biggest issue was the awful smell around the corridors and my room which I can only describe as “herbal” if you catch my meaning - not pleasant.

title: 5 action packed days in NYC
text: The Paramount Hotel is in a brilliant location to explore NYC.  My teenage daughter and I had an excellent stay.  The staff were all very helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The decor is a bit tired but no more than usual for a busy inner city hotel.  Would definitely recommend the executive king room.  Plenty of space for mother and daughter to share the huge bed and to sleep well.  The construction site noise was the one downside but we were up early and out of the hotel so didn't trouble us as much but could be a problem ff you needed a lazy day. The Paramount quickly became our 'home away from home' and a welcome base camp during a busy trip.

title: Great price. Comfortable bed.
text: Used to stay ten plus years ago. The remodel is not great. The lobby has black walls and an air freshener that smells like someone used way to much perfume. It is not attractive or welcoming. Room is small of course it's New York. No place to put your suitcase etc. Tiny table with no shelf between beds and a tiny desk. Plugs next to be are worn out and any plug you insert falls out. Had to charge phones below desk. There are no glasses or an ice bucket. Only ice machine is on the 4th floor and you get paper cups and a plastic bag. Cups saturate quickly and the ice melts in the bag and then spills into the room. Not the Paramount it was years ago.

title: Great Location
text: This was a good price for the location. However, there were no washcloths available during my stay. There was also very loud construction every morning/afternoon. Customer service was great and friendly staff.

title: Great stay
text: Great value for the price. The lobby is beautiful. I have no complaints about the room. They have a bar but no restaurant. I went to the hotel only to sleep, yet I noticed that the facilities are good.

title: TO AVOID
text: disappointing welcome with a room not ready arriving after 4 pm, we arrived at midnight, a dirty room with remains of detritus under the bed of previous clients, empty water bottle, lipstick, plastic bag.. . an air conditioning that does not work and no one deigns to come and fix it!!!!

title: Terrible rooms, staff and unprofessional manager
text:
Manager yelled at us for complaining about our shower drainage being broken. He's very disrespectful and rude and trying to belittle us throughout the conversation. I don't know how he became a manager, he's not well mannered and unprofessional for someone who works for hospitality. Pretends like everything is under control but he does not know what was going on.
Take your money somewhere else, they will charge you additional $40/night for facility fees and believe me, their facilities are crap. Its wither their AC is not working or the shower is too hot. While I was in the lobby at least 5 people are in line to complain about their room. Save yourself some trouble and don't choose this hotel.

title: Horrible experience
text: The two bed room is tiny, and across from the elevator. It is likely modified from an utility room. The air quality in the room is horrible. we kept coughing through our stay. The noise is Horrible. It is literally 10 feet from the elevator.

title: Review of our stay
text:
Location was great of course and staff overall was good.

My issues was the fact that our plugs in the room did not work. The bath tub drain would back up each time we took a shower.

The biggest thing for me, is when we checked in, we were real early as we came from Canada and the hotel stored our bags at no charge for the day. When we checked out, the same thing...we were not leaving until dinner time, we asked to store our bags for the day and because we were checking out that day, we were going to be charged $2.00 per bag. I mean come on, we just spent 3 nights there @$300 dollars per night...really?

title: Filled a need
text:
It filled a need for this trip

It was a boxed room very small but then in fairness most places in NYC are so that is fine 

Pros 

- The location is excellent literally 3 minute walk to Times Square so that was a perfect t location as the area is quiet as well 

- Rooms are cosy and no noise so loved this 

- Wi-Fi good 

Improvements 

- lack of really good service at the front desk - no real information at check in and only 1 person on at peak time 

- the rooms did not have a desk or coffee, of any glasses - so I brought myself plastic cups - you can argue that it’s not needed but I always like this 

- the cleanliness is mixed as when I came in the room there was hair in the bath so was not convinced it was a proper clean - but they did clean daily and replenish stock 

- the leave your luggage required 2 dollars cash - I did not have and I could not pay by card so this was totally inflexible and in my view lacked service 

- lack of customer service it will be helpful if at the start the service was to tell you about the hotel- check out time, places you can eat erc 

- I did not do my diligence but you have to pay a per night fee do this was different to other hotels I dated at - they do not ask for a deposit. If you look at other hotels I would think I could have had better with this extra cost

It’s a good place if you are not in the hotel only to sleep

title: Not coming back
text: Bathroom and room is very outdated. Wall outlets were not working. The room did not feel clean. Lobby is always dark and always have a line to the front desk. They charge for storing your luggage for few hours after staying at the hotel.

title: Horrible Horrible experience
text: Horrible view due to seeing trash and someone shoes on the ledge. Room doesn't look anything like the website is advertising. Room had stains on the head board. No towels. Had to clean up and buy towels for the entire time I was visiting. We were here for 5 days. Air conditioner kept us up all night rattling sound like it was about to break down and a rat chewing through it. Just a Horrible time. No stars.

title: Great hotel
text: When I arrived they were able to accommodate my early check in. The room is small but looks like the pictures on the website. Fair price for what you get in the room. My air-conditioner wasn't working and they came and fixed it within 20 minutes. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Great location, that's about it.
text:
This hotel is "ok".  Price is usually right, it is clean and really well located.  Late checkout (after 11a) costs $50 to stay til 2p.  Leaving your bag costs $2/bag.  They have lots of comfy space to relax before checkin( which you will need if you were hoping for early checkin) but it's quite dark in the lobby.  No business center, but there is free wifi.  Concierge wasn't aware there was an ATM next to the elevators... that pretty much describes the staff.  They're fine, not rude, but not great.  Phone in room to call down for more towels didn't work.  
I would stay again in a pinch but it's def not my first choice.

title: Daniel
text: Estupenda visita a Nueva York, la el servicio y la ubicación del Paramount es de las mejores de Manhattan, gran parte del personal habla español facilitando y mejorando la atención. En resumen la mejor la experiencia de unas vacaciones soñadas

title: Week in New York
text: Stayed here for a week and was really impressed with the facilities and hotel overall. The reception area is stunning and staff friendly. Rooms were small and basic but more than adequate. Would definitely return here

title: Not a good place very small. Took all my info on the phone right. For 4 people I was given a sofa bed. No parking lot.
text: Not a good place very small. Took all my info on the phone right. For 4 people I was given a sofa bed. No parking lot. Overall I did not enjoy my stay there the room was so small. Not very clean. With two little kids. I was given a sofa bed. After knowing that there was two adults and two little kids.

title: A dump - avoid.
text:
Popped in to reminisce having stayed there when got married 25 years ago.
Still looks the same fundamentally but gosh - popped to the bar for a drink or two. 
I needed the loo and was told there was none you need to be a guest. So decided to go and pay only to be told we don’t take cash.
I says what do you do - no toilet, a bottle of warm beer no glass and expect a tip on card plus the service charge for using a card. 

What a total dump. It needs to say up front it’s pricing and charging policy

title: Affordable and convenient spot in New York.
text: Affordable hotel to stay at while on vacation in New York for less than a week. The location is pretty crammed in between buildings with lots of construction and garbage in the street. Since it is in the middle of New York expect it to be noisy from all the commuters, cars, sirens and people chattering. Some people are no ignorant and blast music really loud at night. But it comes with the territory. The entrance was easy to find. The lobby is very dimly lit and dark in there. The rooms are okay - comfortable enough. They did not look like how they were advertised online - some pillows were missing and the rooms are smaller than in the pictures.

title: The room was 80 degrees and we called the reception so many times and nobody came, we couldnt sleep the whole night.
text: The room was 80 degrees and we called the reception so many times and nobody came, we couldnt sleep the whole night. There was construction going around and from morning 5am, there was so much noise we couldnt sleep with the heat and noise!

title: Good Central location
text: Excellent central location. First stayed in room 1642. Very small, no table or chair, no view, construction noises from street. Upgraded to room 1601, much larger, city view, no construction noises. Great central location for shows, shopping, restaurants.

title: Too much noise
text:
The room was in front of a building under construction bulldozer from 7am to 6 pm it was terrible
And the air conditioning very noisy is Just in a hole in the window so there is no isolation of noise at all whith outside
The price was cheap but the expérience terrible so tired with the jetlag and the girl at Check-in said that it would have been better by booking direcly throw the hôtel and not via booking.com,
so why you are on booking.com if you gives to booking.com all the bad room on the very noisy side

On the way back we stop again 2 nights in New York and i book at the New Yorker the view was fanstastic ask for the view empire statue building and chrisler building  and no noise and the upgrade us to à suite that was great

Paramount need à lifting

title: THIRD STAY THIS YEAR
text: Perhaps I am too easy to please.  All I want in a hotel is a friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed and quiet surroundings.  The hotel fits the bill.  I don't care if there is no coffee maker or in my recent stay no alarm clock.  Don't need a large room and I admit I am have the freedom to travel when I can get the best rates.  Not much for solo dining but several restaurants are a few steps away with most offering take-out.  I suppose I could complain that there are no plastic cups in the bathroom or the toilet is too low to the floor but the water pressure and hot water in the shower makes up for it. I will be returning....hopefully soon.

title: Clean room, Tiny bathroom
text: Clean atmosphere, housekeeping daily.  Disadvantages requested wash clothes daily, bathroom extremely small barely turn around room, nowhere to put body wash in shower, everything had to come out so next person can shower, bathroom setup very poorly, tiny clothes hanging area, no ironing board, no dressers had to live out of suit case, no ice bucket or cups, no coffee machine and no refrigerator.

title: It was ok.
text:
Room was ok, floor was dirty. No way to close curtains (window ac). There was construction with Loud jackhammer all day outside my room. (7-5pm) 
The lobby is beautiful. Security was good. Staff was pleasant.

title: Disappointing stay sadly
text:
Upon checking in I was in a question of 6 people. The staff at each counter did not call the next person over and new people just walked In to check in and walked straight up to the available counter and got served..

the room was floor 19. Has no seat or chair in the room. Nowhere to put your luggage. The bathroom had no shower gel and the mirror was hung way to low I had to bend down to use it. 

Construction noise was crazy loud which was not expected. 

Each night hookers would hang at the entrance to get business..

Upon checking out.. I was told its $2 per bag to hold for you. I had no cash.. they would not let me pay upon collection. So forced me to use the Lobby atm.. with a fee of $4.50 just to get a $20 out to pay $4... I was not happy at all. Good location is about it. room was comfy but small. 
But overall a frustrating stay. I have wanted to try this hotel for years as it looks so nice. But sadly not a great experience. Won't be booking again.

title: Horrible place to stay
text: Worst experience, the bedroom is terrible, small, ugly , you feel like in jail. The rooms are super small, tiny, the bathroom was even smaller, and dirty and didn’t flush the water . I won’t recommend this place I won’t stay never again

title: Complaint about security breach
text:
Twice, on different days, employees entered our room, in the afternoon (4:16pm and another day 5:15pm). They had the master keys, they knocked on the door and, before I could answer it, they already opened the door, and, me in my underwear with my wife. In the two days, I went down and made the complaint at the reception and also through booking, but I didn't get any answers. The only direction I received was to leave "do not disturb" hanging on the door. My wife was scared every night that someone would come into our room at night.
I was also very concerned about the type of treatment and safety of the Hotel in front of the guests.

title: Broken ac
text: The ac didn't work. I had to go downstairs to tell the desk clerk to fix it.  Well, they reset the ac 3 times but only lasted 15 min. They finally gave $40 credits bc of the inconvenience of no sleep.  It should be free!

title: Is ok if you don’t care
text: The services is no good, the water of the shower go every were in the bathroom. Don’t  They do not provide towels if you do not ask for them during the hours that the housekeeping works because there are no more staff. The good think is the location. No parking lot.

title: August 2023- Construction beware!
text: This hotel is amazing and when we checked in on Sunday we were excited about the location. Monday morning at 7:45 am incredibly loud construction began for the entire day that shook our walls, and was overbearing even with ear plugs. Do not get a room on the front exterior wall- its terrible! If on other side of hotel, might not be as bad. No one mentioned it, and it ruined our one morning off in months.

title: Hôtel à éviter quelle que soit votre enveloppe
text:
Chambres minuscules (impossible de déplier une valise par terre), pas de minibar ou de bouilloire/machine à café, literie trop molle, salle de bains spartiate (le lavabo est une simple vasque en inox, rien pour déposer ne serait-ce qu'une brosse à dents), pas de gel douche, électricité vétuste (climatisation HS et fenêtres fixes),  entrée de l'hôtel vaste mais sombre, bref, un quatre étoiles qui en vaut deux pour les prestations mais quatre pour le prix.

Attention, l'hôtel fait payer des frais (de l'ordre de 40$ par jour et par chambre) pour des prestations plus qu'ordinaires (distributeur d'eau fraîche, machine à café) situées chacune à un seul des 17 niveaux.

En résumé, à éviter quelle que soit votre enveloppe : vous trouverez forcément mieux un peu plus loin de Times Square, qui est facile d'accès.

title: Horrible experience
text: I booked a room at midnight  to take rest . then when I booked the room the checkin time was 4pm tomorrow.. I was with my kids 1 kid was under 2 yrs .. then I went there to have my refund . They don’t try to help me . I told 1 of the front desk staff to call his manager he told me ..he is busy .. such a bad experience ..I went there on 5 August  now it’s  21th august I didn’t get my refund.. I was with my little baby .. they don’t have any humanity. The staff didn’t want to help us at that situation..so bad

title: Amazing Time in Time Square!!
text: I've taken both my daughters & now my grandson to NYC for their 13th birthday.  This is our 2nd stay @ Paramount.  It's just perfect!!  Everything is close & it's neat & clean!! I love how close we are to Times Square & all the shops!

title: Very well located
text:
Not the perfect hotel, but enough for a trip in Time Square.
I recommend for family and business trip.
Location is amazing.

Not the perfect hotel, but enough for a trip in Time Square.
I recommend for family and business trip.

title: AVOID! Rooms are bad!
text:
The best part about this hotel was the staff, they were all wonderful and kind. 
The hotel itself is a scam - The lobby is beautiful and modern, but once you hit the rooms you're in for disappointment. We had a wheelchair accessible room. Normally, wheelchair accessible rooms are larger so that the wheelchair can turn and we can transfer to the bed with enough space. This room was tiny, the wheelchair couldn't even get to the bed without moving the furniture in the room (of which there was only a dirty table and a bench). Not a problem, but technically not allowed under ADA Accessibility guidelines. Add to that the paint was chipping, the linen was all slightly wet, the bathroom smelled of weed, and the "roll in shower" had a gigantic rubber guard that was pasted to the floor in a way that made it difficult for the shower chair to get in there AND leaked all the water all over the bathroom. I get that what I'm paying for is the location and the lobby, but I expected a whole lot more, and I just feel robbed.

title: Comfortable, affordable, basic in a great loacation
text: Wonderful and caring staff,   Politre and polished but not stuffy.   The rooms are very small, but that is the norm these days.  The desk chair is not helpful:  heavy and does not roll or swivel.  Shower was scalding hot.  But it was quiet and just what I needed.  (There is a lot of outside construction noise and jack hammering during the day, at least when I was there.

title: Fine
text:
Overall the stay was fine.  No real problems to complain about, but the room was honestly reminiscent of a prison cell - the room pretty much fits the bed and the bathroom is basically just a small closet packed in with a shower, sink, and toilet.  If you literally just need a place to sleep in NYC, this isn't bad for the cost - it's got a good location and it's not like it's dirty or gross or anything, and the staff was pleasant and I didn't have any real negative experiences.  Just understand that you are getting the absolute bare minimum that you could possibly be getting, so if you're looking for anything more than that, look elsewhere.

If you just need a place to crash for the night near Times Square on a budget and don't care about literally anything else, it's got a convenient location and it's not dirty, so it's at least worth considering.

title: Bad.
text: The lobby is dark, filled with a lot of people and security guards. I wasn’t expecting much from the room (small with twin bed) but the bed frame was a 1960’s metal frame that squeaked loudly and the air conditioner didn’t work. I called customer service 4 times- each time telling me someone would be up to fix the problem. No one ever came.

title: Fantastic for Theatre Lovers
text: Simple rooms, but very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping every day. Location is amazing - no more than 5-10 min walk to Broadway theatres. Literally just off Times Sq. Team are friendly and helpful.

title: Not recommended
text: Miserably hot and humid in the hotel. Room temp was 75-76 and thermostat dial made no difference. No cups or glasses in the room to brush your teeth. Cheap by NYC standards and certainly in good location near Times Square if none of the other is important to you.

title: Decepcionante y un timo los cargos extra obligatorios
text:
Bastante decepcionante por diferentes razones.

 1. Me parece una estafa que debamos pagar un suplemento de $35 por noche y habitación para usar los "servicios" del hotel.  Si bien es cierto que como nos dijeron, lo pone en su web, al reservar, no te lo especifica y por tanto no te das cuenta hasta que llegas allí, si no lo buscas adrede en preguntas de los clientes.
Nunca he visto un hotel que obligue a alguien a pagar por un gimnasio que no vamos a usar y menos por usar los ascensores (cosa obvia) o una fuente de agua en el 4to piso siendo un rascacielos y cuando el agua del grifo  es potable y por el Wi-Fi que en la web pone que es gratis y en algunas partes del hotel, ni siquiera llega.
Sería más normal que quien quiera usar el gimnasio lo pague aparte, y si creen que es obligatorio, que lo incluyan en el precio total al reservar (a ese precio, ya no hubiera reservado)

 2. Es imposible dormir o estar en la habitación con el insoportable ruido del aire acondicionado/calefacción que cuando se pone en marcha parece que despegue un avión. Es indescriptible y una pena que no me deje subir el video
Es bastante ridículo tener dormir con edredón (única  ropa en la cama) en verano,  porqué son conscientes de que al no poder modificar la temperatura del termostato, hace frio, pero entonces pasas calor.
 3. Pagué por usar unos ascensores a los que puedes esperar 5 o 10 minutos hasta cansarte y bajar andando o tener que pasear arriba y abajo por un montón de pisos si llegas a cogerlo, antes de llegar a tu planta. Porqué en otros pisos lo estan llamando.
 3. El armario es insuficiente para una habitación de 4  cuando hay sitio suficiente para poner estanterías o una cómoda.
4. Debería haber 2 mesitas de noche.
5. No había interruptor para encender y apagar la luz desde la cama y tenías que levantarte hasta  la general a oscuras.
 5. Los enchufes no sujetan correctamente los dispositivos que están enchufados, lo que es un problema para cargar el móvil y secarse el pelo, porque alguien debe sujetarlos.
 6. Una tarde no teníamos agua caliente, y cuando mi marido fue a preguntar,  nos dijeron que en 10 minutos subían a mirar.  Después de 50 minutos esperando para ducharme, volví a bajar y me dijeron que era una avería general que  intentaban resolver, eso puede pasar, pero podrían habernos avisado para que no esperáramos.
7. No es normal tener dos toallas de baño y ninguna de manos, cuando somos 3 personas en la habitación, y que tengamos que pedirlas cada vez que nos la limpiaban. Acabamos por piner el "no molesten.  Pero es menos normal que el primer dia no nos las quisieran dar en persona en recepción 
y aunque insistimos en que no las subieran entonces porqué ya había un miembro de la familia  durmiendo,  el camarero apareció al rato con las toallas, abriendo la puerta con su llave y nosotros en la cama.  Eso fue para denunciar.

 LO ÚNICO BUENO a destacar es la comodidad de las camas y almohadas, el buen trato de los empleados de recepción y la buena situación (pero hay muchos otros por la zona)
Es la tercera vez que estamos en Nueva York y no lo recomendamos.
No tiene nevera, ni cafetera, ni desayuno, las instalaciones estan anticuadas el ruido (no exterior) es insoportable. Por este precio hay otros mucho mejores.
Y una estafa pagar mast de 300$ extra al llegar.

title: Great value hotel
text: Great location to a lot of typical tourist attractions (Times Square, Broadway, Central Park) and subway. The ice machine (and water bottle refill station) is only located on the fourth floor, but fortunately that's where our room was placed so it worked out well for us, but I imagine that may be an inconvenience for the other floors. Didn't interact with the staff too much but they were very friendly and willing to help. The room was small but suited our purposes, just be wary there is no in-suite fridge or microwave, but suited our purposes just fine. The affordability of the rooms relative to its location was the key selling point. Lobby was very nice as well.

title: Do not stay here.
text: Cancelled my booking upon arrival then when we did get a room the AC was broken - slept with the windows open for 3 days before getting a new room. Every other guest I spoke to during my 5 day stay was having problems and had also requested to move to a new room. One guests toilet was leaking and they also had to wait before getting a new room and another guest was checking in as I was checking out who also had their booking cancelled and was trying to find another hotel for the night - this was at 2am!!!

title: Basic hotel in a great location
text: So this wasn’t the most luxurious hotel I’ve ever stayed in. The lobby was beautiful but the room was very basic.  It was definitely was the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in but that was fine. The bed was comfortable. The place was clean. There was no iron but there was a steamer. No fridge or coffee maker or cups/ice bucket. There was an ice machine on the 4th floor where there were paper cups and plastic bags to get ice in. I didn’t ever find anywhere to get coffee in the hotel so I walked around the corner to Dunkin every morning. We never got a washcloth while we were there. We asked and were told they were out so we bathed with large hand towels. The location couldn’t have been better. Perfectly centrally located in midtown close to subway stops. Overall the stay was fine but would have expected a little more for the price. In the future I would likely look for somewhere I could get a little more.

title: Nightmare Check in
text: The hotel is at great location, but once we checked in,  the toilet was not flushing. They did send someone right away, then he said there's issues he'll be back.  We left, once we arrived we noticed our ac was NOT working.  We called right away they said they will send someone up, we waited again, no one showed up, then notice no towels, called housekeeping told them about towels and ac.  they did bring towels.  The hotel was kind enough to send towels and credit the facility fee.

title: Relaxation
text: My weekend stay was really cool and nice. I love the atmosphere of the lobby, clean, cool and calm. The receptionists are professionals.looking forward for a comeback. The looking is very good, easy access to all that you might need. It  was a beautiful and awesome experience.

title: Good
text: Good location right next to times square and broadway. Lobby is very dim and has billards in the middle where everybody can play. Housekeeping changed towels and emptied trash everyday. Overall a good stay.

title: The room wasn’t clean
text: No washcloths, no lotion, mold in the bathroom, dirty carpet, and no housekeeping after 3pm.  Overall I wouldn’t stay here again especially for the price per night. Perfect location. The lobby was nice!

title: Good base but no frills
text:
This is a good base to explore Manhattan, very accessible to lots of subway stations and with many landmarks and mutiple restaurants within walking distance. All of the staff were friendly and helpful at reception, concierge and housekeeping. There is an ice and cold/hot water dispenser on the 4th floor.
The rooms really are 'no frills' accommodation and not 4 star. Our family was in two "superior" double rooms at the front of the building. On balance, next time I would book a hotel a few blocks farther away from Times Square to get a better standard of room at the same price and minus the awful building site noise that starts at 7am.

title: Solo travelers, you get what you pay for
text: So...I am on a budget and for two nights I see $404, $380 and $355 in my internet search. Not bad, but I could have did better. Which one, I paid??? Times Square. I wanted to try something new, so I picked Time Squares for $380 vs my usual stay. I did regret it slightly, but mostly due to how high volumed the area was, which could have led to security problems. Luckily, there were none. The room was...single, small, but cute. I had to remind myself that this is what most Asian/Euro/South American hotels look like, anyway.  Only in America is bigger, better. Or at least my usual hotel upgrade solo me into double kings/queens and often. Spoiled much! Plenty of space, iron, safe, coffee/tea makers, robe, slippers,etc. The Paramount will give you the basic: a clean full bed, small towels, two hand towels, soap, shampoo, and conditioner (no lotion). And NY construction sites waking you up as early as 7am. Paramount could have warned us and gave us earplugs. The check in and out, so easy and cute. I didn't even have to put a card down.

title: Don't be fooled by the lobby, this hotel is not worth the money.
text: After a pleasant surprise with the lobby, our disenchantment began. The size of the room was minuscule. The two beds took up all the space, leaving no room for suitcases. The sizes of the closet and desk were ridiculous. The bathroom was tiny even for one person. The sink did not drain and one night there was no cold water. This hotel is definitely not worth the price. Better to look for other options.

title: Lovely week in NYC
text:
We have been there with my mum to visit NYC. It was a dream for her to come here and so first time. 
We loved the hotel for the comfort, and the location! Nearby Times Square pretty much enhance the full experience for both of us. 
Service was amazing, clean and the aircon was more than appreciated! It was an amazing experience! highly recommended!!

title: Very Good
text:
Everything was very good. The only thing I missed was a fridge in the room, that would have been very helpfull. 
Excellent Location, a block from time square and near all theaters.
Staff very friendly.

title: Comfort, Beauty and Modernity right next to Times Square
text: Hotel very well positioned, comfortable, cheerful, with everything very close. A wonderful place to stay with your family or on business when visiting New York. Close to Times Square. Close to everything, including the bus station, if you want to travel without renting a car to an Outlat recommended for shopping. Have fun at this hotel!

title: "Bait & Switch or Regret" Save your money,
text:
If you're up for a masterclass in "Bait and Regret," the Paramount Hotel in New York should be your next stop. 

The pictures must have gone to a luxurious spa while the actual rooms stayed home, as they look nothing alike. It's like they hired a magician to make everything seem bigger with those wide-angle lenses. And don't get me started on the carpet - it's a living testament to all the spills it has endured.

Staying in those rooms is like having a sleepover in a budget time machine that transports you straight to a hostel in the '90s. 

The only problem is, this nostalgia trip doesn't come cheap; they seem to think it's worth way more than a mere $25 a night. 

Time travel might be cool, but this price is just out of this era.

title: Perfect place to stay and see how beautiful New York is
text: I came here on my own to spend a night in New York and I couldn’t be happier after this trip. I arrived earlier and it wasn’t even a problem, you can just leave your bags in a safe place and go out to see New York at its best. Water for free and also just amazing rooms. I’ll definitely come back!

title: La peor experiencia
text:
Llegamos al hotel y tuvimos que pagar un suplemento de 40 dólares mas por día, ya que una cosa es la habitación, que ya estaba pagada, y otra cosa son los servicios del hotel, que se pagan a la llegada. Los servicios son, según explicación en recepción, el wifi, los ascensores, el gimnasio, la fuente de agua para beber, etc...
La sorpresa fué decepcionanate, pero tuvimos que pagar, ya que sino no entrábamos (palabras textuales).
Lo mejor de todo es:
-El Wifi, ni contar con el.
-Los ascensores funcionan como les da la gana, y eso si funcionan todos.
-La fuente de agua, está en la 4a. planta, y nosotros en la 7a.
-En una habitación para cuatro personas, hay un armario de 30 cm de ancho, con dos cajones.
-A las 21:30 es imposible ducharse con agua caliente.
Hasta aquí en nuestro tercer día......y aun nos quedan siete.
Felicidades a la dirección, por llevar tan bien este negocio....por favor, no llamen hotel a esta chapuza.

title: Très mauvaise expérience
text:
Un hôtel très moyen en terme de prestations 
Une chambre trop petite : impossible s’ouvrir nos valises ailleurs que sur le lit. Impossibilité d’accrocher une robe dans la penderie tellement elle était petite 
Une salle de bain pas fonctionnelle : rideau de douche qui goutte dans la salle de bain, toilettes presque dans la douche 
Du bruit toute la nuit

title: Nice hotel, great location, very simple room
text: Went to NYC for the weekend to catch a couple shows, and Paramount was in a prime location for the theatre district. The lobby had the best atmosphere of the whole hotel. The rooms were clean and nice enough, but we had brought a bottle of wine with us as well as leftovers from dinner and there were no glasses nor a fridge to store things in. I can appreciate the minimalist style, but a few more amenities would’ve been nice for a NYC hotel.

title: New York Besuch
text: Die Lage ist top. Man ist gleich am Time Square oder an der 5th Avenue. Leider musste wir nach der ersten Nacht das Zimmer wechseln. Das Zimmer war sehr laut (sehr wahrscheinlich der Generator der Gebäude Klimaanlage) und dadurch hatten wir fast kein Auge zu gemacht. Nach einer Meldung an der Reception bekamen wir rasch ein anderes. Welches ruhiger war. Die Zimmer sind leider allgemein sehr klein. Wir waren zu viert in einem Zimmer. Und da es nur einen kleinen Schrank gab mussten wir aus dem Koffer leben. Die Lobby ist sehr dunkel und könnte heller sein. Die Angestellten sind alles sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

title: 10/10 Would not recommend...
text: The hotel looks great on paper, but the reality was 20 minute waits for an elevator, inability to call the front desk from your phone, a broken tv, a soaked floor due to condensation from the AC, no source of drinking water available, easily clogged toilets, and no place to store luggage or toiletries.

title: Ok but cleanliness to improve
text: Ok but cleanliness to improve. Lobby and public areas too dark, even during the day. Gives a creepy shady look not appealing to family or women alone. Would be a lot better with just a few improvements.

title: Small rooms but the lobby made up for it!!
text: The rooms were very small with basically just a bed and a TV and a very small bathroom. The lobby, on the other hand, was wonderful. We played pool for hours each night, and the couches and chairs in the lobby were very very comfortable. The staff was wonderful. What?

title: Room needed renovation
text: Room needed renovation very old and stained carpets, bathroom old tub had chips, sink and cover falling apart, staff was not friendly or welcoming.   The bed sheets were clean and bed was comfortable.  The lobby was very low lighting it looked a lot better than the rooms.

title: Good location but run down and small rooms
text: Great location next to Times Square, but the rooms are small with only one electrical outlet that worked, and the bathroom had a metal sink with no countertop space. The lobby was dark and reminded me of a casino. There is an active construction site across the street which makes it noisy and the street crowded with construction vehicles.

title: You’re paying for location… that’s all!
text:
Don’t let the pictures fool you. While the lobby is lovely, the experience is down hill from there. The room pictures advertised were far from what we got. Our first room was very poor quality. The TV looked like it was about to fall off the wall, the windows were dirty, some very poor wall painting and the stainless steel toilets felt like a seedy train station bathroom.

Water and ice is available but just go for ice since the glaciers will melt before you get a cup of water out of the water tank.

We were moved to a second room for the rest of our stay which was an improvement but the bathroom door wouldn’t shut, the windows were still dirty and our room was situated next to an air con vent outside which ran constantly. There was also a very strong smell of weed which, while legal on New York, I don’t expect to smell it when I leave my hotel room. 

I would have complained again but i didn’t fancy that being that main focus of my holiday.

Make no mistake you are paying for location being so close to Times Square. Beyond that though this is just a place to sleep and don’t expect anymore.

title: Stay away from this.
text: There is a construction going on and they don’t tell up front. Front desk and luggage room guys are super rude. Resort fee is a hidden junk cost for this place. Overnight luggage room person collects cash for storage.

title: Perfect location!
text: My friend and I were in town overnight to see Hamilton, and this hotel was perfect. Great location, awesome vibe as soon as you walk in the door. The hotel was quiet, despite being in the heart of Times Square, and it was just perfect for our needs. We were able to check in an hour early, go explore, come back and dress for dinner, head to dinner and the show, and then walk right across the street after getting autographs by the Hamilton stage door. The next day, we were able to walk to breakfast, came back to check out, stowed our bags for only $2 apiece, and walked through Central Park to the Met. Every single employee that we interacted at this property was excellent--friendly, helpful, and efficient. I would definitely choose to stay at the Paramount Hotel again.

title: Sister Trip to NYC
text: The Paramount is a nice hotel.  It is very close to the heart of Times Square.  There was construction that hid the hotel entrance and it made it feel unsafe as two women were traveling together.  The room was small - as is any room in NYC.  The staff was very nice and always helpful.  The rooms are older and can use a little upgrading.

title: Bad night stay.
text: Stayed in room 1125 from 11/29/23-8/3/23.   Unidentifiable stains on the carpets.  The bathrooms were gross.  Rust and around sink and unidentifiable stains around bathtub.  And the bathtubs were small like I would expect in the house.  No sound insulation from construction work across the street.  Every 7am we were being woken by jack hammers.

title: Not as bad as other recent reviews but...
text:
The good...  staff was friendly.  the small room with 1 queen-sized bed was clean.  AC worked great, no mold.  plenty of natural light.  Bathroom was clean too.

The bad..  only one working outlet in the room.  There is no USB-charging as advertised.  Card readers in elevators malfunctioned a few times over the weekend.  The Resorts fee is a rip-off.  There is nothing there but a pool table in a dimly-lit reception area.

title: RATEROS
text: Pésima experiencia, el hotel tiene una gran ubicación, la pizzería que está a un lado es incluso mejor que la recomendada de Joe's pero el hotel a pesar de ser bueno aparentemente me dejó mucho que desear en atención, de mi habitación mágicamente desapareció una botella de perfume NUEVO, según ellos, nadie vio nada, nadie reporto nada, en mi cuarto nunca hubo nada, al final después de 3 días de insistir en una investigación y una respuesta NADIE dio la cara, esperaron a que diera la hr de mi salida para el aeropuerto y me pidieron 5 min más para esperar al manager que jamás apareció, me quedé sin loción y llegué a 5 minutos del abordaje de mi vuelo por estar esperando. CUIDEN SUS COSAS DENTRO DE LA HABITACION SI VAN A HOSPEDARSE CON ELLOS, NADIE DA LA CARA NO DAN RESPUESTA NI SEGUIMIENTO

title: Trip to New york
text: Nice clean hotel with very nice helpful staff great location good air conditioning it was very hot on our visit good security staff and safe in the room for your valuables that's very easy to use would recommend this hotel

title: Paramount Times Square Hotel Stay July 20 to 25, 2023
text:
Front Desk Staff were friendly, location is excellent. No bar or restaurant on site. 

One Lobby Security Guard was very rude and shouldn't be interacting with the Guests, the others seemed fine.

Numerous issues that add up to an annoying stay: Room safe didn't work, air conditioning broke down, room keys continually didn't work, no cups in room, no face cloths, slow draining sink.

Asked for the Manager to contact me, but he/she never did. I don't think I would stay again.

title: Fine, not great
text: No frills but the room was clean and the staff very friendly.  Our AC was not working properly and it never got fixed while we were there.  Unfortunately it was very hot during our stay! The location is good for my purposes in traveling to the Javits for business.

title: Decent/Could have been better
text: Location to Times Square is excellent.  Bed and air conditioner were really good.  Apart from that, everything was very mediocre.  Room was small, bathroom was tiny.  No fridge or ice bucket in the room.  Hardly any shelf space in the bathroom.  Tried to call the front desk for assistance multiple times, nobody ever answered.

title: Basic hotel
text: Just beware-very basic. People that worked here are very nice. Location is fabulous. Kinda dirty in places. Elevators weird. Hard to adjust air in room, either too hot or cold. I can't say I would stay here again. The bed was very good though,  surprisingly.

title: My First Visit to New York
text: This was my first visit to New York.  My Overall mini Vacation was great.  I was very dissatisfied of the service for request of additional towels.  I was stunned to find out this establishment doe not offer Washcloths to their Guest.  The location is Wonderful for sightseeing in Time Square.  A few adjustments for ensuring staff are fulfilling guest needs will make a stay at Paramount more enjoyable.

title: Mision Cumplida
text: Centrico y pasos de Times Square. Deben mejorar el sistema de aire acondicionado ya que la habitación donde estuvimos pernoctando por cerca de una semana no enfriaba adecuadamente y en ocaciones hacia calor.

title: Paramout Midtown
