text: Last minute flight cancelation required a last minute available hotel. Very poor lighting throughout. There were no hand towels in bathrooms and the room's carpet was filthy. Few outlets available in room.

title: Great location
text: The location is great! And quiet for being a block from Times Square. Conveniently located and close to subway.  Lobby is immaculate and trendy. Rooms felt old and needed MAJOR updating. The room was plain and zero frills or design. Carpet was old and paint needed touched up. Bathroom was very outdated.

title: Paramount hotel
text: Nice hotel in a great location in time square. Very helpful staff. Especially Nathalie. Nice rest area at reception for travellers to relax after checking out.The pool table was a great idea. Small problem was no coffee machine or body wash and shampoo in the rooms

title: Very good experience beautiful hotel stolen could have ice buckets in the room you provide owes but nowhere to put it
text: Great trip to NYC  and the hotel was a convenient location . Need ice buckets in the rooms, you provide ice but nothing to put it in and only one ice machine in the whole hotel. Valet was very helpful and provided me with the ride to the airport.

title: Stylish and affordable in Times Square
text: Paramount Hotel had a cool and hip vibe with comfortable and clean rooms.  Room size and in room amenities are bare bones, but stylish with all the basics covered.  But who really needs more than a place to sleep when out and about in NYC.  Location and cost couldn't be beat.  I would definitely book again.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square
text: We booked 3 nights on this hotel because it is located at Times Square. The room is small but that is fine, however the bed is itchy! My mom had an insect bites, they had to move us to a different room. The staffs are all rude even if you’re asking them nicely!

title: Never again!
text:
There are so many hotels in NYC why did I stay here!
Had to change rooms after a night as the allocated room was simply awful. The second room (front of hotel) was a little better but the windows were like paper. 

For the price charged for a weeks stay this simply isn’t worth the money. If your on a stag/hen weekend though it’ll probably suit!

title: Bad property do not stay there. Dirty sheets, bathroom
text:
MY PICTURES SHOW THE BED MADE THAT WAS WHEN I WALKED IN AND FIGURED OUT THE SHEETS WERE DIRTY PICTURE OF BATHROOM YOU CAN CLEARLY SEE NO TOWELS I DID NOT TAKE A PICTURE OF THE DIRTY BATHTUB I SHOULD HAVE
First off rooms are dirty, they don't have wash rags at the hotel only bath towels and hand towels. There's no amenities at all not even a candy machine. Staff doesn't give a crap whether you're there or not.   No microwave no refrigerator you're lucky to actually get a TV beds are worn out.  Had to make them come in and actually clean our rooms and use a vacuum cleaner bathtub was completely nasty made them clean it rooms are about the size of a small den not a clean place.

title: Location 5 ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️
text: Location is PERFECT! However rooms are outdated and quite basic. Staff don’t really respond to requests when things are broken (bathroom tap not working) The water cooler is on the 4th floor and wasn’t working so no drinkable water in the hotel.

title: Paramount
text: Hotel is good but location is too hectic and the hotel can certainly be more friendly to the guests by making drinking water available in the rooms along with a kettle for coffee and tea! Any modern day hotel has this as part of their room!!!! How can you make guests go to another floor to get water!!!!

title: Very close to the main points
text: Good hotel, close to Times Square and very clean. I took a trip of two days to know a piece of New York and as it was close to most of the things a really appreciated been there. Also they have the service to take care of your bags after you check out to have more time to spend at the city.

title: Close to Time Square
text: Room was okay, close to Time Square so was convenient. Lobby was nice ambience. We had a clean room, and was fine for the amount of time we spent in it.  The front desk lady was helpful and seemed to deal with difficult customers well.

title: Room Review
text: Overall, average. Rooms can be a lot of cleaner. Bathrooms can be upgraded. Air vents should be regularly cleaned. You don’t get a comfortable sleep when your room window faces the streets because there’s so much noise coming from there. Air quality is bad on the streets.

title: Stay Somewhere Else
text: I would definitely consider staying somewhere else.  While the location is great, the bedroom flooring (carpet) was stained/torn and was dirty. Bathroom was horrible  Very little room in the bathroom because of a massive sink that looks like it came out of a prison cell.  Bathroom floor was dirty.  Upon checking in, we were only given two bath towels (no hand towels or washcloth).

title: baddest hotel in new york
text: this is the baddest hotel in ny, for sure, Horrible hotel, dirty, with an incredible smell, the photos on the site don't match the real ones, rude employees. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone. thanks for your attention

title: Website is misleading
text: I normally do not leave reviews but we were so disappointed in the Paramount Hotel that I decided to complete the review. The pictures on the website are misleading. The rooms and hotel do not appear as they are on the website. In addition, there is no Paramount Cafe as shown on the website. It has been closed since Covid. The room is outdated and need several repairs. The air conditioner made a rattling noise the entire time it was on, electrical plate in bathroom was not secure on the wall, some of the outlets did not work, the picture on the television was blurry, no top sheet on the bed are just a few of the issues we dealt with. The cost per night for this hotel is overpriced for the quality you receive.The only positive for this hotel is the location to Times Square.

title: Dirty rooms
text:
Dirty rooms
Dont put clean towels 
Very small rooms 
Dirty toilets 
Staff not friendly
Dirty Bed sheets 
Dark lobby 
They dont put toilet paper 
The only good is the location 
Dirty bathroom 
They dont change the sheets

title: Not recommend
text: The room was not clean. Sink was broken and no hot water. We had one towel for four people. They did not refill any shampoo or soap. We needed to call down for this each day. Even then, they still did not bring up soap.

title: A stay at the Paramount Hotel just off Times Square on 46 th street
text: An older hotel. The lobby is quite dark so make sure you remove your sunglasses.  Your key fob is needed to work the elevator when you get on so make sure it's handy. The hotel is in an excellent location off Times Square. Remember, it's not a Marriott or Holiday Inn so the amenities are not there as they are in other big name hotels.  Good value for the buck and it's okay for a one or two night stay. Lots of restaurants and cafes close by. The hotel is in the heart of the theatre district.

title: Not worth the Money.
text: The Hotel is fine. Do not get me wrong. If you want to be just next to the TS and nothing else, its all good. Next time, we will be not as close and rather take the 20 min trip with the Metro, while having a better Hotel with a good roomsize and a bed big enough for two people.

title: Odd experience
text: Good location if you want to be very close to Times Square, but the elevators were an issue and some rooms had bathrooms you literally couldn’t use.  Never seen a toilet on an angle that a person over 5 feet couldn’t sit on before.

title: Good location,  poor quality
text:
In Manathan , good location downtown
but low quality hotel, 
small room, not very clean and fresh, without view 
noisy inside with the ventilator and outside with outside system, no restaurant neither breakfast

title: Great - reviews are mostly outdated
text:
I'm going to start this off by saying that this isn't a paid review, it's just not bad like the reviews say it is.
I booked this hotel on Priceline - 658 for a full three days, all prepaid, since I was traveling on an extreme budget. I hadn't read the reviews before I left, and it was honestly kind of worrying. Lot of 1 star reviews, people talking about hidden fees, etc. When I got to the hotel, I was greeted cordially by the staff. Not much of a line. Asked for my ID, and I was in. No 200$ security deposit. I was able to spend the next three days relaxing and hanging out with friends around New York worry-free. The staff was always cordial and friendly.
With Times Square being down the street, I expected more noise, but my room was completely quiet. Although I could hear construction in the mornings, it wasn't too much of a distraction and I was able to sleep soundly.
The rooms themselves are very small, and there are no bells or whistles - it's just one bed in one small room. Being plus-sized, this wasn't too much of an issue - the bed was big enough and was comfortable.
The bathroom, on the other hand, could stand to be bigger.
The only thing that was annoying was having to go to the fourth floor to grab water, but that's my only grievance.
Paramount Hotel is a great place to stay if you're on a budget (at least during this time of the year, being July), especially for the location.

title: Sub-par Bedrooms
text: You get what you pay for I suppose. Next time i will spend a little extra for a nicer place. Can't change how tiny the bedrooms are, but the hotel can fix the holes in the walls, throw away their sheets and get new ones since mine looked like they have been around for at least 15 years. Upgrade mattresses since they are terrible spring beds. Maybe have a few basic accessories like a mini ironing board...

title: Pleasant
text: I was discouraged reading the reviews. My experience was quite pleasant. It's location was so convenient that I could walk around to get to most places. The front desk also extended our check out time by an hour.

title: Terrible hotel
text: Had to check out early. Room and surrounding area was dirty, toilet looks like it's from a Russian prison, and the AC didn't work. No water pressure in the bathroom. Terrible experience. They only refunded 60% of my payment. Really, stay away from this place.

title: Great location, Clean room
text: As it has been said, the location is the best. Pretty much walking distance to any theater. Yes the rooms are small but that's to be expected in NYC for this price range. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was very nice and even upgraded our room to a full King. We did not come across anything broken or out of service. You may have to request more towels and bring bottled water.as there are no disposable cups in the room. We plan on staying here again.

title: Not adapted for disability
text: I use a walker, The shower in the accesability room was not accesible for me because I could not sit in it without a stool. Under one of the beds we found a pair of glasses and a travel pillow. The number of towels varied and we had to ask for more. The wifi in the gym did not work.

title: An experience
text:
So first we wanted to be in Times Square and this was walking distance. The location was absolutely great, so many places to walk to. We had our 3yo and 5yo with us. The lobby of the hotel is very dark but fancy looking, well furnished. Had no issues checking in. We did read previous reviews before booking and were apprehensive. The biggest issue that we had was the air conditioning did not work consistently. By some luck it did the first night and we all got amazing sleep. The next two nights the air went off and our room was 84 degrees. We did call and staff came to fix it promptly and were so kind. However the issue is the AC would not remain on. It kept turning off and we could not get it back on. The staff even came in and replaced the whole AC unit on our last night, so we were able to sleep — but when we woke it was off again and wouldn’t turn on. So visiting NYC in the hot summer, I’d not stay here again because I was miserably hot. Location was great though, room was nice/bathrooms pleasant, friendly staff. The only big issue was the AC not working.
Also some complained there was no water, on the 4th floor they have water / ice and cups.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE- AWFUL!!
text: As other reviewers mentioned, the photos DO NOT match what is actually at the property.  AC didn't work, it was so hot in there even after maintenance said they fixed it.  The rooms were beyond tiny for 4 people- (I have stayed in NYC many times and rooms can be small but this was ridiculous), bathroom consisted of an old shower with a too short shower curtain that was too short and leaked water all over, no bath towels (had to ask for them), a tiny metal sink and not enough pillows.  No security guard I ever saw and not the best area to be honest.  Thin old carpet and walls- it was like staying in a horrible hostel... fire alarms were beeping on an off and they made an announcement at 9am that they would be testing the fire alarm system!!! We got out of there and moved hotels and forfeited our next 2 nights!  Also VERY understaffed and there is no bar or restaurant there.  Go elsewhere!

title: I mean….it’s in time square
text: Blood on our sheets, power went out to our room and took 30 minutes to fix it while every other room had power. No wash cloths. Given two towels for three people. A housekeep came into our room while we were sleeping. Elevator buttons didn’t work half the time. And keys had to be replaced twice.

title: Tourist trap ahoy
text: On my arrival the light in the bedroom didn't switch off and the safe was broken. I immediately informed the reception personnel, which sent up the nicest handyman, who did his best to help out. He unfortunately could not solve the problems as both the switch and the safe were actually broken, but he screwed out the lightbulbs so that I could at least sleep without the lights on (!). I again informed the personnel at the reception that the problem was not really fixed (as did the handyman) but nothing was done anymore, and I did not receive an apology for the poor service nor a compensation whatsoever. I think this is a joke for a hotel that considers itself four stars and which sells a mini single room for USD 200 a night. You even have to pay extra for your luggage to be stored on departure day, which is some standard service in every hotel in the world and shows how poorly customer-oriented this one is.

title: Extra fees and minimalist rooms
text: Beware of the shakedown at the front desk, you will be charged a $70 per night "resort fee" at the front desk, the room is minimalist, no fridge, no cups, no dresser, one chair and bench.  The bed and the linen and bath are spotlessly clean and the housekeeping does a great job with what they have to work with. There is HEAVY construction that starts at 7am across the street and they were breaking stone so if a quiet stay is what you're after, it's not here.

title: Not responsible front desk employee
text: I don't like staying with family. Only good part is their location. Rooms was terrible, bathroom looks like railways toilet. Not interested for any problem of guest. Overhyped and very expensive hotel with good location only

title: Terrible stay with dirty and loud room without natural lightning
text: Terrible stay with dirty and loud room without natural lightning. We got no help from the hotel in getting another room at all. We had to leave the hotel and search for a new one. At least we got a Reagans afterwards for the first night

title: Good value and great Location
text:
Paramount Hotel is a historic building right at the heart of times square. The impressive double height lobby is spacious, modern and a nice place to convene. Rooms are adequate and the bathrooms are showing some signs of age but clean and very well mantained. 

The first single room i had was tiny and had no view but i extended my stay for another 5 nights for a better king room at a higher floor. 

I would also like to give special mention to the very nice front desk receptionist Vivian, she was very accomodating and the main reason i was convinced to extend my stay.

I'm also pleased with the 24hour gym at the second floor. Overall a pleasant stay and would definitely return. Kudos to Vivian!

title: NYC stay from upstate NY
text: Upon arrival the staff was very pleasant and pleasant for the duration of our stay. For the price and location It was great. The room was very small. We woke up every morning by 730 am to the sound of Jack hammers while that is not the hotels fault it was still annoying.

title: Great hotel
text:
Very nice hotel. Staff very friendly. Loved the open space lobby and the pool table. My bedroom was very clean and the housekeeper was attentive and very kind offering me more towels.
The hotel is located in the center of theaters and one block off the action on 7th ave.  I highly recommend the hotel.

title: Never staying there again
text:
Paid top dollar for terrible service and old style bathrooms. 
Bathrooms look like from the ancient times. Broken sinks in the bathroom, they have no first aid at the hotel. As simple as bandaid. 
The air-conditioners are so old, they make so much noise, and shuts down in the middle of the night causing a loud sound. Also, the air-conditioning starts leaking on the dirty carpets randomly

title: Terrible
text: Waited in a 20 minute line to check in. Room was 78° when we walked in due to broken ac. Went down to front desk to ask for new room and they refused to switch us or even offer a discount. Someone eventually came to fix it 30 min later. There were some suspicious stains on the carpet. Bathroom looked like it belongs in a hospital. Baby crying in the room next door through a thin wall. Woke up at 7am due to extremely loud construction 11 floors below, with single pane glass that barely sealed properly.

title: HORRIBLE
text: HORRIBLE FROM START OVER CHARGED ! The room size was small as a box the bathroom was horrible! chipped paint old nasty shower curtain! looked like a project bathroom So disappointing , my husband birthday was a disappointment because of our stay at this hotel

title: The smallest rooms in NYC!!!!
text: Go somewhere else! The rooms are so tiny you can barely walk around your bed. They are also dirty, the elevators don’t work and we had a window unit for AC which allowed all the noise of the construction to come in starting at 6:00. This hotel isn’t worth the money. Sometimes you get what you pay for. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location,

title: Decent Stay for a Cheap Price, Needs Cleaning
text: The hotel itself is nice. Beautiful lobby and atmosphere. The room was okay, looked decent but not extremely clean. Nice tv and desk. Bathroom was the biggest issue with the toilet and tub not being the cleanest. Also looks like an elementary school bathroom! Also no wash cloths. But for the price, it was a good stay, a safe place to sleep and a great location.

title: Visit New York
text: I’ll get the king room next time. Queen room was tight. Didn’t spend much time in the room. A/C worked great. Times Square was within 2 minutes. Plenty of good restaurants close by. Great pizza was next door.

title: Location… location…location
text: The hotel is great location. The people at the front desk could be more friendly. The beds are very comfortable but the pillows were not. House keeping is an area that needs improvement. Towels and toilet paper were needed several times. The carpets were very dirty. The lobby was great looking. If this is your first time in New York, the location is great!

title: Assolutamente daa evitare (non fatevi ingannare dal prezzo)!
Terrible Stay
text: Do not stay here!!!  Nothing like the photos!  I was completely disappointed in the room, the staff and the cleanliness!  We had a window unit in our room and the noise was outrageous!  The room was subpar at best!

title: Stay at Paramount
text:
Average customer service here, feels like a no frills offering. Given excellent location within walking distance of Times Square, they have a lot of upside potential, if they wish to. 
Rooms very basic and cramped

title: Bad experience and nobody take responsibility
text:
Bad service and shorts on: supplies and towels and space
We stayed for 5 days and every day we had to ask for towels and supplies and some days almost got even half of we need
I great location but I don't recumbent this Hotel

title: Not worth it
text: A good hotel, cool lobby, but for the rate they offer, it's not worth the money. The room was quite small, our air conditioner hardly kept the room cool since the windows leak a lot of heat and noise, and the amenities provided are not especially good. Bring your own shampoo, they provide tiny bottles of 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner and only a bottle of body soap, which isn't exactly the ideal for washing hands in the bathroom.

title: Great price for location!
text: The location was right in Times Square. My room was clean & I had ac! That’s all I wanted! It would have been nice to have a microwave in the closet or refrigerator. It would have been nice to get a wash cloth or two but again I’m overall happy with my stay.

title: Less than impressed
text: This hotel gets an overall rating of 1 because of the bad service.  The location and rooms were fine but the staff didn’t do their job.  There were 4 people in our room and each day they would leave 1 or 2 towels for us to use and we would have to request more.  I would go to the front desk and they wouldn’t give me any because that is a “different department”.  One night they delivered them after midnight when we were already asleep.  Another time they delivered them the next day but early while we were still in bed.  On our last night we had 1 towel.  After two visits to the front desk and 2 phone calls to housekeeping, no towels were ever sent to our room.  All four of us had to use the same one.  With such a high price tag on our stay, that is unacceptable!  Very disappointed in their service.

title: Everything is old and broken
text:
Hotel uses hidden fee paid at the property to pretend to cost less when comparing against others.
Elevators are all broken. Not enough staff to support all the guests. AC works whenever it wants. Toilet is blocked by the heater, you can't sit on it. Towels are randomly replaced.  Furnitures look old.

title: Works only for sleep
text: If you want only for sleep, it is ok. If you want have breakfast, it is not the option, because the hotel does not have any kind of restaurant.  The bathroom is complicated because it is lack of fornitures to put your things, like toothbrush, cosmetic bags, deodorant or personal items.

title: Overpriced with unhelpful staffs
text: Would have been better if they have front desk or customer service staff who can accept calls. The common area was like a batman cave, dark and boring.  Rooms dont have usb ports. Tv does not have streaming apps.

title: My yearly couple stay - disappointed!
text:
Unfortunately bedroom was not as displayed. 
Half of the room rug was wet due to a leaking air conditioner, misty smell in the room, sheets smelled like that had been used. Only one towel and had to go down and get another one. 

Only satisfaction was a high floor room which help with some of the noice from an outside construction.

title: Decent place near Times Square
text: Room size can be small so read the details. Absolutely NO extras here but location is ideal. Make plans for ride drop offs to be a block away because getting close to Times Square is tough (avoid extra charges by walking). Staff is super attentive/responsive.

title: Had to leave the hotel for everything. Absolute minimum provided for stay.
text: We booked through the chase travel site. Hotel was advertised as having an on-site bar/restaurant (this is not the case). I was also told by staff there is no access to ice/water, no vending machines. No microwave/mini fridge/coffee pot in the room; also no community station offering coffee/ water/ or a microwave. Only one towel in the bathroom with no wash cloths. When I called and asked for more they brought me one washcloth. I guess they wanted the two of us to share it. Toilet had no pressure to flush; wouldn't even flush pee/ toilet paper. Had to find a public bathroom elsewhere to have a bowel movement. Found out our last night that there is one ice machine in level 4 (which staff had directly started did not exist when I had asked for one). I do not mind staying at a hotel like this had I not been mislead when booking into thinking these amenities were available. I was just entirely disappointed that I had picked a hotel solely on the restaurant it offered only to find out when I got there that it didn't even have one. Also I placed a do not disturb sign on my door after being woken up the first morning by cleaning service, so instead of knocking the next morning she called and woke me up to ask if I needed my room cleaned. I was on vacation and rarely get to sleep in. I told her no and asked that she not wake me up the next day but she called again the next morning prior to 9A.

title: Not sure why a hotel with such promise falls so flat
text:
From entering the very dark lobby, to having no help parking except to be told to go to a garage a couple blocks over, the place had going for it only the fact that it's across the street from the Richard Rodgers theater, as we were there to see Hamilton.

The room had a small window air conditioner held in by plexiglass, which, even on the 12th floor let in every noise from outside. The shower drain couldn't keep up with the water coming in, flooding the bathroom floor. One towel for two people. No drawers but a couple in a closet that couldn't open beyond a couple inches before banging into the wall. One hard plastic chair. Lights, with no switches. Switch for one light that needed to be hit with a hammer to work. Just a weird place.

title: WHAT A DISSAPPOINTMENT
text: We chose The Paramount because an colleague used to work at The Rockwell group and their designs are interesting and very 90s. I am a designer myself and loved the idea of staying here. But beyond the very well designed lobby, there is virtually NOTHING this hotel can show for. The staff is slow and very limited. The room was boring, tiny, and the bathroom leaked; the toilet was installed very low, the doors were old and were old and torn form the edges. The tub had no preassure and the temperature kept changing. We were asked to choose between a room with no view on the lower levels or a room exposed to noise form 6am because there was construction going on outside. We went with the no view, ofcourse. Then there is that ridiculous fee, the "facilities fee" you pay per day for water and wifi (which is said to be included in every room on the website); but I would have rather purchase extra data from my european mobile carrier , as it would have been cheaper, because that fee is 40dlls per day. For the same price, you can stay at the Four Points Marriot or the Hilton Garden-and you stay away from the Times Square area, which has become a dump, filled with weed, trash, homless people, and a horroble stinch that stays in your clothes and hair. Horrible experience, avoid the Paramount if you don't want a dissappoinment.

title: Do not book here if you can
text: The bed is small, room smells stale, cracks all over furniture, the bathroom tub dirty, and paint on the toilet. The room is the size of a closet. Wish I took several pictures but I was so appalled…..

title: Great location!!!!
text: Stayed here on 46th street to go to show on 54th street...and to walk to see sights the next day!! Perfect location for shows and everything near Times Square!!! Enjoyed every moment if it!!! Definitely recommend highly!!!Room was small...but served it purpose ...clean and comfortable and good price considering the amazing location!!!

title: Precious big Paramount fan, this time, not so much.
text: My precious trips to the Paramount were all amazing. Beautiful hotel, swanky atmosphere, cool NYC feel. This time the hotel seemed tired and plain. The decor was lacking or worn, no longer has a cafe onsite, the overall feel was more basic than posh. Our room was loud (ac unit) & the bathroom needed updating. It might be time for me to find another hotel in NYC to call “home” when I travel there.

title: Okay for one night
text: The atmosphere in the hotel is great but the rooms are really small and there were destroyed spots on the wall. All in all the room was really small and there was not enough space for storage. Although the description said we would have breakfast, they did not offer any. The hotel is definitely not worth the money you spend.

title: Run from this hotel much better hotels in the area at same price
text:
Pleasure Broadway shows 
Sorry excuse for a 4 star hotel as advertised 
The only thing good is the location.
Just want a clean room did not care about the view
Have stayed in the area many times at least 4 times a year to see Broadway shows

title: Perfect hotel with a catch
text: Paramount has it all...location, friendly staff, great prices  cool lobby. that's all great but there is a catch,  you'll have to invest up to 1 or 2 hours to check in.  I see people checking in and half the guest take 7 or 8 minutes with the clerk having to disappear half that time to go back to the back. They have an online check in system that does nothing. they need a real on line check in and they will be the perfect hotel in times square... until then you spend your whole stay in New York with a sour taste of having to spend 90 minutes to check in.

title: Worst place ever
text: Staff lied about everything, rooms were filthy, mechanical failure in rooms (no AC, leaky plumbing, clogged drains). Public areas were extremely dark. Only redeeming quality was location.  Great proximity to theaters

title: Dirty rooms and xenophobic front desk employee
text: I had the unfortunate luck of booking this hotel by trusting the Agoda website and the Hotel rating of 4 stars. The minute we walked into the hotel we were mistreated.  I got to the front desk with my mother and the employee Vivian was the rudest and most xenophobic person ever, my mother has 52 years old and is a Brazilian immigrant, and English is not her first language. My mother would speak to her and she would acknowledge my mother and would only answer me, when was my mother that made the question and was paying for the hotel. She charged us at the front desk and when we asked about the charge she refused to explain it to us. She gave us the iPad to make the payment and rudely took it out of my hands to make a change and again she wouldn't explain the charges. We went up to the room already feeling super bad, and once we got there the room was disgusting for a 4-star hotel. We paid the hotel fee in full amount before arriving. The ac was not working, the windows were dirty, and there was pubic hair on the sink, the room smelled like mold, and the wall paint was all scratched  (see pictures attached). We were advised by the Agoda team to leave the hotel immediately. Overall one of the worst experiences I ever had in a 4-star hotel in NYC and we come to this destination very frequently.

title: Good location, but room was lacking
text: Minimalistic is generous. No ice bucket, glasses or cups of any kind in bedroom or bathroom, no washcloths, tiny table to set items on. Great location and price, but don’t base your expectations of rooms based on photo of lobby on website. They also note that this is a quiet location. Construction across the street starts at 7:00, so ask for a room not facing 46th St.

title: Terrible Stay, Awful Wifi, Gross Rooms.
text: Would never stay here again. Terrible Rooms. Terrible Wifi. Embarassing. The lobby is nicely remodeled and the rooms are smelly, with stains. Why would you spend so much on the lobby to house guests in a prison cell?

title: Nice Staff, Great Location, AWFUL Accomodations
text: When we arrived we were impressed by lobby. It ended there. It was 11:30p NYC time and for us, 5:30a as we had come from Europe. The elevators were a mess when trying to use key to go to room. Next, we got off and were smacked in the face with the smell of strong marijuana. We got to our room and it is smoldering hot. I went down and asked for help and I was told Maitenance would come. Nobody did. We called two more times and were told it would be marked urgent and someone would be there. After two hours of waiting and it being 2a I gave up and tried to sleep very uncomfortably. By this time, the marijuana smell had also made it under our door and I had to pull my shirt over my head to sleep on top of it being 78 degrees in the room. By 5:46a, construction started right outside our window. It did not stop. My daughter went down and again asked for help with the air and discussed the construction with an audio outside our room. She was told someone would be coming up and we could check out at 2p. Nobody came and the construction did not subside. She went down again and this time  we were told we could check out at noon and they would see what they could do about a partial refund with Expedia. After the supervisor from Maitenance came, he was upset nobody came all the other times and in fact, our air was broken. He talked to them and they offered for us to check out at 2p and try to get us 50% off of the room. On top of those issues, there was a small amount of blood on the sheet and a dead bug smashed on shower wall. With the heat in the room and the construction, we had zero sleep and it caused a great deal of stress. We should get a full refund as that was the most miserable stay I have ever had. We left more tired and stressed out than relaxed and well rested. Finally, we had a late flight and needed to store our bags. It was $2 a bag (including souvenir bags) for them to put your bags in a room. We tried to explore NYC but were too exhausted to do so. The hotel ruined our stay in NYC. The staff, was very kind and I do not want to take that away from them. Location is great but do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else! Lobby is impressive, rooms are old and run down.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square
text: We have stayed at the Paramount several times as we like the vibe, service, price, and especially the location. While our stay was generally positive, the cooling unit in our room was not functioning properly even after we requested it be fixed. As a result, the room temperature at night was uncomfortably warm in the upper 70s.

title: Substance abuse counselor
text: Amazing atmosphere. Beautiful place to be right next to the center of it all. The best thing about the hotel was the tantalizing smell as soon as you walk through the door. The decor of the hotel is very retro and relaxing

title: Jail Cell
text: the lobby was dark as if they had something to hide.  I would not recommend staying a room the size of a small jail cell, but that is what they gave me for the two nights I was there.  The room was dated with a clear plastic desk with a dated chair from the 60's.

title: Great location, friendly staff, and clean rooms!
text: Check in was a little hectic with most people sitting in the lobby waiting till 4pm to check in. But can check in your bag with the bellman while you wait which was nice. After check in thought it was a breeze. Clean rooms with attentive staff that came to clean them daily and provide new toiletries. Great location near Times Square and all the Broadway theaters!

title: Paramount Times Square
text: Customer service staff were very rude and unprofessional but cleaning staff couldn’t have been nicer and in my opinion should switch rolls. The rooms were so out dated and cost was ridiculous to be treated like we were. The location was great and it’s very unlikely that I’ll stay at this hotel again. I’m going

title: Good but NOT Great
text: I chose this hotel primarily because of location in Hell's KItchen. I have been a customer on several occasions over the past ten or more years. The price eas also an attraction. I am more inclined to rate my experience because it was of "value" If I had been forced to pay the higher rate advertised I would have been less approving. The hotel seems well maintained inspite of its age. THere was considerable trouble with the elevator operation. The key cards do not always trigger the ability to select room floor. I was in the elevator for several minutes and several trips up and down before I could get it to stop on floor 11. Several other guests exoressed similar frustrations.

title: Worst stay in NYC
text:
Been to 4 hotels in NYC and this one is the worst. The only good thing is the lobby area and the location. Initially had to pay 40 USD for amenities, when I asked what it includes, they said ‘Gym… water….’ Did not even want to use the gym, and water should be free.

Room is small, loud and terrible. There was mould on the shower curtains, on the sink, and the air conditioning was loud. Terrible sleep. Room was dim and small. The wardrobe was dirty. Carpet was dirty. Windows were so stained with dust we could not see outside.

It also costs $2 per bag for storage after checkout. I’ve never been to a hotel which charges for this.

I will not come back here again.

title: Super fun!
text: An impromptu trip to NYC and we used points for a the Paramount! It was a perfect location and so fun to be in the thick of all the action! Lineups at the front desk were inconvenient and free coffee in the lobby would have been nice but it’s so funky and the staff so pleasant that it was not a deal breaker.

title: THE WORST HOTEL
text: The pictures don't true, the room was nasty, smell bad, too small the room and the bathroom. Don't believe. The a/c was so noise. the view was the worst. My room was deluxe, but it seemed the basement.

title: The worst hotel you could imagine. Keep away.
text:
The only reason I chose this hotel was it's location. Apart from this, there is just absolutely nothing which I can say positive about this place.

Check in time is 4pm and check out is at 11am. If you have a late evening flight to board, they have a place where you can temporarily keep your baggage. But they charge USD2/bag which you have to pay only by cash.

The room itself can be described as a big rat-hole. I lost count of the number of times I accidentally got hit by the wall mounted TV because the space between the bed and the wall is just enough for one person to walk sideways. 
No breakfast is served here and there is no coffee maker or kettle in the room. For the price they charge, it is pathetic. This is a basic thing which even 2 star hotels have. There is only one person at the front desk on any of the staff. And they are supposed to run a hospitality business. Good Heavens!

The only saving grace is that the rooms are clean.

Oh by the way, the guy who keeps the baggage would ask if you would need transportation to the airport. Don't fall into this trap and don't accept it. It is a total rip off. Uber and Lyft are easily available.

Keep off this place. I wouldn't touch it with a barge pole again.

title: Worst hotel I've ever been. Get out of there if you can. It's like sleeping inside a drilling machine
text: We were up all night because of the noise. At 7 am the drilling machine started and it feels like being inside a construction site. The bed are small and everything is dirty. The worst hotel I've ever been

title: Worst youth hostel ever.
text: I’ve seen hostels with better amenities and better rooms than this hotel.  The rooms are actually the size of 2 king sized mattresses placed side by side, I measured my room.  Blank white walls, no hot water, little water pressure, and they charge a $40 daily resort fee. Save your money and your time and stay at the YMCA, at least they have water pressure.

title: One of my worst experiences ever
text:
I understand it’s Manhattan and the rooms are small, but the elevator doesn’t work, the wifi doesn’t work… not to mention I could at least expect a bottle or water in my room? 
What am I paying for then? 
Please don’t ever ever ever think of staying here. Seriously. Don’t. Thinking again? Don’t!!!! I would hate to say I told you so!

title: worst hotel ever
text:
smallest room I have ever been in.  Staff was unfriendly.  Bathroom looked like it belonged in a prison.
Musty smell througout hotel.  Safe did not work, sink did not drain, electrical sockets were loose and plugs kept falling out.  Elevators were an adventure.  Would never stay there again  Great location.

title: Not great stay. No wash cloths, no hand soap, had to ask for more towels repeatedly, no place to put my luggage
text: Not great stay. No wash cloths, no hand soap, had to ask for more towels repeatedly, no place to put my luggage, no bathroom counter space, disorganized, creepy lobby very dark, loud elevators & very touristy area

title: Terrible room, smelled bad, small, loud noises
text: Awful experience, will never stay here again. It was the size of a shoebox. Floor was filthy and stained. All night you could hear a loud noise which was some kind of mechanical device nearby. It was the building and not street noise.

title: The lights
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The location is good enough, it is close to a lot of attactions and restaurants but that also meant that it can be noisy. For me, it is tolerable as I can only hear the loud vehicles and not like the noise of the crowd or the other room.

The only flaw for the hotel is how badly lit functional areas are such as the elevators and the hallways. I know that it is dimly lit to create a certain vibe but I think they should consider those areas. And I think it would be helpful if they orient guests on how the elevators work as again, the instruction/signage are not that visible once you go in.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE. DO NOT BOOK A TAXI.
text: Awful. Dirty, poor reception. Excess surcharge on arrival of $160 for no reason. Rooms and hotel are dirty. No tea or coffee facilities, no bar, no cafe, nowhere to get breakfast. The hotel charge $2 per case to keep them for you when you check out (28 years of travel and no hotel has ever charged me) they offer to book a taxi for you - you agree a price and they give you a receipt - when you get to the airport they refuse to let you out of the taxi and charge you $20 extra.  A TOTAL SCAM - BEWARE. If I could give it no stars o would. A dreadful place. Only good thing - bedding and towels were clean. Do not stay here.

title: Great location, frequent deals make rooms affordable
text: I've stayed here a few times already, they have great deals offered frequently that make it easy to spend the night and start rested when you have late meetings and you're from just over the bridge. Nice ambience and great location.

title: Paramount Needs to Improve for Business Clientele
text: Wifi not good for zoom calls.  Lobby is very dark with no quiet spaces for workers.  Loud banging music all day long in the lobby and the upstairs spaces.  Decent facility for quick overnight at a low cost in a good location for Times Square.  Not made for romantic nights because air conditioners are old and loud.  (All of the above is based on two separate visits).  In my upgraded room, no counter space for curling iron near outlet.  Curling iron rests on floor to stay connected to outlet.

title: Great location and lobby, terrible room
text:
Liked the location, lobby and reception staff. 
The AC in the room and the hair dryer we way too aged. 
The noise of the AC forced me to turn it off.
Small room, not very comfortable bed.
Could not find any towel when I went back to my room after it was cleaned.

title: Our 4 night stay in NYC
text: Our time staying here was awesome! It was very central to everything and right next to Times Square, so it was easy to travel downtown or uptown as needed. The lighting was dark and a little too moody but that wasn't really a huge deal. The housekeepers were really nice too! It is a small room, but that's to be expected in NYC.

title: Wouldn’t stay here again.
text: The room safe didn’t work.  There isn’t a mini fridge.  The carpets were dirty.  The bathroom doesn’t have any air circulation, ac or ventilation.  The water pressure is terrible and the water doesn’t get very warm.  The beds were actually quite comfortable. The service was friendly and efficient.  Overall, they need to update the rooms!

title: Great stay
text: Good location value for money as I got a very good deal staff are very friendly & cooperative room services were great just missed the deal of breakfast as it was included in trip it was put me more complete

title: Ok
text: Well we chose to stay at Times Square so can't really fault the hotel. Wouldn't recommend staying at the area unless u have broadway as the main thing on agenda. Rooms small, basic, no service, staff opened the door while I was in the room. Lobby very dark and absolutely no service.

title: Not worth the price
text: There are plenty of places to stay in the area and I would look elsewhere.  The room was spacious, but that's about it.  The room was extremely basic... nothing boutique about this hotel except the lobby.  Very limited in everything.... getting extra towels from the room attendants was a chore to say the least.

title: Would definitely book again!
text: The location was incredible!!  Two blocks from 2nd Stage Theater and one block from Times Square shopping!  The employees were SO nice, and never made me feel like my questions were stupid...I mean, I'm a small-towner traveling to the big city...I feel plenty stupid!  Thank you, Paramount Hotel Times Square!

title: Bien ubicado reo pocos servicios
text:
Buena ubicación pero para la conserjería tenes que hacer cola, en la habitación siempre falta algo (toallas, jabón, etc) que tenes que reclamar.
No hay restaurante ni posibilidad de desayunar en el hotel. Si viajo a Nueva York nuevamente no creo que lo elija nuevamente

title: STAY. AWAY.
text: No hot water in shower, which we discovered at 4am on the morning of our departure after a one night stay.  Hotel offered us to change rooms, but really, at 4am?  The room was clean. and the check-in went fine.  The lobby is dark, like other reviewers say, and it's kinda weirdly decorated, but it's NYC, man, just go with it.  I reached out to the hotel for at least some compensation for no hot water and received only "we're sorry we disappointed you."  LOL - stay away from this place!

title: Best location- low quality room interior and bathroom
text: Use restroom in lobby area instead and try to spend more time outside. Romm doesn't have slippers, too small, very old repainted interior, clogged handwashed and there is no any air vantilation inside bathroom.

title: Great Location, Nice Lobby, Poor Amenities
text:
We chose this hotel due to location and cost.  Both of these criteria were positive in nature, the location was the heart of Times Square/Theaters and the cost was just under what the big name hotels wanted to charge.  A positive thing to note is that our room was cleaned every day without requesting it, I have not experienced that since before COVID and it was a pleasant surprise.  

We believed we knew what we were getting into stay there such as small rooms, no coffee, no breakfast, but there was more.  I have no problem with resort fees being charged, but their resort criteria was one pool table and a gym.  When I asked what else there was I was told hot and cold running water - I would have thought that would be part of the room rate.    When we got settled, we noticed there were no face/washcloths or cups for the bathroom so we went to the front desk and were advised they do not provide them and were referred to a local drugstore.  I have stayed in Times Square plenty of times and all of the hotels provided these things.  

Overall, I would give this hotel a rating of 3 out of 5.  It was acceptable and if I had minimal choices I would stay there again, but there are better values even if you opt to spend just a couple dollars more for a better experience.

title: Great for sightseeing
text: All staff were so nice and friendly. Room was clean and organized well even it is little bit tiny. It was little bit noisy during night since the hotel is located in very close to Times Square, but it is not avoidable and is not their fault. Great access to any public transportation.

title: Quiet and sleep happens somewhere else
text:
If you don't plan on sleeping .
The AC in the room was so loud it was impossible to sleep, but it did drown out the noise of the city outside from the windows that also didnt block and noise 

The bed was actually good, and the pillows were nice (pretty much the only good thing)
This is mostly based on the high price per night for the room, I expected more, the room was tiny
They also had a bunch of booking charges. I booked via travel agent but had to pay on site so extra 10% or so cost of the booking wasn't great

title: Clean hotel in Times Square
text: Good location to see shows and was very clean.  Standard amenities such as a trash can in the bathroom and drinking cups were lacking.  Construction across the road and noise from Times Square was constant.  If you go, bring washcloths and ear plugs.  O’Casey’s across the street was a great reasonably priced breakfast.

title: Centrally Located but Serene
text: Located in the heart of New York, I found this to be close to everything and right near the theater district, but also found the hotel to be quiet and comfortable. Gabrielle at the front desk was extremely helpful as was everyone I interacted with at the hotel. Will return next time in New York.

title: Don’t Stay at the Paramount
text: DON’T STAY HERE: This place is a filthy dump with the world’s smallest rooms. My carpeting was dirty. So was the bathtub. One morning, they claimed to have shut off the hot water so I had to walk around NYC all sweaty and gross for critical business meetings!

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square - Great Experience
text: The Paramount was great! Great location, customer service, clean and over all a wonderful hotel with great staff. Hamilton is located right across the street. Bond 45 Restaurant is beside the Paramount with great food.

title: Vacations
text: Highly recommend the paramount hotel. A centric hotel that have everything so close that you don't need a car, taxi or an uber. A lot of places to have dinner near by. My wife and I enjoy our trip and we recommend this place for anyone that wants to stay in time square.

title: Terrible hotel
text: Terrible hotel! The interior lobby is not cozy as it seems to appear in the advertising. It is dim and dark with minimal lighting. Only one person at the check-in desk, causing long lines. Our room had no luggage stand and the bathroom was postage-stamp sized. The base of the tub/shower was peeling and there were no safety bars, which would have been helpful since the wet tub surface was slippery. It’s the only hotel I’ve ever been to that did not provide wash cloths for their guests; when we requested them, we were told they only had hand towels! The Richard Rogers Theater was across the street from our room but the windows were so filthy it was hard to see it. I’ve stayed at much nicer hotels for substantially less money. Will never book a room here again.

title: Unbeatable experience!!
text:
I’ve been staying at Paramount every time I go to NYC since they re-opened post COVID-19. Every time the experience just got better and better. For sure this is not a brand new building leading to what some reviewers complain about the “mediocre” interior design and amenities. I’d like to acknowledge that this where their management team shines: AJ, Nat and many many others always get to your needs once they get your calls. Room switching is available should vacancies exist. 

Some review up here suggests that their website mentions there is dining and laundry on site which is not true. Paramount has clearly stated on their website that they do not have such services on site, but staff members are more than happy to give local recommendations. This is where their location shines because it’s next to TSQ which takes you to almost anywhere with just a few minutes of walking or a subway ride. Either high-class restaurants or popular diners of any cuisines you could think of are in the neighborhood. Laundromats are close as well.

The fact Paramount may not provide as many services have reflected on their rates. Compared with at least 10+ nearby hotels, Paramount charges the most reasonable rate. The added values of its location and amazing staff should make up for what Paramount lack compared with others. I don’t think you can find any place like this anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Clean rooms, on the small side, but responsive staff
text: AC kept going out and had to repeatedly had to call to have the breaker switched for it to work.  However, the front desk promptly had the engineering staff come to flip the breaker in a reasonable amount of time. No wash cloths provided in the small bathroom.  Reasonably comfortable bed for the price paid.  Don't bother asking the concierge for assistance on local area recommendations. She wasn't very helpful or familiar with local places to eat.

title: If I could give it no stars I would
text: Because of the all night party in the room next door, screaming people and children in the hallways - I got NO SLEEP and I was ONLY there to sleep as it was a business trip. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone again.

title: new york in may
text:
au milieu des théâtres et a la lisière de Times Square, quartier central pour les musées, le metro et hudson wharf 
les personnes sensibles au bruit de la rue doivent s'abstenir, comme celles dormant dans le noir 
IL

title: The Snazzy Paramount Hotel
text: This little gem is perfectly located, a boutique style hotel in the heart of Time Square. It's still as chic as it used to be since Philippe Starck redesigned it in 1986. The most chill, dimly lit, coolly tempered, unique lobby ever!

title: Bien placé
text: Hôtel très bien placé car à 50m de Times squares, métro, restos tout est à proximité. Bonne literie, le hall de l’hôtel est sympa même si trop tamisé. En revanche pour le prix payé cela ne vaut pas un hôtel 4*. Aucune insonorisation on attends le voisin d’à côté ronfler! Pas de petit déjeuner proposé le matin et chambre plutôt vieillotte, la baignoire part en friche au niveau de la peinture… service d’étage compétent car chambre faite chaque jour. On recommande tout de même pour la localisation.

title: Nice on the outside. Mid on the inside
text: The room was so tiny it could not comfortably fit me and my partner. The room was so basic and not what I was expecting at all. No fridge no microwave a closet that fit one jacket. No dresser. No desk. A tiny clear plastic table that was 10 inches wide and 2 feet long. I understand nyc is crowded and ever bit of space gets used but this room was so small it was uncomfortable and I regretted it the moment I checked in. Our room had a wi Dow that looked directly into another hotel guests room it was so odd and very disappointing. The bathroom was so small u could not open or close door while on toilet and you had to sit sideways on toilet because of the radiator. The lobby is chic and gives the vibe the hotel will be nice but really it is worn and old. The lighting in the hotel is so dark that it is disorienting. I believe they do this to hide the west and tear off things. Overall I give the hotel a 2 out of 5.

title: Don’t waste your time
text: The website is false advertisement. No restaurant, no lounge, no wash cloths. Bathroom was so small we couldn’t even sit normal on the toilet. Bathtub is old and stained, AC had ongoing issues. Videos will be on YouTube Soon!

title: Very good and quite
text:
It was a trip to see some friends and recognize New York after 10 years.  
Was very wonderful and your hotel is very near from the place I wanted to visit. 
Good room. Just only I think the lobby is too dark for my taste.  Ans the taxi you call for my return to JFK airport, block my credit card.

title: Chic not
text: Supposedly a chic hotel it was beyond disappointing.  Not even a refrigerator in the room. The front desk and concierge service were very accommodating, but all in all it didn't measure up to it's reputation.

title: OK
text:
OKJuan,

We miss you already!

You may be home by now – but we haven’t forgotten you.

As you unpack, look over your photos and reminisce about your trip, we’d love it if you would let us know what you enjoyed most about your stay.

Click here to take our quick survey

title: mai piu' in questo hotel
text: e' la seconda volta che vado a new york e ho scelto questo hotel a pochi passi da times square,un'ambiente un po' tetro e con personale poco gentile,avevo sentito di fantomatiche fatture fatte ai clienti e alla fine per fortuna bloccando la mia carta di credito,mi trovavo dei tentativi di prelievo.Si vede che tutto il mondo e' paese

title: This is a two star hotel!
text: Only one check-in desk that is used.  The other counter is used to sell broadway tickets.  Hot water in the room runs out every night (possibly even starting in the afternoon).  No coffee machine or refrigerator in the room.  I was told the staff will supply towels etc. upon request, but there will be no everyday cleaning.  No restaurant on premises, and no breakfast available.  Baggage hold fee is $2 per bag, but they DONT ACCEPT A CREDIT CARD!  The ATM machine charged $4.50 fee for a $20 withdrawal, and my bank charged me additional $3.  Therefore $7.50 charge for a $20 withdrawal to pay $2 to hold a bag for a few hours.  The hotel looks nice and the staff were nice.  But how did this two-star hotel got their FOUR STARS?  A big mystery!

title: Functional but a little depressing
text: If you are going to NYC and have no other option, go for it. The room is depressingly small and the staff is pretty rude. I had to wait in line for more than 45 mins to be able to check in. And they charge more than you expect from your Airbnb booking. $40 per night and a $200 deposit.

title: Not the best
text: This is meant to be a four star hotel however lacked basics facilities. The room are tiny, no shower gel or toiletries, no kettle, tea bags. four nights cost me 1200 dollars. The hotel has no bar, however as bar next door which you cannot bring your drinks into the hotel.

title: Traumatic, do not even look at this place.  RUN
text: The 1st room we were offered was filthy, the lock was broken and someone had been on the beds. The 2nd  had drug needle and pot in the bin, the bath was broken,there were drinks left in the room and even the night manageress said it was disgraceful.  We were told it served breakfast, it does not. The place stunk of drugs and even though we had been up for 24 hours, none of our group wanted to stay there. We ended up maxing a credit card out to stay somewhere else. Do  not stay here.

title: DISAPPOINTMENT
text:
The price of a four stars but not at all the standards of service in the bedroom required for a four stars.
Carpet dirty, very old and tiny bathroom non convenient, no kettle, no bedsides...and the permanent sound of the air-conditioning units near the window.

title: High Price for Tiny Room
text: Room was TOO small.  Had to walk sideways to get from one side of room to the other or just cross over bed to get to other side.  There was no place to set suitcase for easy access; had to keep it in a corner upright to not bump into it.  There was no desk to accommodate laptop.

title: the bedroom was pathetic
text: there were flies all over the room and stains all over the walls and floors - the lobby is stunning and the vibe change from the lobby to the rooms is absolutely shocking… will be recommending that my friends stay anywhere else in nyc

title: Perfect location. Needs a little tweaking.
text: The location was perfect,  the entrance beautiful, the staff very helpful and friendly. The carpets need replaced in halls and rooms, add a coffee pot and an outdoor sitting area for guests maybe add a rooftop area. No food or drinks on location for purchase and NO PARKING!  That cost us $70 a DAY down the street!

title: Paramount stay
text: At least we had a clean bed to sleep in. They could at least clean the carpets and elevators in the hotel. Could also do something about the noise control on the streets from local bars that you can gear in your room.

title: Love this Hotel. Will be back!
text: Although not the biggest room, it’s absolutely adorable with plenty of room around the king size bed. I loved the tub, it was so deep, I took 3 baths in my two day stay. Staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: Prefect location to the plays and Times Square. Aside from the expected city noise, hearing extremely loud music from stadium speakers at the Irish bar across the street was not enjoyable until 4AM when it stopped.

title: it's a good stay in a marvelous location
text:
The location is great and the bed is comfortable, unfortunately, my room did not have proper privacy. Hearing every sound in my neighbor's room made me a little uncomfortable. 
Also, weird fact that I didn't understand: I could leave my bags for free in the storage before checking in, but I had to pay for my bags after checking out.

title: Horrible experience no AC
text: No air conditioning in room. Second room very tiny. Very lazy attendants. Long line. Do not book this hote take my warning ! Very dark interior nasty bathrooms no wash cloths in bathroom no sense of luxury anywhere 0/10

title: Boring & Expensive
text: The hotel is uninviting and expensive. The lobby is so dark you can barely see anything. The employees are rude. Prepare to wait 45 minutes in line to check in and to check your bags into the hold room. BTW they make you pay extra to hold your bags on the day of check out and it's cash only. The rooms are small and hospital like. If you get unlucky and have to sleep in the bed by the AC unit, prepare to stay awake all night as it sounds like an airplane in the room and blows air directly on the bed. I'm not even sure if they have a bar/restaurant. We didn't see one and no staff alerted us to one. There are really no amenities to speak of. There are just much better places to stay if you're going to spend this much money.

title: Awful experience, receptionist was the most rude person.
text:
The receptionist was the most unfriendly person I’ve dealt with. When I made the reservation the holding fee was 100$, by the time I got to the hotel (about 3 weeks later) they had changed this fee to 200, which was never communicated to me, and the lady response was “well you either pay it or leave” . The rooms were disgusting, mine even had a dead cockroach on the carpet, the shower curtains are not long enough and water gets everywhere, and one day the hot water didn’t even work.

I don’t have the receptionist name, but she was the only one working there around 10am on Friday, and she spoke Spanish.

title: Great experience!
text: I had to stay last minute in Paramount due to another hotel’s cancellation. Paramount was affordable, flexible, in a WONDERFUL location, and provided me all the resources needed for a last minute stay before my flight at LaGuardia.

title: Not worth the price
text:
We booked a room in this hotel for a week end. Although it was decent, too many things were dysfunctional:
- The noise from the construction site right across the street is insane. We were not warned at all.
- We were given a twin bed while we asked for a double room
- There was no convenience drinks or coffee in the room

title: Not worth the price, deafening LT construction outside window
text: Arrived exhausted after long flight to find a 25 minute line to check in, despite having completed pre-check in before coming. Stayed in a deluxe king that has deafening construction going on right outside the window that starts at 7am … asked to be moved but had to accept a downgrade to do so, second room was tiny and very tired.

title: Very Misleading
text:
If I had to summarize our 1 week stay at the Paramount Hotel, I would say that it was very misleading. The professionally-taken online photos show a completely different hotel from the one we stayed at. See notes below.

Just know before booking that you are 100% paying for location and overpaying for pretty much everything else. We paid almost $400/night and feel completely ripped off. Do not stay here at all. There are better options in the area.

The good: 
1) You get a bed to sleep in.
2) You are in the heart of Times Square.

The bad:
1)  The room was *extremely* small and uncomfortable. You should believe everyone else's reviews which also mention the same thing. I'm not picky with room size, but this was pretty bad. You will be crowded in your own room. Our bathroom door did not even open all the way because it was blocked by... our bed. Ridiculous. Also, there is no mini fridge in the room.

2) The hotel is VERY dark. And I don't mean in a cool aesthetic way, it felt more like a "save on energy bill" thing. The lobby, hallways, and elevators are almost comically dim and you will have a hard time seeing anything. One can only assume it is deliberate to cover something up.

3) The building is old and not in good shape. Yes, it was built in the 1920s, however, there seemed to be no visible major investments in maintaining the building to reflect the expectations of a more modern hotel. I'm all for the older look, but the hotel feels like it's falling apart inside. Take a closer look at the inside of the elevator and you'll see that it's not maintained at all. This might explain the previous point.

4) The gym has no windows. You will be working out in a dimly lit, small, poorly equipped gym. The water dispenser didn't even work properly. All for $400/night.

5) The AC unit in the room is weak and extremely loud. I'm not even a light sleeper and I had to cover my head to sleep through that thing.

6) The bathroom is glorified airplane lavatory. Both in terms of size and comfort. The shower was big enough for a single person to stand in, you won't be able to extend your arms in any direction. There are no vents in the bathroom. The sink is a depressing metal utilitarian unit with pretty much no surface area to place things down. Bathroom did not even include hand soap, so we had to go out and buy some. All of this would be perfectly fine in a hostel-type of building but not for this price. Again, I cannot stress enough for cramped you will be in there. Did I mention that our door didn't fully open?

7) There is no breakfast onsite. Yes, you are in Times Square and have a million options to choose from. However, you are also paying $400/night. Any hotel that charges half that, especially in this location, will offer breakfast in some way. It says more about the hotel management than anything else.

8) The front-desk staff were not professional at all. If you can somehow see them through the dim lighting of the lobby, you'll be greeted with staff that feels annoyed that you're there and who won't tell you anything about the hotel except which room you're in. You will have to ask about amenities and anything else. I've been to many hotels in my life, but never witnessed something like this. Other reviewers have commented the same thing and I can confidently say that they are right.

title: Great Stay
text:
I stayed at the Paramount for almost a MONTH!
Great stuff, specially a wonderful lady called Natali! she is so helpful and make you feel at home.
In general very design, cool, young atmosphere. Great Stay!

title: Stay Hydrated and lean
text: Excellent location, clean, nice people. Felt safe. Bedrooms are very small but bright. Definite lack of flat services on which to place suitcases, drinks, anything. While there is an ice machine there are no glasses or ice bucket provided. Not sure of the logic here. Hope you can carry enough ice to make it back to your room and drink out of your hands. Also no facecloths provided which made washing my face a bit challenging too.

title: Great location! Decent rooms. Clean.
text: Great location for Broadway plays, Times Square, Rockefeller. Excellent value. We fit three adults in the two double bed suites just fine. Very clean. Request an upper level floor as the construction is really noisy happening across the street. Great experience.

title: Paramount Hotel: An Unforgettable Stay in the Heart of Times Square
text: "An unforgettable stay at the Paramount Hotel in Times Square! I was delighted by the perfect combination of comfort and prime location. The hotel offers a modern and welcoming atmosphere, and its proximity to Times Square is simply spectacular. Undoubtedly, a great choice to immerse yourself in the vibrant energy of New York City. Highly recommended!

title: Paramount
text: Average stay. Was nice enough, not amazing! Security deposit is a little much honestly. And getting it back is delayed which I don’t think is right. They shouldn’t take that until there’s a need to take it.

title: Family Celebration for Graduation
text:
Location was great!  Room had problems with electrical problems.  Wouldn't hold plug, very loose insides. 
The overall room (Super Queen) was okay.  I knew it would be small but it was clean so I didn't mind.  I didn't plan on being in room long. I felt the the scent of the room could have been better. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't refreshing. The staff were very polite. The lobby was inviting but electrical issues there concerning outlets for charging devices.

title: Yikes.
text: Bad hotel. Dirty and smells like cigs. Our first room was disgusting and we paid $400 for it. The carpet was stained and the shower wasn’t even usable. It was foul. For the money we paid, foul. Not to mention there’s no mini fridge, but you can rent one for $30 a night after you’ve overpaid for your room! Most staff was decently nice and we got a better room our second night. Room service tried get to get into our room at 8:45am and woke us all up. Oh and our first room was right next to a construction zone in which they started banging at 7am. Random banging noises throughout the night in our second room seemed like it was coming from upstairs. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere nicer. We’re hoping to get a bigger refund.

title: Fine but tired
text: It took about 40 mins to check in which was too long to wait. The room was clean but tiny and the bed was small. This is not a 4 star hotel by British standards. Tired and in need of renovation. But we did sleep well and it was ok for 3 nights. Location was great. It could have been worse.

title: Prison with hidden fees
text: Pictures were a lie, the bedroom was literally a prison with the bathroom not much better. Not to mention an additional $50 fee after checking in, fun surprise. Far better hotels for similar (if not cheaper after the fee) prices

title: Amazing lobby, disappointing rooms
text: We went for my Birthday. They did not have any options for special requests, no upgrades available (to pay for, not free) the lobby looks so modern and moody, very cool! People hang out there. The front desk is okay, not super friendly, but not rude. The rooms are lacking. Very small. The carpet is dirty, wear socks. And it looked like our sheets hadn’t been changed, there were a couple strands of someone’s hair in the bed. The AC unit was broken, the wall panel had to be taken off and manually turned on or off, no temp adjustments. The bathroom was gross, moldy caulking and loose seals around the shower. There’s no fan, so I’m sure that doesn’t help. I would be embarrassed to recommend this place to someone I knew. It was fine, but I wouldn’t stay here again, it’s definitely missing any sort of wow factor once you get past the lobby

title: unacceptably bad
text: This is a 2-star hotel with a nice lobby. Also it is terribly noisy because of extremely thin walls, and it is largely unfinished. Electrical work is nonexistent, and AC/heat broken. This hotel should be condemned then rebuilt from the ground-up.

title: Excellent Room + Location!
text: I would highly recommend this hotel as I Had a wonderful stay at the hotel! Lovely sized room and the best location ! Lovely staff members who were happy to help at reception. Would definitely recommend staying here and felt very safe as a solo traveller.

title: Superior Queen room was cramped
text: Highly recommend getting a room with double beds in lieu of one King or Queen bed. My daughter and her friends had a much larger area to work with in their double. I had the smallest bathroom and it was hard to get ready in the morning and at night in such a cramped space. Also, recommend bringing your own washcloths bc they do not offer those. I got two hand and two medium towels each day. Appreciated the daily maid service, but the front desk is understaffed. It was hard to get through on the phone to housekeeping or guest services. I had no warm or hot water during my stay. And, my AC stopped working during my last day there. It wasn't the most comfortable stay.

title: Not happy
text: Staff was great but the room had too many issues with the hot water and air conditioning.  You should really provide more than  one little square of soap and wash cloths.  Front desk was very kind and helpful but had to take 2 cold showers which wasen't fun at all.

title: Good location, friendly staff
text:
The hotel is in a good location right off of Times Square. The staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful. Natalie at the front desk was personable and charming as I checked in, and gave a very good first impression to the property. My room (a single), though small was well laid out and comfortable.
One downside to the property (which the hotel has no control over) was the construction happening nearby. During the day it sounded like piles were being driven in a nearby lot. Thankfully that work stopped at night, but construction resumed early next morning and the sound of trucks beeping as they reversed could be heard clearly from 6 in the morning.
The lobby is dimly lit and stylish, however it seems like maintenance of the property could be improved. There is scaffolding around the front entrance and the windows are covered in grime.

title: Adequate for my needs but way too noisy.
text: Just needed a place to sleep for the night.  I expected the room to be super small, which it was.  That said, the bed was comfortable enough.  Walls and finishes seemed to be worn.  Multiple items were missing from the room, including cups and an ironing board.  The worst part was the noise, both from the hallways and construction down the street which went on all night making sleeping very difficult.  Everything seemed really dark in this hotel.

title: Nothing special
text: I booked two rooms for my mom, sisters and I to stay for two nights. First impression of the room: nothing special. Our room seemed semi-clean with confetti on the floor. No hand towels or wash cloths. We didn’t really have any cold water. I was able to take one warm shower very early in the morning. Other than that it was scorching and uncomfortable to shower. Even the toilet had hot water running in it, you could feel the heat when you sat down which I thought was so odd. Our AC stopped working around midnight on our second night and we were unable to get through to the front desk to let them know. We tried going down to the lobby where we saw a very long line of people waiting to check in. It was one of the least expensive options in the area and it was still pricey because of the location. I think I’d rather either spend a little more money elsewhere or go a little outside the city where I’ve stayed in nicer Airbnbs.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I came to New York with my sister to see a few Broadway Shows, the hotel was perfectly located, it was walking distance to all of the shows that we were seeing. It is a little pricey, but its New York... We had a great experience, staff was very nice, and the room was excellent.

title: Subpar
text:
For what we paid, we definitely received subpar value. The rooms were pretty clean, but the bathroom did not have a clean vibe and was not nice. The sink did not go down, it remained stuffed for a few minutes after each use. 
The beds were very very soft and hard on the back.

title: Small rooms with non-working air conditioning.
text:
If the air conditioning had been working correctly, I would have said it was small, slightly updated prewar rooms/bath that was reasonably clean and a good value for the location (fantastic). Staff was nice once you could actually get to one at the desk. Lobby vibe is pretty cool.

Unfortunately, the air was blowing but not cooling and I spent every night in 79 degree heat.

Also note that while I was there in May, major construction is going on across the street. They don't do early morning but forget about doing business calls from your room with the racket going on.

If everything had been ok, it would have been a good value for the location but this has no business being 4 star.

title: Steps away from the heart of NY
text: Perfect place to stay in Manhattan.  Time square is a 2 minute walk up the block. Pizza place right out the front door, coffee and breakfast in walking distance. Nothing fancy about the room but served its purpose. Clean, comfy bed and spot on location.

title: Reasonable price in great location.
text: Hotel located in the heart of Times Square. Modern feel with east check in and check out. Bathrooms dated and views non existence but price reflects both. Great price for the location, decent bed and good internet.

title: I do NOT recommend this hotel
text:
I’ve stayed in a lot of 3 & 4 star hotels and never have I experienced a hotel like this. Yes - as per other reviews - the location is great, and the beds are comfy. We stayed for 4 nights and paid about £950. To summarise some of our issues:
-From about day 2, the water in the room was scolding hot (even the water in the toilet). We raised this issue in total 4 times - after it wasn’t fixed we were then moved to a different room. The water here was normal.
-You have to ring reception about 10 times before the phone gets answered
-Normally in 4* hotels there is a kettle/glasses/mugs/bottles of water. This hotel doesn’t have any of that.
-The rooms (and bathrooms) are really small. If it’s 2 of you staying you would need a king size room, the double beds seem to be small doubles.
-The air con system is the loudest noise ever, impossible to sleep with it on. So we ended up leaving windows open which isn’t ideal in the centre of NYC.
-Our flight wasn’t until the evening so we requested to leave our suitcase - could not believe there was a $2 fee for this! I wouldn’t expect this from a 2 or 3* hotel, let alone a hotel that claims to be 4*!!
-There aren’t any irons or ironing boards available in the hotel, though they do provide steamers.
-The queue at reception is always quite long. 
-We had to pay a $100 security deposit at the start of our stay (think this is a North American thing as we had the same in Canada) - but on check out we were informed we wouldn’t receive the deposit back instantly and it would be refunded in 3-5 days.
