So overall, no I wouldn’t recommend this hotel. We paid slightly more in order to be on Times Square, but if we were to come again we would look for an alternative 3 or 4* hotel. We went to the Yotel one afternoon for drinks on the terrace and that seemed much nicer and cheaper. I hope management look into some of these issues.

title: Not a home away from home.
text: They charge me extra $140, there’s no restaurant, it’s hard to connect to the television and the windows are dirty. Based on the thing I signed vlogging is not allowed, it’s not like other hotels where they let you Vlog in their hotel because they are confident with the quality of the service and the beauty of the place. This place doesn’t give me the home away from home feeling not like other hotels.

title: Best deal in NYC
text: This hotel gets all of the basics right: extremely cool vibe, plenty of elevators that are fast and work, quick check-in and check-out process, clean rooms, and well-preserved historic architecture. It's much better than similarly priced hotel chains in the area.

title: Great location
text:
Clean, safe, and amazing location if you are seeing broadway shows. 
Check in was a breeze but we also arrived late at night. We had them hold our bags until we went to the airport and there was a $2 charge which seemed fair. 
Friendly, helpful staff. Our room was cleaned daily.

title: Could be an awesome place, but...
text:
Priced right, great location (although a bit loud, but it is NYC), clearly spent alot on the lobby and reception which has a cool vibe with pool tables and lounge areas.
Smarmy woman at reception when we asked about early check in, but very nice housekeepers.
WHY are there no washcloths or even cups in the rooms? Having to wet an entire handtowel (which you have to ask for) to wash your face is absurd, and having a "water station' on the 4th floor is understandably green, but jeezus, have a few cups in the room when you are thirsty at 3am!
Won't stay again, or if I do I will come equipped...

title: Great Location
text: Great location, very accommodating staff.  if you want to be close to Time Square and the Broadway District and on budget, then the Paramount is a GREAT choice.  We loved the location.  The room was very small, but we weren't in New York to hang out in a hotel room.  The hotel was very clean and comfortable.  The lobby is big with lots of places to lounge around.  If we ever return to NY, we will absolutely return to the Paramount.

title: There are better options
text:
Needs a lot of improvement, the building looks old, needs options to eat like restaurants,  not so clean and the environment is very dark…. I won’t come
Back there are much better options !… the bedroom is extremely tiny and is not that clean

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: The location of this hotel was perfect! The room was a little small but we were hardly there so it didn’t even matter. Our biggest problem was how hot the room got at times and the air conditioner didn’t seem to help very much. Other than that slight issue it was perfect for what we needed!!

title: A true night are - stay away from the Paramount Times Square.
text: Do not stay at the Paramount - even for free - it is that bad. We have a Queen Superior. The room is 90 square feet at best. The website states that the room is 160 square feet.  None of the electrical outlets work so we can’t charge anything. There is not even enough room to open a suitcase. If you had thoughts of a hot shower, you will be out if luck. The water was barely warm.

title: Look Out
text:
Before you book make sure you know about the $40.00 per night "Hotel Tax"
When we checked in there were no hand towels or washcloths and the room was freezing with no blankets to be had. Service was fine and the room was clean.

title: Average stay at paramount
text:
The facilities were very below average for the price of stay per day compared to other hotels around the same area

Like no trash cans inside the room, no water bottles etc

Bathroom did not have hot water supply and also very dusty bathroom

title: Great time at the Paramount
text: We stayed at the Paramount for nearly a week and it was a great location and really good room. We had two beds and there was still room to walk around. There was some construction so it was a bit noisy in the mornings but to be expected in a big city. Otherwise, the rooms were quiet from other guests and not much other street noise considering we're right at Times Square.

title: The rooms are horrible
text: The rooms were too small, there is no facility in the rooms on top of that Lights are not working, door knobs are broken, and the exhaust fan of the bathroom was not working. when we complained and the staff calls us at 3 am in the morning to fix the issues.

title: If you want Internet-Access, don't book it!
text: All in all it was okay, but due to the non-existing internet-access on the weekend, i wouldn't book it again. The location is nice and next to timessquare. If you want room service, there is none. So you can't  get dinner or something at the hotel. It is just for sleeping.

title: Great location
text:
I booked this hotel because it was one of the only hotels that had two double beds & didn’t cost a fortune. We travelled from jfk airport on the subway.  We got off at 50th street station and it was only a 10 minute walk to the hotel. 

CHECK IN -The check in was VERY slow. We waited over an hour in a huge queue with only 2 & sometimes 3 staff checking people in. We were charged $40 per night resort fee! Which is basically free money for the hotel. I’ve no idea why they just don’t add this on to the price of the room, so people are clear on the full price. If you are staying for more than one night this can be very costly. Nearly all New York hotels do this. 

ROOM - our room was small with just two queen sized beds, a tv and very small cheap desk. Our room over looked the back of some Times Square signs, not the best view. But we were only intending on sleeping in our room so it was ok. I thought being next to the lift it would be loud, but we never heard a thing. There was a steamer to iron clothes and also a hair dryer in the room. No tea/coffee though. 

LOCATION- the location was perfect for us, close to the subway station. If you walk out of the hotel and turn left down the street you will come to Times Square at the end. There are Broadway theatres and restaurants all along the hotels street. It is literally in the middle of everything, the location is ideal. 

OVERALL- we loved the location of this place, the price was reasonable for New York prices and the room was small but ok. Definitely nothing luxurious, but adequate. The check in is definitely something that needs sorting out, it’s far too long a process. You can leave bags here for $2 each, which was great. I’d stay here again if the price was good and check in was better.

Our roo

title: Never Again
text: I will never stay here again. It was extremely over priced for what the accommodations were. Wonderful ambiance in the foyer, and in the hallways, but the rooms are that of college dormitories. EXTREMELY SMALL and uncomfortable. My teenage son's bedroom is larger than these "hotel" rooms. The ONLY advantage to staying here was the close proximity to Time Square.  I will never stay here again.

title: Poor quality stay
text: The reception of the hotel was really nice and swanky, but that all goes out the window when taken to your room. Understandably, the standard room is equipped with the bare minimum, however we did not expect to be greeted with dirty, stained carpets, frayed bedding, electrical sockets almost disconnected to the wall providing low wattage. The rooms are also much tinier than shown in pictures. The bed was very comfortable and the shower also very nice, however overall the look and feel of the place was very subpar. Would not stay here again nor recommend to others.

title: Great location but horrible amenities
text: The hotel was located in a great location, but had horrible amenities. There was no vending machines located on the property, and the rooms did not come with any refrigerators or microwaves. there was construction going on and it begins at 7:30 AM and can be heard on the 15th floor and it is very loud and the staff did not alert us that the construction could possibly be a problem and if we were OK with that. The bathrooms were in dire need of updating in the bathroom shower had nowhere to store your shampoo or soap.

title: Heart of the theater district
text: We were working in Times Square and the Paramount was recommended to us by an advance person.  They found an excellent home for us, great vibe, super helpful staff. It couldn't have been better.  I'll be back with my family next time.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square
text: The Paramount Hotel Times Square is perfectly located in Times Square with a quick walk to all the great Broadway theaters and other great sites. The staff was very friendly and helpful with great service. The rooms could be updated a bit and sound proofing would a nice upgrade. Especially from outside noise which was amplified up between the buildings. There could definitely be more outlets added as there weren't many available for charging devices. Overall, the stay was good even with the outside noise and minimal outlets.

title: POOR HOSTEL NOT A HOTEL.
text:
I stayed there. These are my observations; 

1) The location was good as it was right next to Times Square. 
2) Very close to Central Park. 
3) The lobby is so dimly lit, it gave me a feeling of as if I am staying in some Hostel. It didn't look like a hotel to me. 
4) There weren't all the toiletries in the washroom. 
5) The room was very very small. Not as mentioned in their advertisement. I was not even able to open my suitcase. 
6) I could hear the noise from the other rooms. 
7) After checkout, I asked for my Invoice, and it has been more than 10 days, and to date, they haven't shared the Invoice with me. 

8) I will never ever stay in the Hotel again. It was a bad experience. If they cannot send me an invoice after 10 days or hand over one at the time of checkout, then they are irresponsible. 
9) The washroom was also very small. 
10) The lobby had two buckets kept as some construction work was going on. 
11) One of the elevator's access cards was broken. 
12) They will ask for cash to store your bags in case you check out and you have 2-3 hours before you leave for the airport. 

Please feel free to go and check out, If any of my comments are not true, then I will edit my review. 

HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED.

title: Close to everything you need
text: Nice area to stay it’s close to all the touristy places you’d like to visit. I didn’t like that they didn’t have a kitchen in the room.. beds were comfy clean room. Once we checked in and got our keys and went to our room we saw that someone was already staying at that room and we realized the person from the reception gave us the wrong room! other than that was a good experience

title: Not worth it/unsafe practices
text: Upon entering the hotel I thought it was great- had a very cool/classy vibe. But that ended there. We proceeded to check in at the front desk. The check in process was pretty concerning- the front desk staff member completely flipped around the tablet/iPad used to store the guests information. I was able to see several names with their room numbers, how many guests were staying in the room- including the number of children. This is not a normal hotel practice and extremely unsafe. Not only that but when handing us our room key she announced our room numbers, loudly, several times- which is another huge no-no in the hospitality industry- and again, extremely unsafe. The room was very basic given the price, nothing special, not cleaned very well and the room and hallways smelled heavily of marijuana. There were also hairs on the bedsheets. I didn't see it mentioned anywhere but there is also very loud construction going on right outside the building that continues overnight. We were still hearing it around midnight and well into 6am int he morning. We were on a high floor and it was extremely loud so I can only imagine the sound on a lower level. I think I was able to get about 2 hours of sleep due to the sound. There was a facility fee charged when checked in despite pre-paying, I'm not sure what it was for as this hotel offered less amenities than your basic chain hotel. All in all I regret booking this hotel and do not recommend it.

title: Theater trip
text: It is a great location for Broadway shows and restaurants.  Hotel had excellent security.  The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean.  Good temperature control.

title: Awful - do not book!
text:
Absolutely awful, you should avoid! The rooms are seriously outdated and drab. Felt like a prison cell especially with the metal sink. 

The only positive about this hotel was its location - right on Broadway.

title: Hotel che si salva per la posizione... camera scarna
text:
Hotel in ottima posizione, con una bella ma scura Hall.
La camera non rispecchia la fastosità della hall, risulta abbastanza scarna. Chiesto il check-out posticipato di 1ora e me lo avrebbero offerto a 50$ + tasse, ho rifiutato.

title: Amenities were bad but overall a decent location
text:
Paramount Hotel is located right beside Times Square and on the street of Broadway: A very busy area with constant noise. 

While we stayed on the 18th floor we could still hear the constant cars and music but it wasn't loud enough to stop us from sleeping.

Upon entering our room, we learned immediately that the hotel pictures were deceiving. Our room was small, and I mean small. To the left immediately is the small closet connected with the washroom door. To the right is a small bed with one nightstand directly up against the corner wall. We didn't even have enough space to place our luggage anywhere without interfering with the door or our shoes.

The washroom door had the landlord special: there was a crack in the top of the door and instead of fixing it, they just painted over the crack numerous times which increased the door size and prevented the door from even closing.

There was no water pressure from the sink, I preferred to wash my face in the shower instead.

Onto the good things about the hotel:

the shower and sink was clean and I enjoyed showering there.
the bed was very comfortable, while small, still nice to sleep in.
The elevators moved quickly and efficiently: 4 elevators total.
the gym was very small but it still got the job done. however I wish the weights went higher than 50lb dumbbells. 
the staff are very friendly and efficient, any issue we addressed, they responded immediately.

Overall: For $400 a night, I was a little disappointed but the staff were very friendly :)
6/10

title: Rough experience
text: There was one receptionist during check-in hours. The key card maker for the hotel rooms were not working. Manager had to bring us to our room w/o giving us a key. The front desk  lady said they were going to call the rooms around to provide a key. Within five hours we did not receive a phone call and tried to call the lobby and no one answered. We went to the lobby to try to obtain a key and still there was a long line to get a key. Overall, the check in process was really rough.

title: Honest Review
text:
Great location, average hotel. 
Hotel room is basic, but clean. 
Best part of the hotel...location!
Check in was ok, we arrived early; so they checked our bags until our room was ready.  Once we were able to get into our room...it was perfect for what we needed!  
Check out was easy well.
Did I mention the location???

title: Great for somewhere to sleep!
text:
Okay so… you can’t beat the location. Times Square is around the corner, about a 20 second walk and you’re literally in the centre of the universe. It’s an atmospheric location for sure. 

The hotel has a very chic reception area that is insta-perfect. The staff were friendly and helpful. You can leave your luggage for a small price if needed. The lifts are slightly annoying as they are key-card operated and a bit clunky to use. 

The rooms… the beds are so comfortable, I can’t fault them. The room itself was a little outdated and needed some TLC. We unplugged the air con as it was too noisy to sleep with. The TV was good, the hairdryer was great and the lighting was fine. The bathroom needed a refurb, even though the shower was perfectly pleasant. It is a little bit of a noisy hotel to sleep in due to the street noise - as stated previously, you’re in the centre of it all so I recommend some ear plugs. There is no tea or coffee in the room sadly. You can fill your water bottle in the ice room. The gym is really good and was free to use. 

The hotel doesn’t provide breakfast, a big shame. The bakery cafe on the corner of the street was closed for Easter when we came so I can’t comment on that but I can highly recommend the Times Square Diner & Grill for an incredible breakfast. We went there every morning for breakfast and it’s only a 2 minute walk away. 

Would I stay here again? Sure, why not. It’s in NYC so you’re not going to spend a lot of time in the hotel anyway.

title: Not worth the money
text: This is the second time we stayed in NYC in the last 3 months and this hotel cost more than our previous hotel.  I was hoping since it cost more that we would have nice room and great service. We were very disappointed.  The location is good but I rather walk an extra three blocks that stay in this hotel again.

title: Don’t stay here
text: This was not a good experience for me and my friend. We called to see if we can check in early consider it our flight landed early in the a.m. We were told to show up at the hotel, and there will be an effort made to find a room. Upon arriving the guy at the freight was very rude to us, and we had to wait in the lobby approximately six hours before getting a room. There was roughly about 50 other people Waiting for a room assignment as well.

title: Avoid
text: The only positive I can give this hotel is location. I’ve stayed in countless New York hotels and know the rooms are always small but this took the biscuit. The bed literally sits by the air con which sounds like a 747 taking off. It’s not suitable for 2 people & the bathroom resembles that off a prison

title: Poor customer service
text: Arrived at the hotel 15:45 and advised Check in can only take place at 16:00. We left to go have lunch and returned at 17:45 only to wait 55 minutes in a checkin queue. Getting to the front advised key card machine is faulty and have to wait for someone to manually open room door. Left the hotel for a broadway show and returned at 12:15 only having to wait in a queue for another 30 minutes to get a room key card. The issue I have is that management knew of the problem and did nothing extra to put extra staff to relieve the inconvenience they caused. This hotel just a Money spinner taking the guests for the fool having to queue their holiday away after paying for a service. This hotel gives NYC a bad name - shame on you!

title: Loved it!
text: Came early to drop our bags & the front desk clerk upgraded us to double beds! It was absolutely wonderful & so unexpected. The location is literally across from the Hamilton theatre & just down the street from Times Square. Very walkable & great rooms!!

title: Très bonne situation géographique 😍
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé à deux pas de Times square 😍
Hôtel propre et bien équipé 😊
Le personnel est professionnel et sympathique 😊
Nous gardons un bon souvenir de cet établissement et nous n’hésiterons pas à revenir lors d’un prochain séjour à New York 😍

title: Great Location, but would think twice
text: The overall hotel is in a great location to Times Square and Broadway.  The room was a good size for 2 people (in NYC standards).  The bathroom needed some updating.  The tub was flaky off pieces, the sink was dull and dingy looking. There was no fridge or hair dryer in the room.  This made it difficult to save money on food not being able to keep leftovers.  I've stayed here multiple times, and had a bad experience the last time (maybe 10 years ago).  I won't go back.

title: Needs improvement and a good carpet clean
text:
Our stay was okay, what impacted the score most was how disgusting the rooms carpet were. Sticky, smelly and dirty. The shower in the bathroom can’t contain the water and it gets the bathroom floor extremely wet for hours, even when using the floor towel.
There is construction going on in front of the hotel and I was woken up by loud construction noises which sucked

title: Hotel itself not bad!
text: The hotel was conveniently located; clean; and staff was friendly.  There's a 24-hour construction site across the street, which is very loud.  Had to turn AC on to lowest setting to have white noise for as long as possible.

title: Excellent location for theater and restaurants
text: A comfortable stay at an amazing location for our theater trip to NYC.  Check in at 4:00, for some reason, was a little chaotic, and we were surprised there were no drinking glasses in our room.  But overall it was a very pleasant stay.

title: LOCATION IS EVERYTHING
text: You are paying for the hotel's location not for your room or any extras.  I booked a single room which I knew would be small.  It was clean and fresh smelling.  I had plenty of towels and an extra roll of toilet paper but only soap, body wash and shampoo.  I had no problems sleeping and heard no noise from traffic or other guests.  Check-in took a while with two people manning the front desk but leaving was easy and fast as I had prepaid my bill so all I had to do was drop off the key.  The lobby is rather dark with a pool table and lots of seating. A "guard" was sat by the elevators but never glanced my way every time I entered but you did need your key to use them.  I thought the TV was placed in an odd place on a side wall near the foot of the bed but no one had told me it is mounted on a pull out/swivel bracket.  Figured that out on my own.  Was surprised there was a hair dryer and a clothes steamer in the closet neither of which I used.  For a solo senior man it was OK for theater going because of  where it was.  Probably another hotel in the area would have gotten me a bigger room with more "extras" for the same price.  For me it was adequate so this review is not a complaint.  I cannot speak about the larger rooms.  OH.....one real warning...the toilet was the lowest one I have ever seen.

title: Great Location - Reasonable Price
text: Great spot for easy access to the Theatre District; walkable to so much. Room was small (I had a single bed), but adequate and overall pretty quiet. Bed was comfy and always had hot water. Not super deluxe but certainly a good place to crash after full days exploring!

title: Good location
text:
You are definitely paying for the location!
I stayed here with my son after seeing a broadway show. We are used to staying at hotels with more amenities, but this one was very basic, no frills. Can’t beat the location, but it was just ok.

Things that might have influenced my stay here:
There is no parking, valet or self-parking. You have to find your own. There are several parking garages within a couple of blocks (not cheap)
No breakfast included - there are tons of places in walking distance.
No room service. I had to go to the lobby to get my DoorDash order. 
The elevators are small and very busy. I have no idea what algorithm it uses, but if you watch the display with the current floor, it seems that they are all passing your floor several times both ways. Once inside, one elevator wouldn’t let us select a floor until we used a key. The next time I got in, I went to swipe my card and someone just selected a floor before anyone swiped. 

Overall, I would only recommend this if you prefer location to amenities.

title: Great location for theatre & Times Square
text: Older city hotel in a perfect location for those interested in theatre and Times Square activities. Close to "Restaurant Row" with excellent food choices. Rooms could use some updating but comfortable.

title: Terrible
text: Do not stay here ! You are literally just staying here to be right on Time Square. The bathrooms and rooms and real small and stuffy . Some of the rooms have mold and things don’t work like the phone and Wi-Fi and because of this we had to switch rooms . They charge you for everything, 40 dollars a day in resort fees to stay at a dump . I highly don’t recommend.

title: Construction Location
text: There is a new building going up next door and the noise of jack hammers is loud and consistent. This hotel lacks modern conveniences in room such as coffee maker and usb ports. I would not reccomend this hotel for the business traveler.

title: First New York Trip
text:
We had initial problems with the room (bathroom not cleaned, AC not working. There were shattered tiles in all of the elevators.

Service was wonderful and the location was central to everything we had to do.

title: Dirty and lost its shine
text: I wouldn’t recommend The Paramount Hotel. We have been coming for years but now it is not very good at all. Rooms and bathrooms are filthy including carpets. Elevators work intermittently staff have no uniforms or workwear, reception foyer has been made smaller, coffee shop has been closed, there are no doormen, security is non existent and safes in room are not secured down and didn’t work this time at all. Sadly we will not be bad I see it closing at this rate very poor. It’s sad because it used to be much better than this.

title: A few days in NCY
text: Perfect position for my holidays in NYC - I spent 4 amazing days at the hotel and I loved how close the hotel is to Times Square and all the theatres - Broadway city life is wonderful and I cannot wait to come back and visit around, again.

title: Shabby & dated. Very basic - good location
text: I would not stay here again to be honest, don't like to moan but all that is going for this hotel is the location. Maybe it has better rooms, but the one we stayed in was small, air con was knackered and everything was absolute basic. Staff were friendly enough and it was clean - we just got our heads down and spent minimal time within it. If that is your plan the location is great... see I can be positive!

title: The room was terrible small
text: The room size was like a jail cell. The bed supposed to be a queen size but definitely was like full bed. When you enter the hotel, you see a modern lobby but when you open you room door, you’ll be surprised how bad it is. I don’t recommend it at all.

title: Stay somewhere else
text: The room was dingy, tiny, and was missing basic things like a washcloth, hand towel, cups, ice bucket, pad of paper, etc. The ONLY amenities were 2 beds, 2 towels, and a tiny table with chair. Bed/pillow was decent.

title: Rundown gem
text: The room was very run down with stained carpet and an air/heat unit that didn't work and I was freezing. The safe didn't work and when I went down to find the bar I couldn't find one. I had to find out where ice was in the hotel and there were only plastic bags, no buckets in the ice room and none in the room

title: Never again
text:
The list of problems with this hotel is lengthy.
The lobby is so dark you wonder if it’s even open.
The elevators continued the trend of bleakness ,although they are quick.
The room are smaller than a cruise ship interior.
No extras, ons and worn out . The price should have suggested a much better experience. 
The only pleasantness was the staff who were genuinely nice

title: Loud construction and dated hotel
text: Loud construction outside window, no pre-warning from hotel. Executive king room tired, stains on carpets. No facilities at hotel despite the expensive facilities fee. Would not stay again unfortunately.

title: Great People running a potentially wonderful hotel that needs some upgrading
text: The staff, from reception to housekeeping and security, were wonderful.  The hotel itself is mysteriously poorly lit - one can barely see the amazing moorish design elevator doors, or where to push the buttons once in the elevator, and the lobby is like a cheap Las Vegas nightclub where one cannot sit but only sprawl on wide sofas and there is no place to sit and read or talk without theatrical lighting (that doesn't really work for a hotel lobby). Paramount Times Square hotel owners, go study the Edison Hotel lobby and look at something that is both artistic and really works! The location is great! But, the construction that blocks the sidewalk is a bummer - when will that be done? This historic building has so much potential ... go to it!

title: Terrible cigarette smoke throughout trip
text: Although it may seem like a deal for NYC, I do not recommend this hotel at all if you have any respiratory issues. They call themselves non-smoking, but it did not seem entirely true. The first room they put us in absolutely reeked of smoke. The second room that they gave us, which we stayed in for over a week definitely had smoke odor embedded into the walls. Absolutely disgusting. A strong cigarette smoke filled our room in the middle of our trip as well. I think it came through the vents. The fact that they don’t have any smoke detectors is alarming and unsanitary. The room is extremely loud all night from police vehicles and just all sorts of random city noises. No need to stay this close to Times Square.

title: Deposit was charged unfairly.
text: Deposit was charged unfairly. No explanation as to why. I sent an email but received no reply. You should think of it as just a place to sleep. As others have stated in their Google reviews, I would recommend not using this hotel.

title: There's "Boutique" and then there's just TINY.
text:
I originally booked us here because of an event happening next door at Sony Hall, which was canceled in too short a time for me to change to a different hotel. I didn't know what to expect, and since we were only in for one evening, I wasn't thinking I would be too picky about the accommodations, however... the room, bathroom, closet, shower, were all so very tiny. That's the main gripe. Otherwise, when we checked in, there was only one staffer on at the desk while there was a long line of customers waiting, at check-in time. That was frustrating, but not earth-shattering. 

Overall, given the choice again, I would stay someplace else. $325 (even discounted) for the size of the room and amenities was very unsatisfying.

title: Terrible accommodations
text: No wash clothes, hand towels, ice bucket or cups in rooms.  One floor with ice machine with very flimsy bag that rips before you get back to your room.  Cups are just sitting there, unsealed - can’t believe Health debarment would approve in this day and age. Terrible, uncomfortable beds.  Bathroom looks like a prison bathroom.  Elevators are dimly lit with no audible indication of opening.  Overall unpleasant, hot, uncomfortable, expensive stay.

title: Rude staff and had to get out to buy sheets. Dirty room. We were going to stay for 3 days, we left the same day. Don't
text: Dirty room , stained and disgusting sheets, hair all over and rude staff. It's nothing like the pictures I saw before booking. Worse than a motel ! Don't book there please! There's a hotel the same area , same price and it's decent. Nice and polite staff ,old rooms but very clean.

title: Totally Great!!!
text: I went and stayed at this for two days for work, and though I had not stayed there before and was a bit leery I was totally impressed, totally happy, everything was perfect. There was one small problem with a slow drain in the bathroom, and they sent somebody up in a timely manner and took care of it. I highly recommend it , and would stay there again! Sparsely furnished but was perfect for me.

title: Weekend stay
text:
Fair. Good thing we didnt have to stay in the room much. So small couldnt walk around.
How about some water please? in the rooms? Coffee? Somewhere on site for guests....Vending machine...... Handy store on first floor instead of a vintage clothing store nobody is interested in.
More help at the desks please. Nice people but overwhelmed

title: NYC WITH FAMILIY
text: The stay at the Paramount Hotel has been satisfactory. I traveled for a week with my husband and two children. The location of the hotel is very good, the Times Square subway station has many connections to the different areas of Manhattan. The decoration of the hotel is very nice and modern, to put some improvement, the bathtub is quite worn and would improve the cleanliness of the room, under the bed we found a glass of ice cream from previous guests. I still recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Overall, fantastic, accessible hotel!
text:
When the original ADA Accessible Hotel room I booked at another hotel was not going to work for me as wheelchair, I was able to find an open accessible room at The Paramount, and I am so glad I switched. Not only is the location fantastic, in the heart of the theater district, but the price was reasonable. Additionally, when I fell in my room and my companion was unable to assist me in getting up, hotel staff were so generous and were able to get me the assistance I needed. I was so grateful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any theater lover coming to NYC!

Downsides: No wash cloths, or clock in the room. And I would have liked to have complimentary conditioner and lotion rather than just shampoo and body wash, but these things are all minor!

title: NYC- Paramount
text: Our stay at the Paramount was great!  We didn't have any issues. Bathroom was clean, lobby was clean and staff was very courteous and helpful. The location is perfect for Times Square and Broadway. We will be back!

title: Great location, but don't expect much
text:
We booked this for a multi family mom-daughter trip. The price and location were great. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. However, basic amenities at this hotel are sorely lacking. 
1. There were no cups in the bathroom to use like most hotels. Cups are only located on Floor 4, where the only ice machine is. 
2. Speaking of ice machine, there are only small paper cups to collect ice and garbage bags. There are no ice buckets.
3. There were only 2 bath towels in our room. No hand towels or washcloths. When we asked for more towels since there were 4 in our room, we were told they had NO washcloths. But they did send more bath towels and a couple of hand towels.
4. The a/c went out during our first night. We had to call the front desk twice to get them to come repair it. It was 85°F and sweltering in our room.
5. There are no places in the hotel to get coffee or beverages. The bar and restaurant next door to them offered discounts, but seeing has how even the most economical hotels these days offer complimentary coffee, if not in room then at least in lobby, this was most unfortunate to learn when we got there.
6. This last item is not the hotel's fault, but they are doing construction across the street. Construction noise was very loud first thing in the morning on weekdays. 

The location is fantastic, but I will not be staying at this hotel again.

title: Fantastic location for theatre lovers.
text: Just some steps from the action in Times Square. Very close to all Broadway theatres. Nice vibe. Always something going on at the clubs and pubs in the very same block. Helpful personnel at front desk and luggage deposit.

title: Terrible.
text: The lady at the front desk was condescending and rude. Not to mention the fact that they keep extorting money out of you for this lack luster stay. My bedroom was dirty and had stains. The bathroom was disgusting and looked like it had jail sinks built in. There wasn’t even water in the room! What kind of hotel doesn’t give a bottle or two of water - even if you have to pay. Never staying here again.

title: Great nightly rate for location
text:
I was only there for one night to see a play and had read a number of the reviews. 
- The size of the room was just fine for me. It’s NYC. 
- The location was perfect for us. 
- no coffee in room but I never drink that anyway. 
- AC didn’t work but it was so late we decided to deal with it. 
- there was a short in the lights over the bed that made the lights only work half of the time. 
- only 2 bath towels, no wash cloths or hand towels, which I knew about from reviews so brought my own since I drove from DC. 
- when we checked in at 11:30pm, there was no line. When we came back a couple of hours later the line was crazy long. 
- checkout was efficient enough. 

Overall a perfectly fine stay. Not amazing, not terrible. We got a good rate for a great location!

title: Terrible experience
text: The a/c didn’t work in the room. It was like 80 degrees in there. Called service no one came then we went downstairs and finally got some help after 2 hours. Got another room and a/c still didn’t work.

title: Disappointing
text: Will not be back. The hotel was in a great location. Upon walking in very clean and seemingly posh design; yet when I got to the room, I couldn’t find the bath towel. Upon calling reception they advised where they were and also advised you only get a towel not a washcloth, but a hand towel. There also was not a hand towel. How is someone supposed to bath without a standard staple of wash cloth? I’m also disappointed that I paid a $40 resort fee and they were zero amenities there’s no bar there’s no restaurant there’s no perks there’s no room service. I was then told by reception that you offer are used machines at a gym. Those are two things that come standard any hotel without paying an extra fee, so that was disappointing as well. For what very little is offered the value for price was excessive. I will not be back.

title: 24 hours of disappointment
text: Wildly understaffed, and could never get a live person to help me with the temperature control in my room. It was 78 degrees the duration of my stay. Elevators had minds of their own and I never got to the floor I wanted to go to on my first try. Noise in the room from construction across the street was so bad I had to take my Zoom calls at the Marriott across the street.

title: Vacation trip
text: It was overall very good experience. The staff was amazing, very good location and facilities. The only problem we’ve faced was the temperature setting. Neither the bedroom or shower wasn’t working well. But it was a very good experience overall!

title: Do not stay here. Horrible.
text: Extremely small rooms with pot smell in hallways. Dirty and unprofessional staff. Rooms and beds were not as advertised. No free amenities so be prepared to bring a lot of extra soap, coffee, and towels. No door signs to let staff know if you’re in the room or not. Very small! Management didn’t appear to be present.

title: Dark, noisy, ac was terrible,
text: Hotel was dark, the ac did not work very well, there were blinds missing so the light from the billboards would shine through. The room had 2 Murphy beds that were uncomfortable. TV didn't work well..

title: Staff hate their job and take it out on customers
text: Only one person in that hotel had respect for their job, and that was the guy that took my luggage/checked me in. My room's television wasn't working (a room of $200) and when I called to ask for help with that at 7pm, they said they'd send someone and hung up on me in a horrible way. Someone came eventually, at 11:45 pm while I had already given up and fallen asleep. Thanks. The next day when I woke up, I inquired about extending one more night because I had a show I was performing in nearby, they were so rude (a lady working the morning shift of 4/11/2023 at 10:00AM)  and once again hung up on me then too without any answers. All I wanted to know was if I do it through Expedia or with them since they have my deposit etc... So I went somewhere else. There are a million better-staffed hotels with facilities that work. I never leave bad reviews, I usually suck it up and hate to ever make someone's day bad, but this hotel really made my trip feel sour and they were just so horrible to me. They hate their job, I'm sorry that's the case, but it's not your customers faults.

title: Birthday Vacation
text: My stay at this hotel was horrible to say the least.  I would not recommend this hotel to my friends/family. I found dirty socks under the bed when checking to ensure I had all of my belongings. The sink and tub drains really slowly. The hotel had NO WASH CLOTHS the 2 days were were there. No microwave nowhere in the hotel to reheat your food.  I wouldn’t stay here again.

title: Convenient but not enough space
text: The hotel location is very convenient. The rooms are very small. Not enough space for luggage, and if you have two people it will get crowded. Windows are not soundproof, so you will hear construction noise outside, which may or may not prevent you from sleeping.

title: Pleasant
text: Overall I had a pleasant experience .Welcoming staff .Hotel is right in the middle of Times Square .I was on solo trip .Would surely recommend if u are planning your trip to nyc .Just rooms are way too small .They do have a facility to keep luggage even after you check out (nominal charge which I dnt remember ).

title: The worst hotel I've ever stayed on
text: If you are thinking about booking this hotel DON'T DO IT. It looks nothing like the pictures the rooms are small and the bathroom is so small that an average size person can barely fit. Our room was really dirty and when we got there we saw that the sheets haven't been changed they had hair from other people on them, and the whole night you could hear the cars from the street honking and there's some  construction going on and you can't sleep past 6:00 am because you could hear them working. Please don't book this hotel.

title: April in New York
text: The hotel was ok, the facilities better suited to families , or younger people, the twin room was adequate, but overall it was ok. Nothing more. We used it solely as a base, for which it was ok, but wouldn't go again.

title: Just what you need and nothing more
text: It was safe, clean, and an excellent NYC location for our family visit. The room was extremely plain and stripped down but we didn't come to hang in the room. We slept comfortably, the shower was fine.

title: Péssimo atendimento.
text: O único ponto positivo é a localização. O resto é ruim, como por exemplo as cortinas q não baixavam totalmente e o quarto ficava claro as 8h da manhã. O atendimento é péssimo/horrível. Te atendem como se eles estivessem fazendo um favor pra vc. Lixo de atendimento. Qualquer informação eles te dão de cara fechada e ainda são informações completamente erradas.

title: Don't trust the pictures. But it is a great location.
text: The room was unbelievably small, nothing seemed to match the photos. But it was very well located. Nothing in the rooms seem to work properly. The outlets were so loose I had to do some sort of abercrobatics in order to balance this on that so the chords wouldn't fall out. The on off switch for the very bright light above the bed was broken, and when I asked for assistance none came. I ended up actually having to remove the light bulbs in order to get some sleep. A room attendant was so insistent she literally tried to push her way in when I close the door, insisting that she had to clean the room. Had to yell at her to go away as I had just stepped out of the shower. All of this having been said, we were in the middle of the times square area with Broadway shows literally across the street. If you're thinking about staying at this hotel, way those very serious cons with the locational pros.

title: Don’t Do It.
text: The hotel is run down. The carpet had large stains all over and the bathroom is outdated. Mine had cigarette stains on the toilet seat cover and the tub looks old and gross. Save your money. I decided to book another room at the Hilton and it was $40 cheaper with a better/cleaner room, better/faster service, and great amenities.

title: Sadly horrible experience
text: The location is great but I don't know what happened to the management of the hotel. Definitely lots of room for improvement. I've stayed here a handful of weekends and have always had a great stay, but this time was horrible. Noisy room so loud I didn't sleep. Being ignored by check-in counter. I might be researching other hotels for my next visit into the city.

title: The worst city hotel I have ever stayed in
text:
The Paramount has to have the worst rooms I have stayed in.

I arrived excited to stay at the paramount for a work trip. The location is the only pro of this dated, tired and over priced hotel.

My first room I changed within minutes of checking in - the window was insecure and fell out when I touched it. Outside of the window was a lot of trash that would indicate that people were outside - this made me feel immediately unsafe - I reported this to the hotel and they said that they would send maintenance up to take a look - but said they were unsure when this would be - I asked to be moved. The second room was next to house keeping closet which proved noisy and in the evening and early in the morning meaning I had minimal sleep. I requested another move, which the hotel said was an upgrade. This final room was terrible - only a blackout blind and no screen meaning I was changing with the blackout blind down. The sink was broken, the bath stained, not all the light working and a broken lock on the door.

At this point I checked out a day early and went elsewhere.

This hotel stay was a terrible experience, severely overpriced. I would urge you to look elsewhere if you're staying in NYC.

title: Just a few days
text: If you don't have to drive in...don't. Room was very tight and had very little space to put anything. Shower was week. Enjoyed the Lobby and staff was very helpful and friendly. Good coffee! Pastry selection so so.  Location is excellent. Place looked clean all the time. The room was small but the bed was comfortable. I would not stay there for a prolonged period of time, although, I would like to see a bigger room. The price was to be expected, although, I'm not sure you get the bang for your buck. But like I said, if you want Time Square this is a good choice.

title: nice stay in NYC
text: Could not beat the price and location - right at times square and half the price of nearby hotels. my son asked for a window view and your team made sure we got a nice one on the 17th floor! very accommodating.

title: A stay close to time square
text:
Hôtel close to time square so it is practical. 
But Too much noisy even windows closed.
Very small room and bathroom.
So for me the price is not in accordance with the quality of the hotel. 
I recommend to book an hotel not close to the center in order to get cheaper price and better quality

title: The Hotel rooms were very cheap looking
text: Once we  arrived to the hotel it was very dark and gloomy.  There was a check in line. The room was way to small. I book a double room and normally when u boom a double bed room it's two queen size beds. Not this hotel,had two full size beds. Scratches on the wall. Bathroom sink coming apart. Hand towels and towels had stains on them. Room really didn't have no ventilation.  Hotel didn't even have coffee for guest

title: Great location, pretty lobby, not so great bedroom amenities
text: Shower pressure was horrible. It took forever for the water to get hot. a/c wasnt working and then when it was "fixed" it made noises throughout the night. The safe didn't work either. I hope they get to iz these little hiccups, because for the price,  they are not providing good quality

title: Not great.
text: The hotel has a great location. The interior is way too dark. We did book a room with 2 singles, it was so small, we both could not open our luggage. The bathroom sink leaked, it took 5 minutes for hot water for the shower. We were provided one towel each, no wash clothes, or hand towels. I could never get wifi on my ipad. The wifi went in and out on phone. There were stains all over on the carpet. There is scaffolding surrounding the hotel, so it does not look like the picture. We survived.

title: Convenient location, poor service.
text: The room was small but comfortable. Bring your own wash cloths and hand towels as the hotel does not provide them. (This is the only hotel I've seen do this.) Housekeeping did not replace the towels and I had to request more.

title: Beware of noise
text:
There is construction going on across the street, and if you are there on a weekday, they start at 7am and it is incredibly loud. If you like to sleep in beyond 7, bring some ear plugs because there is no way you’ll sleep through that ruckus without them. The beds are incredibly comfortable, but unfortunately the construction noise ruins that heaven-like mattress and pillows. 

You’ll also find the hotel is very minimalistic - you get two towels, no hand towels or washcloths. Very small table to sit at, no luggage rack to put suitcases on. If you like a cold room, A/C was not great for that (without opening the window, the room did not get below 72). Hot water doesn’t get very hot, and if it’s the morning, you’ll be lucky to get any ounce of the hot water at all. Don’t be fooled by the elegance of the lobby, the rooms are not the same level. 

Late checkout? Anything more than an hour will cost you (which isn’t stated on the website). Ask them to hold your bags if you have a later flight? They’re going to charge you for that too (cash only, so be prepared or get hit with a $4.50 ATM fee).

title: Alojamiento Perfecto
text: El paramount Hotel, esta super bien ubucado, en medio de manhatan, ideal para cualquier tipo de visista, bien sea de negocios, famila, pareja o lo que sea. Por su excelente ubicacion, optimizas tiempo y dinero en NY.

title: New York at its Best
text: The center of New York best things to do. This Amazing place is steps away from Times Square on my right Broadway and Restaurant row. We did not need a car. The staff was friendly. I will definitely recommend this beautiful hotel to others.

title: For the price, not the best
text: The shower had no hot water, there were no hand towels or washcloths in the bathroom, the bathroom window lock was broken, the main window was unlocked. Signs in the elevators were broken or missing. Some of the staff didn’t seem to know what they were doing for example when I first arrived I went to see if I could check in early and it took three people to figure out if there was a room ready or not. Then I was told that I could check my bags, which I had emailed about and was told I could, but no one told me it was going to cost anything which would have been nice to know so I could have had the cash. Overall I feel like for the price I paid for the room, it was not great. It was nice being right around the Theater District but that was the best part of the whole experience

title: Poor quality. Never stay again.
text:
Room had nothing inside only two towels, no coffee maker, one tiny table, lot of dead space. Poor air circulation, wall/AC unit was filthy dirty and clearly never serviced was busted non-operational.

Horrible stay, they charge you for each bag you leave before leaving day of checkout also.

title: Not a great experience for a wonderful city.
text:
I was very surprised there were no cups or coffee or tea in the room.  Not even in the lobby.  On 2nd day I did discover cups at the ice station on 4th floor.  But each day I had to dress and walk somewhere to find coffee.  There were no hand towels or wash clothes all three nights I was there.  Only large towels replaced each day.  There is a ridiculous facility/resort fee which provided nothing.  I was told it was for the gym and wifi.  I did not need either but they would not remove from my bill about $35 per night plus tax and they seemed embarrassed to explain it.  I forgot my razor to shave but front desk said sorry but there is a drug store a few blocks away.  Shouldn’t that be something covered in the resort fee ?  
I will stay at an Airbnb next time for clear instructions on fees and Ameneties as I was told most hotels now in NYC charge this ridiculous resort fee when they are not resorts.

title: Average Hotel... Great Location
text:
Great location... half a block from Times Square.
Felt very safe in this location.  There are a lot of police in the area, and because it is close to Times Square, the area was quite lit up at night.
For the price, it would have been nice to get a free breakfast, but we didn't get a free breakfast.
The hotel offered a shuttle service to the airport for $60 USD, which was awesome!!
There were only 2 bath towels in the bathroom... no hand towels or wash clothes.  There were no glasses in the room to use to brush my teeth.
The concierge was very helpful.
The lobby is large and beautiful!  Has a pool table and lots of very comfortable seating options.

our experience at the paramount hotel in time square was excellent, not only for the location of the hotel but also for its comfort and accessibility. The hotel staff treated us very well. Without a doubt, if I visit New York again, I would choose this hotel to stay.

title: Great Place for First Time Visit
text: The Paramount was a great place to stay for my first trip to NYC! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, but honestly perfect for my needs. While I enjoyed the atmosphere, a little more light would be appreciated—especially in the elevators where it was hard to see the buttons. My visit was mainly to see theatre and this is the perfect location. Opportunity to store bags after checkout is also a plus. I definitely recommend it and will stay here on the next visit.

title: Dark and depressing
text:
Excellent location for Times Square logistically.  Damaged interior in bathrooms, very dark and dingy hotel, poor signing to access upon arrival and had to get through group of men smoking weed upon arrival.
Basic basic basic. Ok if you are just wanting a bed for the night.

title: Some things I liked, some things not
text: The staff were great. The look of the lobby upon entry is lovely.  The small rooms, however, are not the best.  Problems with the toilet flushing properly the 5 days I was there.  The wait time in the lobby was also a bit problematic.

title: Great location, basic facilities
text:
If you're looking for a central location but with no frills, this might work for you. Don't expect anything in your room other than a bed, linens and TV - no tea or coffee, and no option for an iron (though a hand steamer is provided).

On the plus side, the wifi worked well and with good speeds, and the housekeeping team were efficient and friendly. Shower pressure was good, too.

On the downside, the Paramount has definitely seen better days. As it approaches its 100th birthday it's clearly looking a little shabby and run down in places. The carpet in my room looked stained and the windows looked like they were last cleaned in the last twenties… My room safe also refused to work.

Also, if you're travelling any time soon, bear in mind there's a full construction site just across the street at 46th and 8th, which means pile drivers from breakfast time every day.

At the price, and for the location, it seems churlish to complain too much - but revise your expectations to "it's a room and a bathroom, and everything else is a walk" and you'll be fine.

title: Size matters!
text:
Great location although a little noisy due to building work that started at 07:30 every morning. Reception area modern and impressive, however, this is not reflective of the bedrooms. The rooms are very small and in great need of renovation.
All this would have been ok if it wasn’t for the ‘facilities fee’. Non optional 21 dollars a night for facilities you would expect at any hotel (24 hour reception, wifi, water)

title: NYC Getaway
text: The staff was helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, and the location can’t be beat. My only small complaint is that it would be good to have plugs (and possibly tables) on both sides of the bed. We would definitely stay again.

title: No frills, but you can't beat the location!
text: I was nervous when I read some of the reviews, but we didn't have any issues with our room. It was very comfortable, and spacious enough for a Times Square hotel room. The closet provided the perfect amount of storage space. The beds were so comfortable, there was plenty of hot water, we were right near the ice room which had a water bottle refiller. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to NYC!

title: Dated Hotel in good location
text: The rooms were small as expected. Our first room smelled of mildew. Thankfully, the staff moved us with no questions asked. The second rooms heater didn't work properly and when "fixed" it made an awful sound the remainder of our stay. The staff was willing to help and make accomodations, but only so much they were able to do. The hotel is dated and we were told they were going to go through an update soon.

title: Very good
text: Hotel was very nice and updated on the inside. Only complaint was check-in took almost a half hour since only one staff member was helping with a difficult customer who backed uo the line, while the other staff members hid in the back room and peeked through a curtain rather than helping. The rest of the trip was smooth. Overall nice place

title: Trip to Times Square
text: Great location and cool lobby. Steps from Times Square and many theaters and restaurants. Room is compact with two comfy beds. Bathroom very tight, needs work. One small desk but no outlet nearby to plug in your device.

title: New York
text: Hotel and staff were fine.  Conceirge did not confirm early morning transport (4:50am) to airport with Apple Transportation.  We will not book transportation through the hotel nor through Apple Transport again!!!

title: Don’t do it
text:
Stains on the carpet 
Prison sink
End table for a desk table 
Old chair in the room 
Also you can tell it was a old apartment building cause it still had the old laundry shoot and it had some type of insulation coming out of it

title: Disappointed after a supposed renovation of the Paramount
text: The Paramount is located in Time Square, so if you are a theater person, its location is wonderful. The majority of rooms in NY hotels are very small. However, these rooms are even smaller. There is no restaurant nor doorman. So, you are on your own hailing a taxi. I'm on the fence as to whether I would stay again. The pricing looks great until they start adding all the taxes. You end up with an additional 50-100 dollars added to the room. However, this is true with all the hotels.

title: Great Location, crappy property
text: Perfect location, but except for the lobby, this hotel hasn't been upgraded in probably 30 years.  Miami-vice bathrooms, dark lobby, scaffolding and the restaurant was closed during the entire stay.  Hotel doesn't have washcloths, give you one piece of soap that is like the size of sliver of soap you throw away after it has been used to the point where it is no longer functional.

title: Ok hotel in a great location, but with unfair and stupid policies
text:
The hotel is very close to Times Square and all the theatres. Also close to the subway. The rooms are a decent size, but the bathrooms are small.

I ordered some replacement airpod tips (for $7) to the hotel and the hotel refused to give them to me unless I paid $10 in cash. This is extortion. Doesn't the hotel realize that we're paying them good money to make the hotel our home and you never pay to receive a package in your home. This cheapens the hotel and will stop me from staying here again.

title: No parking, so disappointed
text:
I was coming to stay at the Paramount Hotel in NYC with a group from work.
We were told they did not have any parking. 
My husband drives into the city often and always complains about parking.
I could not understand that such a   Good Hotel would not provide a parking option.
We booked another hotel.
The city is complicated enough without having to worry about parking.

title: Screams, construction, and bad decor
text: The vibe does not match the photos. It’s depressing inside, outdated. We were awoken during our stay by daily construction across the street, a woman screaming in our hall, and 8 am cleaners knocking.

title: Opening Night of Bad Cinderella
text: The staff was friendly, informative and accommodating both at check in and check out. I loved the open concept in the lobby with the pool table, separate seating areas, and the upstairs area. Although I did not use the gym, it was well equipped and clean. I loved the nostalgic photos throughout. Elevators were quick and easy. Our room was quite & comfortable. Thank you!

title: Not worth the price
text: While the location to Times Square and Broadway was amazing the amenities were subpar. No coffee make or ice available in the rooms. Washcloths and hair conditioner not provided. Our bathtub was dirty and old.  No store onsite to purchase necessities or snacks. Staff was not super friendly and inside lighting extremely dark.

title: Review
text: I loved the property! It was clean and the beds were comfy. Room was bigger than expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I couldn't have expected anything better. It truly made our trip to New york great!

title: Comfy beds but small rooms
text: Amazing location, right next to Times Square. The beds were spacious and comfy. However, the rooms were very small and cramped with little room to put belongings. The bathroom was small and you couldn’t use the toilet paper whilst sat on the toilet because it was so small. The shower didn’t work properly, with the water still coming out of the bath tap whilst showering. No tea/coffee facilities in the room and the safe didn’t work. The heating/air con didn’t work and when an engineer checked, it wasn’t even plugged in! However, value for money this was in the perfect location and a cozy stay.

title: My paramount stay
text: The overall property was clean and tidy. The staff did an exceptional job with their assistance and advice. They were very helpful and courteous. I would recommend to anyone who needs a central location at a great value and great staff this hotel.

title: Don’t expect luxury!
text: We stayed here because some travel companions picked it and we wanted to stay in the same hotel. Bummed that there was no coffee available anywhere in the facility, but shocked that they didn’t even have cheap plastic drinking glasses in the room. Bring your own cups if you don’t want to slurp from the faucet or use your hand as a cup. The place was clean, so that was good, but expected.

title: P&D in NYC
text:
Let's be honest you want to know the cons so lets start with that:
Room sizes vary but our 2 bed room felt smaller than what you would expect for a "4Star" property
The common areas like the  lobby have had a facelift but the rooms not so much. 
Construction next door and city sounds carry right through the single pained windows. 
The washroom in our room shows its age with lots of patch repairs.

With that said it is a great location , staff are incredible and the lobby can be a fun place to shoot some pool but you'll probably be enjoying the city! We got to take in a Broadway show steps from our hotel and enjoy our pizza tour with a few stops for tacos as we enjoyed the city lights.

title: Great place, but so noisy
text: The hotel is in the heart of Broadway, so location is amazing, within walking distance to Subway, restaurants, shows, etc. However, there is a construction right in front and they start at 7 am or before so you have late noise from the theaters around and early noise from heavy duty machinery working so, if you are a light sleeper, this is not the place to stay.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE. Massive LOUD Construction all night long - you cannot sleep!!
text:
HORRIBLE HOTEL. DO NOT STAY HERE. 

The location is good BUT there is MASSIVE LOUD CONSTRUCTION STARTING AT 1am. It is still going now at 7:50am as I write this review. Seriously the worst place ever. Zero chance of sleeping. Zero.

title: There’s def better places to stay at
text:
The staff at reception was super nice. Nothing I have to say is against them! 

However, The drywall in the hall outside my room
was water damaged. There was also a huge spot of water damage on the ceiling in my room.  

The room looked clean for the most part. What really bugged me was that my room was an adjoining room (to my surprise). The door to the room on the other side was locked, but considering the rooms were built as adjoining rooms the guests next door were VERY close. I could hear their TV, I could hear them move, cough, and laugh.

If you want water or ice you’ll have to go to the 4th floor. The ice machine was broken— the face of the machine was hanging on by a thread. The water cups are tiny meaning multiple trips to the 4th floor during the night if you become thirsty like me. 

The chromecast didn’t work and No breakfast included—Which would be fine but $300 was too much for all that.

title: Could do better
text: The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quiet, but the hotel has slipped from what it was when we stayed pre-pandemic. Simple things that one expects in a hotel room and that add to the comfort of the stay, like luggage holders, water glasses in the bathroom, and wash cloths no longer seem to be provided. They seem to be focusing on attracting high school and college groups, which is unfortunate, but probably necessary to stay open.

title: The worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at.
text:
By far the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Read the reviews and you’ll see a common pattern. You walk in and the lobby is nice… and that’s where the pleasantries end. 

The rooms are TINY. I could literally almost touch the wall at the end of my bed with my feet. It was also disgusting and definitely hadn’t even been wiped down. There was dust everywhere. The whole place was falling apart- shower floor was peeling, chunks of the headboard gone, and the plugs were so loose I could barely keep my charger in. 

Another common theme is they skimp on the towels. When we arrived there was ONE towel and the staff made me feel like I was crazy asking for more. 

I’ve never been more eager to leave a hotel. Never again.

title: Cool, top location, small bed and room
text: The position is top, 2 minutes walk from Time Square. The hotel is cool. Unfortunately, the room was really small and the bed too: it was not a double bed, ut was one and an half, so it was not much comfortable sleeping there in 2. Very clean and good views

title: Stay away from this place
text: Great location and staff were quite nice, but the rooms are old, toilets hardly work and you might as well be on the street because you can hear everything.  3a and the drunks may have just as well been in my room.  Halls smelled like pot the entire time we were there.  Never again.

title: Tiny weeny bare bones hotel
text:
Location made bearable. 

I had stayed here years ago before renovation. I knew rooms would be small - but wow, guess we are now bigger. My husband and I had virtually no room to walk around and this is the first time we crammed ourselves into a double bed in over 50 years! You open door and bed takes up most width of the room! 

The person who booked the room and paid for it had asked for a king. King it was not!!

We got to our rooms at 11 pm. I checked and there was just one towel! Called down for more and phone rang forever. Finally one more bath towel, and another hand towel was brought up. No wash cloths!!!!

Also There were no cups. Fortunately we had our own water bottles. Two room plugs did not work at all. Toilet paper was scratchy. 

But location great. Room was quiet and clean. Bed made up each day. We tip well! 

The theme is DARK in lobby. As in pitch black dark. Glad I had a cane to navigate. 

Bathroom small but ok. Tub had no hand rails at all and was hard to get in and out. Beware! 

But location great. Pizza joint next door had $3. slices and a food cart on corner great freshly made breakfast sandwiches. No coffee in room or lobby. Have to walk to corner to get your Joe. 

Easy walk to three theaters and restaurants. A big plus. 

Uber came to door. No doorman to help. 

Long checkin lines. 

Were able to store luggage. A plus. 

Rarely complain and it appeared full but was not a super cheap place. Think about 260 per night.

title: It was good for a short trip
text: Came for a business trip, it was a small room and perfect for what I needed. Staff is very friendly and there are plenty of food option right be the hotel. A quick 1 minute walk to Times Square. Only problem I had was my ac/heat wasn’t working.

title: Worst hotel I've stayed in
text: Easily the worst hotel I have stayed in. The lobby fools you into thinking it may be a decent hotel, but the rooms look like a barely cleaned hostel. We couldn't find working outlets in the room to save our lives, there were no towels for us because "the laundry service didn't deliver that day", our ac was broken and so loud when it DID momentarily turn on that my 9 year couldn't sleep,  and there was no warning about 7am construction. I am so glad we only stayed for 1 night, but for almost $400 I was expecting at least basic amenities.

title: Value just isn’t there
text: Room was $250. Room is tiny (ok in NYC), but also out of date and not as clean as I would have liked. They charge a ridiculous fee to store luggage briefly after checkout. Long lines at reception.noisy.

title: 1 Night stay at Paramount Hotel
text: Location of the hotel is amazing, beside Broadway, only minutes walk to any of the theatres in the district. Great restaurants around as well. Hotel itself is beautiful and room quality for the price is not too bad. We didn't spend much time in the room but we did notice that water was running very slow in shower and sink and there was ALOT of noise from a nearby factory from about 6:30am. This is the perfect location to be at with a very affordable NY price if you're planning to just be in the hotel room for short periods of time.

title: This property has seen better days
text: Once a cutting edge hotel property, this property is WAY past its prime and is in desperate need of an update. It felt like a hotel you stay at because it was once cool but is now really cheap. I wouldn't stay there again unless it received a complete overhaul.

title: TOURIST BEWARE!!! DO NOT BOOK - WORSE NYC HOTEL
text:
This hotel is awful, pls do not stay here. One , my friend and I live in NJ/LI and stayed over bc we had a business dinner and did not want to commute home. We looked into hotels tonight and this hotel popped up for $161.00 ( plus resort fee collected at hotel). First the hotel is very dark as you enter, the staff aren't even dressed in front desk attire instead an Adidas hoodie which was very professional. Our room was a SHOEBOX which it is NYC okay fine by that, but forget that it was SOO DIRTY, no towels and when I asked for towels - I was told I asked for too many and they have a lack of towels to supply guests.

We complained to hotels tonight who got us in touch with Omar the front desk manager who took 3 hours to contact me , I was not chasing him down for a " new " room he told our 3rd party booking agent he would provide us with, finally after I did call and left him a VM - he called me back and claimed "miscommunication". We went down to get our new room key and they put us in a much spacious room with  a King bed- foolish me to think that was a kind gesture by Omar. 

We woke up to a construction ZONE across our room - that started at 6:30am, technically NYC is not allowed to start until 7am but they must have had a special permit ( I know this bc my bf is in construction). we changed rooms at 10:30 pm we did not even think to open up the window to look outside. 

 Please do not waste your $ at this hotel, imagine I was a tourist and woke up to that construction zone outside my window or had children and wanted to sleep in a bit. 

We told Hotels Tonight they shouldn't even have this listed as an option

title: Great hotel
text: I went with my brother and the hotel is great it was comfortable and the location was great we didn’t need to get in a taxi or anything everything was near the hotel privacy is great too 100% good experience

title: Noisy Stay
text: Our stay at the Paramount Hotel in room 1236 was Unsatisfactory, do not stay in room do not stay in this room! I was awakened by constant annoying construction noise which began at about 7:15 am or so this morning, and it was relentless. Due to this noise I could not sleep in until my intended actual wake up time. I tried camouflaging the noise with the TV unsuccessfully, as the noise was too loud. I looked out of the window and I became aware that I had been given a room which was located directly in front of the construction site. I have also emailed the manager Mr. Kavanagh regarding my stay, but he has yet to respond.

title: Can’t be 4 stars
text:
Not comfortable and not clean only the location is perfect …. Noise and and bathroom not clean, very old carpet and very old mattress, the best thing in the hotel is location and security. 
Very disappointed

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Family friendly hotel with amazing location near Time Square, restaurants and theater. Easy access to train and buses.  Very walkable.  Lovely rooms (a tad small), but it has everything you need for a short stay.

title: convenient but tiny rooms with some broken things
text: The room was clean but tiny, with the bed taking up 90% of the floor space. No outlet near the small "work" desk, so not convenient to plug in a laptop. The only free outlet, besides the bathroom outlets, did not work so I had to unplug the clock to charge the phone or laptop. I was on the 15th floor and could hear heating/air conditioning units and a lot of street noise, but hey, it's just off of Times Square so you can't expect otherwise as far as street noise goes. An atmospheric lobby with a pool table and comfy couches, and for the location a good price.

title: bad experience in hotel
text:
Verbal abuse and bad attention from the receptionist (woman at checkin moment).
heating malfunction, safety box didn't work (the personal changed my room 2 times).
poor lighting in reception and elevators.

title: Nice Hotel, great Location!
text:
great location! Had that there is no buffet. Bond 45, the restaurant next to the breakfast was not particularly professional. The Rooms was clean, Great Hotel! 

I would take again!

The hotel itself was great!

title: Vero good hotel in amazing place
text: Very good hotel in amazing place to visit New York. Near Times Square and a lor of services (pub, restaurant, supermarket, shopping, bakery, POI). The staff are very friendly. In Hotel is present a gym.

title: First Visit to NY
text: I booked this hotel on the fly after having the worst time with a reservation at the Hilton Times Square.  The lady at the Paramount reception desk recognized my stress and got me into a room within 5 minutes of my arrival.  She was the first helpful person I had encountered.  While the room was no frills, it's literally a block from Time Square!  Also, given it's right across the street from Hamilton and that close to Time Square, you'd think the rooms would be noisy but no, I had no problem sleeping through the night.  Also, the bed was super comfortable and, while it took the shower a minute to get hot, it had amazing water pressure and super hot water!

title: Weekend in New York
text: Good hotel, clean, great location. Rooms were clean and housekeeping was nice. Rooms could have had coffee for those of us that need that first cup quickly. Also they need more front desk staff as I waited in line 30 mins to check in. That said I would stay again as it a great location, clean, and a great price.

title: In the heart of the Theater District and Times Square
text: It is at the heart of Times Square, small, but clean room. Friendly staff, elevators only accessible by room key card. Reservation does not include breakfast of any kind and bathroom sink was leaking, also it took me 45 mins of standing in line to be able to check in into the hotel because there was only 1 person at the front desk.

title: Incredible location for seeing shows, but the rooms themselves are very bare-bones
text: Perfect location for access to broadway and Times Square, but the rooms themselves (can’t speak for the suites, this is regarding “Superior Queen” rooms) are spartan at best so you’ll be happy to stay here if you plan on spending as little time in the room as possible. Good value for the location if you’re looking for a place to sleep and little else.

title: Not worth it
text: Room was very small, bathroom even worse. Did not want to shower in there. Was hair on the bed. Long wait line to check in. Never received the wifi code. Toilet could barely flush. Only good thing is the location and the lobby looks nice.

title: Nice stay
text: Great location to see a show.  My room was very clean, and very quiet as well.  Tony and AJ, at the front desk, were very friendly and helpful.  The price was one of the lowest I found in the city. I thought the lobby was a bit dark, but that was fine.  Would definitely stay again if I was in town to go to the theater.

title: Broadway stay
text: The Paramount Hotel was easy to get to and convenient to everything shows, restaurants,and Time Square I could walk to everywhere or hop on a bus or the subway if need be. I would stay here again if I was planning another trip to NYC.

title: 1/5 would not recommend
text: Compared to the price, the rooms were very small and so was the bathroom. I have seen better rooms and bathroom in a $70 motel. No cold water in shower, barely any accessories provided to shower. I was charged $40 over at the property even tho had paid over 200 beforehand online not including the 100 refundable deposit.

title: AMAZING!
text: Beautiful hotel, very polite staff! Perfect location for those looking to be close to times square! A few cafes and a Dunkin all on the same corner. Unfortunate view from our room due to construction, but no complaints because the real view comes from your sight seeing travels! 10/10 would recommend and return!!!!!!!

title: Surprising experience.
text: Uncomfortable room/bathroom the worse. Old and bad layout, toilet uncomfortable. Vent not working in bathroom. Ac and heather not working. Called front desk they came in but still wasnt fixed. Windows dont block noise from outside. Couldnt sleep from so much noise, elevator buttons had to be pressed multiple times every time and hard presses for it to work. Annoying and uncomfortable at the same time. Not a 4 star hotel not even close. Stayed  at hard rock before which is 5 star was 10x better.

title: Just the basics
text:
Great location close to Times Square and theater district. We took the train into Penn Station and walked about 15 minutes to the hotel. We easily walked to our show at the Eugene O’Neil Theater, about 6 min walk.
