Rooms are small and very basic, and spotless! Bed, bathroom, small closet, small desk, TV. Hair dryer provided, shampoo and body wash. No alarm clocks, no wash cloths in bathroom, towels are just fine. 
Bed and pillows very comfortable! Noise from street was minimal. 
Lobby/Reception area is very dark. Sony Hall is connected to the lobby and serves some food, but very limited and was all packaged or pre-made. Mostly it’s a bar, with a nightclub downstairs. The nightclub has a separate entrance and does not interfere with your stay. 
I can’t say that this hotel would be very family-friendly…the rooms are small with few amenities. Likely best for couples, adults, groups of friends.
Tony and AJ at the front desk were so kind and helpful when we checked in. 
For one night in NYC, there just to sleep, it was fine!

title: TERRIBLE HOTEL - SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE
text:
Too much went wrong .. here's a few
- Giant vomit stain in the bedroom between the bed
- everything is dusty
- bathroom looks like a prison cell
- found hair in the bathroom before we even used it
- toilet is soo beat up; it looks like poo stains in the bowl
-shelves are soo dirty in the closet
- if something slides under the bed ... let it go, don't bother reaching down there
- AC/Heat vent is SOOO loud you will get no sleep all night
- there is barbed wire outside your window - what a view - WHO are they keeping out??
- Something went terribly wrong in the room next to us and we saw forensics bags getting brought out by cops
- cops outside our room for like 12 hours waiting for a suspect to return next door
- not a safe area, lots of sketchy people walking around outside
- water pipe burst in the main lobby on the last night as if everything else wasn't already sh*t

Afterall this - 0 Attempts made to compensate us for any troubles.

title: Find another hotel
text: I would avoid this place at all costs. The staff is friendly but there are no amenities at all. There is no fridge in the room, the carpets are dingy and the air conditioning/heat doesn’t work well at all. We had to call twice to get someone to fix the air conditioner/heat which the second time was unsuccessful so we ended up sweating all night and opening a window. The windows are cheap and allow all the sounds of NYC right into your room all night. Coffee is $4 for a small 12oz cup, nothing is complementary. There aren’t ice buckets, they have oddly shaped reusable bags that they advised us to use. The bathroom is much to be desired with a (public-like) toilet that barely flushed. The room at check in has no towels, and the tub had particles in it. There are many other hotels in the area at similar pricing. We had selected this hotel based on the photos, only to find out our they were either photoshopped or from years ago. I’d recommend other hotels in the area.

title: Need Vending and more cleanliness
text: We would not stay there again nor would we recommend it to anyone.  Bathroom in room not clean, shower walls. Also no cups at water station and no vending available anywhere or anything. StAFF VERY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY THOUGH.

title: Paramount hotel
text: Excellent location, very nice and helpful employees, very clean and relaxing atmosphere. there was plenty to do in the hotel and the surrounding areas in times square, and it wasn’t too far from the subway. overall great experience!

title: Great for a quick trip!
text: Room was ready EARLY - which was so amazing! Room was small, but we literally only slept there as the goal was to be out and about in NYC all day. Broken cold water tap in bathroom. But again, we literally stayed one night. Did NOT realize there was an extra $40 hotel fee since I booked through Expedia - probably didn't read the fine print. That's on me.

title: Economical clean rooms close to Times Square
text: Amazingly friendly and accommodating front desk staff. I appreciated the closet and safe in the room. I knew there would be limited bathroom amenities, but it would have been nice to at least have a hand towel and washcloth. My thermostat stopped working-a maintenance staff replaced the batteries but the temperature setting never worked.

title: Pretty decent place to stay
text: Not bad overall. Pretty quite even though it was so close to Times Square. Can’t beat the location if that’s what you care about. Relatively close to subway access as well. Pretty clean. Just smallish rooms for the price.

title: Bad Hotel good location
text: I do not recommend this hotel. It’s great location but it’s dirty, no security, rooms are extremely tiny, no coffee maker or anything complementary, the A/C broke 2 times and the rooms pillows are terrible pancake literally. The hotel is expensive and not worth it. We paid almost $1,000 for 3 days and nothing included.

title: Paying for the location, not the hotel
text: I found and booked this hotel through my JetBlue account, so I didn't look directly on their website or TripAdvisor for reviews. That said, the location is phenomenal. It's about 6 doors down from Times Square and directly across from 2 of the theaters. The theater we went to (Walter Kerr) was only a street away and was a 4 minute walk. Perfect for a quick weekend trip. That said, the location is the end of the amenities. The lobby is significantly nicer than anywhere else in the hotel. The elevators required a keycard to choose a floor but not consistently. Sometimes you could just click a number and one of the elevators had a missing keycard reader. There's no security anywhere inside or outside the hotel either if that feels important. The room looks like a micro hotel. I've had better towels at cheaper hotels elsewhere in the country. I was glad I brought my own wash cloths because the room didn't have any. The bathroom also had a 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner, another shame and inconsistent with much cheaper hotels I've stayed at that offer proper sizes of body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. The rooms were very quiet though, I didn't hear a single neighbor during our trip. There was a problem with the air conditioner and maintenance came very promptly to fix it. That said, the room never got below 73 degrees even with the air set to 64 and blowing all night. Even for the middle of winter, we were rather uncomfortable with the temperature.

title: Amazing Stay near Times Square
text: Fantastic stay.  Very clean rooms and facilities.  Very close to Times Square.  Very professional, friendly and attentive staff.  We had an issue with the heater at around 1:30am and the on hotel technician was there to resolve the issue within 5 minutes of calling the front desk.  Excellent.

title: Good location not so good hotel
text: Had to change rooms due to noise from construction to a room with a non working A/C and neighbors who were smoking in a non smoking facility. A couple of sleepless nights, but staff were quick to respond and seem to be understanding and polite.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square a good option!
text: I was seeing a show at Sony Hall next door and it was getting out late, and I’m from CT, so I decided to stay over at the Paramount and it worked out well! Room was small but perfectly fine, clean, a very good value! I would stay there again and definitely recommend! Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Broadway trip
text: Planned a quick 3 night trip to watch a Broadway show. My friend and I wanted a location near by and the price was right. There was one issue with the heater not being able to be fixed but we were moved to a higher floor. I would go back if I were to have future plans visiting NYC.

title: Super Lage für Städtetrip, Zimmer klein
text:
Wir haben dort ein paar Tage in der Vorweihnachtszeit gewohnt, eine Familie mit zwei Kindern und ein Paar. Das Doppelzimmer war klein, aber ruhig und hatte ein Fenster zum Hof, die Klimaanlage konnte nicht von Hand eingestellt werden. Das Bad war winzig, aber für die paar Tage ausreichend. Mit großen Koffern sollte man jedoch nicht reisen, weil dafür im Zimmer kein Platz ist. Die Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption waren freundlich, allerdings gelegentlich auch vom Besucher -Ansturm überlastet. 
Die Familie wohnte mit zwei Kindern in einem Zimmer mit zwei Doppelbetten, von denen jedes wirklich schmal war. Ein solches Zimmer für vier Personen zur Verfügung zu stellen, war nicht richtig, weil nicht ausreichend. Das Bad war genauso groß wie das im Doppelzimmer.
Die ganze Lobby ist extrem düster, aber groß und mit Billardtisch in der Mitte – das ist nicht jedermanns Sache. Auch die Fahrstühle sind so düster, dass man die Zahlen auf den Etagenknöpfen nicht gut lesen kann. Dafür sind die Fahrstühle super schnell.
Super, klasse ist die Lage des Hotels zum Timesquare, denn dort ansässigen Geschäften, Theatern und Kinos. Das geht kaum besser bei diesem Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis.

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Emplacement excellent, pour visiter Manhattan , à 100 m de Times Square. Personnel de la réception professionnel, notamment Omar et Bryant qui a eu à me surclasser à la chambre 1535 offrant une belle vue sur des gratte-ciel de Manhattan. Seul bémol le Chantier attenant avec sa pollution sonore. Mais cela n est pas un problème si vous n y restez que pour dormir le soir. 
Autres avantages la proximité des restaurants, magasins de souvenirs et du supermarché Target en sous sol situé sur la 42 iem rue , ainsi que l arrêt de Top view à 100 m permettant de visiter les différentes attractions de MAnhattan !
(-) plus de lumière au niveau des ascenseurs est souhaitable. De même que la gratuité de la garde des bagages après le Check out: 2 € par bagages, quelque soit leur dimension, c est inadmissible!!!

title: Deceptive and Dilapidated - Don't Bother
text:
In short: avoid this hotel. My first gripe is one that I bare some responsibility for: the "resort fee." I booked through a 3rd party that, to their credit, did specify in the fine print afterward that there was a resort fee to be paid upon check-in. It's $40 a night. This is a deceptive practice designed to make hotel rooms appear cheaper than what they really are, leaving guests in a difficult situation once they book. If you book with the hotel directly and show up, it's not easy to just find another hotel at the last minute. And they're still going to charge you for the first night, anyway. If you book through a 3rd party, you won't be able to cancel the reservation at all.

The resort fee covers, by the way, access to a rather mediocre hotel gym. You are paying $40 a day extra to use the gym. This practice should be illegal. I've only just checked in and I'm here for several days and I'm already unhappy. Not just because of that experience, but also because the hotel is in disrepair. Our room looks like it got "the landlord special" and is falling apart; see images. This hotel really has the unmitigated gall to try and dupe guests and it's not even a nice facility. 

Absolutely cannot disrecommend this hotel enough.

title: Not the old paramount I used to know.
text: It looks like the administration is another, there is no a place to take breakfast, the rooms have not maintenance, the public areas are dirty. The heater in the rooms in winter time doesn’t works properly.

title: Great location
text:
It’s a New York hotel you get what you paid for 
Great location friendly staff and pretty cool lobby the bar closes late so it’s ideal for a night cap after running around the city 
Right in the theater district ideal for couples

title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel
text: More like 3 star at best. Decent for what it actually is. Lobby is catchy and the attached bar is pretty decent. Price was not bad and overall accommodations were average. Staff seemed to be friendly and attentive enough.

title: Update Bathrooms
text: Please do some work in your bathrooms if they are not updated!! Bathroom cleanliness is a very important part of a comfortable stay for me and my friends. Thank you for an excellent stay otherwise, we appreciate it.

title: Excelente localização
text: O hotel é limpo, cama confortável e muito bem localizado, bem no coração daTimes Square. Você consegue conhecer a cidade à pé ou indo por uma das diversas estações do metrô no seu entorno. Recomendo demais

title: Relentless noise
text: No wonder this aging property has such competitive room rates. There's no parking, no valet, and no assistance with parking; the vintage shop advertised on the website never opened; there's no bar or cafe as advertised; the carpet in the rooms is threadbare; it's impossible to talk to a human being if you need to adjust your reservation; and most of all, the noise at this site is unrelenting. At 7 a.m. the giant construction site across the street started going full blast; there was supplemental noise even closer, so I looked out the tiny window and saw a guy with a welding torch on the roof outside. Pffft. Being able to sleep is a pretty basic expectation for a hotel room.

title: Little People Bathrooms
text: If you're over 5'5 don't bother staying here. I literally had to squat to use the toilet as it was made for someone no taller than 5ft. Same issue w/the sink. Great location but they don't even offer free water or coffee.

title: Be aware of hidden charges
text: Hidden charges. Charged me twice the amount that was shown as the total on the booking. I will make sure write reviews on this topic everywhere. I complied but they don't care. Terrible experience, would never come back!

title: Rooms are tight and walls are thin
text: I came for a conference that was in Times Square. I stayed here for the price. Don’t book you room thru hotels tonight as the hotel will charge you an extra facility fee per night on top of paying hotels tonight. Room is tight amd floor carpet was dirty. Bathroom n room overall is very tight. Walls are thin. We heard the vacuum in next room at 9 am. So disturbing on a Sunday morning. For these reasons I will not stay here again

title: Disappointed
text: This hotel wasn't anything that I expected. It was like staying in a dorm room. My bathroom wasn't clean , there wer bugs coming out of the shower drain, they don't provide washclothes, in which I had to wait 30 minutes for hand towels. I ended up going to Target to get the items tha I needed. This was a very disappointing stay.

title: Won't be coming back
text: Was there for two nights for a work trip. Shower was clogged. Heat didn't work at first and then when maintenance fixed it, the heater was so loud, it kept waking me up during the night. Card readers in elevators were very finicky. Location in Times Square is great, but the price isn't worth the issues, in my opinion.

title: Going down slow
text: The hotel is getting shabby, still clean but not pristine. Half the common areas are closed off and the open ones are showing a lot of wear. The tiny rooms are fine for an overnight or maybe a weekend.  The "resort fee" is in no way justified by any resort type amenities.

title: Room was very disappointing.
text: The lobby is very luxurious, but the luxury ends there. The elevator was very old and difficult to use. The room was very outdated and many cheap aspects in the room. The electrical sockets were also broken.

title: 2 day stay
text: My only comment is the lighting in the elevators was extremely dim. It was difficult to see the buttons on the board. It also was a safety concern, as a woman traveling alone. Room was cute and clean.

title: My Paramount Trip
text: The Hotel was okay for one night, but it was not as satisfactory as it was when the hotel was in it's glory in the late 90's and early 2000's. If I had to stay more then one night I would have not been so forgiving.

title: The KING bedrooms are SMALL
text: not what we expected - the bed was to small - we asked to be moved to another room for the bedsize first, and cleanliess second.  everything is extremely outdated. The front desk staff isn't old enough to know what good customer service is so it's lackluster.  They wear hoodies and tshirts to work.

title: Wet carpets, no wash clothes, no water cups, failing paint
text: I used to love this place in the 90’s and 2000’s.  It is now just “Inches” from being a roach motel.  Terribly understaffed and when you call on the phone, it will ring for 5 rings then disconnect you.  It was infuriating just trying to get cups to hold water for the night.  Will not go back under current management/ownership.

title: Oh dear…. Not a great stay
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel 5 or 6 times over the last 10 years and have always recommended it to people when staying.  So much so, I decided to use it for my work colleagues on a recent business trip and sadly were really disappointed.  Our initial check-in was incredible and the receptionist who dealt with is was full of energy, seemed genuinely interested in us as guests and was a real credit to the team.  We had 3 rooms allocated, all rather small and in varying states in terms of condition.  My 2 colleagues reported no hot water and were not dealt with particular well back at reception and after a theatre visit still had no hot water at 11pm.  They were eventually moved.  Whilst I had hot water, the tap was faulty and was running all night, part of the head board was ripped and handing over the bed and the room genuinely needed a thorough clean. I had attempted to open the window to get some air but the whole pane came away from the runners and I had to leave resting against the frame. 
I was moved the next day to a nicer room and before moving my luggage checked the water… alas no hot water at all. 
Another trip to reception and I was moved to lovely room that finally had hot running water.   The receptionist that dealt with her check-in handled herself brilliantly, but other interactions during the stay were met with some disinterested individuals who struggled to look up from a phone screen. 
The hotel just seems tired, the lifts were hit and miss and the swipe card entry system once in the left leaves little to be desired - most units seem broken and if you aren’t quick you will find yourself on the top floor with no way of changing where it is going. 
The attached bar is fine, but staff seem to interchange when they give you a resident discount or not and seem geniuinely uninterested in your custom - a closed sign was on the outside door for 2 days despite the fact they were ‘open’. 
One staff member mentioned that they opened too soon, so I really do hope this is a glitch and the hotel gets back on better form.  You can’t beat it location wise, but the disrepair in some instances was not acceptable.  You really need to read the details clearly, get the wrong room and you will feel like you are inside a box, get it right and you feel more relaxed. 
I will remain hopeful that things will improve, but right now I can’t justify taking my business colleagues there again. 
IF you are booking, Times Square and the theatres are literally right outside the door but at no point do you feel stuck in a tourist trap. 
Disney are building a hotel across the road and so there was incessant drilling from 7am every day in the week.

title: Nice hotel
text: The hotel is very nice, although the rooms aren’t gigantic it’s not a bad price point for being where it is In the city. I would recommend if you’re just looking for a quick nice stay in the city. No room service was kind of a bummer though.

title: Never again
text: Don’t do it. The worse experience. The place is going down hill as I was told after the booking by an employee. She was telling the truth. Toilet was a disaster. Noise from the construction was insane.

title: Horrible
text: Rude staff. Nasty place. The place does not have wash cloths, front staff told us we could walk to Walgreens at midnight and buy some if wanted them. Rooms were like an asylum. Bathroom was like a cruise ship except worse.

title: Smudges smears gunk
text: No surface has gone untouched. I know this because as I looked around any surface that a person could reach had a smudge or smear and a thick dust was on the areas that people could not reach. Under the bed was literally gunk and old toys and strands of long hair and pencils 3 old socks (4 ww the one I left not wanting to reach under there) and a doll and a child’s ring … that I could see.

title: Don’t stay here
text: I don’t know how this is rated a 4-star hotel on google. Though the lobby is pretty, the good things about the hotel pretty much stop there. It’s like staying in a hostel. Though the bed was fairly comfortable, the heat didn’t work because they have it set to go off after about 20 minutes (the maintenance guy straight up told me this) and even after he fixed it, it didn’t work properly. It didn’t get warmer than 70 in my room and I was very cold overnight both nights. I asked for extra blankets and never received them. The tub did not drain and they never offered to come look at it. I had no wash clothes or hand towels and they told me the hotel does not carry wash clothes. I’ve never in my life heard of this. I asked for hand towels and never received them. The location is good but there are other hotels in the area with comparable or just a little more expensive pricing. Stay somewhere else!

title: Great Location
text: Small rooms, but perfect location. We were able to walk almost everywhere we needed to go and the Marquis theater was across the street which was the main reason for our trip. The lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are tiny, but other than no fridge in my room, we enjoyed our stay. House keeping was awesome!

title: Convenient and quiet!
text:
Despite being so close to time square and construction, there was almost no road noise for our 3rd floor room. 

Incredibly nice staff at check in. There was an included concierge that we did not end up needing. The location!! is perfect if you're going to see a show, visit in time square or just wander around for a day or two. 

All around good value

title: Great Place a block off Times Square
text:
Bathroom is small so be prepared, no mirror in bedroom so it's a good idea to bring a mirror if two of you are putting on makeup. Other than that it's a beautiful hotel and a great location. 
Check in was very, very slow and we were ready to explore the city.

title: Dated rooms, worn out, mattresses, cheap towels…
text: The Paramont used to be a funky call moderately priced hotel in Midtown West Manhattan. However, now the rooms are beat up the mattress was terrible. Overly fluffy to mask the lack of support in the mattress. There were stains on the carpet. The bathroom had chips in the tile, chips, and the paint, two metal shelves that were crooked, and no hand soap. And let me add the cheapest towels on the planet. I’m really sorry but, they were really terrible. If I wasn’t a bit buzzed after going to concerts and barhopping, I would’ve left and went to another hotel. It’s quite a shame that this place has gone so far downhill. But it could recover it just needs a complete overhaul in the rooms.

title: Loved it!
text: How did I not know this hotel was here? We loved it. Room 1620 is what you want if you want total silence for sleeping. Cannot wait to return! Very walkable. Very clean. Great lobby. Secure elevator system.

title: Good Overall
text: Went here for a nice one night stay since I'm from NYC and wanted a quick getaway. Fine overall. The staff are amazing. Bathroom had issues. Bathtub floor was dirty and stained. The sink had a leaky faucet as well as the hot and cold handles were leaky.

title:
Worst hotel IV ever ever ever stayed in... 
I wouldn't even give the room a star only i had 2... 
Stains on the carpet..
text:
Holes by the windows.... 
Freezing cold every night... 
Staff told the same 4 quest who complained that it's just brought over n only the lobby as been refurbished...
Rooms our a joke, I was told I could get a refund if I want to book another hotel then the cheek I'd have to wait few weeks for refund, only took me a year to pay for it... 
My daughter's Xmas present... 
Ruined the trip as I hated every thing about the dated room witch is nothing like it says... A joke that there getting away with the false advertising... 
Believe the reviews don't book this hotel it's shocking I stayed in better hostels

title: Was fun!!
text: Only issue was no breakfast but the view and location was amazing! Staff was so so nice and it was a beautiful hotel. The beds were so comfortable and I enjoyed my first experience in NYC and I definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Budget Hotel at best
text: Paramount is a ok hotel. It's very close to Times Square, you can easily walk there. We felt safe staying there. The room was bare bones, no amenities. It's a place to sleep, but don't plan on spending time in hotel. We had issues with water and a/c. It was clean, safe and close walking distance to everything. I probably wouldn't stay again.

title: atención a lo que se rompe
text: Buena ubicacion,muy buen servicio,en la reception y en la habitación, las hab itaciones son pequeñas,pero practicas,solo poner atención a los pequeño detalles, los que se van rompiendo,como en el baño de la habitación 1642,las tohallas y sabanas muy limpias y olian muy bien

title: Average but good value
text:
Very   reasonable  priced   hotel.
Very   central   location   near   Times   Square.
Lobby   too   dark.
Cloakroom   in    public   lobby   area  in    bad     condition  -  no faucet   in   one    cubicle.
Mattresses   were    very    soft.
Hanging  rail  missing from one   closet.

title: Rooms are Terrible
text: We stayed here during the new year’s weekend. The lobby and location is the only thing appealing at this hotel. The rooms are in bad condition they are deteriorating. Not only that but they are small. We had to pay more to upgrade but the second room was just as bad.

title: Bait and Switch Hotel prices
text: Made reservation using Booking.com, which at the time was the cheapest for our timeframe. The information for the hotel clearly said, taxes and fees included. Once the reservation was made, there was a HUGE increase in cost. We tried work with Booking.com, they said that the increase was on the hotel's side who was refusing to budge, saying it was their taxes and fees, which on booking, we clearly paid. All in all, we actually ended up paying double for this room. We could have ended up at a really nice hotel instead of the matchbox rooms we did end up with at the Paramount. There were no amenities, such as coffee in the room, no fridge, no sink space, or drawer space. There was a king bed, and a small table. The space between the bed and the TV hanging on the was minimal, barely enough to just walk by. The staff was also very rude and not in any way ready to holp with what had happened. The check in time was a good 45 minutes as well, due to the fact that only one person was working the front desk at peak times for check in. PROS: The location of the hotel was excellent. Close to Times Square and the transit of your choice. Recap: If you have a choice do not stay at this hotel. It's not worth the extra feet you may need to walk to stay somewhere that is actually nice, up to date and worth the money. And you won't need to deal with the bait and switch we did.

title: Better than expected, great location
text:
Having booked this hotel in Jan 2022, whilst it was still closed for refurbishment, I was a little concerned to read so many poor reviews following it’s reopening. 
However, our stay here was just fine! 
The room was an OK size. If you’re going to NYC, don’t expect a large suite unless you’re willing to pay the big bucks. The room could do with a lick of paint & updating in general, but it was OK as it was. 
The bathroom was dated and could probably do with an update, however everything was in working order & house keeping cleaned it up lovely everyday. 
There were a few complaints about lifts in previous reviews - we had no issues & waited no longer than 1 min each time. The lobby area is very nice.
The location of the hotel is PERFECT. Couldn’t ask for much better. This really makes up for any little complaints you may have.
There were construction works across the street, and we had a room on this side of the hotel, however they worked during the day whilst we were out, so we didn’t really notice other than slightly ruining the view (if you looked down).
We had to pay to store our bags on check out day, which was a little annoying. 
If you are like us and using this as a place to sleep (who is in the room for more than just that whilst exploring New York??), then you will be just fine.

title: Absolutely terrible hotel! Avoid, avoid, avoid!!!
text: Worst hotel.. not 4 star.. barely 2 star! Penitentiary like bathroom.. No mini bar.. heater was not functioning properly so had to call engineer in every night to reboot! No views.. lifts always busy.. have to go to 4th floor for water..

title: Most terrible sleep I’ve had
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Paramount for five nights to experience New Year’s in New York City for the first time. The hotel lobby and the hotel employees overall were fantastic and very friendly and the lobby was very clean and beautiful. However, once you get into the elevators and head toward your room you get a completely different experience. The elevators only worked half the time and often times you would get stuck going up and down to different floors because the buttons wouldn’t work correctly. They were also very creaky and old.
The rooms are very deceiving from the pictures that were posted on the website that I saw. The rooms were much smaller, old, dingy and just not what I had pictured.
The bed was the most uncomfortable bed that we had ever slept in. Neither of us got much sleep at all for the full five days that we were staying there. The bed was far too firm, the pillows were very flat and it was just overall very uncomfortable.
The noise at this hotel was a joke. Even on the eighth floor the windows were not sealed enough to keep any of the sound out so that we could hear all of the sounds  of the city very loudly all night long. There has been no efforts to drown the sound out by the hotel. The walls were extremely thin so that I could hear conversations happening in the room next to me while I was trying to sleep. There were also weird loud random noises happening all throughout the night in the walls and ceiling which I’m not sure what they were, but they were very disruptive. On the first night about 2 AM a ridiculous alarm started going off for quite a while waking myself up and most people on my floor were opening our doors and trying to figure out why this alarm was going off and why it wouldn’t stop.
As I mentioned, the pictures on the website were deceiving of the room. The lobby was beautiful, the service was great! But if you want to be able to sleep at all, do not stay here!!

title: Great location
text: Great location and nice staff. Sony bar is located next door and a few pizza spots if you get hungry. Also Sony bar offers 20% off if you stay at Paramount. Room small and decent. The lobby is comfortable and huge.

title: Over Price Awful Quality
text: We stayed over New Years at a very expensive time admittedly but we expected so much more like getting the room we paid for not one which was dirty, holes in door frames, frayed carpets poor facilities and generally a room that we felt was at a price we were ripped off!

title: Good location, but that's it.
text: The location was great for our New Year's Eve stay however the bedrooms were lacking ambiance and amenities. The water pressure was very low with no hot water. The lobby had a fun vibe and the staff were very kind.

title: Noisy overpriced room
text: Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel if you get room 1837 as it was very noisy.  The windows are not tight and sirens can be heard all night. There is also currently construction noise from across the street and the heating system makes odd noises whenever it turns on.  Given the very high price during a major holiday week, I am glad we only stayed here for one night.  I will never stay here again as sleeping was impossible. The location is good for midtown, but not worth it for the poor experience.

title: Christmas 2022 stay
text: Location of the hotel is what makes it acceptable, but there is no storage for a family of 3 and we had to live out the cases for our 8 day visit. Room was rough round the edges and there were multiple leaks in the bathroom which we had to keep wiping up. Heating was so noisy that you couldn’t use during the night, it was like a plane taking off! Cleaning staff kept the rooms well stocked, but must feel they are fighting a losing battle with the state of the rooms. At the end of the day it’s only a bed and didn’t ruin our holiday, but really needs an upgrade for the price they charge and maybe invest in better lighting in the lifts!

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text: Room was in a bad shape and extremely small. Not much space to even put luggage and clothes. It is renovated but very poorly. Everything is painted over and they have tried to make it look nice but it is not. The only thing good in the room was the bed.

title: Hotel in Theatre district: very exciting!
text:
Paramount is in the 46th in Time Square in Theatre district, so you are near to the heart of Manatthan. Hotel was good. People very kind. Our beedroom was not so big but comfortable.
Just bathroom wasn’t so good, they could improve shower, window, design.
The bed was veeery comfortable!!!
Air conditionar was broken and very noisy. In general not bad!

title: Great location if that is all you care about.
text: Bedroom was not clean.  Lobby restrooms were not clean.  Staff was friendly.  Location was excellent but given the poor cleanliness of the room would not stay there again.  Unfortunately, it looks like they put all their effort into the lobby and decided that the rooms weren't important.

title: Overpriced Hotel
text: The rooms were ugly and the bathroom too, but they were comfortable and functional. The lobby looked better on the pictures, but was too crowded all the time. Reception check out always took forever, felt like an airport terminal. The restaurant next to it offered the worst breakfast options, service was slow and there was construction. I don’t recommend this to anyone.

title: Staying at the Paramount
text: The Paramount is close to the fun and for that, it is convenient, however if you're looking for a lot of staff, frills, and other amenities, this is not your hotel.  Our room was adequate, the noisy construction outside of our window, was not a huge problem as we only needed to shower, sleep and watch the news there, but a mini fridge would have been great.  It's okay if you don't need a lot of frills and have money to kill!

title: Rudderless Shop
text:
You think when entering the lobby that this could be a plush hotel - it isn’t. 
Rooms are bare, basic and lacking any comfort or homeliness. Admittedly it’s a place to lay your head but still bleak. Clean but in desperate need of updating, painting etc. 
lots of hiccups

Tried to charge me for the hotel tax which I had already paid.
Moved rooms and they then sent me emails saying they were sorry I had gone. Only moved because of the building site - which I understand they can do nothing about. 
Charged me for the hotel tax and had to fight to have it reimbursed. 
Promised for 4 days to fix the safe but it was never done. 

Other reviews have said that the staff were rude but we did not find that to be the case. Staff were helpful and courteous. Unfortunately they are passengers in a rudderless ship which keeps banking.   To be honest I felt sorry for them as it seemed that many complaints were having to be handled and they only work there. 

OWNERS OF THE PARAMOUNT - you need to update the decor and upgrade your digital systems to be up to date with 2022 technology.

I would not stay here again even though it was handy for Times Square - shame.

title: Rip -Off
text: What can I say , over priced , no extra bedding , room was embarrassingly small- I expected more . I was cold , the bar was too loud , no atmosphere . Lighting was poor . I would really like a partial refund, I think I deserve it , had a poor nights sleep and paid top dollar .

title: IDEAL LOCATION
text:
Perfect location. Comfortable beds.  Adequate bathroom. Bit noisy as building works going on but no fault of the hotel.  Just ask for a quiet room. Nice atmosphere in the reception with a pool table while waiting for airport taxi.  
Reception staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Stay at Times Square
text:
The location is the only real gem about this property. Truly minutes away from everything you’d want to cover. 
That’s it. Our room was alright, but the heater was rickety and kept us up all three nights with borderline scary sounds in the middle of the night, 10 times a night. The thermostat also had a mind of its own and changed temperatures randomly and several times in the night. We paid the price for the location with our sleep. 
The location is pretty good though. People were nice too

title: Not as pictured.  False advertising.
text: We stayed in room 802 on December 26, 2022.  The room os NOT what is pictured on their website.   The website is clearly photoshopped.  The rug was so dirty and stained.   There was hair on the bedspreads.  The shower did not drain properly and you were standing in water.  We would not recommend this hotel.

title: Paramount (should be called a motel not a hotel) - Just the basics and nothing more - Don't bother
text: This place is the worst I have ever stayed in having been traveling for 30+ years. Just don't bother booking. Nothing in the hotel matches the pictures on the website. It's 100% fraud. No services of any kind. Rooms are tiny. Its crowded. Understaffed. The only thing good about this place is the location. So if you're looking for an expense place that under-delivers near time square, this is the place for you.

title: paramount hotel
text: very poor establishment ,heat not working , front disk give a room with no towel , shower is very undesirable , the place is too old and ran down  . i paid just as much as i would have in a brand name hotel , such as Marriott properties near by , for the same price or maybe a bit more but you  get what you pay for

title: Vacation
text: This was a Christmas gift to my wife Suzanne she has never been to NYC  I'm sorry but the horn's the sirens all day and night I really thought that the security was great the person who checked us in was fantastic we asked a few questions and she was very helpful if we were ever to come back there I would definitely consider you first unless another place would cut us a better deal my sister is in the area at this time and she got one heck of a deal because she lost her husband back in June so who only knows

title: Great location, poor hotel with dated decor. Broken taps and safe,cool showers and a heating system that will wake the dead.
text: Arrived at the hotel and got checked in. Room on 6th floor where we found damp coming through the hall wall and paint falling off. Room was very dated and the carpets were stained. The heating system was so noisy we had to turn it off through the night which made the room freezing. No spare blankets so on the heating went and no sleep! Safe wasn't working so we had to carry our passports etc everywhere for a few days until it was changed but not fixed in? Cold tap wasn't working and when it did it wouldn't turn off. Shower is quite weak and sometimes hot.  Came to leave and was charged for leaving our bags 2 per bag which should have been included in the service charge. No idea why we had to pay? Basic TV etc . Asked if we wanted a taxi called and took 15 deposit for the taxi and told it would be a further 70 to give to the driver on arrival at the airport. We got there and 85 was demanded by the driver who told us that the hotel keeps the 15.  Absolute rip off again. Would I recommend this hotel? For location yes. Absolutely not for everything else x

title: No restaurant, Air conditioner not working and was fixed during the stay. Old Fashioned rooms.
text:
Staring with the bad things: we booked 2 bedrooms and each of them have air conditioning problem, rooms were old fashioned, the hotel should provide at least a place to have breakfast, there were no trash container in the public areas, public bathrooms were dirty.

The only good thing I can say is that the location was super convenient. They provided assistance to fixed the air conditioning issue in the middle of my stay. Air conditioner too old and make a lot of noise.

title: Great Location to Explore NYC
text:
The Paramount is a great hotel for travelling on a budget but wanting to be in a central location. The Hotel can definitely be considered no frills when it comes to the room but the facilities are clean and house keeping do a great job to providing a clean stay. We had fresh towels each day and top ups of our complimentary toiletries. When it was noticed we were using our travel pillows under our hotel pillows we came back to additional pillows on the bed. 

The rooms themselves aren’t huge but from other travels to NYC this is common place. The hotel does a great job at sporting a 1920s style decor with mood lighting and styling throughout but also compliments this with modern additions with a room safe and a flat screen TV which gives the capability to stream your own content if desired. 

The climate control was great, I travelled in Winter but the room was plenty warm and comfortable. The location couldn’t be better for exploring Manhattan; a 1 minute walk to Times Square allows you to explore it before it’s busy and from there you can get anywhere you need to. 

I didn’t interact much with staff but the ones I did speak with were incredibly pleasant and polite. 

The hotel is also served by 4 elevators that are incredibly fast. I was on the 15th floor but never felt that I was waiting long for an elevator to arrive or to travel to and from my floor. 

Granted it’s a bit rough around the edges but for the age and price I’d challenge you to find a better hotel, with better facilities in a better location

title: Christmas in NYC
text: I have stayed at this facility in the past and am very happy that it has re-opened since Covid.  The price and location are good for NYC.  A nice - not too expensive amenity - would be morning coffee.  The front desk, maintenance and housekeeping are courteous and helpful.  It is a no frills property but you really can't beat the price and location.  I will return

title: Loved staying here
text: This was my 2nd stay and I loved it just as much as my first stay. Close to everywhere we wanted to be and the staff was always so helpful and kind. We loved that we could safely store our luggage on our last day and take advantage of the car service to get us safely to the airport on time!

title: NYC Holiday visit
text: The holidays are always a fun time in NY. The Paramount is a great hotel. The location is excellent and a vary stylish yet understated ambiance ... although I do miss the over-the-top Philip Stark design from the 80"s. One unexpected and not pleasant surprise was the "resort" fee. Nowhere prior to my booking was this mentioned and something I wouldn't use ever. So as much as I like the hotel, I may choose another location in the future as I find rude to charge for a service that I would never use.

title: POOR LIGHTING VERY DIM @ Lobby, Elevator Room Floor Hallway,  NARCOTIC SMELLS @ Room.Floor
text: Ajdin Tahirovic. Manager doesn't returns calls at The Paramount Hotel Times Square. Tripped, sprained my ankle. Front desk to hotel manager ignores guest. Todate still waiting on a call back. I complaint, waiting for someone at corporate to call back. Our experience is the worst. Please reconsider other options when deciding on The Paramount Hotel Time Square.

title: Shocking description of a hotel
text: Overall the hotel is outdated and in a bad state of repair. Booked this hotel due to the fact that it was reportedly refurbished during Covid and due to its location. I do not think the contractors that were used were professionals. Paint used to cover damaged walls and ceilings. Water running down the inside of our clothes closet. The room smelled stale. We expected smaller rooms but the room we got you couldn’t even swing a cat in. The bathroom you couldn’t even fit the cat in with you. The pictures and description on the website give a false impression. Let’s just say that on the first night we were looking for another hotel as we felt that the experience of staying here would put a dampener on the visit. We did get moved to another room which only had the improvement of no running water on the inside of the clothes closet. When we complained and wanted to speak to the manager, they were to busy as they were on the phone. The majority of the staff were nice. /The hotel needs a major refurb by professional contractors and better management. Overall my advice is stay well clear of using this hotel. We are definately looking to get out money back.

title: Perfect location for shows, food, and Times Square
text: Great access to the subway, taxis, walking distance to most of the great sites in NYC! Housekeeping (towels, toiletries) and Maintenance (for the built-in Chromecast!) were super helpful whenever we called. I was super happy to see cans for both trash and recycling in the room.

title: stayed here for two days
text:
rooms are super small and the not that clean 
heaters do not work 
baggage safety is questionable 
really not satisfied for the amount they are charging 
no water mugs or water in room 
no micro oven to heat any water or anything 
water dispenser, hot water does not work at all

title: Do not stay here!!
text: We stayed 10 minutes and moved straight back out. Very poor quality hotel, awful room, and there is a large construction site directly outside so loud you can’t hear yourself speak. Staff polite and helpful, they accepted our complaints and we were refunded in full.

title: Inferior
text:
Dissatisfaction is what I experienced while staying at this hotel in December 2022.
Prepare for an inferior experience or plan not to stay at this hotel if you expect a pleasurable stay within a New York City hotel.

title: This  hotel we booked threw booking .com not like website .
text: The website on booking.com and the hotel itself showed the room completely different . The room was listed as a superior double room , in which we paid  a lot money for this as we wanted to be in Times Square , one double bed was like a camp bed near the floor the other bed not so bad , both beds fitted into a wall so fold up beds . The heating wouldn’t go off , the air conditioning we put on to make it cool made so much noise , neither of this could we turn down . The hoteliers said it an old hotel and couldn’t alter these item,. No quilts on beds just a sheet and throw over then another sheet . Bathroom so small , the shower head so small had to stand under it for ages to receive any water , not like the website, .wardrobe tiny no room for two people let alone if four people were sharing , no bedside cabinets and the sideboard for rest of clothes so old not white units like on the website. Building site at the back of us ( we weren’t warned about this ) work up by machinery starting up at 6.55 am every morning . I definitely wouldnt recommend anyone to use this hotel , really disappointed we paid over $2000.00 for a 6 days stay here , how can I get my money back PLEASE or can anyone help.

title: Good Hotel for a Shortrip
text: Good stay for a few days just to sleep there.the rooms a small, the beds for two a even smaller 😅 but that could be romantic. The windows are old so our rooms were cold on our trip in December and it was also loud.  But the whole staff was extrem nice and make us feel warm welcome.

title: Needs updating
text: The room was very tired, the carpet was old and worn, the heating was very noisy, it needed a repaint, there were no drawers so had to live out of our suitcase. The stainless steel sink resembled that from prison. The bathroom needed updating.

title: Not worth the money
text:
The rooms were so small, felt like a jail cell, no where to place clothes we had to leave our stuff in our luggage in the floor. The bathroom is completely out dating and all of the walls in the entire unit were bubbled paint, and the bathroom was peeling. This place is not worth the price and I will not recommend this hotel to anyone! The front desk staff was very rude when I asked where I bag check was located. There are no amenities, no room service, no place to buy drinks, no mini refrigerator. Our room did not even have towels when we checked in I had to go locate the worker to get some. 

Not worth the money, I will return to the Hilton on my next stay for the same price.

title: Brilliant location
text: Was a bit unsure about the hotel as i read some negative reviews however there was nothing to worry about. The hotel is in the perfect location and the staff are all so friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The room was on the small side but we were only in it to sleep so not a problem. I will definitely come back again

title: Basic (only) hotel in great location
text:
This hotel is just off of Times Square and has comfortable bedding. Otherwise, it feels “budget” on every level: having stayed at several 3+/4 star hotels in Times Square, it’s high rating is just mystifying. 

Their customer service email bounces back as does their messaging set up on their website, so we were unable to respond to emails from the hotel before or during our stay.

The elevators are small, run by key card, and under lit, one of which required a flashlight to see the card reader as well as the floor number buttons. For our 4 night stay, the elevators were full of international travelers with large suitcases, going up when they thought they were going down and vice versa, because no one explained the key card system at check in. The elevators only hold 4 people at a time, so this made getting in and out especially difficult.

The rooms themselves are spartan-no cost incurred. The flat screen tv has network tv and has a set up where you can stream your own apps on it. There is a small plastic desk and even smaller bed table. No reading chair, lamp, coffee maker, dresser, suitcase holder, or any other amenity now commonly found in even in budget motels.

The carpet was stained, the toilet leaked, and most off-putting of all, the walls were extraordinarily thin. Night one we slept with a crying baby in our room, nights 2 and 3 we shared our sleep with a coughing and vomiting man, and night 4 we had drilling/rotorouting at 8pm somewhere in the vicinity of the bathroom.

Could not find any ice or vending: there is some kind of eatery off the lobby, but its hours and menu were a mystery. I have no idea what the extra “resort fee” covers other than the pool table in the lobby. I would have loved for them to have spent it on a lightbulb for the elevator.

Overall this was a profound disappointment, as the room was within $40 of rooms at hotels I know are quite nice. I usually travel with my elderly parents, and had they been on this trip we would have needed to eat the cost and booked a different hotel.

title: Good location, poor rooms and facilities.
text:
Pros-Location. AND THATS ALL!
HERE ARE THE CONS-
Poor heating, dirty, smelly carpet, no refreshmemts available for guests in waiting area and none in the rooms.
My room was small, and though everything worked it was in no way  what was represented via photos.
Why is the facilities fee $160. And there are no facilities available. Upon.checkout i had ro pay for my bag to be held and also beg the front desk the use the washroom.
The internet was horibble, the worst i ever experienced at a hotel. 
Would i ever stay here again...absolutely NO! 
And i would recommend you spend the extra cash and stay somewhere nicer and friendlier.

title: Christmas trip 2022
text:
Would I recommend this hotel? Yes and no. The atmosphere and where the hotel is situated was amazing, couldn't be better. Downsides was the building site opposite, having the window we had that didn't shut all the way down didn't help, so the noise was worse. 
The heating didn't work, the wall lights in the room didn't work and the shower head didn't work 100%, water was dispersing not how it should be. The lobby was amazing aswell as the staff they were all 100% 
If you aren't going to stay in your room for long then yes I would recommend this hotel, if you were a couple that would like to go back for a rest and a nap, then forget it 

At the end of the day you get what you pay for I guess

title: Quick Trip to the City
text: Good location for a very basic hotel. Rooms had nothing in them except the bare minimum. No bottled water, cups, ice buckets, washcloths, lotion, or hair conditioner. Water in shower was lukewarm at best. Beds were very comfortable. Staff was good and friendly.

title: Never again
text: This hotel charges premium hotel rates when it is clearly not. It is an old and basic hotel with new make up. Really noisy. They charge for things other hotels don't. Early check in (USD 50) no matter they had empty rooms. If you receive packages at the hotel, they charge you USD 10 per package. Just because. And you can only pay cash. This hotel has no interest in guests coming back. I don't recommend it at all.

title: New York get away
text: Our stay at Paramount hotel. Not quite the boutique hotel that we were looking for. This hotel is fine for travelers that are looking in an expensive average experience. From the website, it looks like more of the boutique type hotel. It was clean,a bit on the noisy side and in a good location.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!
text:
WORST HOTEL EVER!!!
Rooms DO NOT look anything like as advertised. Rooms are horrendous, bathrooms are disgusting. Jail cell resemblance. 
Damp, mould and flaking paint everywhere! 
Manager knows all rooms are like this but continue to sell rooms and blamed covid.

title: Super unique
text: The hotel itself is like walking back in time with modern twists. love the young hip vibe the staff bring. the hotel rooms itself are in need of update but it was comfortable and had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. it was a small room but what can you expect in New York. we had a great time. before our stay we read alot of reviews and were a little concerned about our stay. immediately upon arrival our mood changed and we fell in love. bar and cafe were cool and open. will visit again

title: EXCELLENT TIME
text:
Just returned from the Paramount Hotel, read the reviews previously and was apprehensive.  Stayed 5 nights and i must say both my daughter and myself was surprised, hotel reception really helpful and no long queues.  Stayed in Super Double room, beds really comfy and bedding immaculately clean.  Had an issue with the heating system reported to reception and sorted within an hour.  On leaving left luggage in luggage room for $2 each case, the gentleman in the luggage room booked us a taxi to JFK and made sure when it arrived outside that we were escorted to the correct taxi.
This hotel is in the middle of a busy area,  so easy to get to everywhere you need.  GIVE IT A TRY

title: Business stay at Paramount hotel
text:
Except for the great location, everything needs to be improved
Room is very small, limited space, small board, bed was not comfortable at all, and the reasons to my enquiries took long time. Thank you 
!

title: Don’t stay here, we had mold in the shower and the construction was so loud we couldn’t even hear on our phones
text: Don’t stay here, we had mold in the shower and the construction was so loud we couldn’t even hear on our phones! When we called and asked about switching rooms they were so rude! The location is good the beds and bedding were terrible and the pillows were paper thinp

title: Basic hotel but convenient for sightseeing
text:
Location was excellent but facilities very basic, not even water or tea/coffee facilities. Very expensive to not even have the basics but bed was comfortable. 
Also, check in took almost an hour…the queues were very long and staff didn’t seem to know what to do and/or were very slow.

title: PASSEZ VOTRE CHEMIN !!
text:
j'ai réservé une chambre DELUXE et je me suis retrouvé dans une chambre minuscule avec 2 fenêtres donnant sur des murs et les clims du bâtiment d'en face!
quand j'ai exigé de changer, la personne à l'accueil me dit que Booking.com ment sur son site car il n'y à pas de chambre avec vue!
je leur ai montré la réservation , j'ai payé très cher les 4 nuits, hors de question de rester dans un cagibi !
j'ai fini par parler fort dans le hall (y'avait bcp de monde qui attendait ) en leur montrant la photo de la chambre DELUXE, la manager à fini par nous donner la chambre exacte de la photo de la réservation (au 11ème étage avec vue sur la ville) sauf qu'il n'y avait pas de chauffage.(en dècembre à NYC) ...
salle de bains vétuste, on ne voyait quasiment rien à travers les vitres déguelasses, enfin bref, 
ne vous laissez pas faire, ce sont des voleurs , ils vous mettent dans des chambres minables, si vous ne dites rien et en plus ils vous prennent 100€ de plus en caution, j'attends qu'ils me les rendent !
cet hôtel était un des seuls dispos proche de Times Square pour un voyage de dernière minutes, on comprends pourquoi !
à 1981€ les 4 nuits, je pense avoir le droit de râler ! une honte !  j'ai souvent voyagé c'est la 1ere fois qu'une nana de l'accueil me gueule dessus car je demande une chambre qui correspond à ce que j'ai payé ! 
A FUIR !

title: Worst Stay Ever
text: With NYC being booked up in December, this was one of the only options under $1500. That was a mistake. Between the mold in the bathroom, shower, and sink, the tiny peeling white painted room felt even more like a jail cell. That and the metal prison sink tied it together. The sheets and pillows were dingy and yellow with the pillows being about as thin as a tissue. Really no security downstairs at any time yet front doors are unlocked 24/7. Do not stay here.

title: Average hotel, close to Times Square
text: Hotel is average. Check in and out was easy, very close to Times Square, restaurants within walking distance. Bed was comfortable, room was clean. Now the cons: water was lukewarm at best; no storage in room (barely any space for two suitcases in deluxe queen room); swipe pads on elevators and doors were temperamental…sometimes they worked, sometimes they didn’t. For the price, it was okay…but I wouldn’t have lasted much more than 3 nights there.

title: Quite surprised
text: Check in was quick. We never waited for a elevator. Yes the bathrooms are small but ok for what you need them for. We always had clean towels and had miniature shampoo and soaps in the bathroom. The bedroom was small but quite adequate for what you need it for. The bedding was clean and the beds comfortable. Our room was at the back of the hotel so was quite quiet. We heard the digging from the construction but we managed to sleep through it. Our air con/ radiator started to leak, I saw reception and it was sorted before we returned later that night. We used the bag storage which is $2 per bag and they arranged for a taxi to collect us to take us to the airport. All in all we enjoyed our stay for what we used the hotel for. I was worried before we arrived but was pleasantly surprised.

title: Value for money spent - not good!
text: Only towels in room upon arrival were hand towels. Took until next day to get some bath towels. Heater in bathroom literally up against toilet which means having to sit sideways on toilet - very uncomfortable. Hot water turned off at 10:30 every night - again, unacceptable to come in at night and have only cold water. Only thing redeeming about this place is its location and the bedding - mattress and pillows were very comfortable. So, not a total loss, but for the large sum of money we spent to stay here, I expected much better.

title: Rip-off for quality of room/experience
text: Hotel staff were rude, the bathroom was awful and the rooms were sparse. The air con was broken and the whole atmosphere was of a place that were willing to charge £400 per night and they didn’t care about your stay. The concierge also failed to book an airport transfer.

title: You won’t be disappointed
text: Fab hotel, location spot on ,friendly staff , yes rooms are small but we hardly spent any time in room ,only to sleep.give this hotel a go , you won’t be disappointed. Cheers paramount.. couldn’t get in juniors for cheescake , but did manage to get into carmines for lunch.

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
text:
The rooms were extremely unclean, socks from previous resident left in the middle of the room, large chips/scuffs in the walls and wooden back panelling within the rooms. 

There were marks on the floor from make-up use as well as smudges of what appeared to be sauce on the wardrobe doors. 

No hot water in the shower on multiple days. The bathroom had red cracked bath tiles loose fittings for the appliances and prison style toilet/basin. The sealant around the bath was brown and mouldy, the bath had paint stripped off it as if it has been in place for 10+ years 

The heaters within the room are extremely loud after coming on in the early hours of the morning they woke us up with how loud they were 

The hotel appeared out dated but this wouldn’t have been an issue if the rooms were clean and up to standard. 

This hotel put a horrible experience on the visit to New York and made us not want to return to the rooms at the end of the day. 

Would not recommend to anyone thinking of staying here, don’t be fooled by how nice the reception looks.

title: Horrible Experience
text: Horrible experience, miniature rooms, hardly a space to walk in the room, room only fits a bed, nothing else. Temperatures cannot be adjusted, no water available, no kiosks to buy any water. I would advise against staying in this hotel.

title: Solo Room = So Low Room
text: Hotel prices in December in NYC are bananas but even the "economy" rooms are not worth it. Due to some miscommunication, the Paramount Hotel was booked for me on a discount travel site and it was non-refundable. When I saw "Solo Room Twin Bed" I panicked but thought, hey, it's one night, how bad can it be? Bad. It was bad. The room is as states 100 sq feet with a slightly larger than twin bed. The linen was poor quality and the carpet is absolutely old and ratty. The bathtub is peeling in big patches and the towels are VERY thin. No true desk but a slim table that the laptop barely fits on. One visible power outlet that was very loose, charger kept falling out of socket. A dropped something and as I got on the floor to pick it up, I noticed paper underneath the bed. I called the front desk but the hotel is completely sold out. They offered to send a housekeeper but it was already late and I knew I wouldn't be able to stay in the room. Left and went to stay with a friend. Just know what you are getting with a Solo Room.

title: Room so barren as to be a joke.
text: The room had no amenities.  As in , no glasses or cups.  no pad of paper with notes.  No book of restaurants and activities in the areal  No restaurant or breakfast.  Small but adequate room.  piece missing out of bath tub.

title: Filthy. Broken. Horrific service
text: Stay anywhere else if you can.  Everything in this hotel is cracked, broken and filthy.  Every tried going up to your room by sticking your finger into a broken elevator button and hoping it works?  The carpets and bathrooms in the rooms look like hostels. The staff is incapable of helping the needs of business travelers-- and have no desire to deliver anything close to what you'd call customer service.

title: PHTS
text: Great location, clean, could be cheaper, bellman and security staff are awesome - any one you need to go to with a problem, well, none of them helped us with any of them. One of them being the hotel overchargeing on check-in.

title: A terrible hotel!!!
text:
Over priced, under loved and rude.

This was sadly my last option on a business trip.  For an extortionate price I got a small noisy and hot room. 
With dirty tile grout, cracked door, lumpy bed and the smell of hash permeating the floor.
The staff at check in were unhelpful and slow.

A funky lobby with a pool table is an attempt to put gloss on the rubbish hotel.

Do not be fooled.

title: Worst hotel stay of my life! Avoid at all costs
text:
I travel a lot for work and pleasure and I've never stayed in a room with a twin bed. Yes, I was aware it was a twin in advance, but at $800 (including taxes) for 2 nights I would've expected the following, which this room did not have:
1. Body wash or soap for the shower
2. Fridge
3. Bottle of water
4. More space - I had to use the top of the save to store my purse and jewelry. The safe was also broken and never worked. 
5. The toilet was so close to the heater that I had to shimmy my legs to the left to pee - literally no room to pee with legs in front of you like a regular person.
6. Carpet was filthy and I was afraid to walk on it; it was worse than carpet at a run down detnist office.

In short, avoid at all costs, this place is NOT worth $400/mos ever. A true NYC robbery!

title: Great location!!!!
text: We stayed here for a 3 day girls trip and it was perfect. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was fantastic. We walked almost everywhere and the one tour we couldn’t walk to the subway was about a 3 minute walk away. The bar downstairs is convenient and the pool table in the lobby was a nice touch!

title: Sorry staff, BOOK ELSEWHERE FOLKS..
text:
I'm a naturally positive person so take no pleasure in writing this but I simply wouldn't recommend this hotel.
It's old and needs demolished and rebuilt as the only positive is the location. But even then there are better hotels, cheaper and in a similar location. 
The noisy heating, the building site across the road (work begins 7am) we asked for a quiet room, view unimportant and they put us next to the cleaners room, banging all night long...we complained,  but no difference was found.
The staff love this place, love the fact its 100 yrs old, but the Americans have so little history it's a big deal to them.
But to anyone wanting the energy to enjoy the walking and sightseeing in NYC. Book elsewhere. 
Plse read my other reviews from Russia, Israel etc...we are worldwide travelers, we don't like to moan.

title: Location to Times Square is all they have going
text: What a disappointment!  Rooms are so outdated and in need of major cleaning.  Bathrooms small, tile cracks and stains, leaky sink.  Nowhere to put your luggage but on the floor - which was a problem for my elderly mother.  No basic room amenities like cups, ice bucket, lotion, coffee maker.  No restaurant or bar in hotel, adjacent small cafe cannot handle hotel volume.  Our first room (had to be moved) had pull down Murphy beds, heater was broken ( had to use suitcase to block vent) and window shade held up by the broken chain.  Bed leg collapsed during the night which literally left me hanging sideways.

title: Beautiful hotel and friendly staff!
text: My husband and I stayed here before the renovation and loved it then. I am so happy to be able to return wit our children has well. Love the new look of the hotel and the staff is just amazing!   It's a block from TS and close to the theatres. Can't wait to come back and stay there again!

title: Great place in the center of the Theatre District
text: The hotel was warm and inviting. The room was clean, linens nice and a great shower. Hot water, great water pressure. Hotel room was small, we had a Double room and it has 1 chair. But that was to me the only negative. The staff was all helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Nice enough stay
text:
If you read other reviews you know what to expect. The hotel is nice enough. Great price (make sure to shop around), the location really can’t be beat you’re in the middle of Times Square. You can’t control temp in your room, but they have windows that open. No mini fridges in the room which is frustrating, I know they are small rooms but you should be able to fit in a small fridge. There is no bar/restaurant at this time. The room was clean and room was comfortable. They are small rooms but you have to expect that in Times Square, however the lack of clothing/coat storage is still lacking. 
I would stay here again given the cleanliness and comfort and location.

title: small room
text:
Hotel lighting not great, permanently in darkness. Cannot see the floor numbers when in the lift. Room was very small, double bed nearly took up the full width of the room. One side was right up against the wall.
Location is great for Time Square. Couldn't fault the cleanliness.
Wouldn't want to stay there again.

title: Old and dirty
text: I think that you have a great localization, but you have to rebuilt all the rooms. The carpet are disgusting, there is no security, you don¨t have any shelf in the room to put your things, and every thing is DIRTY.

title: 3* hotel that needs updating in a good location.
text: I would give this hotel a 3*. The location is the best thing about it, mostly everything is in walking distance which is such a help when your a tourist. The hotel itself is average. We had an executive king room which was a fine size. Everything is very dated and tired but I was kind of expecting this from previous reviews. We were lucky when we arrived as it was quiet so can’t comment on check in. Rooms are quite noisy with being on Times Square so ask for a higher room if you like your window open at night.

title: Not a Great Stay
text: This is a very overpriced hotel for what and where it is located.  Not worth it.  The bathroom was bizarre with a prison like sink.  The water pressure was lousy.  The common areas were so busy there was no where to sit.  The check in took forever.  The bar was closed.  Overall not a really nice place to stay.

title: Amazing  location for Broadway theaters
text: Arrived at 5 pm to the hotel hoping for a swift checkin. When I arrived there was a long queue in the somewhat smallish lobby making guest ready for check-in having to stand in front of the elevators. When I arrived there was one person doing the check-in. After 20 minutes they finally had one more member of the staff check-in guests in and 1 hour and 10 minutes later I got to check-in. On several occasions I saw a manager come out to the lobby to inspect the queue but nothing further happened. The combination of waiting and the humidity was horrible but I got there in the end. After that experience check-in took five minutes. I got a double ADA room on the 6th floor which was very nice. Sparkling clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was very nice however there was no ventilation  in the bathroom making it necessary to have the door open while showering. The bed was very comfortable with nice linen. Big flat panel tv with loads of channels and the possibility to stream from your own device. Very nice. Cleaning is done every day and the staff kept the room sparkling clean.  All the staff I interacted with were ever so nice with big smiles and very helpful. The hotel has 4 elevators which was  kind of sufficient but two broke down during my stay which created some waiting. Check-out was contrary to check-in very fast and the hotels offers luggage storage for a small fee. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely return. I was gonna rate the hotel 3/5 however having written this I have to say that the unfortunate experience at check-in was just that - unfortunate - but I did otherwise have a great stay so a rating of 4/5 Is appropriate.

title: Rooms are not as advertised and rudest manager ever!!! AVOID!!!
text:
On arrival we were delighted with the initial impression; the location was great and lobby was lovely. Then we tried to check in. One word answers were all we got before being given the keys to our Superior Double Room for 3 guests. When we entered our room we were surprised to see two slightly larger than usual single beds with one pillow on each, and exposed wires hanging out from the wall. Clearly not a superior room and only for a maximum  of two people. The floors were stained and had not been hoovered. We returned to reception and asked to speak with Manager and that’s where we met Sheena. We showed her the photos online and Sheena told us that we must take this up with booking.com as the beautiful large double bed pictures were not the responsibility of the hotel, and we had no choice but to stay in the tiny room with 2 single beds, all 3 of us as her computer told her it was 2 doubles. When we showed her the exact same photos were on their website she told us again. Nothing she could do. Like it or lump it. We asked her to come look at the room to see that it was not the same as the photos. She refused saying she was short staffed and couldn’t leave her post, despite only appearing from the back when we requested to speak with her. After paying £1600 for 4 nights this was completely unacceptable . Sheena finally found us another room (despite her telling us the hotel was full when booking .com said they had 11 rooms available) and we could take ourselves to look at it but she was done with us now. Never have I ever experienced such a rude and unhelpful Manager. We opted to move to that room for the night as it was cleaner and had no exposed wires but wanted to be moved in the morning to the size room we had paid for. Sheena told us to return between 7&8 to speak with AJ as he was the only one who could do that. So we took my 67 year old mum to bed as she was exhausted and my sister and I returned at 7:15 to speak to AJ… only to be told he wasn’t in. 
Eventually a manager called Omar assisted us as best he could but ultimately we paid £400 for 2 single beds on night one for 3 adults. Sheena could not be bothered and lied throughout her conversation with us. 
Avoid at all costs. The rooms are NOT the same as the photos advertised and Sheena should not be in the hospitality trade with an attitude like hers.

title: I Might Come Back
text:
I was travelling with my mother in NYC for a one night trip to see the Rockefeller Tree light up. Paramount Hotel Times Square is listed online as a 4-star hotel and I stayed in their Superior Room with 2 twin beds.

* Location: 5/5 
I chose this hotel because of its distance to Rockefeller Center. We were right by Times Square, so I expected to hear the outside from my hotel room, but I was wrong! It definitely felt calm and quiet in the room, so that was very comforting. In addition, when people outside the room passed through the halls, little to no noise could be heard even when they were talking. It's also NYC, so there are most definitely restaurants next door/near by. You can easily order for pick-up or delivery from this spot and you can enjoy a bar right on the first floor.

* Check-In/Check-Out: 4/5
I had emailed the hotel a week ahead that I would want to check in earlier.  They had replied that check in is at 3 pm, but they would note it. I arrived at 2 pm and lined up to check in - the line was long because only 1 person was at the front, but the line moved pretty fast. They were able to check me in early, so I was very pleased that they accommodated that need for me. They ask for a $100 deposit in addition to your overall payment in case there are any damages made to your room. It gets refunded if nothing goes wrong. Check-out process went smooth and quickly.

* Room: 3/5
I was assigned room 1220, which window viewed the back of a billboard ad and some other rooms in the hotel. The room is indeed small, and bathroom is smaller, but it's cozy and decent enough for two people for 1 night. Pictures advertised on Expedia are completely different than what you actually get. To mention some: The table is placed directly under the TV, but it's actually in the corner because there would be no room for people to pass through if it was actually under the TV; Lack of décor on both the table and bed-side table; Beds only had two pillows, sans decorative pillow. There's also a radio with two USB ports, but it didn't work, charge our phones, or turn on, even though it was plugged in. Bathroom had 3 conditioning shampoos. No lotion, no body wash. They don't provide dental supplies so if you don't bring your own, they will redirect you to a nearby 24-hr CVS. Both heater/aircon worked well during my stay.

* Service: 2/5
The staff were really polite and kind, please don't misunderstand my rating. The reason why I'm giving the service 2 stars is because of the overall experience I had with them. I had gift cards with money to use for the taxes and fees, but their machine wouldn't accept my gift card. I was able to book the hotel with a gift card and knew I had enough money left, but for some reason I couldn't use the gift card for in person payment with them? I had asked if I must swipe it or if there was a way to manually enter the card number, but the person at the front desk had no idea and just shrugged at me. She said she's unsure how the machine works, or if it even accepts gift cards, and told me to play around with it to see if it will work if I keep swiping it different ways each time... I didn't want to hold up the line, so I just ended up using my credit card, which was a bummer. Around 7 pm, I had called the front desk to ask for extra pillows, but the lines were busy and hung up on me a few times. I called again at 8 pm and the same situation happened. After 11 pm, I was finally able to actually connect to someone. Overall, for a 4-star hotel, front desk staff really kicked off a few points. 

* Amenities: 3/5
My room did not have a lot of the amenities that are listed online, so I'm assuming the superior two twins don't qualify for the mini-fridge, snack bar/deli, or laundry? For a 4-star hotel, I wish the staff provided more information on the gym, laundry, restaurant, and the bar. There should be some flyers or pamphlets provided in the room that advertises said amenities. It does not feel like a 24/7 front desk.

* Pricing: 4/5
The hotels surrounding the area were about twice the price for what I can expect to be the same experience. For what it's worth, it was definitely affordable, but it didn't feel like it was worth almost $200.

* Overall: 3/5
With everything tied in together, I had an OK time at the hotel. I may book again if I ever need to stay a night in NYC!

title: Great Price - Perfect Location
text: You can't beat the location - steps from Broadway and across 8th Ave from Restaurant Row 46th St.  The  single room was small but perfect for a short stay  For a view of Manhattan get a room in the front overlooking 46th st

title: Exceptional doesn't describe how amazing
text: I will always come back the hotel itself is beautiful the staff amazing helpful and great quality. The location and price I couldn't ask for better. The front desk lady black wavy curly hair so sweet and very helpful. Honestly we will be back soon such an amazing properry

title: Could be better
text:
Hotel is in a brilliant location,  we did not like the 40 min wait to check in. Rooms ok, bathrooms need updating. Please note that twin rooms are opposite lifts, which is not much fun when your disturbed during night.
We stayed 9 nights so had to get used to a smallish rooms.
