Rooms had change of towels and bins empty everyday. 
We keep ourselves to ourselves,  so don't bother anymore.  No kettle or a drinking cup in rooms, so please bring your own.
Had a good time in New York.

title: The Paramount Isn't Like It Was
text: I thought the hotel was undergoing renovation during closure.  The only change I spotted was a pool table in the lobby and a loss of a lot of staff.  It now feels like a budget hotel (though hardly budget prices for their rooms).  I have been staying here for over 10 years - but I won't be returning.

title: Paramount Hotel
text: We stayed here from 24th to 28th November 2022. The location is second to none. The hotel lobby is cool. The cleaning staff did a great job. Reception staff were friendly but not respond to the issue we had.The tap/shower in our bathroom was not working properly. Despite saying it EVERY DAY to reception the problem was not rectified. We had so little water pressure that when one of us was having a shower that other person had to hold up the knob of the bath tap together some pressure of water to go through the shower head. The pressure was so weak we could not wash our hair. A hotel should have a working shower!

title: Thirsty prisoner in New York
text: This hotel has removed all signs of welcoming their guests from the front door's tacky plastic plants to the dull and dark lobby. The front desk is untrained and unfriendly. The rooms are all gray and white like a prison cell.... so tiny and so minimalist and they even lack a drinking cup.

title: Plan B
text: Si vous n'avez pas d'autre choix, la localisation de l'hôtel est son seul point fort. Pour le reste, passez votre chemin. Pas de service sans payer de supplément (frais de garde pour les bagages, lorsque vous quittez l'hôtel), bruit à partir de 7 heure du matin, pour cause de travaux en face de l'hôtel, pour encore très longtemps (construction d'un nouveau building), chambre "supérieure" très (trop|) petite, etc...

title: Thanksgiving Weekend Stay
text: We were extremely unhappy with the cleanliness and quality of the room overall (another other things). I was allergic to the room. Every time I walked in, almost immediately, I'd be sneezing and my throat would be itching. We also love going there for the restaurant and the breakfast buffet (which wasn't open yet again) and drinks. A place to not have to walk far and be able to walk right back up to our room to change if needed is key.

title: It was good but not worth it
text: It was good and clean but it would have been better if you have enough resources at the front desk so that we doesn't kill our time waiting in the queue.. and if you have provided a tooth paste to your guests.

title: Great location but missing a lot
text: I felt compelled to write a review, as a family with younger kids (and a toddler.) We also traveled with two other couples, for a total of three rooms. We booked the hotel for the location, which I will say is amazing. Close to the action, not far to walk to all major attractions (a bonus with kids.) However, this hotel really falls shorts on anything more than the very minimum. No mini fridge or microwave to help with fussy eater kids or toddler’s drinks or leftovers. No washcloths in the rooms- towels only (which was strange.) There was always a mile long line with at least 30 minute wait for checking in (all throughout the day.) The rooms aren’t tiny, but aren’t huge- just enough space for a NYC hotel. We are a family of five and had no issues with baggie storage, etc. I was hoping this hotel was perfect, since we come to the city at least twice a year. Im not sure we would stay here again. For the price, I’d recommend to keep looking.

title: Stay at the Paramount Hotel Times Square
text: Quirky hotel. Seems to be run on a shoestring. No soap or shampoo on arrival, no flannels provided, not enough staff on the front desk (sometimes one, sometimes two desks open for a hotel with 12+ floors). Long lines most of the day as a result. No towels to wipe hands in the reception restrooms (three days running). No one to go to with questions or help (unless you want to line up forever to talk to front desk). No parking and no discounts with any of the really expensive local parking lots (we paid about $80 a day for parking (Honda Pilot is considered oversized)  .. so beware). Weird low-level lighting throughout the hotel, presumably to mask aging decor and carpets. We actually liked the lighting after a while as it was a nice respite from the glare of Times Square. Hard to see the buttons in the elevators though!! Plus items .. friendly staff, relatively clean, safe, warm, older hotel so brick walls meaning no noise from neighbor. There is street noise off course if you are at the front of the hotel. We were on floor six. PERFECT location for Times Square which you may decide negates all the downsides. Have fun!!

title: 35 minute check in for a poor room
text: Check in line was extremely long. Room is poorly decorated. No cups in the room. No water. Carpet stained and not tacked down. No wash cloths. Shelf in bathroom was loose and tilted .Bed is comfortable. Climate control worked well. Not a nice view out the window.

title: Dissappointing
text: Photos of the room look a lot better than the rooms in person. I was staying on the top floor of the hotel and could still hear everything going on on the streets outside. Was woken up at 6 am from loud banging as well. The heater in the room was also incredibly loud that I had to figure out how to turn it off to be able to sleep. Overall I feel like a payed way to much for the value of this room.

title: Paramount NYC
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Paramount.  The location was ideal.  The front desk staff was very courteous , the sales direct was very helpful in suggesting a couple locations to check out, and the cleaning staff did a fantastic job.  the room was quiet considering this is NYC - a city that never sleeps, even when you want to.

title: Not recommended
text: Room small and dirty. Bathroom old and not working properly. The shower was hardly working and the airconditioning was making a lot of noice during the night. Also still some leftover food was stored in the minifridge.

title: Booty
text:
Air worked the first 3/4 hrs then not again for the next 3/4days they finally came to fix it. 
Did have any wash cloths 
Window fell out 
Blow dryer broke
Tub chipping 
Told the guy at the bar our room number never got our 20% for the drinks

title: Sleep and GO
text: Great place to drop your luggage hit Time Square, come back, sleep, either check out nothing fancy. Bring your own face towels past reviews said the same thing. No bad not great more detail to cleaning

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text: The staff was great at check in and we were able to get into our rooms early. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They were very helpful in getting late check out and even extended it an hour when we were late to get back before heading home. Great location to Time Square and Broadway Shows.

title: EVITER CET HOTEL MINABLE : AVOID THIS CRUMMY HOTEL !
text:
Notre chambre ( catégorie supérieure vue ville) devait faire à peu près moins de 10m² et avec une minuscule fenêtre donnant sur un mur, proche de 10 mètres du vitrage ! Aucune vue autre que le mur.
Nous avons donc demandé à changer de chambre et nous avons eu à faire à une responsable à l'accueil des plus désagréables qui nous a simplement dit que cela n'était pas possible en nous le répétant avec mauvaise volonté flagrante...
Mais nous avons insisté et demandé à voir le Manager qui a accepté assez vite de nous attribuer une autre chambre.
Notre nouvelle chambre était un peu mieux, avec une vraie vue sur la rue.
Le vitrage de la fenêtre était gris de salissures et de coulures : nous avons demandé à ce qu'il soit un peu nettoyé, réponse du staff : ce n'est pas possible.
Le petit coffre fort dans le placard ne fonctionnait pas et malgré notre demande à le réparer, personne n'est venu s'en occuper.
La moquette de la chambre constellée de tâches.
Nous avons aussi eu une fuite d'eau dans la salle de bains, en apprenant aussi que beaucoup d'autres clients se plaignaient également de cela.
L'eau de la douche le matin, vers 7heures : juste tiède ( et cela tous les matins pendant nos 4 jours).
La cuvette des wc : noire au fond, usée à la corde !
Mais vu l'état d'entretien des installations dans cet hôtel, rien de surprenant !!
Et puis, pour finir, cerise sur le gateau : pour mettre nos valises à la bagagerie le matin de notre départ : il a fallu payer . 
Nous voyageons beaucoup, dans des hôtels de toutes catégories et c'est bien la 1ère fois que nous avons eu une bagagerie payante : c'est pitoyable !
EVITEZ cet hôtel, qui malgré son bon  emplacement à Times Square, est simplement minable.
Et je ne vous parle pas des petits-déjeuners pour ne pas vous dégoutter plus... il y a une multitude d'hôtels aux alentours alors, un bon conseil : fuyez celui-là.

title: Find another hotel
text: One star for the location. I’ve been to better motel rooms than this so I dropped my standards on the FLOOR. First off the elevators were dingy and could fit max 4 people at a time. Like many others have mentioned here, the rooms were small but it wasn’t a dealbreaker for me. But the heating didn’t work in the middle of November. The technician came over and basically told me the hotel shut down the main heating line to cut costs. The walls were paper thin so I’d hear the housekeeping staff shouting and laughing right outside my door for at least 20mins every morning at the start of their shift - don’t expect to sleep in because that worked better than the 10 alarms I set in the morning. The housekeeper tried to get into our room WITHOUT KNOCKING when we were still in the shower getting ready to check out but thankfully we locked the deadbolt from inside. Did I mention the toilet flush was absolutely useless? Expect to flush at least three times after using the bathroom. I don’t know how they managed to score a 4 star rating, feels like a scam to me.

title: Paramount Hotel was disappointing
text: The location is excellent, just by Times Square but the hotel rooms are small so should be better appointed.  2 power outlets is insufficient in this day and age for two persons in a king bed room.  Elevators were dark so difficult for most persons to find the floor numbers.  Wi-Fi was good enough.  Construction noise next door started at 7 am on Friday and Saturday, it should have been mentioned somewhere on the website or when booking.

title: It was such a disappointment.
text:
A cute lobby, a good gym, and a comfortable mattress are the only good things about the hotel.
Unfortunately, the truth about the facilities is hidden behind photos of 3D blueprints and cute photos of the lobby.

The rooms need to be updated and improved, the staff needs to be trained in customer service, the bathrooms are very dated and in need of repair, the AC is very noisy, the windows do not soundproof the outside and the cleanliness could be improved in several areas of the hotel.

We were taken in by this beautiful photo of the hotel lobby, but somehow forgot to read customer comments about their stays. Unfortunately, around the hotel there is a lot of construction noise that can go on until 11 pm and will make it difficult to rest.

We have experienced a different hotel nearby and the experience was completely different from this one. 

Whenever we return to NYC, this hotel won't be an option.

title: Overnight Stay.
text: Great location, Convenient to Attractions, Entertainment, Restaurants, Transportation, Variety stores, etc. Excellent Reception Desk Staff, Very Courteous, Helpful and.Professional . Excellent Security

title: Inconvenience throughout inconvenience
text: We stayed for two nights. 1st night we had to stop our plans bc as soon as we got into our room the AC, internet & safe were not working. We reported it & waited. an Eng guy came fix the AC & advise it was the breaker, he told us he could not fix the safe & had no other safe to replace. No room move was offered, he never anticipated that this room should not have been giving to us in the first place. We decide to let it go and go out bc we had plans. When we get in at around 5-6 pm in a hurry bc we got a show at 7PM, the AC was not working again. Now we could not ignore it and had to stop our plans again, try to move rooms as fast as possible. We go to the FD, system was down & waited 30 minutes, we changed rooms. Now, I worked at hotel industry all my life and we would never place an inconvenienced guest in a room where they could have another inconvenience bc this is the time to do recovery. We get change to another room, the room was small and the bathroom super uncomfortable, the water only got warm and it took forever to warm up, plus showering there was uncomfortable but we did not care about that. What we did care was the lack of respect. We got woken up by CONSTRUCTION NOISE in front OF US. why would you move us to a room in-front of construction? We get upset but ignore it bc we are on vacation. We put the do not disturb sign and go out, only to get back and see that HSK entered to our room and moved our personal belongings. This crossed the line but we again try to ignore it bc nothing was missing & go out. THE ROOM was in terrible condition, the front door was hard to open, the bathroom door hard to close, shower very small, electrical outlets very bad, nothing fit and everything we connected was lose & sometimes got disconnected but what was really the worst was that when we departed we checked the room before going to ensure we did not forget anything. When we checked under the bed in case my ID falled, we saw that the room was never inspected or clean as it should be bc there were a pair of socks that were not ours. I never slept cuz the bed made terrible noises and shakes for everything. You failed on HSK & FD recovery. We did not need upgrades, or views. We only needed a room with a bed, good AC, Good water heat, and the room to be cleaned and working properly before we were checked in on them. We only stayed two nights but we regreted every minute of it but our prior hotel did not have availability for our last two nights.

title: Downtown immersive close to Times Square
text: Great location in the middle of Times Square Hell’s Kitchen and broadway areas. Walking distance to food & shows and subway stations within 4 blocks that takes you everywhere. Room faced broadway show, Sony concert venue next door that added energy to the property.

title: overall a good experience....
text: great location and i think good price for were it is located in new york😀 we didn't find staff overly nice apart from the gentleman who took our cases both times👍👍 no niceties in the bedroom but very clean and nice towels etc 😀 good experience....

title: My stay a Paramount Hotel in Tines Square
text: Convenient location in the midst of Times Square.  the staff was very helpful. The lobby has a pool table which created a friendly atmosphere. The overall facilities ate maintained. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Location is amazing, but poor facility
text:
A few steps away from the hop-on-hop-off bus station, time square, subway and all the musical theaters.
The facility itself is very outdated, but since I was outside most of the day and all I needed was a clean bed and a place to sleep so it worked out for me. The bed is clean and comfortable.
Read the reviews before you go. I got an exact room which other person posted pictures of stained carpet and chair, and a broken safe so I wasn't too surprised. Let the staff know if you have any problems. They'll try their best to fix it.
A mechanic replaced the broken safe for me, but couldn't fix the broken bathroom fan. I had to leave the room window open instead. Not something you would expect from a 4 star hotel.

Overall, poor facility but great location, and great staff.
I won't recommend this to any of my friends or families but if all you need is a clean bed to sleep in at the end of the day, it might work out.

title: Amazing hotel and location, very nice and comfortable room very clean , room good for relax and sleeping
text: Amazing hotel and location, very comfortable room for relax and sleeping , good atmosphere in hotel , room very clean , nice bar in hotel , good location near in time square , very good street at 46th with a lot restaurants not expensive and good quality

title: Not a four star hotel, but not terrible.
text: When booking this location, it was listed as a four star facility however it is closer to three. It is an old building so is never going to be perfect, but felt a little dirty in some areas (bathroom walls, carpet, etc). We didn't interact with the staff constantly, but when we did they were kind. Location was easy to walk to Restaurant Row and Time Square. The room was slightly larger than expected, which was nice. Location is a little noisy but that's uncontrollable with Broadway District and TS right outside, so if you are a light sleeper bring earplugs.

title: Broken fire alarm and TV
text: Tired and tiny rooms.  Be careful not to hit the bed with the room door.  Jackhammers start at 7 am sharp right next door.  Broken alarm went off all night.  Broken TV.  No coffee nor water in the rooms.  Windows were also very drafty and broken.

title: Very convenient
text: Location was great as it is just a few steps to time square. The lobby was spacious with lots of comfortable lounge you can relax while waiting for your room to be available. Check-in  was a breeze. As expected room is small but good enough to get some rest. Construction was on going in the front corner near our room so it was a little bit noisy and they're doing constructions at night too. Convenience I'd recommend this place.

title: Location is the selling point.
text:
I took my two adult children for a long weekend for their birthdays.  We are all Broadway fans and wanted to see some shows. The location is absolutely fabulous. The room, not so much. They were up front about having the bare necessities- no fridge or microwave ( which meant we had to throw away our leftover Junior’s cheesecakes ) and could not keep drinks available in the room cold). It was very dated- Tough putting two people in a full size bed when they are not used to it- I can’t imagine how plus sized people would handle it. One chair and a skinny lucite table/desk. Suitcases had to lay on the floor. Our air-conditioner did not cool properly. It cut off in the middle of the night and while the blower still moved air it was not cooling and the room became a sauna. 
They sent someone up to check it the next day while we were out and it seemed to be working but when we got in late at night after a show it had quit cooling yet again. By the time we left the next day, it about 78 and muggy. The carpeting was badly stained and long overdue for replacement. Mattresses were very firm ( which I happen to like) Our sink faucet was non functioning. You had to turn the hot water on and off manually at the wall. If we weren’t paying so much, I could have been less bothered, but it was very disappointing. 
Maid service was great, staff interaction was all positive, location excellent. 
I’d have to think long and hard to book there again.

title: Great stay at Paramount
text: I truly enjoyed my stay, so convenient to everything I wanted to do, plus a convenient train ride to other meetings. I like the Paramount Work spaces, a nice perk. I definitely recommend this hotel for personal and/or business.

title: Lovely Place to Stay!
text:
A very nice hotel. Great staff. The location was perfect. Easy to get to lots of sites. Staff was very knowledgeable about the area. Best bang for your buck.

I have to leave at least 200 words. I don't know what else to say. A good place to stay. Okay, I'm done.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: Dirty tiny room with stains on the carpet and barely cleaned bathroom. Chipped bubbled pain on every wall. Door to the room was hitting the TV when you open it. TV remote didn't work. Do not stay here - there are plenty good hotels around.

title: Bare bones
text: Upgraded to the larger basic room. The hotel lobby was nice, but the elevators sound like they’re falling apart and our room was very unimpressive. It was practically a white box with a bed and a tiny “desk” you could barely sit at (not that you’d want to hang out in this room for any length of time). The bathroom fixtures were old and industrial. It took at least 5 mins of running the water on full heat for it to warm up. Bed was comfortable thankfully, so we slept fine. For upwards of $400 I would expect more creature comforts. Maybe a free coffee in the morning instead of an $8 espresso in the bar downstairs. I wouldn’t recommend

title: Great location, the lobby was really nice but the rooms need some work and updating.
text: The sink in the bathroom was bent and loose. The grout in the shower should be bleached or replaced The outlets in the whole unit are so used nothing would stay plugged in. The rooms where clean but lacked simple amenities such as ice bucket and cups, wash cloths and more than 2 pillows per bed. The staff needs to let visitors know to use the key on the elevator, and house keeping should knick before entering but other than that they were good. The location makes up for alot but for the money I will probably explore other options on KY next stay.

title: Lackluster at The Paramount
text: Hotel looks very sleek upon first arrival. However all the razzle dazzle is in the lobby. Hotel rooms are very small and lack luster. Capet was very dirty, comforter was moldy, bathroom is very small and feels like a prision bathroom. No microwave or mini fridge, no mirror at desk to fix hair or make up. Air conditioner doesn't work properly leaving room very hot and miserable. The evening desk staff is very rude. Location is the best part of the hotel. However; I would not recommend this hotel and would spend the extra money and stay somewhere nicer.

title: Great location
text: The Paramount Times Square is located very close and is convenient to everything.  The drawback is the rooms are tiny, like most rooms in NYC.  For the same rate, rooms can be found in other areas which are larger.  Or, similar size rooms are less expensive outside of the Midtown area.

title: A disaster. Look for other accommodation
text: Zero information on arrival. Two nights in a row the fire alarm went off in the early hours of the morning. Very noisy room, need to insulate the windows, impossible to sleep. Expensive hotel for young people partying all night, NEVER for families.

title: Old but Clean
text: Lobby was beautiful and staff was good. We felt safe there. Rooms are small but efficient. Bathroom could use a facelift. Way overpriced for what you get but it was NYC Marathon weekend, so I expected it. Perfect location to see and do everything!

title: Unbewohnbar
text:
Wir hatten für eine Woche gebucht - und sind nach einer Nacht wieder ausgezogen. Winziges Zimmer, völlig verdreckte Teppichböden, Badezimmer schmutzig und schäbig.
Als wir abends um 21 Uhr eingecheckt haben, war das Bett benutzt und wurde nur notdürftig frischgemacht. Mussten eine Nacht bleiben, danach wurde Zimmerwechsel angeboten: noch kleiner, gleich schmutzig. Nie wieder!

title: A night with the FDNY
text:
The fire alarm system at hotel started sounding at about 10PM.  The front desk was not answering their phones and for safety's sake I marched down 17 flights.  The FDNY later left the scene - the alarm sounded again.  The alarm sounded at least 4 times during the night.  The hotel finally found the PA system and announced that this was a false alarm and to go about our "business". 
I felt they could have done a better job of telling guests what was going on and a better job of fixing the problem.  The morning checkout,I was told that they hope i enjoyed my stay.  There was no mention of the problem or an apology.

title: WARNING: Safety Issue
text: I arrive prior to my friend and checked into the Paramount settled in and then decided to go out for a walk. I told the receptionist that he would be arriving later and had given them his name and was told he would just have to show his ID and they would give him a key. We eventually met up a few hours later and we headed back to the hotel. Got in the elevator. I hit floor 4. My friend thought I was messing with him, he said we're on 7. I said "No, we're on 4," He insisted we were on 7. I said "I'll show you." We walked into my room and the look on my friends face was pure confusion. He told me how he was in a room on the 7th floor and when he entered that room there was already luggage in there and he assumed it was mine. We went immediately up to the other room. And it was just as he described it, but the luggae obviously wasn't mine. We were baffled and were trying to figure out what to do. Just then there was a knock at the door. It was the gentlemen who was also checked into that room. He was confused as well. Luckily he was cool and we were cool. This is definitely where this scenario could have gone sideways. We all agreed we needed to go speak to the manager immediately and headed downstairs. We walked up to the desk and explained the situation and the lady at the desk didn't seem to understand it despite us explaining it to her a few times in great detail. It was as if this couldn't possibly have happened and she seemed to imply that we must have done something wrong. It was maddening. She didn't seem to understand the HUGE safety issue that could have occurred. If I or my buddy were sleeping or the other guy was and one or both of us barged into what we were told was our room it could have escalated to violence. Or even worse if one of the involved parties was a woman who was under the impression that they were in a reasonably safe hotel room. The demeanor that the hotel employee showed us couldn't have been less empathetic. So we asked to see the manager. We got the classic "I am the manager". I was surprised to hear this seeing as she was wearing jeans and a t-shirt. I am used to hotel employees being more "business casual" at the least. But we took her word for it. After some more discussion, it basically devolved into "Well, what do you want me to do about it?" We felt that there should be some kind of compensation. Eventually, she said they would refund us the "resort fee" I believe is what she called it. Problem is, we didn't pay a resort fee nor were we informed of one upon check-in. After we told her that she said "Well then we won't charge you for it." Soup to nuts, a complete cluster. The lack of customer service was one thing, I know how things are now and good help is hard to find. But don't urinate on my shoes and tell me it's raining. I had stayed here in the past and had a good experience, but never again. In addition to the circus I just described the light was burned out in the bathroom, there were no toiletries, the room was bare bones. There are PLENTY of other options in the area. Do yourself a favor and avoid the Paramount. It's not worth risking your life.

title: Overpriced but underdelivers
text:
Location and lobby are fine and generally clean but the issue is when it comes to rooms and fees. $300 for a tiny room with single bed, no cups, no suitcase stand (just enough room on the floor to open it), shower curtain missing leading to flooded floor and a ridiculous resort fee of $35 plus tax (which apparently includes access to hot and cold water and other facilities that any hotel would offer as standard). Staff were uninterested in feedback on this fee.  They also charge to store luggage which the hotel says is a direct gratuity for bell staff.  If it's a gratuity leave it to the customer otherwise it's a fee to subsidise hotel costs.  First and last stay here; it's not a service led establishment.
Moved to a Hilton Garden Inn with a much larger room, bed, bathroom, much better rate and no "resort fee".  The Paramount has also subscribed the the 11am checkout in order to cut housekeeping costs.  The Garden Inn offered a midday checkout as standard.

title: Paramount Hotel Times Square, not recommended! !!
text: Specifically room was in very poor condition !! We had paid for a premium double and were  very disappointed with standard of room.  This was booked as a package with BA. Bathroom had serious leak from sink, reported it, supposedly fixed and the leak happened again. You have to ask for fresh towels every day, no kettle or even drinking cups provided. Again you have to ask for these which were provided. Aircon unit sounded like it was about to take off at any moment. Carpet was only fit for the bin along with the blinds. The bath had serious cracking in the inside of it.Constant smell in public areas of drugs. Asked to be moved but this wasn’t an option. Overall, I would never recommend this hotel or be returning to it. We never complain about our holidays but we feel so strongly about this hotel and poor room standards we have to highlight these issues to other travellers.

title: Lisette is a Superstar!
text: While traveling for business, I found myself stranded without a hotel the night of my arrival in NYC. After being turned away from several hotels without vacancies, Lisette listened to me and empathized with me. She worked hard to find accommodations under pressure (it was close to 11 PM by the time I found The Paramount). After a stressful day of travel and  the mishap of accommodations, Lisette exuded the perfect amount of kindness and humor I needed in that moment. She’s a superstar! Moreover, the whole staff was excellent; Edgar and Carlos were fabulous in assisting with luggage and taxis as well. The atmosphere of The Paramount is nostalgic—I highly recommend it to anyone who loves architecture and design with lots of character. I would definitely stay here again and I’m grateful to the staff for working so hard to help me when I needed it.

title: Bien placé, chambre a rafraichir
text:
Avantages: Hôtel super Bien placé La chambre a une belle vue et la literie est tres confortable

Inconvénients:  chambre qui a besoin d'un rafraîchissement, surtout la salle de bain. Petite baignoire pas très propre a notre arrivées( usure et cheveux) et fenêtres qui ne s'ouvrent pas . Pour garder nos bagages avant le vol, 2 dollars par bagages en plus sachant que nous avons payé  plus de 100 dollars en plus pour les frais de sejour pour 5 nuits

title: Muy bueno
text: El hotel muy bueno, a solo una cuadra del Times  Square, las habitaciones muy cómodas, no cuentan con frigobar. Y tampoco hay desayuno . Llegamos temprano y nos guardaron las maletas sin costo , al día siguiente nos íbamos y tbm nos guardaron las maletas pero esta vez si fueron $2 por maleta hasta la Noche que ya dejamos el hotel. Muy buena atención .

title: Pleasant surprise around Time Square
text:
If I am being honest, I checked into Paramount with doubts: Partly because of the mixed prior reviews, and partly because of its location. As a frequent NYC visitor, I am not a fan of Time Square. Surprisingly, my one-night stay at Paramount completely changes my views on this pleasant surprise at TSQ.
My usual pet peeve about any hotel/resort is the unfriendly staff. I am also tired of hotel managers who don't seem to care about our current stays and only respond to anything with something like "... we hope you'll give us another chance next time." I don't necessarily care about stained carpets or dark rooms because my apartment is very much like that and we all know how time-consuming and costly it is to clean carpets. Besides, I am aware of the fact that Paramount just re-opened a couple of weeks ago so there are definitely things they can improve on. I'd, however, cast doubts on whether staff members can improve their attitudes through time. Paramount's staff members always get onto my needs right away: From my early check-in; personal fridge; extra key cards, to my request for late check-out, everything takes less than 10 minutes to be taken care of. Staff members at the concierge also give excellent recommendations for my sightseeing trip. If you are interested in catching as many Broadway shows as you can, Paramount is definitely your top choice. Even if you are not, I'd still recommend this awesome place with amazing staff members to you. :)

title: A short break away
text:
Staying here from 2nd till 7th October as part of a British Airways package was slightly apprehensive after a lady posted a very negative review telling people to avoid at all costs.So glad we ignored her review,the hotel reception has a great boutique atmosphere, staff were polite and friendly on arrival.The rooms are very clean nicely decorated and although small are very functional. The location is great and positioned for easy access to all the attractions. 
Please judge on several reviews not on one experience.

title: Disgusting rooms
text: I had the worst stay ever in a hotel, the room was disgusting, blood on carpet, marks all over the walls, chunks out parts the walls at the bottom, bathroom was like walking into a public toilet, rust, dust and mould showing all over it felt so dirty that my partner didn’t even take a shower before leaving the hotel the next day, I mentioned it to the hotel when asking for a later check out but nothing mentioned and wanted to charge $55 extra for a few hours. I’ve written an email to this hotel still no answer this hotel is more like a 3* than a 4*

title: Definitely recommend!
text: Beautiful hotel located near Times Square. All the staff were very kind and were always ready to help out. The lobby had a nice layout and our room had a beautiful view. Shoutout to the girls at the concierge desk. They helped my husband and I buy tickets for Wicked and book a shuttle back to EWR airport. Will definitely be coming here again!

title: Dont EVER stay here. If it were the only hotel in New York, then dont go to NYC
text:
This is a HORRIBLE hotel.

I was advised on check in that they re-opened around 2 weeks earlier. They could have done everyone a favour and stayed closed.

The room was far more deteriated than in the pictures in Booking.com, the room was SO basic there wasn't even a beaker / glass to use for taking medication.
There is a daily resort / services fee which is really $20+ for the wifi. The other items are irelevent as all other hotels include these.
The shower was so slow it was effectively useless.
When the toiletries were replaced after trying to shower on morning 1, they were replaced with half full little containers.
On departure I wanted to leave my bags but the hotel wanted to charge for storing my bags for a few hours.
The rate per night is not representative of the quality of the hotel and the reception staff are offensive on check in.

title: Do not stay here
text:
HORRIBLE! 
Hotel needs to be updated, faucets in bathroom did not work, no wash cloths provided, room needed painting refresh. Disappointed to see this hotel with a high rating from TripAdvisor. DO NOT BOOK HERE, stay was not comfortable and I recommend finding another hotel.

title: Not too good
text: Stayed in September,  check in was chaotic, took ages,  the hotel wanted payment in full even though we had already paid. Took a while to sort it out. Rooms were tiny, very basic. Metal sink in bathroom looked like something from a prison cell. It was fashion week while we were there and there were events in the hotel over the weekend.  You couldn't use the bar, the lobby was constantly packed full, the lifts were so busy you had to wait ages, I felt that we had paid for the hotel and they should have told us about the events as it made our stay less enjoyable. The staff were never around. We had to ring for towels twice as we didn't have any in our room. Its a good job you dont spend much time in your hotel as it wasn't a nice place to be. On check out we wanted to ask about a taxi to airport,  but the staff member at the concierge desk was sat on her phone. She saw us but chose to ignore.  We had to shout her over, really rude. I would not reccomend staying here. Im sure there are much nicer hotels in new york. Not value for money.

title: Paramount hotel - new york
text: Review of the Paramount:   I read they  recently reopened and they should've did traveller's a favor and stay closed.   I would NOT recommend this hotel.  Dark entrance, unfriendly staff, usually only 1 person at check in (at check in, we waited over 1.5 hours and there was not 1 time that there was not a line up), rooms were small and dirty with loud air conditioners. No face cloths in rooms (had to request), nothing in rooms other than clock and hairdryer.  Ice machine only on 1 floor.   I  the room and showers - it was either too hot or freezing.  Paint peeling.   The staff were absolutely the rudest and most ignorant unhelpful staff/people I dealt with in New York (possibly in my life!!!).   The last day, maids entered our room 2x before checkout time which makes me question if they even knew which guests were due to check out and not just need room refreshing.  Do yourself a favor and book elsewhere - anywhere else than here!!!!

title: Take care, imposible dirty fake hotel
text: Total a catrastophe, no room cleaning, no soap in the rooms, tv damaged, safe not in function, extremely loud, couldn't sleep till morning, all stinking for drugs and nicotine,  we changed the room 3 times, wasn't getting better

title: Fantastic Location....state of the Art Libby ...very clean
text:
Clean basic and a very big room ....they don't have a kitchen so don't provide water or a coffee maker ....not glasses or spoons ....location is Fabulous...the lobby is state of the art ....the reception ppl especially the 2 ladies from the evening shift  have more NO s than yes ...before you ask a question they are ready with "sorry no '.Simple things like an adaptor is a big dea

Other than that it's a good hotel...will stay again here

title: Paramount Hotel 🏨 🤩
text: Cet établissement vient tout juste de redémarrer ses opérations (fermé depuis 2020) Nous avions réservé via Booking.com et nous avons déboursé 139$ USD pour une petite chambre avec deux lits #1820. Évidemment pour un séjour aussi rapide dans Time Square ce majestueux Hôtel avec du staff surexcité de revoir des clients c’était magique et ce fut aussi excellent pour la propreté de la chambre et de l’hôtel qui était impeccable. Notez : pas de petit frigo dans la chambre ni de débouche bouteille mais la TV était à la fine pointe avec plusieurs postes gratuits. Nous y retournerons c’est certain!

title: Irresponsables
text:
irresponsables!
hace mas de cuatro meses tengo reserva para diciembre y un mes antes descubro que el hotel esta cerrado!! la reserva la he hecho a traves de Destinia. ahora me proponen un hotel lejos y de inferior categoria! Ni siquiera me han avisaso

title: Can't wait to come back!
text: I've stayed at the Paramount numerous times - with my adult daughters, with my brother, and alone.  It's the best situated hotel for plays on and off-Broadway, within walking distance to Hell's Kitchen restaurants and other neighborhoods.  I had never to Lyft or Uber!  From the minute you enter the delicately scented lobby (smells so delicious), the Paramount is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city.  The lobby is hip, low-lit and inviting, with the friendly and helpful staff at the desk.  The rooms are clean, well-attended, and quiet.  I'm returning to New York in December, and look forward to being back at the Paramount. and the wonderful city.  I've missed you both!

title: Our go to Hotel
text: This is the BEST Hotel for the money in Manhattan.  We have come many times to NY in the last 5 years and we always try to stay here.  The Staff if very friendly and always helpful.  It’s always clean, comfortable and convenient.

title: Great hotel
text: Amazing hotel right on times square, room was lovely staff were excellent the door man was brilliant always struck up a conversation when coming in and out, 5 star service was our first visit to new York and  will absolutely be back to stay at paramount.

title: Fantastisk lokation
text: Fantastisk lokation. flot receptionsområde. Fantastisk udsigt. værelser lidt små og lidt slidte. Men der var pænt og rent. serviceminded personale der gerne er behjælpelige med at finde oplevelser. City bus tours lige uden for døren, hvilket gjorde det virkeligt nemt at komme til de forskellige lokationer i byen. Vil gerne komme igen

title: COVID cancellation cooperation
text:
We were supposed to stay at the Paramount in early April for several days, then again in early July for a couple of nights. Unfortunately, the pandemic put all of our 2020 vacation plans on indefinite hold.

However, we had no problems canceling our hotel arrangements. Expedia and the Paramount worked to make good on any prepaid deposits or fees, and it was quite simple to get refunds, especially when compared to dealing with some other companies we’ve had to contact.

We appreciate their service and will be happy to use Expedia and to stay at the Paramount again, whenever we may be able to travel to NYC in the future!

title: Amazing customer experience
text: We booked our trip long before COVID changed everything.  When travel started to fall apart, we received a personal email from Joe Kavanagh, the manager.  Over the next few months, he and I would communicate back and forth from time to time regarding the state of travel.  When our flight was changed, he was prompt, professional and understanding and sought to help us alter our hotel reservation.  Well, now, our entire trip had to be cancelled and he has been nothing but wonderful.  This would have been our third or fourth stay at the Paramount and we will 100% stay again.

title: Be careful! This hotel will charge you extra on your credit card
text: I stayed at the Paramount in October 2019 and I was charged more than what I had booked for. After returning to my home town I still kept getting charges from the hotel which had nothing to do with my booking. I called and emailed them in several occasions and all they say is that it's my bank's problem. I have spoken to my bank many times and it is not their problem. I travel all around the world for work and this has NEVER happened to me. Let alone the fact that it's now been more than 6 months. I simply don't understand how a hotel management can let this happen. Be careful if you hook this hotel.

title: Is a great and convenient hotel that is near the theater district and Times Square. They are always willing to help you
text: Is a fabulous hotel near the theater district and Times Square. Is secure and have great amenities. They are always willing to help you if you want to stay more hours before your departure without charging and extra day. I recommend it a lot. Love The PARAMOUNT!! We have stayed several occasions and never have a complaint.

title: Cancelled trip but awesome customer service
text:
Just wanted to say how amazed I've been with the customer service at this hotel. We've had to cancel the trip due to C19 and we are so disappointed but the hotel have stayed in contact with us throughout and have been wonderful.

As soon as NYC is open for business we shall be delighted to rebook the Paramount!

title: so sorry we had to cancel!
text: I had to cancel our planned visit to NYC in May.  The staff were totally kind and caring when I cancelled the reservation.  Having previously worked in the hotel business I knew how heart wrenching it had to be to receive yet another room reservation, but the reservation person was very polite and courteous.  I hope we can book again soon!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: Great hotel, service and location. During these crazy times all fees were waived during the Covid pandemic.  I can't wait to get back! This is such a wonderful hotel.  Clean, quiet and wonderful service.

title: Reliable hotel Paramount
text:
our stay in Juni 2020  was canceled due to COVID. Nevertheless we got the whole refund immediately - this fact testified that your hotel is very reliable. It is invaluable experience and we plan to use your hotel next year. We were in Paramount hotel in 2018, the location is fantasti enabling to visit theaters and etc. on foot. We hope that next year will be better.
Alex

title: Annulatie owv corona crisis
text:
Helaas door de corona crisis is mijn verblijf naar New York geannuleerd. De vluchten en het hotel werden geannuleerd door het agentschap waar ik heb geboekt. Echter heb ik meer hulp en service ontvangen van het hotel zelf. Zij contacteerde me rechstreeks owv de annulatie en hielpen zelfs met contacteren van het agentschap waar ik geboekt had zodat ik mijn geld van de boeking terug kreeg. Dit hoefden ze eigenlijk niet te doen dus vind het zeer klantvriendelijk van hen. 
Van het hotel zelf kan ik geen beoordeling geven, aangezien ik er niet ben geraakt. Maar van de service ben ik echter al wel zeer tevreden!

title: COVID Cancellation
text:
Unfortunately, we weren’t able to make the trip we intended for our daughter’s 13th birthday. But Paramount was amazing about rescheduling our initial trip and ultimately making it easy to cancel for some unknown time in the future when Broadway opens back up. 

Not only were they extremely understanding but they made it easy. Look forward to a trip hopefully sooner than later!

title: Cancelled due to Covid
text: I was booked to stay in this beautiful hotel (i have stayed here previously) but had to cancel due to Covid. Joe from the Paramount got in contact with me to check up on my booking and was able to help me cancel. Joe made it all really easy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to stay in NY.

title: Full Cooperation
text:
I had a reservation at the Paramount Hotel in May for several nights. When covi 19 hit New York, I decided to cancel m non refundable reservation.
The hotel management accepted my cancellation with no penalty and no hassle. On my next visit, I will definitely stay at the Paramount

title: Refund
text: Just wanted to thank Joe & his staff for their first class efforts sorting out our refund after unfortunately having to cancel our trip for a family birthday. We have already rebooked so hopefully see you all at Christmas!

title: Very close to Times Square, stylish and comfortable
text:
We've been here a couple of years ago and the combination of the proximity to Times Square, being in a quiet street and the stylishness and comfort of the hotel make it a perfect hotel. 

recently we booked again (we have booked pre-Covid19) and when the pandemic hit we had to cancel our trip to NY. We were expecting that this would cost us a lot of money but the hotel reached out to us an waved all the fees! This was totally unexpected and was such a great gesture of the Paramount, thanks for this and you have won my loyalty for life!

title: Cancellation Request
text:
We had a family trip booked to NYC for April of this year which we unfortunately had to cancel due to the Covid pandemic. I can say with absolute honesty that Joe Kavanagh and his team at the Paramount Hotel were fantastic to deal with during this challenging time. Two emails max were all that was required from me to cancel our stay and have the full $ amount refunded straight away. It left me with an extremely positive opinion of the Hotel's management team and I'm grateful for their support. 
Our plan is to reschedule as soon as practical to do so and the Paramount will be our first choice hotel.

title: Can't wait to return
text: We have stayed at the Paramount many times over the past 20 years.  The location is so convenient to Times Square and Broadway theaters, the rooms are small but very comfortable, and the hotel is stylish without being stuffy.  We had a reservation at the Paramount this past May, but had to cancel because of the Covid-19 shutdown.  With so much else going on I'm not sure that I would have even remembered to cancel our hotel reservation, and I was so impressed when the Paramount's management reached out to me to ask if we needed to cancel.  When I told them them that we did need to cancel, there were very gracious and took care of it without delay.  It really was an extra, personal touch that was much appreciated.

title: Hopefully next time.
text:
Was due to stay in April for three nights. Unfortunately I had to cancel due to the pandemic and the fact that irish citizens were not permitted entry to the USA. The staff were super helpful and understanding in cancelling my reservation without delay & offering their help with any future plans. They also wished me good health and to stay safe which was very kind of them.
If I return to NYC I will most definitely be staying at the paramount.

title: Thank You for your handling of our cancellation due to the pandemic.
text: The Paramount was most accommodating in cancelling our reservation due to the Pandemic.  We had planned to stay at The Paramount on a family trip to NYC to celebrate my mom’s 75th birthday. Our trip has been postponed but The Paramount has earned our business when we do get to return to NYC.  Thank you Joe Kavanagh for his personal attention and understanding and helping us cancel our booking.

title: So sad to cancel but so helpful
text:
I’ve stopped at the Paramount before about 5 years ago and it’s such a lovely clean modern hotel in a fantastic location. We had rebooked to travel in December 2020 for my birthday weekend. We are so sad to cancel but with Broadway not planning on opening till January 2021 being  so worried about travelling through this worrying time as we live in England we asked the hotel if we could cancel. We’d already booked and paid last December. The hotel immediately said yes and gave us a full refund with no quibble whatsoever. 
I hope everyone stays safe and we will rebook as soon as travel restrictions allow.

title: Cancellation for May due to COVID 19
text: We were scheduled to go to New York in May. The hotel did a great job of working with us on initially postponing and then canceling our reservation. I got an email from the manager and very quick response to our requests.  I did NOT travel so many of the boxes can not be filled in correctly.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I have stayed at the Paramount a few times and had planned to stay again this past May, but unfortunately due to Covid-19, my stay had to be canceled.   I cannot even begin to tell you how much I appreciate the staff of this hotel for being so attentive to my needs.  On one trip, I had inadvertently left my cell phone at an airport in another city. I was distraught, as you can imagine, and everyone from the front desk to the concierge provided help and assistance above and beyond the call of duty.  When, more recently, Covid hit, the hotel manager, Mr. Kavanagh, was most helpful and answered my e-mails promptly as he assisted me in figuring out what to do.  I have nothing but great things to say about the Paramount and plan to stay there again soon (hopefully) when it is safe to go back to NYC, one of my very favorite cities int he world.

title: Cancellation due to Covid
text: I have stayed at the Paramount before and was due to revisit. However, this was all cancelled due to COVID. The hotel were fantastic. They contacted me and the reservation for 2 rooms was cancelled with no fees or cost to myself. Excellent service and a brilliantly located NY hotel. I hope to visit as soon as it is safe

title: Cancellation of hotel due to Covid 19
text:
This is giving a review on what excellent communication we received regarding our trip in May 2020. With everything changing since Corona virus took hold on the world even before the U K were banned from entering America the hotel answered every email I sent regarding do we or do we not cancel?. Joe replied personally reassuring us that they were still open initially but if we didn't feel safe to travel would completely understand and we could cancel without any fee. Obviously as the virus progressed and we all went into lockdown Joe emailed us again to confirm the cancellation due to current events in the world
Even though we haven't yet visited
 the hotel yet we can't wait to book next year as their service with their communications has been excellent all through this terrible time. Thank you Joe Kavanagh we will see you next year.

title: Understanding and Guest-focused
text: Due to COVID-19 pandemic, the Paramount went out of their way to ask about our plans and to offer cancellation or rescheduling without any hoops or conditions.  A smaller hotel must be struggling in these times, but they continued to focus on their customers.

title: Cancelled due to COVID
text:
I had a conference that was scheduled in NYC for mid July.  My wife and I had booked to stay at the Paramount before and after the conference. We have previously stayed at this hotel in 2012 and had a very positive experience and decided to stay here again. The rooms are small but nice, the hotel lobby and common areas are amazing, and the location is perfect for the subway, broadway shows, and Time Square. 

My conference was cancelled due to COVID. The hotel has also chosen to stay closed through the end of August.  We received a prompt full refund from the hotel (even though the room was booked at a non-refundable rate).  We will not hesitate to book a room at the Paramount on our next visit to NYC.

title: Stayed Many Years Ago - Was Scheduled to Return Spring 2020
text: I had stayed at the Paramount Hotel New York many years ago and loved it - so much so that when I had an event scheduled for March (and rescheduled for April, then May) I was excited the location of the event made the Paramount the obvious choice. While the pandemic changed my travel plans, I have been incredibly impressed by the professionalism, compassion and transparency the property has shown during these unprecedented times. My reservations were modified and cancelled without any hassle or issue. I will certainly be back when travel is part of my normal routine again.

title: Great hotel even in the face of Covid
text:
Unfortunately we never got to revisit the hotel due to Covid 19 but the whole process of cancelling our reservation and getting out money back was exemplary. The hotel contacted us to keep us up to date with what was happening and refunded the money and took all the hassle out of the process.
We have been before to this hotel and it's great location and customer service is great and I can't wait to take my family back to Manhattan and enjoy this hotel once again.

title: Cancellation Review
text: Due to the Coronavirus my daughter and I had to cancel our travel plans. I had made a non-refundable reservation with the Paramount and thought for sure I would be out the money for my reservation. But, I called and left a message with the hotel manager just in case. Without asking any questions they quickly and fully refunded the entire amount. I was so very grateful knowing that their business was likely suffering as a result of the shut downs. I definitely plan to book with them again when we can safely travel to NYC.

title: Curse of COVID but hoping 2nd time lucky!
text:
I had booked a surprise trip to New York for my wife as she has always dreamed of going but unfortunately we were unable to go as it had to be cancelled due the the COVID outbreak. 

The hotel and especially the manager, Joe Kavanagh were absolutely amazing and couldn’t have been more helpful. So much so we have rebooked for October so fingers crossed it will all go ahead and my wife can have her dream holiday. 

Would highly recommend the hotel due to its amazing customer service and I will hopefully do a review of the hotel itself once we go!

title: Lokasi yang sangat bagus
text: Lokasi hotel ini sangat bagus begitu kita keluar hotel tinggal jalan ke kiri sudah sampai di tengah Time Square. Kesana saat weekend dan cukup ramai, keluar hotel ke kanan jalannya ditutup untuk semacam pasar rakyat. Menarik sekali lokasinya di tengah keramaian dan dekat kemana-mana. Sayangnya kamar hotel sangat sempit, apalagi kamar mandinya bikin orang susah gerak. Tapi kalau tujuannya hanya untuk tidur dan mementingkan lokasi ya hotel ini bisa menjadi pilihan.

title: New York Birthday
text: The rooms were so tiny that I felt I was in a capsule. However, proximity to Time square, Broadway shows made it all worth =while. The price was reasonable. I never could understand why the foyer lights were dimmed but overall a good hotel.

title: The Paramount Hotel Rocks!
text:
We spent 5 nights at The Paramount in March 2020...right before the Coronavirus hit New York and the world hard.  The Paramount on the map looked close to everything we wanted to see but it was right in the middle of it all!  We were literally about a minute's walk from Times Square if we took a left out of the hotel and if we went right about the same distance we were in Restaurant Row and beside Broadway. We could see our theatre from our 12th floor hotel room.  The people at the hotel were amazing...from the doorman to everyone inside. They were helpful and courteous. We felt very welcome.  The hotel is historical but had everything that we needed and more. The room was much larger than the one on our last stay at another hotel further away so win!  The lobby was gorgeous. My bff and I were there to celebrate 50th birthdays and my daughter her 16th. The hotel staff even sent her up a card and some treats for her celebration. She was very touched. 
The complimentary cold breakfast was great...two choices of bagels/donuts/Danish, etc., hot and cold beverage, fruit, yogurts, etc. Three Canadian ladies had a great time and will go back!!  A big thanks to Lucy Tian, Guest Experience/Communications Manager for all of her help.  Trip of a lifetime!  Cherie,  Canada

title: Bra hotell mitt i smeten
text: kan inte bli mer centralt än så här om man gillar Manhattan. Bra hotell designat av Phillpe Stark. Times Square har allt man kan önska sig, men gå två kvarter ifrån, så hittar ni små fantastiska krogar eller inte så barnvänliga barer. Alla är värda ett besök. Ett tips, om du hamnar på en bar och inte känner dej välkommen, gå till jukeboxen och sätt på Billy Joels "I*m in a New York State of Mind., jag lovar, den finns där och sen är ni hemma

title: Lobby Obsession
text: I love staying at the Paramount for its location, price and staff. I also LOVE just smelling the lobby. What? If you've stayed there, you know what I mean. Amazing. Finally found the closest thing to it. Le Labo Santel 33 or Maison Saint Louis No. 4.  Just like being there!

title: New York New York!
text: A very nice hotel in a great location. A beautiful building with a lovely reception area and bar. Because of the coronavirus we could not visit the music hall next door but we hope to on our next visit.

title: Great hotel! Close to Broadway Theaters and Times Square
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Paramount Hotel. We loved how close it was to the Broadway theaters and to Times Square. The hotel itself was beautiful and clean. Loved it. I would definitely stay here again.

title: An amazing stay in an incredible city!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for his birthday and we cannot recommend the hotel enough. 

Staff were beyond helpful and even added a complimentary bottle of wine in the room for an added birthday touch. 

Staff were helpful with restaurant recommendations and wore more than accommodating with any queries and questions that we had. 

The room was clean, comfortable and stylish and the breakfast area downstairs was perfect to grab a coffee before a cold day in the city. 

We cannot recommend Paramount Hotel enough and cannot wait to stay with you again!
